posts.Title: JOIN-the-MOVEMENT - WINTER CLUB MEMBERSHIP REGISTRATION opens SEPT 1 @ Noon!!!
posts.Content: The LAUNCHING PAD is in place…. and The POLE VAULT ROCKET is about to BLAST -OFF!!! ….. WELCOME to another exciting year at the FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT ACADEMY. Our programs have been expanded to meet the needs of our Beginners…Intermediates and our Elite Pole Vaulters in Middle School…High School and Open/Masters programs… We invite you to ..”JOIN-the- POLE VAULT MOVEMENT” here at FLYING CIRCUS this Fall…Winter and Spring seasons. REGISTRATION FORMS for our very LIMITED WINTER POLE VAULT CLUB will be available on September 1 beginning at 12 Noon on our NEW & IMPROVED WEB SITE (www.hvflyingcircus.com) and here at our Flying Circus e-mail NEWSLETTER … Act Quickly..as the first 20 Boys and the first 20 Girls to Register will be accepted… Avoid the WAITING LIST and jump with us this winter in Warm conditions and a Positive Environment !!!!! BOYS CLUB Meets Monday and Wednesdays Class 1..5:30-7PM Class 2…7:00-8;30PM GIRLS CLUB Meets Tuesday and Thursdays Class 1…5:30-7PM Class 2…7:00-8:30PM FALL VAULTING BEGINS Monday September 9 !!!! It’s time to get a JUMP-START on your competition…. Mondays…. Girls Elite 5:30-7Pm Boys Elite…7-8:30PM Tuesdays.. Girls Begin/Intermediate 5:30-7PM Boys Begin/Intermediate 7-8:30PM Wednesdays..Private Lessons By Appointment Thursday.. Girls Begin/Intermediate 5:30-7PM Boys Begin/Intermediate 7-8:30PM Fridays….Girls Elite 5:30-7PM Boys Elite…7-8:30PM Saturdays….Private Lessons By Appointment Sundays.. Girls Open…1-2:30Pm Boys Open 2:30-4PM Girls Level 3.. 11’ 0” PR and Up Boys Level 3 .. 13’ 0” PR and Up FLYING CIRCUS…… INVESTING-in-KIDS

posts.Title: HVFC Opens Monday, September 9th!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC
“Reaching-for-Excellence”
USATF Club # 06-1129

WELCOME HOME…… It’s time to get ready together !
<hr>
Your Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy opens Monday..September 9 and it’s time to start the Climb to the TOP of the POLE VAULT MOUNTAIN together. Join us as often as possible this Fall…as we get MOTIVATED for the up-coming Indoor Track & Field season here in the Tri-State area. Check out the Fall Pole Vault schedule in the schedule tab and LET’S BE GREAT !!!!

“JOIN-the-MOVEMENT” @ FLYING CIRCUS

“REACH for EXCELLENCE”
<hr>
* Make Training a PRIORITY.
* Train MIND-BODY and SPIRIT
* I want to LEARN.
* The Art of Training….is to ENJOY IT.
* Positive thoughts unlock the pathways to IMPROVEMENTS.
* Look for GENIUS in OTHERS.
* GO BEYOND YOUR BOUNDARIES.
* Athletes are NOT BORN…they are DEVELOPED.
* EXTRA-ORDINARY RESULTS = EXTRA-ORDINARY EFFORT.
* Train ANIMALS ….. Educate PEOPLE.
* HELP OTHERS REBOUND.

JOIN THE FLYING CIRCUS.

posts.Title: Fall Newsletter #1
posts.Content:
The FLYING CIRCUS is ROLLING ……. Congratulations to all new and returning vaulters participating in Week #1 Progressive Drills Vault Program this week at THE VAULT BARN…… this early start up will be an UNBELIEVABLE ADVANTAGE for the Indoor Meet season. NOW .is the time to outwork your opponents…… Conditioning…Strength and Speed Development and Technical Short Vaulting is the blueprint for you success this winter… Thank you for joining the program again this year!!!!!!!!! * NEW UCS SPIRIT VAULTING POLE ORDER
FREE SHIPPING on ALL ORDERS !!!! The FLYING CIRCUS Club will be placing their FALL/WINTER VAULTING ORDER on October 1…… All individuals/families wishing to purchase their NEW UCS SPIRIT VAULTING POLES for the upcoming season should contact Coach St. by October 1 and take advantage of this FREE SHIPPING opportunity (Save Approx $150/pole). FLYING CIRCUS is out of the Used Pole Rental and Pole Lending business. Check payable to HV FLYING CIRCUS. No School Vouchers . The 2013-14 FLYING CIRCUS UCS SPIRIT VAULTING POLE PRICES
UCS…. THE BEST VAULTING POLES ON THE PLANET!!!! 10’ 8” UCS Spirit………… $335.00 Each 11’6” UCS Spirit ……….. $360.00 Each 12’ 1” UCS Spirit………… $395.00 Each 13’ 1” UCS Spirit………… $450.00 Each 13’ 7” UCS Spirit………… $480.00 Each 14’ 1” UCS Spirit………… $510.00 Each 14’ 7” UCS Spirit………… $540.00 Each 15’ 1” UCS Spirit………… $575.00 Each 15’ 7” UCS Spirit………… $635.00 Each FREE SHIPPING …. SAVE BIG !
* MEGAN CLARK WINS …TOP DUKE FIELD EVENT AWARD !!!! Congratulations to DUKE UNIVERSITY Freshman…Megan Paige Clark for her outstanding Indoor and Outdoor seasons. Megan vaulted 13’ 7” to win the USATF Jr.National Pole Vault Championships and placed 4th at the PanAmerican Games this summer. The speedy and dedicated clark is studying Biology at Duke and is the proud daughter of Ron & Simona Clark of Durham,NC !!!!! * JOIN the ARMORY FUN with us this Winter!!!! The Armory Foundation has announced the energy-packed schedule for this Indoor season…. and it is loaded up with Spirit and Friendship… Convince your HS Coach to join us… at “THE MECCA of HIGH SCHOOL TRACK & FIELD”… The New Balance Track & Field Armory Center !!!! Here are just some of the meets THE FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT STAFF will be on site to help you this Winter: December 21…. 60th Bishop Loughlin Games December 27…. Marine Corps Holiday Classic January 3-4 …. Hispanic Games January 11……. Molloy Stanner Indoor Games January 24-25.. New Balance Games February 15…. 107th MILLROSE GAMES February 24 … 79th Eastern State Championships March 14-15-16 The NEW BALANCE NATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIPS * The NEW MONDO SUPER-X PERFORMANCE Runways are now in place at The Flying Circus for our Indoor and Outdoor Pits…. Be ready for speed…. ONLY 1/4” Pyramid Spikes now allowed at the Flying Circus… Enjoy the Speed !!!!!!!!!! ”Aspired for more….” -Milt Campbell(USA) Decathlon Champion

posts.Title: Fall Newsletter #2
posts.Content:
Welcome to  The Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy… Our Boys and Girls High School  vaulters are now entering their  forth week of HIGH PERFORMANCE FALL POLE VAULT TRAINING and  the spirit and results are  inspiring.   The everyday gains in technique…speed  and strength will  be showing up  early this winter season on the  runways in the  Tri-State  area…..    Let’s GO HIGHER  TOGETHER !!!!

   * Thank you all for the quick Registration for our WINTER POLE VAULT CLUB. The Boys and Girls sessions are almost SOLD OUT AGAIN for the November 11-February 9 Program. Only 3 spots left in both….. FLYING CIRCUS is FLYING!!!!!

    * Our Fall UCS Spirit  New Pole order is going out  on October 1…Contact Coach St. to place your order before Oct. 1  at coachst@gmail.com.  We are out of the pole vault rental and pole vaulting pole lending program for this year.

    *  FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLINIC @ ARMORY !!!!  Mark your calendars… Friday  November 22, 2013… The Armory Foundation and The Flying Circus   “Team-Up Again” for Pole Vault Development …with their 2nd  ”EVERYTHING POLE VAULT” High School Clinic for athletes in NY-NJ-CT-PA-MA … Girls  Clinic 4-5:30pm  Boys Clinic 5:30-7pm  @ NEW BALANCE  NATIONAL  HALL of FAME ARMORY CENTER….  more details coming for all Circus members to sign up!!!!  Limit   5 Boys & 5 Girls per HS Team !!!

    *  GOALS of the COACH *

<hr>

    … to instill as much confidence in your athlete the is humanly possible….

    …..to use an encouraging style of teaching….

    …. to harp on small positive gains in technique…

    ….. to highlite correctiveness in every athlete…

    ….  to make  training a FUN  EXPERIENCE…

    ….  to train…MIND - BODY - SPIRIT …

    …… to  handle people with care.

<hr>
     The MILLROSE GAMES …..will be celebrating…” 50 Years of Fiberglass Pole Vaulting” at this years meet on February 15, 2013 at The Armory   Center…. after all… it was  at  the  1962 MILLROSE GAMES  that John Uelses(Quanico  Marines)  set  the first World Record and First 16’  Pole Vault on a Fiberglass  Pole and made this new style a standard.  The High School Girls Invitation in the afternoon… and the loaded  Men’s Professional evening Pole Vault will take on SPECIAL MAGIC…. Don’t miss  this day of historic Track and Field… Tickets available at armory track next month!!!  BUY EARLY  for  choice Pole Vault seats near the  pit!!!!!

       JOIN THE CIRCUS….. and see the world !!!!!

posts.Title: Fall Newsletter #3
posts.Content:
It’s time to…JOIN-the-MOVEMENT in HUMAN SPIRIT….called..”The FLYING CIRCUS”.   This week’s pole vault classes are moving up FAST and are ready to take on the challenges that are just around the corner……. COME FLY WITH US this FALL in Warwick Valley,NY !!!!!!

  * Another packed week of exciting improvements from all level High School  and Middle School vaulters in the Tri-State area. Specific Drills are improving with repitition   and the “Human Spirit” has taken the main stage spotlight @ Circus.

   * MAKING the BIG DECISION ….. ” I want to be a GREAT POLE VAULTER!”  At some point in athletics… every athlete must  make this decision….. and then make the COMMITMENT to that dream. ARE YOU READY to make  that COMMITMENT .  LET’S BE GREAT !!!!!  

         …..” Every day…..excellence has an exceptional effect.”

<hr>

   *  Last Day for Fall UCS Spirit  New Pole  Order is Monday  October 1,  2013.  FREE SHIPPING !!!!    Contact Coachst@gmail.com to place your  order.  

   *  Just 53 Days to  The 2nd Armory/Flying Circus  EVERYTHING POLE VAULT CLINIC for all High SchoolBoys  and Girls in NY-NJ-CT-PA-MA-NYC ….. Join the  FUN and INSTRUCTION with us  at The New Balance Track Center  ”HALL of FAME” on Friday  November 22, 2013… 10 Elite HS Pole Vault Coaches….Girls 4-5:30PM  Boys  5:30-7PM… Entry Fee $20 per athlete at the door registration.  Registration Fee dedicated to the New UCS Vaulting Poles coming to the Armory this winter!!!!    Limited to 5 Boys  and 5 Girls per High School Team!!!!

   *   CIRCUS 5 STEP PRE SEASON MEET….

<hr>

         Girls Meet  Friday  Oct. 18    Warm Up 5PM  Meet starts 6:01pm  Entry $20/athlete

         Boys Meet  Saturday Oct. 19  Warm Up 11AM  Meet starts 12 Noon Entry $20/athlete

   *   “CHAMPIONS CHECKLIST”

<hr>

       - Go BEYOND THE BOUNDARIES ….   TRAIN HARD.

       - ACT NOW…. Don’t miss your mark in life.

       - SARCOMA….. that well being feeling. POSITIVE THOUGHTS help strengthen the immune system. …..    

        - LARGE INVESTMENTS =  LARHE RETURNS …. Make Training a PRIORITY.

        - LINE YOURSELF UP….. with  FOCUS.

        - DO SOMETHING FOR SOMEONE ELSE.   GRACIOUS.

        - AIM FOR THE STARS….. with SPIRIT.

        - TAP into the  ’POWEWR of DREAMS”

           LET’S BE GREAT……. FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: Circus 5 Step Meet Coming October 9th!
posts.Content:
"TRADITION COUNTS"
<hr>
97 STATE POLE VAULT CHAMPIONS
55 ALL-AMERICAN POLE VAULTERS

<hr>

“Todays preparation….. determines tomorrow’s achievement” . ARE YOU READY ?????

MARK YOUR CALENDARS….. Just 12 DAYS to the….first of 7 FLYING CIRCUS INDOOR POLE VAULT MEETS At-The-Barn…. Coming October 18…Our Girls 5 Step Challenge at 6PM and October 19…Our Boys 5 Step Challenge at 12 Noon… on the SUPER FAST MONDO SUPER X CIRCUS RUNWAY in Warwick Valley, NY… Break the ice and join the fun with us next week and START UP YOUR POLE VAULT ENGINES!!!! Barn Doors open 1 hour before listed meet time…Cost just $20 per vaulter at the door!!!!!!

Congratulations to Mandy and Rory on there super Wedding Celebration and Party this past Saturday… The reception room was filled with family…friends… coaches… and 15+ Pole Vaulters joining the special day…. Best of luck to Mandy and Rory from all members of the Flying Circus!!!!

We are in the final 4 weeks of our Open Fall Vault program…and the results are pouring in…thank you all for supporting this prep phase…IT WILL PAY OFF BIG RETURNS this indoor season. Open Sunday Sessions will continue all winter and Spring season… Girls Sunday Open 1-2:30PM Boys Sunday Open 2:30-4PM. Cost still just $30 per vaulter per visit !!!! Join the Movement!!!!

NEW FLYING CIRCUS CLUB “T” SHIRTS…… will be on sale beginning November 11 at our Winter Club Sessions and at The Armory/Circus “EVERYTHING POLE VAULT CLINIC” on November 22…. Let’s ” Wear the Spirit” … everywhere we go… T Shirts $15… Circus Logo Magnets just $10 each…. Don’t leave home without it !!!!

Final Winter Club Class placements will be posted on our Web-site on October 30. Almost all vaulters received there first choice of class instruction.

<hr>
GREAT TRAINING HURTS…. 
<hr>
 …….for no matter how tough the athlete may seen outwardly… every new level of athletic development and intensity of effort…brings it’s own quality of pain and new levels of HUMAN PERFORMANCE. TRAIN HARD….WIN EASY !!!!!!

Things to remember……..
<hr>
* Always show STRONG MORAL CHARACTER in all situations.
* Live your life according to the “GOLDEN RULE”.
* Be LOYAL to YOURSELF and YOUR EVENT. 
* FOCUS on what WE COULD BE…. NOT WHAT WE ARE.
* BELIEVE YOU CAN REACH THE TOP …. TRAIN YOUR MIND.
* Never be boastful about your abilities….They are God given.
* ALWAYS remember who you represent….. YOUR FAMILY and YOUR SCHOOL.
* Leave…. ‘BIG FOOTPRINTS’ .
* Rise above PEER PRESSURE …. BECOME YOUR OWN HERO.
* LIGHT YOUR OWN FIRE…..It’s PASSION that COUNTS in LIFE.
* AVOID NEGATIVE PEOPLE.
* OUR GOAL is not to SET RECORDS…. but to SET EXAMPLES!

FLYING CIRCUS ….. POSITIVELY POLE VAULT

posts.Title: ''POLE VAULT MOTIVATION '' ....JOIN-THE-TEAM @ CIRCUS !!!!!
posts.Content:
”LET THE GOOD TIMES ROLL” …… It’s POLE VAULT TIME !!!  Who has the BEST PV TECHNIQUE  @ FLYING CIRCUS ??????   We are about to find out…with our  first meet of the Pre Season… THE FIVE STEP CHALLENGE……  Girls Meet Friday Oct. 18 at 6pm…Boys Meet Saturday  Oct. 19 at 12 Noon … Special 1st place awards… 2014 VAULTER MAGAZINE POLE VAULT CALENDAR !!!!   Entry Fee…just $20….Barn Doors open 1 hour before listed  time.  COME FLY WITH US this weekend  !!!!



    Our Pole Vault Academy here has been built on the shoulders of many DEDICATED  and  MOTIVATED  Boys and Girls….who enjoyed “OUT-WORKING” their competition …. Spring into action today and give your day EXTRA MEANING!!!



     WE ARE COUNTING ON YOU TO BE DEDICATED !

<hr>



        *  CHAMPIONS are UNGRY in TRAINING.

        *  CHAMPIONS DEMAND RESULTS.

        *  CHAMPIONS LOOK FOR CHALLENGES.

        *  CHAMPIONS THRIVE on MOTIVATION.

        *  CHAMPIONS TAKE PRIDE in THEMSELVES.

        *  CAMPIONS ARE LEADERS.

        *  CHAMPIONS CHASE THIER OWN DREAMS.

        *  CHAMPIONS ARE ALWAYS HUMBLE.

        *  CHAMPIONS PROMISE…..and…. DELIVER.





    ” IF YOU DREAM IT… YOU CAN ACHIEVE IT” …… FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: HVFC's Will Nesbit has SILVER WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS performance in Brazil
posts.Content:
"You Gotta’ Believe"

  NEWS FLASH …..Flying Circus Vault Coach  …WILL NESBITT Took the “CIRCUS GLOBAL” today  with his SILVER WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS performance in  Brazil. Vaulting into a make shift pit  and just a 6” deep vault box  …could not hold back the “USA Spirit” in Nesbitt… With Family  and friends cheering…Vault Coach Ben Simonet lowered Will’s grip  and moved down a few poles to  adjust to the conditions… More details  as they become available… The “Belgium Flash”…Ben Simonet   competes tomorrow in the 35-40 Year Masters Worlds… 

   GREAT PERFORMANCE…Your Flying Circus Team Mates are most proud!!!!

<hr> 

   GOOD LUCK BEN !!!!!!!!

<hr>

posts.Title: 2013-14 CIRCUS WINTER CLUB INFORMATION
posts.Content:
Warwick Valley,NY …..  WELCOME TO ….. “VAULT TOWN” !!!!!

<hr>

   THANK YOU for entering our Flying Circus Winter Pole Vault classes. We are SOLD OUT for the 8th STRAIGHT YEAR  and excited to get you started up. Below is all information for our opening November 11….. start up your fitness  routines now… see you soon.

  Location:  3 Warwick Center Drive & Hoyt Road

                  Warwick,NY  10990

  USATF Membership:  All athletes must  be registered members of USA Track and Field. Register at USATF/membership.org.  Cost-$25 for the year.

  Dress:  All vaulters should be dressed  safety for activity. No Jewelry allowed during classes. Athletes should  have Flats for warm up/ spikes (1/4” only) for vaulting/tights or sweats for  winter months.  Try to dress like an ALL-AMERICVAN athlete.

  Class Time:   All classes will start  and end ON TIME. Athletes should be 10 minutes EARLY for class.  A MISSED CLASS  is  a MISSED CLASS… There are NO MAKE UP CLASS SITUATIONS. There is NO CLASS SWITCHING. Assigned class ONLY!!!!

   Poles: Athletes may bring there own poles in to vault on and stay familiar with. Mark you name on your poles in Magic Marker. We have 231 poles   for your use here ONLY! WE DO NOT RENT or LOAN POLES ANYMORE. WE DO SELL UCS SPIRIT VAULTING POLES.

    CLOSED DATES:  In inclement weather conditions.. we will e-mail CLOSING by 2PM each  day. Check your e-mail before coming in bad weather. Classes cancelled due to extreme weather are NOT MADE UP.  Flying Circus will be CLOSED ALL DAY  on  November 28(Thanksgiving)..December 24/25(Christmas)…January 1(New Years)

   TWO BARN MEETS this WINTER 

<hr>

posts.Title: BEN SIMONET WINS SILVER @ WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS !!!!!
posts.Content:
FLYING CIRCUS NEWS FLASH !!!!!!!!!

<hr>

Porto Alegro,Brazil…

Oct. 22  

   HE DID IT TOOOOOOOOOO !!!!!!   Flying Circus Staff  Coach BENIOT SIMONET…the 4 Time Belgium  Champion… spliced thru the  headwind today to take the WORLD SILVER MEDAL into a shallow box and pit.  Coached up  all day by fellow SILVER MEDALIST  WILL NESBITT… the medals will be on display at FLYING CIRCUS  BARN HEADQUARTERS next week…. Autographs  will be going free-of-charge!!!! CONGRATULATIONS BEN & WILL… WE ARE PROUD of you!!!

      FLYING CIRCUS LIVES  @ WORLD CHAMPS

posts.Title: Newsletter #5
posts.Content:
"EVERYTHING POLE VAULT"

<hr>

  CIRCUS NEWSLETTER  # 5

  October 28

" Nothing happen’s ….but first a dream."

                 - Carl Sandberg

    The fall days  are getting colder…. it must be about that time again.   Get out your vaulting spikes out of the closet  and get your core  strength routines in motion  now….   it’s  almost PRIME TIME POLE VAULT  SEASON!!!!!  Join us at Flying Circus these final 2 weeks before  our Winter Club season begins….. and you are invited to  our  6 STEP CHALLENGE MEET this weekend at The Flying Circus Barn…. Girls Friday Night at 5pm… Boys on Saturday   at 11AM !!!

   *   Special thanks  to all our Winter Club  Team of  50 Vaulters  this year.. We are completely sold out of space  beginning November 11  for the Monday-Tuesday-Wednesday and Thursdays at Flying Circus North in Warwick,NY.   We will still have our Open Vault Sessions every Sunday afternoon  Girls Open  session 1-2:30pm   Boys  2:30-4pm…. Saturday Private  and Semi Private   sessions will close on  December 7 thru March 1…as all coaches will be traveling to Saturday Meets…Summit  and State  Finals.. FLYING CIRCUS HAS EXPLODED with your SUPER INTEREST!!!!

   *  FLYING CIRCUS SOUTH….OPENS this November @ ARMORY !!!!!

<hr>

       We are privileged and excited to announce that we are expanding our Pole Vault Instruction  with Pole Vault Classes at the NEW BALANCE Track & Field Armory every Tuesday  and Thursday  for High School Pole Vaulters. Flying Circus Coaches Will Nesbitt  and Beniot Simonet will be in charge of all classes and semi-private sessions… All details will be at armory track.com and at  our High School Pole Vault Clinic @ the Armory on November 22 !!!!  JOIN THE INSTRUCTION !!!!

  *   6 STEP POLE VAULT MEET….  Two more Vaulter Magazine Calendars will be the ultimate prizes for this weekend ‘s Pole Vault Meet at the Barn… Friday night Girls Meet  at 5PM   Saturday morning Boys Meet at 11AM… Entry Fee… $20 per vaulter…All Divisions…Elementary School…Middle School…High School…Open.. and Masters Divisions.

    * ON SALE @ MEET…. The NEW FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT T SHIRTS and Car Magnets…. this fund raiser program helps support new equipment here at Flying Circus.

<hr>

      “If you believe in yourself.. . and have dedication and pride ——-  and never quit , you’ll be a winner.  The price of victory is high ——- but so are the rewards.”

                — Paul “Bear” Bryant

                    University of Alabama

posts.Title: "HUGE FUN" ...and "BIG JUMPS" @ 6 STEP CIRCUS MEET !!!"
posts.Content:
The VAULT SEASON is HERE!!!!! 
<hr>
CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU to ALL VAULTERS…PARENTS and VOLUNTEERS at this weekend’s CIRCUS 6 STEP MEET at The Barn. It was the finest early season meet in our club’s history and it all points to another wonderful season together.

In all…. there were 39 competitors ( 24 Girls..15 Boys)..there were 11 New Indoor School Records set (7 Girls… 4 Boys)….. and an unbelievable 29 Personal Bests put up (18 Girls…11 Boys)… Yes.. there was a “million dollar spirit” ringing thru that old Dairy Barn called headquarters !!!!! “People are enjoying themselves …. and that’s what it is all about.”

GIRLS MEET (Real Bar) - 
<hr>
Jenna CALANDRO (12’ 1”)..Katlyn RYMARZOW (12’ 1”)…Maddie SCHNEIDER (12’ 1”) Lead the Charge !!!!!

12’ 1” Jenna CALANDRO…….HVFC (Newtown, CT) School Record !
12’ 1” Katlyn RYMARZOW…….HVFC (Pope John,NJ) School Record !

11’ 1” Erin LEAHEY …………… HVFC (Warwick,NY) PR
11’ 1” Leah WACHSMUTH ….. HVFC (Ketchem,NY) School Record !
10’ 7” Kari MURANE………….. HVFC (Lenepe Valley,NJ) PR
10’ 7” Cara KELLY…………….. HVFC (Vernon,NJ) School Record !
10’ 7” Jessica THORNBERRY ..HVFC (Darien,CT) PR
10’ 1” Matea FREIDEL ………….HVFC (Rye,NY) School Record !
9’ 9” Hannah CAMPOS …………..HVFC (Weston,CT) PR
9’ 5” Sophie ALTER……………..HVFC (Rondout Valley,NY) PR
9’ 5” Emily IATESTA………….. HVFC (Weston,CT) PR
9’ 1” Amy BRAVO………………HVFC (Park Rodge,NJ) PR
9’ 1” Hannah GLUCK ………….HVFC (Weston,CT) PR
8’ 7” Kira MAGNANI …………. HVFC (Weston,CT) PR
8’ 7” Danielle CASS………….. HVFC (Weston,CT) PR Top Frosh !
8’ 1” Colleen LEAHEY ………. HVFC (Warwick,NY)
8’ 1” Natalia HARTWELL……. HVFC (Greenwich,CT)
8’ 1” Sarah KRICHEFF…………HVFC (Old Tappan,NJ) PR

OPEN WOMENS DIVISION:…..
<hr>
This is hard to believe…but here we go…. former National HS GIRLS Pole Vault Record Holder …Michelle KERCADO of Monroe-Woodbury,NY …the girls who started it all up with Coach Cauthers in 1999 ..came in to say hello to her semi old coach. After placing 5th in the World Cross Fit Championships last month… this former Columbia University speedster…. took a pole in her hand and jumped 12’ 1” after 15 years of NO POLE VAULTING !!!!! You can’t make this stuff up… Watch out this winter as she will be teaming up at Armory Flying Circus South for a COMEBACK!!!! Congratulations Michelle !!!!!

BOYS MEET (Real Bar)
<hr>
Derek DiBONA (16’ 1”) and Todd UVKERMARK (15’ 7”) set a NEW…NY STATE INDOOR POLE HS POLE VAULT RELAY RECORD of 31 Feet 8 Inches !!!!!!!!! Could this be the BEST in USA this winter !!!!!!! Derek DiBona…coming off 10 STRAIGHT WEEKS of Dynamic FAST Training with Dr. Frank Welling in Warwick,NY paid BIG DIVIDENDS…as the junior walked in to his 6 Step..holding his custom made UCS Spirit made by Steve Chappel…a 14’ 7” x 189.5 lbs UCS to fly 35 inches over his hand grip!!!!! Both Todd and Derek had solid jumps at 16’ 5” !!!!!!

posts.Title: KARA SNYDER COMMITS to VILLANOVA !!
posts.Content:
GREAT NEWS RELEASE……
<hr>

It’s official……the long wait is finally over for senior Pole Vault Champion…KARA LYNN SNYDER of Colonie High School…Albany,NY…… The Multi-Section 2 Pole Vault Champion and State Meet Runner-Up is taking her studies and vaulting to VILLANOVA UNIVERSITY next fall. She will be coached by Pole Vault Master…Talen Singer and continue the rich tradition of Pole Vault success for the ‘NOVA WILDCATS !!!! Kara brings her dedicated training routine and her academic success to the MAIN LINE and will be majoring in Engineering  ! Kara is a four year vault star at FLYING CIRCUS!!! She is the proud daughter of Tom and Mary Snyder of Colonie, New York!!!

CONGRATULATIONS KARA…. YOUR FLYING CIRCUS TEAMMATES & COACHES !!!

posts.Title: Newsletter #7
posts.Content:
Here at FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT….. our mission goes far beyond coaching pole vault…. better stated….. we enjoy “Coaching People” …… and this will be the main focus in our Club practices… meets and clinics. As we open tomorrow for our 52 Winter Club student/athletes for group instruction for the next 3 months…. we are grateful to be a part of what we call .. ..”YOUTH OLYMPIC-ISM”. This being the full fledged spirit of full time dedication….full time spirit…. and full time olympic sportsmanship.

Our focus is about belonging…….belonging to something bigger than self. Many times in sport …this concept gets lost in the translation. This is the place where…”EVERYONE COUNTS.” We so look forward to helping you achieve….. LET’S BE GREAT TOGETHER !!!!!!

<hr>

NEW NFHS Pole Vault Rule Changes for this Indoor season:
* The use of video tapping during a competition is now legal. That’s right..the athlete can now view his/her jumps during the competition. This adds to the safety of our most complex event…pole vault!!!
* The time limit has been reduced from 90 seconds to 60 seconds for a vaulter to start his jump in the pole vault. Competitions will run FASTER NOW… Be ready to jump when your standards are set!!!!!
* Our 7 Step Challenge Meet is this weekend at FLYING CIRCUS!!! Girls Friday Nov. 15…Warm Up at 5PM Meet starts 6:00PM Boys Meet Saturday Morning Warm Up at 11AM Meet starts at 12 noon!!! Join us and team mates for the pleasure of competition . Entry $20/vaulter at the door!!!!
* Make Training a PRIORITY !!!! A lost day can NEVER BE MADE UP !!! The competition in our area has moved up many levels… let’s meet the challenge. Bishop Loughlin Indoor Games just 40 DAYS AWAY!!!!! ARE YOU READY ???????
* Remember…that your ATTITUDE is far more IMPORTANT than your talent. POSITIVITY OPENS THE DOORS for SUCCESS….. STAY POSITIVE !!!!
* Keep a sharp eye on armory track.com for the sale of 2014 MILLROSE GAMES tickets… They sell out quickly  !!!!!
* Flying Circus-Armory Pole Vault Clinic coming fast now… November 22…..See you and your team mates there!!!!

“We make a living by what we get….but we make a life by what we give.”
-Winston Churchill

FLYING CIRCUS …LIVE MORE ….SERVE BEST

posts.Title: Newsletter #8 - CIRCUS VAULTERS ..."CATCH-THE-RECOIL" @ & STEP MEET !!!!!!!
posts.Content:
” 36 VAULTERS JOIN HANDS”  ….

<hr>

      …… congratulations to  all our 36 vaulters…12 coaches… and unbelievable parents/volunteers at this weeks FLYING CIRCUS 7 STEP MANIA MEET at The Barn.  It was another wonderful day of fun…. as the  Indoor  Season bears down on us now. This third meet of the Fall Schedule  will help prepare  us for that  first official…..our last meet is our 8 Step Meet on November 29(Girls)  and 30(Boys).   You WILL BE READY  to “RAISE-the-BAR” for your High School teams  this winter. Thank you all for participating in our VAULT-MANIA MEETS!!!!!

    TODD UCKERMARK(Warwick Valley,NY) hits 16’ 4.75”…JENNA CALANDRO(Newtown,CT) sets best at 12’ 6”   to lead the Fiberglass Charge.  Congratulations to all 36 vaulters… who set 20 personal best…  6 New School Records…… Uckermark moves UP to the #2 ALL TIME FLYING CIRCUS RECORD BOARD !!!!!! He used his 15’1” x 175 UCS SPIRIT   with   his 14’ 4”  grip to become the first 5-METER Vaulter in Section 9…. It’s only November !!!!

posts.Title: POLE VAULT CLINIC RISING...CLINIC WAIVER IS HERE!!!!
posts.Content:
" POLE VAULT FEVER IS HERE" ……. JOIN the FUN  !!!!
<hr>
The Pole Vault Clinic @ FLYING CIRCUS-SOUTH…. THE ARMORY is just 48 hours away and the electricity is in the air!!!! Friday November 22 ..POLE VAULT HITS NEW YORK’S NEW BALANCE TRACK & FIELD CENTER on 168th Street and we want you to be a part of this historic “DAY-of-VAULTING” …. Girls Fly at 4PM-5:30PM Boys Launch at 5:30-7PM… First 50 athletes to Register at the door receive THE ARMORY VAULT T-SHIRT !!!!! 
Each athlete MUST have Clinic Parent Waiver Form Signed at Registration… Download today and BRING IT WITH YOU !!!!! COst OF CLINIC is just $20 per athlete…with this money going to the purchase of MORE ARMORY UCS Spirit Vaulting Poles for Pole VaultDevelopment!!!!

WAIVER FORMS at armory track.com under the article…HAPPY RETURNS !!!!!
<hr>
ALL HS COACHES COME FREE…..LET’s JOIN HANDS and IDEAS!!!!

FLYING CIRCUS SOUTH TAKES FLIGHT !!!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS CLINIC" .... SIZZLES !!!!!!! ..... @ Armory
posts.Content:
The NEXT GENERATION of VAULTERS have arrived !!!!!! THANK YOU ALL for supporting our 2nd CIRCUS/ARMORY POLE VAULT INSTRUCTIONAL CLINIC at ‘The Greatest Indoor Track & Field Venue in the World”…. The NEW BALANCE ‘HALL of FAME’ ARMORY on Friday Night. Thanks to the spirit and efforts of Dr. Norbert Sander at the Armory… this Pole Vault Clinic was our …BEST EVER !!!! The Pole Vault is taking center stage this year and a ‘New Generation of Flying Athletes’ have arrived….. Here are the final numbers….. 114 TOTAL PARTICIPANTS …. Vaulters…Coaches…Volunteers and Photographers took part in this “DAY of VAULTING” instruction. They came from four states and they learned the concepts of SAFE POLE VAULTING TECHNIQUE. There were first time athletes…intermediate level vaulters and there were Elite USA Vaulters sharing ideas…fun… and friendship. 80 Student Athletes…. 14 Adult Volunteers…. 16 Elite Pole Vault Coaches…. 3 Photographers …Great Vault Video…Super Music and Perfect Clinic - Vault T Shirts for all !!! Let the season begin !!!!! "HATS OFF" and SPECIAL THANKS TO: Clinic Sponsors…. The Armory Foundation(Dr. Norb Sander ) …Flying Circus…New Balance ….UCS Spirit Vaulting Company Clinic Coordinators…..Will Nesbitt..Ben Simonet..Hugh Cauthers..Coach St. Clinic Volunteers…… Basset Thompson…Tim Fulton…Brett Hoover…Ed Yaker…Rob Moressato… John Leahey… Vickie Uckermark…Noel DiBona…Michelle Nesbitt… Bobbi-Jo DiBona…Todd Uckermark…Derek DiBona Clinic Coaches… Dan Placentra…Jim Glover…Jim Henderson…Tim Beach…Dan Mecca…Neil Perry…Jerry Dunne…Jessica Reifer…Will Nesbitt…Hugh Cauthers…Ben Sinonet…Nick Mitchell…Carlton Huff…Ron Jackson This clinic launched the opening of …FLYING CIRCUS-SOUTH…. Pole Vault Instruction at THE ARMORY beginning this Tuesday November 26 from 3:30-6:30pm… Get all the details on Registration for this VAULT SCHOOL at armory track.com . JOIN - the -FLYING CIRCUS VAULT TEAM this winter in NEW YORK CITY !!!!!!!!
* The Classes at Flying Circus-North(Warwick,NY) have been sensational this first two weeks. As many of you know… we have exploded to our greatest reach ever in helping young beginning athletes in our pole vault event. With this growth… our private and semi private vault sessions are pack and backed up with aspiring athletes…. but we still offer 1 OPEN INSTRUCTIONAL SESSIONS every Sunday in Warwick,NY at THE BARN… Girls Open Class is 1-2:30PM every Sunday and Boys Open Class 2:30-4PM every Sunday fox any High School vaulter in the Tri-State area. Cost just $30 per athlete per visit. COME FLY WITH US EVERY SUNDAY this WINTER !!!! * MILLROSE TICKETS will be at a prium again this year…as the 107th edition will be SPECTACULAR…. with Mens Professional Vault in the Prime Time evening and the first ever Girls High School Pole Vault Invitational in the afternoon. Don’t miss this meet…. learn from the BEST VAULTERS on the PLANET…. Get your MILLROSE TICKETS IMMEDIATELY at armory track.com !!!! * UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT… Joins Hands with MILLROSE GAMES!!!! A major happening in the pole vault world… as MILLROSE GAMES Meet Director..RAY FLYNN and UCS SPIRIT POLE VAULT SUMMIT Director…Steve Chappell have agreed to promote the Vault to the next level… The TOP 3 MEN at the UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT in Reno,NV on January 17-18 will be AUTO-QUALIFIERS for this years MILLROSE GAMES!!!! In addition… The TOP HIGH SCHOOL GIRL @ Summit will be Auto Qualifier for the first ever GIRLS CHAMPIONSHIP. Will Nesbitt will be event coordinator for MENS ENTRIES… Tim Fulton will again be event coordinator for the HS Girls Championship Event!!! POLE VAULT MOVES UP THE FOOD CHAIN !!!!!!! * JUST 27 DAYS till the first BIG ARMORY MEET…BISHOP LOUGHLIN GAMES ..Dec. 21!!!! ARE YOU READY !!!!! * The Flying Circus will be CLOSED Wednesday(Nov. 27) and Thursday (Nov. 28) for THANKSGIVING with FAMILY….. ENJOY YOUR DAY!!! * Flying Circus re-Opens on Friday at 5PM for the Warm Up for our Holiday Girls Meet (Open to all Vaulters) and Saturday at 11AM for our Warm Up for our Holiday Boys Meet(All Invited) at 12 Noon!!! JOIN the FUN with US . * The Tom and Mary Snyder COFFEE STATION is a HIT!!!! Bring your own K-Cups !!!! FLYING CIRCUS…BECOMING BETTER HUMANS

posts.Title: CIRCUS HOLIDAY POLE VAULT MEET...THIS WEEKEND !!!!
posts.Content:
<hr>
INDOOR SEASON is HERE….JOIN US !!!!
<hr>

Newsletter Flash

YOU ARE INVITED …. to this weeks Flying Circus HOLIDAY POLE VAULT BLAST MEET at THE VAULT BARN in Warwick Valley,NY. This final Fall Pole Vault Meet will be our last “VAULT BLAST” before the High School season opens at West Point on December 13!!! JOIN the final tune-up and really be ready for your opening school meet.

GIRLS HOLIDAY POLE VAULT BLAST MEET…..Friday November 29 Warm Up at 5PM Meet starts 6PM All Divisions(MS,HS,Open,Masters) Entry Fee $20 At-the-Door.

BOYS HOLIDAY POLE VAULT BLAST MEET… Saturday November 30 Warm Up at 11AM Meet starts 12 Noon All Divisions(MS,HS,Open,Masters) Entry Fee $20 At-the-Door

<hr>
SUPER OPENING NIGHT @ ARMORY POLE VAULT !!!!
<hr>
CONGRATULATIONS to Coach Ben Simonet and Will Nesbitt for a successful opening night of pole vault practice at Flying Circus-South last night…. 20+ Pole Vaulters started up the Fiberglass-Magic!!!! Pole Vault is here to stay at the NEW BALANCE HALL of FAME ARMORY !!!

NEW ART WORKS @ CIRCUS NORTH…. It’s official… Our NEW ART LOGO is now hanging from the Barn Hay Gable !!! Fine Art Medalworks…located in Florida,NY has just finished our ‘VAULT SCULPTURE’….check out the Spirit of the Vault….by artist Jon “Roll Tide” Leadford on your next trip to The Barn!!!

THANK YOU….GRACE WEISBECKER !!!!! Two-Time New York STATE PLE VAULT CHAMPION…Grace Weisbecker of Red Hook,NY and Vermont College has donated her HS Pole Vaulting poles to club members at our FLYING CIRCUS !!!! She becomes the 5th Vaulter in our club to pass on the fiberglass tools of success for our next generation !!!!! Many Thanks !!!

GIRLS MILLROSE GAMES POLE VAULT GOES NATIONAL !!!! Dr. Norb Sander(Mr. Pole Vault) and Tim Fulton(Event Coordinator) are going NATIONAL for the enteries in this year’s HISTORIC GIRLS HIGH SCHOOL POLE VAULT event on Feb.15 at The 107th MILLROSE GAMES !!!! The TOP 2 GIRLS in the USA will be invited to THE BIG DANCE…MILLROSE 2014!!!!!
Special Thanks for promoting High School Pole Vault !!!!

The Final UCS SPIRIT POLE VAULT ORDER will be placed on Monday December….This will be the last order untill January 17 Summit…. SAVE SHIPPING ON YOUR ORDER…. e-mail all requests to coachst@gmail.com before midnight December 2 !!!!!

HAPPY THANKSGIVING !!! FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: Keep USATF NY in New York!
posts.Content: Dear Flying Circus Club Members… Please Help!!!! We want to Keep our USATF New York Association in NEW YORK!!!! Please sign the petition to Stay in NEW YORK…The best and strongest association in USA !!!! Many thanks Coach St. ————— Forwarded message ————— From: Lauren Primerano Date: Tue, Nov 26, 2013 at 10:16 PM Subject: IMPORTANT - I regards to your USA Track & Field Membership! Petition to remain a New York Member To: Lauren Primerano VERY IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM USATF NEW YORK The Monroe-Woodbury Track Club also known as a branch of the NJ Striders has filed a petition with the National Office to have Orange County, Rockland County, and Sullivan County moved under USATF New Jersey to allow their youth members to compete for the NJ Striders. Those three counties also include you! We have an additional 420 members from those counties and athletes representing 13 clubs which are; Newburgh Elite TC Rock City Striders Rockland Road Runners Central Park Track Club Zodiacs Track Club Park Racewalkers New York Starz The Executives Orange Runners Club Hudson Valley Flying Circus Wilson Memorial Track Club RWB Track Club Hudson Valley Track Club All members of these clubs would be moved to NJ. USATF New York is the fastest growing association in the country and we are on the verge of breaking 4,000 members, have grown to over 110 organizational members, producing high level programming for youth, open, and masters athletes in all areas of our within our geographical location. Meet and Race Directors will also have to sanction events through USATF New Jersey if this happens which could increase your sanctioning and insurance fee’s. This will also effect our organizational structure since three of our board members reside in the area’s listed above. WE ARE NEW YORK – Where Amazing Happens! Please sign the petition as soon as possible and have your voice be heard! IT IS IMPORTANT THAT WE GAIN AS MANY SIGNATURES AS POSSIBLE THIS IS TIME SENSITIVE! Click here to sign the petition! We also encourage the clubs mentioned above to make sure your athletes sign the petition as well. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions.

posts.Title: CIRCUS HOLIDAY MEET A BLAST !!! Todd UCKERMARK (16' 1")..Kalli MANLY (11' 7") !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC
“Where UPSIDE-DOWN is Normal”
<hr>
Scenic Warwick Valley, New York


CIRCUS NEWSLETTER #9
December 1

IT was FRIENDLY and SPIRITED COMPETITION…. The final Fall meet at Flying Circus Headquarters is complete …. with a Fall Record of 41 Vaulters taking part in the VAULT SHOW of ATHLETICISM on the second floor Hay Loft at The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development. 
The Cheering spectators…parents and friends kept the room warm..even though the Barn Heater did not show up!!! The chill could not hold back the frenzy…. CONGRATULATIONS to all participants in the FALL VAULT SERIES… WE ARE READY TO GO NOW !!!!

Special Thanks to all Coaches…Parents and athletes… especially meet volunteers…Pete Weisbecker,Todd Uckermark,Karen Leggett,Denise Robbins,Teresa Rough,Stefan Buechele,Derek DiBona,Jurgan Buechele…… YOU MAKE IT GREAT FOR ALL FIBER_KIDS!!!!


BOYS RESULTS:
<hr>
Warwick Valley ,NY senior Todd Uckermark posted his 3rd 16 Foot vault of the Fall season…with his gold vault of 16’ 1”…and 1 close shot at 16’ 6”..Team mate Derek DiBona(Junior) also flew at 15’ 1” for the Relay win for the Purple Wave! TJ Murphy and Mike Brunaforte both soared 15’ 7” to lead the Open Men .

….. Burnt Hills,NY Sophomore Kalli Manly…used her BIGGEST POLE EVER to set a new Indoor School Record of 11’ 7” to lead the girls HS Division. Manly.a Black Belt Karate Champion out of Albany ,NY will be taking it up at the National Pole Vault Summit in Reno,NV next month!!! Today’s Thoughts…….
* You MUST BELIEVE in who YOU ARE…..
….Where you are going…………………
….. and How you are going to get there !!!!!!

* You can’t turn back-the-clock……..
…. but… you can wind it up again !!!!!!

* It’s great to be great…..
…… but… it’s GREATER TO BE HUMAN.
-Will Rogers

The Indoor Season is here…… FLYING CIRCUS.

posts.Title: GIRLS HIGH SCHOOL MILLROSE POLE VAULT COMING to ARMORY!!!
posts.Content:
HS GIRLS TO FLY at MILLROSE POLE VAULT 2014 !!!

<hr>

     You are invited… to be a part of Pole Vault History….. Yes… the first ever Girls High School Pole Vault Championship Event will take place this February at the world’s Oldest and Greatest Indoor Track & Field Meet … The 107th  NYRR MILLROSE GAMES in the New Balance Track & Field Center Armory on 168th Street, NYC!!!!!  

    It’s the Girls Turn To Fly…and  some of the very best High School Girls in the USA will be spinning off the top of those Fiber-Bending  vault poles..to delight another packed house of Track & Field  fans.

    High School Girls Pole Vault Event Coordinator…Tim Fulton(Armory Track)   will again try to surpass the Boys Historic Pole Vault  entry of last year…  with a National Reach for the Top GIRLS in the Country…  Armory Pole Vault has gone NATIONAL….AGAIN !!!!  Get your tickets early…and see the future of USA Girls Pole Vault with us… Best Vault seats are in sections 444- 445-446-447

     Adding to the afternoon Vault  Field   this year will be the TOP HS GIRL PERFORMER from the UCS NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT COMPETITION on January 17-18 in Reno,Nevada!!!!   Filling out the unbelievable field of female  vaulters  will be Tri-State area  Pole Vault Girls selected by the Games Committee from competitions thru  February 1. 

 ” Meet Director Ray Flynn   and Armory Director Dr.Norbert Sander are providing great support for  the girls high school   pole vault  and the atmosphere  and Magic of MILLROSE GAMES will  be a treat for all the High School girls. It’s going to be a GREAT SHOW.”  Coach Tim St.Lawrence,Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy.

<hr>

    EVENING POLE VAULT EVENT @ NYRR MILLROSE will feature the HIGH-FLYING OPEN/COLLEGIATE MEN… The Best on the Planet will thrill the crowd…with Fast approaches…Big Bending Fiberglass…..spirited Fly-A-Way action into the rafters all night… Mark your calendars now… February 15…Tickets  go on sale December 2….  It’s going to be another  ”Miracle on 168th Street”… MILLROSE STYLE !!!!!!

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS CAMP"...T-SHIRT DESIGN 2014 !!!! JOIN-the FUN !!!
posts.Content:
"FUN-ON-FIBERGLASS"
FLYING CIRCUS SPRING & SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS are Now OPEN for REGISTRATION !!! Join us this year at the wilderness Pole Vault Camps in scenic Warwick Valley,New York. Another Great and Skilled Coaching Staff has committed to our Pole Vault Instruction and WE WANT YOU and YOUR TEAM MATES to ..JOIN-the-CELEBRATION with us. Our space is limited…as we have exploded with high numbers of pole vault enthusiasts…so… Register Today and secure your spot for our Spring and/or Summer Camps. All Registration Forms are at our newly revived web site.. www.hvflyingcircus.com …..created by Web-Master ..Connor Mulchany of Weston, CT . ENTER TODAY….. SPACE IS LIMITED . Spring 1 Day Boys Camp..Friday March 28 5:00-9:00PM Spring 1 Day Girls Camp…Saturday March 29 12 Noon-4:00PM Summer 2 Day Boys Camp.. June 30 & July 1 4:00-8:00PM Each Day Summer 2 Day Girls Camp… July 2 & July 3 4:00-8:00PM Each Day SPECIAL THANKS to artist Jeanine Fountain, Monroe,New York for designing & hand painting our awesome 2014 CAMP T-SHIRTS for all VAULTERS… This unique piece of VAULT ART will be a treat for all campers!!!!! JOIN the CAMP MOVEMENT…. ASAP!!!! ********************************** NEWS -ON-FIBERGLASS ….. ####################### CONGRATS to our early season vaulters this weekend…as the FUN starts to RECOIL!!! Manhattan University Freshman… Justin Farrenkopf…last years New Yorl State Pole Vault Champion.. won his first collegiate meet…with a 15’ 10” performance at Manhattan Open for Coach Dan Mecca…. Flying Circus-South Coach Ben Simonet flew to a 4.35m place at 14’ 3” for an indoor seasonal Personal best !!! Also taking the Womens Gold was Jasper Freshman Marisa Robbins(Goshen,NY) with her 10’ 10” clear.. Flying Circus alumni Sarah Moore…Breanna Brucher and Maddessen Weekes completed the TOP 4 Vault Sweep !!!! Rye,NY senior…Matea Friedel soared to her first Armory Win at the Section 1 Opener on Saturday night..followed by Leah Washsmuth(TC Ketchum)..Dana Rokicsak(C.South) and Tara Bergstrom(Somers) followed…. James Mariner(Somers) flew 12’ 3” for the Boys Gold…Mike Martello(Somers)…Charles Wilson(N Rochelle) and Pete O’Neill all started up the season on a successful note. Coach Jon Hill at West Point Military Academy was ready to roll at the Carlton Croll Open at Gillis Fieldhouse… with freshman Jordan Worthington soaring 15’ 11.5” for the win as Army took the TOP 6 Spots in Men and Top 4 Spots in Women!!!!! The New Balance Nationals will be at THE ARMORY on March 14-15-16…. Here are the Qualifying marks need to get into the FINAL VAULT DANCE!! Girls Emerging Elite Competition… 11’ 0” Indoor Boys Emerging Elite Competition.. 14’ 3” Indoor Girls Championship Competition… 11’ 9” Indoor Boys Championship Competition… 14’ 9” Indoor KEEP TRAINING with a PURPOSE!!!!! UCS SPIRIT VAULTING POLES ORDER will be here this week…Thanks to Steve Chappell!!! ** CIRCUS POLE VAULT CAMPS……ASAP *** Join the Spring and Summer Pole Vault Camps at Flying Circus… Forms available at web site….. Limited Space…. Elite Coaching Staff…. HUGE FUN !!!! ” The Art of Pole Vault Training ” ….IS TO ENJOY IT.

posts.Title: "JUMP-FOR-JOY"... ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY MEET @ CIRCUS !!!!
posts.Content:
You are invited to spend the day with us…here at Flying Circus…for the FUN and FRIENDSHIP … at The 3rd ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY POLE VAULT MEET in Warwick, New York SUNDAY DECEMBER 29 , 2013
This Pole Vault Meet honors and celebrates one of New Jersey’s finest High School Pole Vault Coaches…… Coach ANDY WASNIK touched every one of us with his compassion…generosity… and his love for helping Track & Field athletes succeed. He is missed every day… but his “Spirit” continues to resonate in all of us. Join us for the Celebration !!! ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY MEET SCHEDULE for 2013
This meet is open to all Middle School…High School…College…Open…Masters Athletes EVERYONE is INVITED… Just like Coach Wasnik taught us. SUNDAY December 29, 2013 9:00AM BARN DOORS OPEN… Register at the Door..$20 per Vaulter 10:00AM…. Girls Beginner/Intermediate Division Bar starts at 6 feet 12 Noon…. Girls Warm Up…HS Elite/College/Open Vaulters/Masters Bar starts at 10’ 6” 2 PM….. Boys Beginner/Intermediate Division Bar starts at 7 Feet 4 PM…. Boys/Men Elite Warm Up HS/College/Open/Masters Bar starts at 12 Feet Pick your competitive level and join the fun…. ($20 Entry/Vaulter) ALL DAY VAULTING …. @ …. THE FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: THRUST-At-the-TAKEOFF @ CIRCUS! JOIN US!
posts.Content:
“THRUST-at-the-TAKEOFF”…..
The mission this winter at FLYING CIRCUS, Inc. is improve the THRUST thru the Take-off…. with a very active PUSHING THE POLE UP TO THE VERTICAL…. this pushing of the fiberglass helps increase POLE SPEED and gain positions for a vertical safe vault to the TOP!!! Join us this HOLIDAY SEASON for some good ..ole… POLE PUSHING !!!!! Points-of-Interest
* Congratulations to Flying Circus South Coach Ben Simonet at the Armory Pole Vault Program. Ben…along with Will Nesbitt have created an unbelievable pole vault educational atmosphere this early season at the New Balance Center at the Armory. Pole Vaulting has taken wings at the armory…. and it’s here for all to take part in… Many Thanks !!!! * Special Thanks to Craig and Bobbi-Jo Di Bona of Warwick, New York for the wonderful gift of the new Pole Vault Safety Collar for our indoor facility in Warwick. This new equipment will make our event and vaulters safer on every jump up… Many Thanks !!! * COLLEGE/OPEN POLE VAULT SESSIONS are here.. We want to re-connect with our Alumni Vaulters.. Practice Dec. 18, 20,28,29(Meet), Jan 2 Check web site for times on those days. Welcome home!! * FLYING CIRCUS WILL BE CLOSED on Dec.ember 24,25,31 and January 1.
* OCL West Point Meet… UCKERMARK..DiBONA…LEAHEY led the “Flyers” at Friday Nights meet at Gillis. Todd Uckermark and Derek Dibona flew 15’ 0” with no spikes and both near missed at school record 15’ 6 bar…. Warwick Valley junior…Erin Leahey had BIG AIR-JUMPS at 10’ 6” for the win. * Kara Lynn Snyder(Colonie) won tonights Jim Mitchell Vault Title with her 10’ 6” clear..followed by Samantha Beyar(MW) at 10’ 6” and Matea Friedel(Rye) at 9’ 6”. Brandon Nebiker(Monroe,NY) sailed over 12’ 6” for the GOLD for Coach Jim Glovers Crusaders!!! * Former Circus Act„,Freshman Justin Farrenkopf(Manhattan College) won his second college meet at 15’ 3” this weekend… and Marisa Robbins placed 3rd at 10’ 10”..Breanna Brucher (10’ 4”) Sarah Moore(10’ 4”) for Coach Dan Mecca’s Jasper Vault team. * Our SPRING PV CAMPS and our Summer PV Camps are a hit!!! They are filling up fast now… register ASAP…Applications at web site… www.hvflyingcircus.com !!! Join the VAULT ARMY here in Warwick, NY !!!! * COMING in 14 DAYS…. “The FLYING CIRCUS GREATEST POLE VAULT MEET of the YEAR”…. Join us here in Warwick,NY on Sunday December 28th ALL DAY… as we .. “ROUND-UP the BEST FIBERGLASS VAULTERS east of the Mississippi River” for a SPIRIT DAY of VAULTING… Check Web site blog for your level of competition for that day…. HAPPY HOLIDAYS…… FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: "ROCKET LAUNCH"... HAPPY HOLIDAYS from FLYING CIRCUS !!!
posts.Content: 'House of Fiberglass' HOLIDAY GREETINGS from your FLYING CIRCUS !!!! ******************************************** CIRCUS NEWS # 10 December 22 CONGRATULATIONS to all Circus Vaulters in this first week of friendly and spirited competitions around the Metro area. Many great performances were recorded and the season has launched successfully. Always remember…that there are many hidden joys of competition… many things that the spectators on the edge of the track…or sitting in the balcony seats never realize…. . The sheer joy and pleasure of being an athlete…striving for your personal goal… being with friends that share the same dreams…. helping others in the heat of the battle and showing complete humility in all situations…. This is the spirit and soul of the sport that we all seek…. Keep striving for the human connection. HAPPY HOLIDAYS !!!!!!! West Point OCL Meet @ Gillis……There is a NEW SECTION 9 and Warwick Valley HS ALL TIME POLE VAULT RECORD… as The Purple Wave senior..Todd UCKERMARK lifted over 16’ 2” on his UCS Spirit 15 x 180 to delight his Coach Mike Potter and team mates on Saturday afternoon. This performance came with a 14’ 6” grip…producing a 30” effective push off the top of the pole!!!! Full PV Results are coming from the complete competition. Armory Track…Bishop Loughlin Games…. Girls action started the 60th edition of Loughlin Games at the historic New Balance Armory…. and Senior Jenna CALANDRO(Newtown,CT) led the Circus sweep of the Top 3 places with her NEW INDOOR SCHOOL RECORD of 12’ 0” on her 13’1 x 140 UCS Spirit Glass…and had 2 good attempts at 12’ 6’ meet record. Jenna is committed to Bucknell University next fall. Placing in a tie for second place were the Albany vault duo Kara SNYDER(Colonie,NY) and Kalli MANLY(Burnt Hills,NY) as both near missed at 11’ 6” on the super fast Mondo X new runway. posts.Title: Staff
posts.Content:
Tim St. Lawrence

The following is an article from the Rockland County Track & Field Hall of Fame:

 

When looking at the history of track and field in Rockland County, one cannot avoid frequent encounters with the surname St. Lawrence. Joe St. Lawrence was the 25-year coach of Suffern High’s track team from the 1940s through the mid-’60s, before entering the state Legislature and later serving as the County treasurer. His sons all embraced his enthusiastic love of track and field and excelled each in their own way in the sport.

 

Timothy, the second son of Marguerite and Joe St. Lawrence, showed the promise of athletic greatness even as a small child. He excelled at basketball, football, swimming, diving and being able to amaze his friends with his ability to do acrobatic tricks. The St. Lawrences’ “back yard” was expansive, and frequently with help from his dad, he and his friends would hold small track meets. Tim was usually a leading point-getter in those meets. Nothing much changed as he grew as an athlete. He was usually one of the best athletes in any contest he competed in.

Continue Reading...

 

Hugh Cauthers

Hugh Cauthers. was born to coach. As a Monroe-Woodbury Central High School(NY) teacher. and coach. for 45 years, he developed championship teams in Boys Soccer. and Boys & Girls. Indoor and Outdoor Track & Field. He promoted the field events for Head Legendary Coaches... Dick Wilson...Lou Hall. and Jim Glover in the " Crusaderland of Purple Pride." His athletes. dominated all four jumping events(Long Jump,High Jump,Pole Vault,Triple Jump). in those. 45 years..... but his real love was... The Pole Vault. He sued NY State into providing the Pole Vault Event for Girls in 1998 and proceeded in coaching Michelle Kercado to the National Record (12' 9.75) in 1999. He also coached Alana Carroll to National Gold. and Stephanie Duffy to National Silver in the Vault.

He was inducted into the Section 9 Track & Field Hall of Fame. and Co-Founded. the Flying Circus. in 2000, for all area athletes wishing. to fly higher on fiberglass. Hugh is considered by all to be... "The Father of the Girls Pole Vault" in New York State.

 

Stephanie Duffy

Stephanie Duffy put the Flying Circus on the Vault Map…with her 3 New York State Pole Vaulting Championships( 13' 1.5") …her 3 Time All-American High School honors…her Runner-Up at Nike Outdoor Nationals (12' 10.75")…Her Many Diving Accomplishments at Washingtonville High School…her National Honor Society accomplishments and her Perfect Attendance all four years in High School and her leadership skills both in High School and College.

 

 

Stephanie competed at a Championship Level for the University of South Florida, Tampa,Florida for coaching legend…Don Marsh. She was BIG EAST POLE VAUL Champion…a 5 Time ACADEMIC ALL-AMERICAN with a personal best pole vault of 13' 6.25" for the South Florida BULLS Track & Field Team. She majored in Elementary Education and graduated with Honors and Dean List status and now teaches young Elementary Students in her home district at Washington Central Schools,New York. Her positive approach in teaching and her patience with young children are above reproach. She has excellent Bio-Mechanics understanding of the complex pole vaulting movements.

Bob Sorensen

Coach Bob Sorensen comes from a long family line of pole vaulters and begins his seventh year at Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy. Coach Sorensen teaches pole vault technique and pole vault safety.

Bob uses small progressive drills aimed at the. athletes ability level and brings a strong emphasis on the approach, run, pole drop mechanics. and plant positions/angles. His positive coaching style promotes confidence and trust in his athletes skills. Coach Sorensen is a Level 1 instructor at our pole vault club sessions, camps, clinics, and meets. He also assists in all Armory camps and clinics in pole vault.

He is an EMS medical certified leader and coaches his All-American son, Dane Sorensen (Cortland University) when he is home from university. He is co-director of our home meets, including our Circus Summer Festival.

posts.Title: Staff
posts.Content:
Tim St. Lawrence

The following is an article from the Rockland County Track & Field Hall of Fame:


When looking at the history of track and field in Rockland County, one cannot avoid frequent encounters with the surname St. Lawrence. Joe St. Lawrence was the 25-year coach of Suffern High’s track team from the 1940s through the mid-’60s, before entering the state Legislature and later serving as the County treasurer. His sons all embraced his enthusiastic love of track and field and excelled each in their own way in the sport.

Timothy, the second son of Marguerite and Joe St. Lawrence, showed the promise of athletic greatness even as a small child. He excelled at basketball, football, swimming, diving and being able to amaze his friends with his ability to do acrobatic tricks. The St. Lawrences’ “back yard” was expansive, and frequently with help from his dad, he and his friends would hold small track meets. Tim was usually a leading point-getter in those meets. Nothing much changed as he grew as an athlete. He was usually one of the best athletes in any contest he competed in.

In 1962, when Tim was in eighth grade, a pole vaulter named John Uelses became the first to clear the 16-foot barrier. He was using a pole made of fiberglass as well as a new technique. Tim knew at that point that he wanted to be a pole vaulter. As a freshman at Suffern High, he matched the school record of 11 feet 6 inches set in 1955, and later that year cleared 12 feet. He, along with David Mumme of Spring Valley, pioneered the use of the fiberglass pole in this area. In four years (1963 through 1966), he helped to bring high school vaulting to an entire new level of achievement. County championships typically won at 11 feet now ascended to 12, 13, and eventually 14 feet plus in a matter of just four years.

Never selfish about his knowledge of the event, he conducted clinics for his competitors that lifted the level of local competition exponentially. The landing pit erected in the St. Lawrences’ back yard (ball nets stuffed with strips of foam rubber recovered from the International Nickel Plant in Sloatsburg) was probably one of the best places around for a young vaulter to learn and excel. It became a local mecca where pole vaulters could come to “play.” Just a couple of years later as Tim became a collegian, the back-yard pit hosted some of the best pole vaulters in the nation, as they would drop by to visit and train.

Tim capped an outstanding run in high school by winning the pole vault at the New York State championships in 1966. His winning performance of 14-5 ¼ set a New York State record, and 44 years later it remains as the Suffern High School record in the event.

At the University of Alabama he won four varsity letters in track and field. At the Alabama Relays in 1971, he set an Alabama school record with a personal best performance of 17 feet, 1 ¼ inches. After college, he competed for the New York Athletic Club, where he won 19 consecutive Metropolitan Association pole vault championships – nine indoors and 10 outdoors. This is a Metropolitan Association record for an individual in any track and field event that still stands today. During this time he competed in the 1972 U.S. Olympic Trials, and represented the U.S.A. in meets in Edinburgh, Scotland; Ontario, Canada; and Tel Aviv, Israel. He was on the East team of the inaugural Olympic Sports Festival in 1976. If you ask Tim what time it is today, he possibly would be looking at the watch he won as champion of the Penn Relays Olympic Development pole vault in 1976, where he jumped 16-6.

Following the inspiration of his father, Tim, sought a career in teaching and coaching. As superb as he was as an athlete, as a coach he has been simply sensational. He coached for 33 seasons in track and cross country at Warwick Valley High School in Orange County. His cross country teams won 27 championships there and won the NYSPHSAA state title four times (1982, 1994, 1995 and 2007). His outdoor track teams won 30 championships and were New York State Class B champions in 1997. He began the indoor track program in 1978, and the team won 20 championships under his tutelage.

In 1997 he was honored as the National Federation of High Schools Athletic Association’s Cross Country Coach of the Year.

Tim has coached 40 state champions (22 in cross country, 18 in track), 32 high school All-Americas, and has had 18 teams over the years ranked nationally. His cross country teams compiled a dual-meet winning streak of 156 victories, while his outdoor track teams amassed an even more remarkable streak of 167 consecutive wins.

His incredible enthusiasm for track and field has now been communicated to two generations. He has become a master promoter of the sport, and is currently the director of the Purple Wave Fast Times Relays – one of the most popular meets among athletes in the area. In 2006 he also started a highly successful pole-vaulting academy, the Hudson Valley Flying Circus, in Warwick.

Many of Tim’s graduates have gone on to excel in collegiate track – including an NCAA champion. Many more have gone on to become coaches as well.

Tim is retired after a long year career as a physical education teacher in the Warwick Valley Schools. He is married to Alice (Wolf) St. Lawrence and they have two sons – Timothy, 30, and Michael, 28 – who were both members of a state championship cross country team while at Goshen High School. The St. Lawrences reside in Goshen, N.Y.

Continue Reading ↓

Hugh Cauthers

Bio coming soon...

Benoit Simonet

Ben was born on November 15, 1974 in Portugal, where he lived until he was 17. At that time he was very involved in gymnastics.

In 1992 he attended college in Belgium where he learned to pole vault in 1995. He later graduated with a degree in Physical Education which he taught in schools form 1996 to 1998 as he continued vaulting. He was among the top 5 vaulters in Belgium from 1996 to 2008 during which time he also managed track and field clubs.

He set his personal best in 2000 of 17' 4.5" which stands as the 10th best all time Belgian performance. In '98, '01, '03, '04 he was the French community Belgian champion.

He married to his wife, Samoa, in 2009, moved to the states in 2011 and now has two children.

Continue Reading ↓

Will Nesbitt

Will began vaulting at Millburn High School in NJ, where he was State Champion and All-American in 1980 in the pole vault (16’4”) and decathlon. He then competed for Duke University and later received an MBA from Harvard Business School. Since his graduation from Harvard, Will has held a number of senior executive positions in private equity and investment management.

In 2012, Will rediscovered his passion for pole vaulting at the Flying Circus and now competes in the Masters Division, placing 2nd in the 2013 National Indoor Championships and 4th in the Outdoor Championships. He is also on the Board of Directors and is Chairman of the Development Committee at the Armory Foundation, which runs the Armory Track & Field Center in New York City.

Will is a member of the Global Advisory Council of TechnoServe, a global nonprofit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking enterprising people in the developing world to information, capital and markets. He is also a member of the Advisory Council of Osa Conservation, a nonprofit which applies scientific, educational, economic and management expertise to protecting the habitats, people and wildlife of the Osa Peninsula, Cosa Rica. Will and his wife Michelle live in New York City.

Continue Reading ↓

Mandy Jenkins

Mandy has been involved in the pole vault for over 12 years. She attended high school at Valley Central High School in Montgomery, NY where she placed in the state meet numerous times, including becoming state champ in the indoor pole vault in 2002. After high school, Mandy attended college at Mount St. Mary's University in Emmitsburg, MD. She was the Northeast Conference champion in pole vault 7 times, and was All-East for Indoors 2007, as well as an Academic All-American.

After graduating from the Mount in 2007, Mandy accepted a graduate assistant position with Wagner College in Staten Island, NY where she coached Wagner's pole vaulters and jumps crew for two years, while also continuing to vault and help coach at the Barn. Mandy now works as a Physician Assistant and continues to stay involved in the pole vault, both through coaching and continuing to vault with Hudson Valley Flying Circus.

Continue Reading ↓

Nothing much changed as he grew as an athlete. He was usually one of the best athletes in any contest he competed in.

In 1962, when Tim was in eighth grade, a pole vaulter named John Uelses became the first to clear the 16-foot barrier. He was using a pole made of fiberglass as well as a new technique. Tim knew at that point that he wanted to be a pole vaulter. As a freshman at Suffern High, he matched the school record of 11 feet 6 inches set in 1955, and later that year cleared 12 feet. He, along with David Mumme of Spring Valley, pioneered the use of the fiberglass pole in this area. In four years (1963 through 1966), he helped to bring high school vaulting to an entire new level of achievement. County championships typically won at 11 feet now ascended to 12, 13, and eventually 14 feet plus in a matter of just four years.

Never selfish about his knowledge of the event, he conducted clinics for his competitors that lifted the level of local competition exponentially. The landing pit erected in the St. Lawrences’ back yard (ball nets stuffed with strips of foam rubber recovered from the International Nickel Plant in Sloatsburg) was probably one of the best places around for a young vaulter to learn and excel. It became a local mecca where pole vaulters could come to “play.” Just a couple of years later as Tim became a collegian, the back-yard pit hosted some of the best pole vaulters in the nation, as they would drop by to visit and train.

Tim capped an outstanding run in high school by winning the pole vault at the New York State championships in 1966. His winning performance of 14-5 ¼ set a New York State record, and 44 years later it remains as the Suffern High School record in the event.

At the University of Alabama he won four varsity letters in track and field. At the Alabama Relays in 1971, he set an Alabama school record with a personal best performance of 17 feet, 1 ¼ inches. After college, he competed for the New York Athletic Club, where he won 19 consecutive Metropolitan Association pole vault championships – nine indoors and 10 outdoors. This is a Metropolitan Association record for an individual in any track and field event that still stands today. During this time he competed in the 1972 U.S. Olympic Trials, and represented the U.S.A. in meets in Edinburgh, Scotland; Ontario, Canada; and Tel Aviv, Israel. He was on the East team of the inaugural Olympic Sports Festival in 1976. If you ask Tim what time it is today, he possibly would be looking at the watch he won as champion of the Penn Relays Olympic Development pole vault in 1976, where he jumped 16-6.

Following the inspiration of his father, Tim, sought a career in teaching and coaching. As superb as he was as an athlete, as a coach he has been simply sensational. He coached for 33 seasons in track and cross country at Warwick Valley High School in Orange County. His cross country teams won 27 championships there and won the NYSPHSAA state title four times (1982, 1994, 1995 and 2007). His outdoor track teams won 30 championships and were New York State Class B champions in 1997. He began the indoor track program in 1978, and the team won 20 championships under his tutelage.

In 1997 he was honored as the National Federation of High Schools Athletic Association’s Cross Country Coach of the Year.

Tim has coached 40 state champions (22 in cross country, 18 in track), 32 high school All-Americas, and has had 18 teams over the years ranked nationally. His cross country teams compiled a dual-meet winning streak of 156 victories, while his outdoor track teams amassed an even more remarkable streak of 167 consecutive wins.

His incredible enthusiasm for track and field has now been communicated to two generations. He has become a master promoter of the sport, and is currently the director of the Purple Wave Fast Times Relays – one of the most popular meets among athletes in the area. In 2006 he also started a highly successful pole-vaulting academy, the Hudson Valley Flying Circus, in Warwick.

Many of Tim’s graduates have gone on to excel in collegiate track – including an NCAA champion. Many more have gone on to become coaches as well.

Tim is retired after a long year career as a physical education teacher in the Warwick Valley Schools. He is married to Alice (Wolf) St. Lawrence and they have two sons – Timothy, 30, and Michael, 28 – who were both members of a state championship cross country team while at Goshen High School. The St. Lawrences reside in Goshen, N.Y.

Continue Reading ↓

Hugh Cauthers

Bio coming soon...

Benoit Simonet

Ben was born on November 15, 1974 in Portugal, where he lived until he was 17. At that time he was very involved in gymnastics.

In 1992 he attended college in Belgium where he learned to pole vault in 1995. He later graduated with a degree in Physical Education which he taught in schools form 1996 to 1998 as he continued vaulting. He was among the top 5 vaulters in Belgium from 1996 to 2008 during which time he also managed track and field clubs.

He set his personal best in 2000 of 17' 4.5" which stands as the 10th best all time Belgian performance. In '98, '01, '03, '04 he was the French community Belgian champion.

He married to his wife, Samoa, in 2009, moved to the states in 2011 and now has two children.

Continue Reading ↓

Will Nesbitt

Will began vaulting at Millburn High School in NJ, where he was State Champion and All-American in 1980 in the pole vault (16’4”) and decathlon. He then competed for Duke University and later received an MBA from Harvard Business School. Since his graduation from Harvard, Will has held a number of senior executive positions in private equity and investment management.

In 2012, Will rediscovered his passion for pole vaulting at the Flying Circus and now competes in the Masters Division, placing 2nd in the 2013 National Indoor Championships and 4th in the Outdoor Championships. He is also on the Board of Directors and is Chairman of the Development Committee at the Armory Foundation, which runs the Armory Track & Field Center in New York City.

Will is a member of the Global Advisory Council of TechnoServe, a global nonprofit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking enterprising people in the developing world to information, capital and markets. He is also a member of the Advisory Council of Osa Conservation, a nonprofit which applies scientific, educational, economic and management expertise to protecting the habitats, people and wildlife of the Osa Peninsula, Cosa Rica. Will and his wife Michelle live in New York City.

Continue Reading ↓

Mandy Jenkins

Mandy has been involved in the pole vault for over 12 years. She attended high school at Valley Central High School in Montgomery, NY where she placed in the state meet numerous times, including becoming state champ in the indoor pole vault in 2002. After high school, Mandy attended college at Mount St. Mary's University in Emmitsburg, MD. She was the Northeast Conference champion in pole vault 7 times, and was All-East for Indoors 2007, as well as an Academic All-American.

After graduating from the Mount in 2007, Mandy accepted a graduate assistant position with Wagner College in Staten Island, NY where she coached Wagner's pole vaulters and jumps crew for two years, while also continuing to vault and help coach at the Barn. Mandy now works as a Physician Assistant and continues to stay involved in the pole vault, both through coaching and continuing to vault with Hudson Valley Flying Circus.

Continue Reading ↓

posts.Title: Facilities
posts.Content:
The Barn

The Barn is one of two main practice areas at The Flying Circus and houses 2 pits, over 225 poles and several apparatus for off the pit drills. The barn is also wired with a high tech camera system to give instant replays of jumps as well as a speaker system for music to be enjoyed both indoors and out.

Outdoor Facility

The outdoor facility also has three pits, for a total of five. Two are opposite each other and share a runway. Having five pits allows us split up our vaulters into different groups for a better learning experience that is targeted toward their ability. Having both indoor and outdoor facilities also allows us to practice and compete year round, rain or shine.

posts.Title: Boards
posts.Content:
Playing For Change

The song you're hearing, Stand By Me, is performed by Roger Ridley, Street Musician Artist, as part of the Playing For Change campaign:

Playing For Change is a movement created to inspire and connect the world through music. The idea for this project came from a common belief that music has the power to break down boundaries and overcome distances between people.

Read more about it here →

posts.Title: Forms
posts.Content:
ALL ATHLETES taking part in any and all activities of the Hudson Valley Flying Circus must have updated membership in USATF.

Register at usatf.org for the coming year.

The Standard Meet and Practice Form

Note that this form is for practices and meets ONLY. It also only needs to be filled out once per school year. It is not for the Summer/Spring Camps, or for the Winter Club Membership. That form is listed below. HVFC Practice & Meet Form (PDF) →

2025 SUMMER FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CAMPS

You are invited to join the fun and learning to fly with us this summer at our 28th Boys and Girls Flying Circus Pole Vault Camps in Warwick, New York. These. 2-day camps at our five pole vault pits, along with our indoor apparatus will provide a sensational understanding of the Mechanics of the Pole Vault event. Both camps are Co-Ed for Grades. 6-12. We will supply all the poles at camp and have experienced coaches leading the ability-based groups of instruction. click here

New Membership Forms 2024 - 2025

New Membership  Forms  Link for our new Flying Circus  Pole Vault Club Membership ..which begins September 1, 2024  ~. September 1, 2025. THANK YOU for all your great support again this year.    Coach St. and Staff Membership  Link  ………… https://form.jotform.com/Schuler_James/hudson-valley-flying-circus

posts.Title: Schedule
posts.Content:
2021 FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER FIBER-BLAST POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEET

The Hudson Valley Flying Circus , LLC Warwick Valley, NY The 2021 FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT FESTIVAL July 9-10 , 2021 @  The Warwick Center Flying Circus, NY 110 Athletes Entered .... 90 Athletes Competed Two New York State Records....  29 Personal Bests Indoor  and  Outdoor Competitions Friday  July 9, 2021  Results (Indoor) Boys Frosh/Soph Division:  1-Andy Cimino(Warwick,NY)..................  12' 4"  2-Scott Anderson(Hopewell,NJ).............  12' 1"  3-Ben Mandler(Woodcliff Lake,NJ).........   11' 1"    -Tom Goydan(Chester,NJ)....................    NH    -Seamus McCann(Silver Springs,MD)..    NH        Girls Frosh/Soph Division:    1-Lily Beattie(Warwick, NY)....................... 11' 7"  2-Ellison Weiner (Weston, CT..................... 11' posts.Title: Schedule
posts.Content:
2021 FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER FIBER-BLAST POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEET

Hudson Valley Flying Circus,LLC Warwick, New York  10990 WELCOME TO OUR SUMMER FESTIVAL POLE VAULT MEET !!!!!!!!!!! YOU  are invited  to join us  here at Flying Circus Pole Vault  for  a  summer meet you will never forget.  Yes~~~~It’s time  to bring back childhood memories and relive the  “Celebration of Pole Vault”.   This is more than just a pole vault meet.   It will be a summer gathering…(aka)….festival of endless  music .. fun…games…friendships …food trucks …dancing  and  real  story telling!!!   You can’t  miss  this happening !!!   ALL Divisions in meet…Middle School,High School,Open,Masters,Elite ~~~~~ JOIN this SUMMER MOVEMENT of FLYING  with US!!!! DATES:  Friday  July 9, 2021  and Saturday  July 10, 2021    TIME:   All Day COMPETITION SCHEDULE:     (Rain or Shine..Indoor/Outdoor Pits)  Friday July 9 ,2021   Barn Doors Open  at 8:01AM  10:01AM…. Pit #1 ….. Boys Freshman  and Sophomore Athletes                      Pit #2…… Girls Freshman and Sophomore Athletes  1:01PM       Pit  #1….. MASTERS MEN and WOMEN Athletes  4:01PM       Pit #1 ……Boys and Girls Middle School Athletes Saturday  July 10, 2021 Barn Doors Open at 8:01AM  10:01AM…… Pit #1 ….. Boys  Junior  and Senior HS Athletes                      Pit #2…… Girls Junior  and  Senior HS Athletes  1:01PM….. Pit #1……..OPEN MENS Athletes                    Pit #2……. OPEN WOMENS Athletes  4:01PM….  Pit #1……. ELITE WOMEN INVITED Athletes(10 Athletes at  14’0″ +PR)   Contact Coach St    at coachst@gmail.com  for details.  PRIZES:   – CASH PRIZE~~ $500  for  winner. – 20 oz Bottle  of  Cold JOE TEA after last attempt in competition for ALL…. The Official “Lighting-in-a-Bottle” Drink  @ FLYING CIRCUS. ON LINE REGISTRATION ONLY:   NO MEET DAY ENTRY.  This is  an entry fee/not a participation fee… NO REFUNDS.ENTER at Sign Up Genius   CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP ENTRY FEE:   EARLY REGISTRATION  FEE (Before June  15)   ………. $55 per Athlete                        LATE REGISTRATION FEE (June 16-July 5)……………… $75 per Athlete                       EVENT CLOSES Mid-Night  July 5.   NO MEET DAY REGISTRATION. This is  a NYRR  MILLROSE GAMES Early Qualifier  for   Jr. Boys  and Jr. Girls  HS  Pole Vault Event. OUR GOAL ……. FUN  and FRIENDSHIP  thru Pole Vaulting.    Hope  to see you this  summer in Warwick, New York  Coach St/Coach Sorensen/Coach Duffy/Coach Cevoli/Coach Pasek

FALL TRAINING SCHEDULE (September 5 - November 9)

The Flying Circus will be open four days per week for Open Instruction Groups. Cost is still just $30 per vaulter per 90 minute open sessions for the 2014-15 seasons. Athletes pay at the door policy on each day participating. Each athlete must be a current member of USATF to participate in any and all activities.

Super Sundays:
  • Session #1 12:30PM-2PM GIRLS ONLY LEVEL 1 and LEVEL 2 (Beginner & Intermediate)
  • Session #2 2PM- 3:30PM BOYS ONLY LEVEL 1 and LEVEL 2 Vaulters (Beginner & Intermediate)
  • Session #3 3:30PM-5PM BOYS & GIRLS LEVEL 3 Vaulters (Advanced Vaulters) Boys 13’0″ and Up/Girls 11′ 0″ and Up

  • 5:30PM-7PM Boys Open … Level 1 and 2 Vaulters

  • 7PM-8:30PM Girls Open Mixed, Levels 1,2,3 Vaulters
Fridays:
  • 5:30PM-7PM Boys, Levels 3 Vaulters Only (13'0" & Up)
  • 7PM-8:30PM. Girls Level 3 Vaulters Only (11' 0" & Up)

Playing For Change

The song you're hearing, One Love, is performed as part of the Playing For Change campaign:

Playing For Change is a movement created to inspire and connect the world through music. The idea for this project came from a common belief that music has the power to break down boundaries and overcome distances between people.

Read more about it here →

How To Register For A Meet

TEAM CLINICS for SPRING TEAMS

This program is designed to help instruct all High School Boys and Girls and Coaches this Spring Track & Field season in the techniques and safety of the High School Pole Vault Event. The Team Clinics will be offered to single teams and their coaches…and consist of 2 hours of Beginning…Intermediate and Advanced Pole Vaulting Instruction and Progressive Drills . Clinics are composed of 4- 12 athletes from the same school at just $30 per athlete. Coaches come FREE…. Join us and schedule YOUR TEAM for a Pole Vault Clinic !!!!

This program begins March 3 -April 11 any Monday-Tuesday-Wednesday or Thursday.

All athletes must be registered members of USATF ($25 per year) at usatf.com/membership.

To schedule a TEAM POLE VAULT CLINIC for YOUR TEAM …. contact Coach Tim St.Lawrence at coachst@gmail.com
