posts.Title: TODD UCKERMARK (Warwick,NY) Flys 16' 9" / MADDIE SCHNEIDER (Darien,CT) Rockets 12' 1" at ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY MEET!!!!!!
posts.Content:
"A DAY of VAULTING" ...... 
  December 29,  2013

  The Barn was filled with friends..... as  The 3rd ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY MEET was the .."BEST EVER" !!!!   The  four section meet  saw a "Circus Record " of   70 vaulters sharing  fiberglass poles... enjoying old stories   and  pushing to new personal bests  and school records in the 12 hour meet at FLYING CIRCUS  in Warwick Valley,NY.   The music   was loud... but the volunteers , parents   and coaches were cheerful and helpful beyond  any 12 hour track meet  we ever saw... CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU  TO ALL for making  our meet a joy!!!!!

  Here's the scoop......
    Warwick Valley ,NY  senior TODD UCKERMARK lifted over 16' 9"  with his 15' 1" UCS Spirit for a school record  and 2nd Highest vault ever in New York State Vault History !!!!   His 36" Push Off the Top was spectacular. It marks his 7th 16 foot vault of the early season for Coach Mike Potters Purple Wave!!!.. Winning Gold in the Open Division  was Navy  Freshman... Mike Brunaforte(Smithtown,NY) at 16' 2"... Taking  the Masters Division  was our very own WILL NESBITT of the Circus...with his 12' 1" sail..... Reno here they come !!!!

   BOYS HS. RESULTS
**********************************
   (All athletes competed Unattached....Hometowns Listed)
   
   16' 9"  Todd Uckermark.... Unattached.... (Warwick,NY
   15' 7'   Derek DiBona........ Unattached....(Warwick,NY)
   14' 7"  Ryan Murphy......... Unattached...(Iona,,NY)

    MEN'S OPEN DIVISION
    ****************************
    16' 2"   Mike Brunforte......Unattached...(Smithtown,NY)

    14' 7"   John Lee.............Unattached ..(Radnor,PA)
    14' 7"   Greg Gallagher....Unattached....(Iona,NY)

    MASTERS MEN'S DIVISION
    **********************************

    GIRLS HIGH DIVISION
    ***************************
        Darien High School,CT...Junior....MADDIE SCHNEIDER....fresh off her gold medal win  at Marien Corp Invite on Saturday.... took her vaulting up to the next level...with her  12' 1" All-Time best    and near missed  at 12' 4" school record. The Blue-Wave multi-event standout  is heading to Reno Summit in just 3 Weeks !!!    Taking our breath away in the Open Division...was Circus-Wonder...Stephanie Duffy...University of South Florida    grad...with her 12' 4"  holiday clear  for the Don Marsh Track Club !!!!

     10'  7"   Toni Werner.............Unattached..(Pine Bush,NY)
      9'  7"    Samantha Cleary.....Unattached..(Flemington,NJ)
     
<hr>
    Weekend Highlites....     Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY)  ..bound for Villanova next fall... won her  third  straight Rhode Island HS Classic Vault title on Saturday.....Maddie Schneider  (11' 6")  and Jessica Thornberry(10' 0")  took the Marine Corp relays Relay on Saturday...and Iona Prep ,NY  Vault crew of Ryan Murphy(15'0)..Matt Fay(13' 6") and Jah'eem Wheatly(13' 6") won the Relay  plaque for  Coach Jerry Cahill!!!  Joe Crispi(Farrell)   flew 14' 6" on new glass....  Erin Leahey(Warwick,NY) placed 2nd at Armory ay 10' 6"  and sped  63.0 on winning DMR...Kalli Manly lifted over 10' 6"  as Did Samantha Beyar and Leah Wachmuth at RCC invite!!... Todd Uckermark won gold on Saturday at 16' 0" at Marine Corp  for The Purple Wave !!!  Matt Leanza(Suffern,NY) won the Pearl River Invite at 11' 6"  at RCC on Friday!!!

     Boys  Club Classes  meet Monday at regular times    and Girls Club classes meet on Thursday evening at regular times.   Circus is Closed December 31  and January 1  to ring in the new year!!!!

                    FLYING CIRCUS....... BORN-TO-FLY.

posts.Title: CIRCUS FALL VAULTING COMING SEPTEMBER 9!!! JOIN THE FUN!!!
posts.Content: The ”BARN DOORS” are about to swing open for the preparation of the exciting Indoor Track & Field Season that will soon be happening at The New Balance Track & Field Center Armory in New York City!!! It’s time to get ready for all the fun and competition …. Join us as often as possible! Our fall practice and meet schedules are now available online here. A few things to note: ALL ATHLETES taking part in any and all activities of the Hudson Valley Flying Circus must have up dated membership in USATF… Register at usatf.org/membership for the coming year. POLE VAULTING POLE RENTAL PROGRAM has been discontinued at the Flying Circus…. as well as lending out overnight poles to athletes. All athletics should talk to your High School Coaches ASAP in regard to providing poles for you this Indoor and Outdoor seasons. When ordering your poles… please specify UCS Spirit Pole Vaulting Poles…the most reliable pole vaulting poles made. Contact mfathletic.com for your ordering of UCS Spirit Vaulting Poles and Equipment!!!!! It will be hard to duplicate this years success at The FLYING CIRCUS… 6 NATIONAL PV TITLES 13 STATE POLE VAULTING CHAMPIONS 9 ALL AMERICANS 123 CLUB MEMBERS But… WE ARE STARTING THE NEW CHALLENGE on SEPTEMBER 9th….. JOIN THE SURGE!!!!! POSITIVELY POLE VAULT …..”FLYING CIRCUS”

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS…..  "HOME of the FASTEST POLE VAULT RUNWAY  on the PLANET" !!!!!!!!
posts.Content: Special thanks to Coach Will Nesbitt ..Coach Ben Simonet …Dereck DiBona…and Todd Uckermark for installing our new MONDO SUPER. X PERFORMANCE HIGH SPEED RUNWAY at The Flying Circus Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development….. New Fall Classes begin September 9 …… Stay tuned !!!!!!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS... HAPPY NEW YEAR !!!!!!
posts.Content: HAPPY NEW YEAR to all pole vaulters and families from your FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLUB!!!! THANK YOU  for your unbending support for our Pole Vault Developmental Project at both FLYING CIRCUS NORTH and SOUTH.  Your  support continues to make this project FUN   and PRODUCTIVE.... See you all after the Holiday.   UP-DATE NEWS .... * Special Thanks to the DiBona Family Donation of our New  and Installed SAFETY  VAULT BOX COLLAR.... * Congratulations  to Ridgewood,NJ  Spencer Llerandi's  13' 6" personal best soar yesterday for the Maroons!!! * Flying Circus  Closed for December 31   and January 1. Regular Classes resume  January 2 . * Hats off and Thank you to  Herb and Vickie Uckermark of Warwick,NY  for the Club Donation of our new  and huge Video  Screen at our Barn Facility. It will provide great feedback of all vault videos for all our athletes.   Installation coming soon.... * FLYING CIRCUS Heads WEST.... 8 Athletes  and 3 coaches will be attending the UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL  POLE VAULT SUMMIT in Reno ,NV  to learn more  pole vault from the very best.  FLYING CIRCUS  in WARWICK  will be CLOSED on January 16-17-18-19. ALL information will be brought back for our club vaulters. * The 3rd ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY CLUB MEET was a resounding success  this weekend.  This friendly  in-house open meet was a USATF Club get together  and ALL ATHLETES  competed UNATTACHED in ALL DIVISIONS  with USATF Rules governing. Athletes did not represent their Colleges  or High  Schools . Special  thanks to all 70 vaulters and families   FLYING CIRCUS..... FEED YOUR  "SPIRIT"

posts.Title: NEW YEAR FIBER-WORKS ... RECORDS @ HISPANIC GAMES !!!
posts.Content:
RUN TALL... DRIVE PLANT..... FLY-A-WAY DEREK DiBONA(Warwick Valley,NY) FLYS OVER 15' 9" at HISPANIC GAMES to tie the NY STATE JUNIOR CLASS RECORD !!!!!! A New Year Begins........ ..... I hope everyone is ready to .."FLY 2014".... the CIRCUS ENGINE is about to put down the throttle...... Let's raise our senses.... take new chances on ourselves and enjoy each fiber-ride together!!! WELCOME to a NEW BEGINNING !!!! WINNERS ************ Some athletes set HIGHER STANDARDS for themselves. They come to practice early...and stay late. They always find the time to do things right. They are self motivated. Funny....how they are usually the winners. Here at FLYING CIRCUS..... We set HIGHER STANDARDS. We put in that extra effort. Be a WINNER....Work HARD.... Set a POSITIVE EXAMPLE for others.... STICK TOGETHER..... Support each other....Set HIGH GOALS.... IMPROVE EVERY DAY.. BELIEVE in YOURSELF .... EARN YOUR SPOT.... NEVER GIVE UP...... SHOW SPIRIT and SPORTSMANSHIP... ........ HAVE FUN thru FIBERGLASS .
HISPANIC GAMES @ ARMORY.... ...The Biggest meet of the year was fun on Saturday at the" House of Dreams"...ARMORY ,NYC....with 12 Circus vaulters enjoying the grand history of this Track & Field "Hall of Fame ". The Warwick Valley,NY Vault Twins... Senior Todd Uckermark and junior Derek DiBona from Coach Mike Potters runninmg stable...let loose with a NEW YORK STATE ALL TIME RELAY Best of 31' 6"...as both skyed over 15' 9" in the 40 man field... and brushed off the new year bars at 16' 3" each. DiBona equalled the State Junior Class record of Ryan Dall(No Rockland-1993). Both will take their show to the National Pole Vault Summit in Reno,NV in just 2 weeks!!! .... Great vaulting also came from Senior Pat Lynch((Cranford,NJ) with his comeback at 13' 9" and super 14'3 "leaps for the Notre Dame University bound speedster. Grayson Wright(Carmel,NY) 11' 3" and Dan Hannen(Cranford,NJ) 10' 3" looked good. .....The Girls Vault took center stage at 2PM following the National Anthem...and Vestal,NY Junior Kari Stromhaug won at 11' 9" ...erasing Jenna Marrione's meet record of 11' 7" from 2008. Kari placed 3rd in her Norwegian Jr. Championships this summer in Oslo and takes the NYS leader board in the vault. Kalli Manly(BH,NY) placed 3rd at 11' 3" on her BIG POLE and Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY) and Erin Leahey(Warwick Valley,NY) tied for 4th at 10' 9" each. Christina Masciala(Pascack Hills,NJ) coached by Russ Koehler and Hugh Cauthers flew 10' 3" for the All Begen County Gymnast. Dara Liss(Cheltenham,PA) flew 10' 3" and Niki Claery(HC,NJ) looked strong over 9' 3" !!!! Congrats to freshman vault star Nick Marino(Hatsboro,PA) for soaring 10' 9" at Vaultworx Games this weekend. He is coming to camp this spring!!!! * TODD UCKERMARK Commits to HIGH POINT UNIVERSITY, NC...... Congratulations to Todd and his family on his decision to attend HIGH POINT UNIVERSITY. This choice is wonderful..as it affords Todd a first class education in his major...Communications . Todd is the son of Hurb and Victoria Uckermark of Warwick,New York. * FINAL COLLEGE OPEN PRACTICE is Wednesday January 8 from 3-5PM at Barn...last chance before hitting the books again!!! Join Us!!! * Regular Membership Classes resume Monday January 6th. * Our SPRING and SUMMER Pole Vault Camps are filling up... SPACE IS LIMITED.... Register ASAP . Applications on our New and Improved web site... www.hvflyingcircus.com
TAP INTO THE POWER of DREAMS..... FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: KARA SNYDER FLYS DARTMOUTH....TRAVIS FOUNTAIN SAILS STANNER GAMES !!!!
posts.Content:
GREAT THING COME TO THOSE WHO WAIT ...... ....... Such was the case this weekend both in New Hampshire and New York City. It's the grand old backbone of participating in athletics... this notion of.."Never Giving Up" ...No Matter What. ...CONGRATULATIONS to our senior club vaulters KARA SNYDER(Colonie,NY) and TRAVIS FOUNTAIN(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) for teaching us all about this wonderful spirit of inner self. Let's follow suit...... Dartmouth Relays... Colonie,NY senior Kara Snyder is back from last spring's injury..with her Dartmouth Relays 11' 6" vault and moving up to her Bigger Poles all day with Coach Cauthers helping hand. The Villanova bound senior brushed off 12' 0" on all three attempts!!!! Circus team mate...Kalli Manly(BH,NY) soph made 11' 0" for 3rd place in this traditional meet in the snow!!! Stanner Games @ Armory "Hall -of-Fame"..... Another great comeback story took shape on Saturday morning...as senior Travis Fountain(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) reyurned to the pole vault event after an injury last spring . The likable and respected Fountain never complained about his injury fate... and Coach Glover supported his comeback this winter...he soared 14' 7" to place 3rd and near missed at 15' 1"..placing behind Circus mate Joe Crispi(Farrell,NY) also jumping 14' 7" for the Maroon... Shawn Cherian(Arlington) leaed 12'1" for 8th place. ...Samantha Beyar (Monroe-Woodbury,NY) was focused for her first Armory Major meet win in the vault as. she sailed 10'8" for Coach Chris Goodwin...and team mate Lexi Finn jumped 8'0" for the Purple Pride!! SCC Invite @ Hillhouse,CT.... 8 Flying Circus Vaulters lite up the Floyd Little Fieldhouse on Saturday....with Jenna Calandro(Newtown,CT) leading the charge with her 11' 6" gold medal vault.. followed by Maddie Schneider(Darien,CT) at 11' 0"...Jane Wall(Weston,CT) at 10' 0" Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield,CT) 10' 0" Jessica Thornberry(Darien,CT) 9' 6" Chloe Brown(Glastonberry,CT) 9' 6' E,ily Castro(Weston,CT at 8' 6" !!! East Stroudsburg Invite,PA..... Junior Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) was the HS Vault Winner at ESU Invite... With No Spikes allowed...Rymarzow flew the coop at 11' 0" and had great attempts at 11' 6" after her 9.40 PR Hurdle placing for Coach Corcoran Squad. They are competing next weekend at the NJ State Relays at Toms River Air Dome !! *** CONGRATULATIONS to Freshman DANA PLACENTRA at New York University for setting an ALL TIME UNIVERSITY PV RECORD at GOTHEM CUP on Friday Night at 10' 2"!!! RUN TALL ..PLANT TOUGH....ENJOY THE RECOIL
FLYING CIRCUS..... JOIN THE MOVEMENT @ CAMP

posts.Title: KARA SNYDER FLYS DARTMOUTH....TRAVIS FOUNTAIN SAILS STANNER GAMES !!!!
posts.Content:
GREAT THING COME TO THOSE WHO WAIT ...... ....... Such was the case this weekend both in New Hampshire and New York City. It's the grand old backbone of participating in athletics... this notion of.."Never Giving Up" ...No Matter What. ...CONGRATULATIONS to our senior club vaulters KARA SNYDER(Colonie,NY) and TRAVIS FOUNTAIN(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) for teaching us all about this wonderful spirit of inner self. Let's follow suit...... Dartmouth Relays... Colonie,NY senior Kara Snyder is back from last spring's injury..with her Dartmouth Relays 11' 6" vault and moving up to her Bigger Poles all day with Coach Cauthers helping hand. The Villanova bound senior brushed off 12' 0" on all three attempts!!!! Circus team mate...Kalli Manly(BH,NY) soph made 11' 0" for 3rd place in this traditional meet in the snow!!! Stanner Games @ Armory "Hall -of-Fame"..... Another great comeback story took shape on Saturday morning...as senior Travis Fountain(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) reyurned to the pole vault event after an injury last spring . The likable and respected Fountain never complained about his injury fate... and Coach Glover supported his comeback this winter...he soared 14' 7" to place 3rd and near missed at 15' 1"..placing behind Circus mate Joe Crispi(Farrell,NY) also jumping 14' 7" for the Maroon... Shawn Cherian(Arlington) leaed 12'1" for 8th place. ...Samantha Beyar (Monroe-Woodbury,NY) was focused for her first Armory Major meet win in the vault as. she sailed 10'8" for Coach Chris Goodwin...and team mate Lexi Finn jumped 8'0" for the Purple Pride!! SCC Invite @ Hillhouse,CT.... 8 Flying Circus Vaulters lite up the Floyd Little Fieldhouse on Saturday....with Jenna Calandro(Newtown,CT) leading the charge with her 11' 6" gold medal vault.. followed by Maddie Schneider(Darien,CT) at 11' 0"...Jane Wall(Weston,CT) at 10' 0" Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield,CT) 10' 0" Jessica Thornberry(Darien,CT) 9' 6" Chloe Brown(Glastonberry,CT) 9' 6' E,ily Castro(Weston,CT at 8' 6" !!! East Stroudsburg Invite,PA..... Junior Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) was the HS Vault Winner at ESU Invite... With No Spikes allowed...Rymarzow flew the coop at 11' 0" and had great attempts at 11' 6" after her 9.40 PR Hurdle placing for Coach Corcoran Squad. They are competing next weekend at the NJ State Relays at Toms River Air Dome !! *** CONGRATULATIONS to Freshman DANA PLACENTRA at New York University for setting an ALL TIME UNIVERSITY PV RECORD at GOTHEM CUP on Friday Night at 10' 2"!!! RUN TALL ..PLANT TOUGH....ENJOY THE RECOIL
FLYING CIRCUS..... JOIN THE MOVEMENT @ CAMP

posts.Title: UCS SPIRIT SUMMIT....... "MAGIC AGAIN" !!!!!
posts.Content:
POLE VAULT COMMUNITY GATHERING.....
  
<hr>
      CONGRATULATIONS TO UCS SPIRIT....MR. STEVE CHAPPELL AND STAFF   for delivering another  SENSATIONAL National Pole Vault Summit this past weekend in the  Wild West Valley of Reno, Nevada.   They came  to exchange ideas...to inspire and to move  our event up a few more steps on the ladder  .... MISSION ACCOMPLISHED !!!!!

     FLYING CIRCUS would like to THANK all  parents....coaches   and especially our athletes who made  this trip a GREAT  EXPERIENCE for all of us.... ON TO THE NEXT CHALLENGES !!!!!

     Results...News...Happenings...
     January 21, 2014

  Reno, NV.....  Warwick Valley,NY senior Todd Uckermark was ready for Runway #1...with a big clear at 16' 2" and then had great  jumps at  the 16' 8 bar on all three...His 16' 2   performance sets a Flying Circus Summit  all time record!!!  Also jumping super was junior Derek DiBona(Warwick Valley,NY)  with a NEW YORK STATE JUNIOR CLASS RECORD of 15' 10" on his 15'1" x 190 pole .... Both  Purple Wave athletes will now move up to the 15' 7" UCS Spirit series!!!! Both are entered in Saturdays New Balance Invitational at Armory.

   The  Five Circus Girls were also ready for the Saturday meet...following the Friday clinic and working with the National Pole Vault Staff. Darien.CT. junior  Maddie  "Multi"  Schneider used her biggest pole of the year  and it still was not enough glass as she brushed off 11' 11" on Runway # 4 to place 3rd in her Pit  competition  and 15th overall at the her first summit. She will now move up to 13' 7" UCS Series... Sophomore Kalli "BlackBelt" Manly )Burnt Hills,NY) flew 10' 9"  and  was super at 11' 4"... Kari "Splash"  Murnane(Lenape Valley,NJ) enjoyed   her second trip to summit  and had 10' 9" on all jumps.. Erin "Super-Kicks" Leahey(Warwick Valley,NY) cleared 10' 3 Huge and moved up poles at 10' 9"  and Cara "Snow-Board" Kelly..just a junior from Vernon Township.NJ set an indoor school record at 10' 3" and jumped  on her 150 UCS spirit for the very first time.

    Our very own... Flying Circus Coach Will "Flying-Blue Devil" Nesbitt(NYC.NY) was the talk on runway #8.. as he jumped big over 12' 2"  by 2 feet... then pole softness at 12' 9" took over. Will sets a Flying Circus Coaches record for Summit...Let's Go Ben and St !!!!!!

    Special thanks to Jim and Susan Murnane..Penny Manly...Craig DiBona...John  Leahey ... and Chris Schneider for helping  with all the little details for all our athletes  and staff. ONLY 360 DAYS to  the NEXT SUMMIT !!!!!

 <hr>
  More Magic Back East.....
    .... Congrats to senior..JENNA CALANDRO(Newtown,CT) for Flying Big at  Yale Invite..with her 12' 3" New School Indoor Record!!   Jane Wall(Weston,CT) leaped 10' 6" for Coach Medve...Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY)  10' 6"...Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield,CY) 10' 0"...Jessica Thornberry(Darien,CT) 9' 6" and Chloe Brown(Gladsenberry,CT)  9'0"..
     ...The  Boys at Yale were lead by Chris Rough(Westhill,CT) at 14' 0" for Coach Neal Perry...Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood,NJ) hit 13' 6" again for 5th place..Leland Roberts(Danbury,CT)  13' 6"  Mike Martello(Somers,NY) 12' 6"  James Mariner(Somers,NY) 12' 0"
..West Point Multi-Meet...Senior Travis Fountain(Monroe,NY) flew 14' 1" with NO Spikes...Matt DeLoranzo(Wallkill,NY) lifetd 11' 6"... In girls   Samantha Beyar(Monroe,NY) took gold at 11' 3" PR...Colleen Leahey(Burke,NY) set a school record of 8' 6"  for the Eagles.
  ..Suffern Invite at RCC.... Senior Leak Wachsmuth(RC Ketchum,NY) set a school record of 11' 3"..followed by Samantha Beyar at 11' 0"  Dana Rokicsak(Clarkstown South,NY) 9'6"  and Lexi Finn(Monroe,NY) at 8' 9" for Coach Goodwin. In Boys action..Matt Leanza(Suffern,NY) placed first at 11' 0"  Jake Diamond(Suffern) 10' 6"  Mike Ganbarg(CS) 9' 6""

   New Jersey  results at Toms River State Relay Championships..... Luke Annichiarrico(Old Tappan,NJ) set a new Bergen County Record of 15' 1" to lead his team . Marc Campo hit 11' 6"   as friendly rivals Nv-Demerast,NJ..saw Sam Siegel hit 13' 6"  and Brett Croen hit 12' 6" this week to set up the  fireworks for  outdoor track !!!

... The Pope John ,NJ Girls did it again this year at STATE.... Katlyn Rymarzow(junior0 flew 11' 6" on small poles   for a meet record...and brushed off 12' 1" and teamed up with speedy Nicole Sarno for the State Championship Pole Vault Relay win for Coach Brian Corcoran. They also won the State Relay Team title with 66 points!!!!  Both will compete on Saturday at New Balance Games at Armory.

   College Happenings.....
   ***********************
      Megan "Flips" Clark...opened up hugh at VT meet  with her 13' 3.5" clear for Coach Wilbourn of Duke. Megan placed 4th and now  hits 2 meets this coming weekend for that 4.25m jump... National Champion Emily "Boomer-Sooner"  Savage ... took her winning ways to her first college meet  and brought home  the win on her small step and small grip in Norman.OK.. She returns to the Armory for  a Feb 5 Collegiate Extravanga!!! Let's GO WATCH BOOMER !!!
    ... James Steck(VT Freshman) sailed 15' 5" for Coach Phillips...Peter Fagan  went 15' 9" at Cornell...Justin Farrenhopf(Manhattan) went 15' 1" this weekend..Marisa Robims (Manhattan) 10"10  Breanna Brucher(Manhattan) flew 10'10" Madison Weeks...10'  Sarah Moore 10' 4" for the Jaspers....  Another University Record for Dana Placentra at NYU  with her 10' 4 vault in Armory !!!!

    Congratulations to Kara Lynn Snyder of Colonie,NY (12' 1" PR)  for  being invited to the 107th Millrose Games Girls HS Vault. * girls are in  from 7 different states.. ONLY 2 spots left. Final invites by Feb. 1.  All final enteries posted at armory track.com on Feb. 1.


    Spring Camps almost  FULL...   Act NOW or be left out in the cold of March.

   FLYING CIRCUS...JOIN-THE-MOVEMENT

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS TEAM CLINICS for SPRING TEAMS !!!!!!
posts.Content:
HIGH SCHOOL TEAM CLINICS  are coming to FLYING CIRCUS  !!!!
    <hr>
     This program is designed to help instruct all High School Boys  and Girls  and Coaches this Spring Track & Field season in the techniques  and safety of the  High School Pole Vault Event. The Team Clinics will be offered to single teams and their coaches...and consist of  2 hours of Beginning...Intermediate   and Advanced  Pole Vaulting Instruction  and Progressive Drills . Clinics are  composed of 4- 12 athletes from the same school  at just $30 per athlete.  Coaches  come FREE.... Join us  and schedule YOUR TEAM  for a Pole Vault Clinic !!!!
    This program begins March 3 -April 11 any Monday-Tuesday-Wednesday or Thursday. 
    All athletes must be registered  members of USATF  ($25 per year)  at usatf.com/membership.

   To schedule a TEAM POLE VAULT CLINIC  for YOUR TEAM .... contact Coach Tim St.Lawrence at
          coachst@gmail.com

    LET'S FLY SAFELY THIS SPRING..... JOIN THE CLINIC.

posts.Title: 'GEARING UP' @ CIRCUS
posts.Content:
The HV FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC

     Now that it's approaching CHAMPIONSHIP VAULT SEASON.. it is time for us to 'GEAR UP' our training...our spirit   and our focus on moving up poles and moving our run back a step.  A continued effort on refining drills positions  and new summit drills perfection. We all must make a "LEAP-OF-FAITH" to get to the next bar...... YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE !!!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS GROWING"...... NORTH & SOUTH !!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC

    PROJECT... POLE VAULT DEVELOPMENT.
<hr>
     The Flying Circus Pole Vault Development Project at The Armory is thriving!!!!  Thanks to the leadership of Dr.Norbert Sander at The Armory Foundation..... pole vaulting has taken  center stage, with grass roots  high school instructional phases in full swing.  FLYING CIRCUS- SOUTH  at The Armory has four   dedicated and passionate teachers this indoor season... BEN SIMONET...DAN PLACENTRA...MICHELLE KERCADO   and WILL NESBITT.  This group of educators are making an impact on the 50+ High School Vaulters every week at  The New Balance Track & Field Center "Hall-of-Fame".   CONGRATULATIONS ARMORY POLE VAULT COACHES !!!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS...THUNDER" @ VARSITY CLASSIC !!!!!
posts.Content:
FLYING CIRCUS.....
LATE BREAKING NEWS BLAST .......
Feb. 4 @ Armory

  The  "Circus Acts"  were all warmed up  and ready for the show tonight  at "THE HALL of FAME" Armory...as  TODD UCKERMARK(Warwick Valley,NY) brushed off 17' 0"  again this week for the Purple Wave Vault Crew of Coach Mike Potter  and Coach  Curtis Akacki . Uckermark has now been over 16 Foot Bar  in 7 different meets and ready for the 17 Foot Barrier!! Team Mate ..Junior Derek DiBona also looked fast  and sharp over 15' 6" for the silver medal  and great jumps at 16' 0"!! Monroe-Woodbury,NY  senior  TRAVIS FOUNTAIN joined the 15 Foot Club for Coach Jim Glover  and Coach Matt Hemmer.. and near missed at 15' 6'  school record held by Mike Uhelsky from 1999!!! Luke Annichiabrico(Old Tappan,NJ) flew big over 14' 6"  Trevor Knowles(North Huterdon,NJ) lifted 14 6"  and Sammy Siegel(NV-Demarest,NJ) flew 13' 6" for the Nordsman!!!

   Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) was sensational at 12' 0" for Coach Brian Corcoran... Katlyn ..used her gymnastic poise..as she stepped up to her BIGGEST POLE EVER...the 13' 7" UCS x   140 lbs!!! Hitting step at mid perfectly   and accelerating all the way in the  "Hot-Zone" ..she was ready to fly.  Monroe-Woodbury,NY junioe  Samantha Beyar..enjoyed close jumps at 11' 6' for Coach Chris Goodwin.....

      Special Thanks to Coach Michelle Kercado for helping coach-the-circus all night !!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS WEEKEND STRONG" ... LUKE ANNICHIARICO (NV-Old Tappan,NJ) SOARS 15' 2" TODAY!!!
posts.Content:
The HV FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT GROUP
"Home of Fiberglass Flyers"

  The CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON is here  and it brings out the best in all of us......

  ...the  "Olympic Spirit" has touched the Athletes on Fiberglass at  the FLYING CIRCUS...with many  wonderful stories  this weekend filling the cold days of winter.  Congratulations to all athletes on spirit... sportsmanship... and performance.

 February 9  Report
 *********************
  Senior Vault Star...LUKE ANNICHIARICO(NV-Old Tappan,NJ) takes over the #1 NJ Vault Rankings...with his 15' 2" Group 3 Sectional win today at Toms River Air Dome. The fast  and gracious  Annichiarico has waited his turn  to shine..as he set a NEW MEET ALL TIME RECORD!!! Following closely was  Sam Siegel(NV-Demarest) at 13' 0"...Brett Croen(NV-Demarest) 12' 6"  and Marc O'Campo (NV-OT) at 11' 0" ... In Group 4 Sectionals.. it was Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood,NJ) hitting 13' 6" for the silver medal and advancement to State!!   Niki Cleary(Hunterdon Central)  hit 9' 6" ..then raced 61.03 on 4x4 Relay !!!

  Four Flying Circus Vaulters took STATE GROUP TITLES this weekend in Connecticut... with Maddie Schneider(Darien) winning her  L Meet at 11' 0"  followed by Jessica Thornberry(Darien) at 10' 6" in the winning the State Team  title for the  Blue Wave. Jenna Calandro(Newtown) won her State LL Meet at 11' 7" and Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield) placed  2nd at 10' 6". Chris Rough won his  LL State Meet at 14' 0" for Coach Neil Perry...Tom Chessman(Greenwich) placed 4th at 11' 6". In Class M State Finals.. It was senior Jane Wall(Weston) winning the gold medal for Coach Medve..Hannah Campos(W) 9'0"  Emily Iatesta(W) 8' 6" Emily Castro(W) 8' 0"..  Nick DiBarthalomeo(Weston) placed 4th at 12' 0"  Will Crum(W) hit 11' 6" for 6th.

   CHSAA City Championships @ Armory.... Big Vaulting in the City today...James Deutemeyer(Fordham Prep) won the Vault Dual  with his 15' 6" for Coach Brian Carney. Deutemeyer  heads to Villanova next fall to join Coach Talen Singer's Vault Squad.  Coach Jerry Cahill's junior star  Ryan Herrera-Murphy(Iona Prep).. blasted over 15' 6"PR for silver..Joe Crispi(Farrell) hit 15' 0" easily  and Jahkeem Wheatly(Iona Prep) joined the 14 Foot Club in 4th place at 14' 0"..Matt Fay(Iona Prep) also came thru at 14' 0"!!!

   Section 2 @ Albany Air Bubble.... Kara Snyder(Colonie)...  won her vault title at 11' 0" and then placed 3rd in Hurdles for big Colonie team points. She heads to Millrose next week... Kalli Manley(Burnt Hills) also took home gold in her division. The Soph star hit 10' 6" for Coach Chip Button.  Ian Allen(Chathum.NY) is coming on strong..with his win at 12' 6"PR!!!

  OCL Champs at West Point....Todd Uckermark(Warwick Valley) hit 16' 6" for gold in training flats..then took another 3 shots at the 17 foot Goal. Team Mate Derek DiBona  made 15' 3"..Travis Fountain(MW) 15' 0"  Brandon Nebiker(MW) 13' 6"PR...Aiden Woolsey(TV) 12' 0"  Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) 12' 0"  Brendan Bogart(Kingston) 11' 6"  MacKenzie LeRoy(Port) 11' 6"  Ivan Mieses(Middletown) 11' 6"  Matt Karl(Kingston) 10' 0"
 OCL (Girls... Junior Samantha Beyar(MW) hit 11' 0" for the win..Erin Leahey(warwick Valley) 10' 6"..Katarina VanLedtje(Cornwall)  10' 0"PR  Lexi Finn(MW) 9'0"  Colleen Leahey(JSB) 9' 0"PR Kristen Lebeski(MW) 7' 6" PR-8th Grade...  Crystal nelson)O'Neill) 7' 0"

   VT Elite Meet...Blacksburg,VA...  Megan Clark zooms 14' 3.5" for new Duke University Record  and 2nd in NCAA this winter.....  Red Shirt  freshman  James Steck made 15' 3" for Coach Bob Phillips... Emily Savage(Oklahoma) was sensational at NB Colligate at Armory with a near miss at opening height of 13' 1.5" .......

   Millrose Games...Update... Congratulations to Texas Pole Vault Club vaulters this weekend...as Desiree Freier(Justin Northwest,TX) hit 13' 6" and near missed at 14' 0" for Coaches Devin  and George Rodriquez!!! Junior  Zoe McKinley(Grapevine,TX)..also  competing  at Millrose this Saturday..hit 13' 0" for  2nd place!!!!

   "If you are made of the right stuff.......a hard fall... results in a HIGH BOUNCE."

posts.Title: JENNA CALANDRO (Newtown,CT) SOARS @ STATE !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
NORTH....The Warwick Barn
SOUTH.... The New Balance Armory

  CONGRATULATIONS  to   Newtown High School  senior  Pole Vault  Champion JENNA CALANDRO  for  taking home the GOLD  MEDAL  at yesterday's Connecticut  State Open at Hillhouse Arena in New Haven.  Jenna is one of the Flying Circus 's MOST IMPROVED Success stories.  Less than  14 months ago... Jenna came to Warwick with a 9' 3" personal best in the pole vault... and turned up the motivation and dedication with year round training in vault...to capture the State Title at 12' 0" yesterday...to go with her 12' 4" personal best.  Jenna  has signed her  scholarship to Bucknell University for her academic and athletics future  and is coached by Flying Circus  mentor  Hugh Cauthers.... Jenna still has 3 Indoor meets to fly...Eastern States(Feb. 24)   NB Nationals(March 16)   and FLYING CIRCUS VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS on March 22 in Warwick !!!
  Also soaring BIG at STATE was Darien High School's Maddie Schneider ..who placed Silver at 11' 6" first attempt  and close bar at 12' 0". This junior has a seasonal best of 12' 1"   and her  4x200 Relay Won the State Title yesterday at 1:45.93!!!  Jane Wall(Weston) placed  3rd for Coach Medve at 10' 6"  followed by Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield) at 10' 0"  and Jessica Thornberry(Darien) at 10' 0"...Chloe Brown(Gladsberry) 9' 6" and Hannah Campos(Weston) finished up the Flying Circus  fireworks!!!    
  In the Boys  State Open Finals.. Congratulations  to Chris Rough(Westhill)..taking silver medal with a 14' 6" clear for Coach Neal Perry.  Nick DiBarthalomeo(Weston) 12' 0"..Will Crum(Weston) 11'6"  and Tom Chessman(Greenwich) all  came thru again. 

  Toms River,NJ... In the State Meet Group 4... North Hunterdon senior... Trevor Knowles was flying again.... as the senior won his  Vault Title at 14' 6" and near missed bar 15' 1" for the Green and Gold. Trevor will be at Eastern States on Monday Night  at the ARMORY!!!

  Section1 North Champs... Rye High School ,NY senior Matea Friedel set a school indoor record  in winning her title at 9' 7"...as Armory Circus Coach Ben Simonet guided her the last  few weeks to the Championship.  Vernon,NJ  junior  Cara Kelly  flew 11' 1" yesterday to  officially qualify for the NB Nationals Emerging Elite Championships on March  14. Using her 13' 1 x 145 she near missed at 11' 5" on all three vaults.  Kari Murnane(Lenape Valley,NJ)  coming off her successful swimming season  won the Armory Youth Meet... as did Ike Osbun(MKA,NJ) in the winners circle  in the Boys Division!!!

  Congrats to Dana Fineman at Morivian College,PA!!!! Dana jumped a personal best of 11' 3.75 " this past weekend in the Armory for Coach Mike Leyark  and now qualifies for the post season fun!!!

    "THE BLAST @ MILLROSE"...... History was made in the first ever Girls Pole Vault Invitation at Saturday's 107th MILLROSE INDOOR GAMES at the Armory. Honoring the" High Flying Girls of Pole Vault" ...  was the vision of Armory Executive Director...Dr. Norbert "Mr. Track & Field" Sander.  This gathering of Pole Vault Stars went NATIONAL...as the 10 girls represented 8 different states....and proven CHAMPIONS ALL in their vault careers.  The scene was electric  and emotional in both the the warm up  and competition.  and the results were   sensational. The Girls High School Pole Vault Event has gone thru the roof!!!  Many thanks to all ten girls for a GREAT SHOW !!!  Here are the full results:

  1- Desiree Freier..Texas Pole Vault Club.....  14' 0" #3 USA  All Time Indoor!!!!
  2- Greta Wagner...Los Gatos, CA................  13' 1.5"  UCLA  bound next year!!
  3- Zoe McKinley...Texas Pole Vault Club....   12' 9.5"  Junior this year!!
  4- Jackie McNulty...Oakdale,MD...............     12' 5.5"  Junior  this year!!
  5- Jackie Meeks...LOJO Vault,VA..............    12' 1.5"  Senior this year!!
  6- Kennedy Shank...Vaultworx, PA.............    12' 1.5"   Junior this year!!!!
  7- Alexis Romero...Raise the Bar, NV.........     11' 8"   Kansas boiund next year!!!
  8- Kari Stromhaug...Vestal PV Club.........        11' 8'   Junior this year!!!
  9- Katlyn Rymarzow...Flying Circus,NJ.....       11' 8"  Junior this year!!!
 10-Kara Snyder..Flying Circus,NY .......            11' 2"  Villanova bound next year!!!

     FLYING CIRCUS INDOOR VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS
     <hr>
        " A Celebration of Pole Vault Spirit"
           ALL Vaulters Invited to Compete 
        BOYS MEET  Friday  March 21 @ 5PM
        GIRLS MEET  Saturday  March 22 @ 12 Noon

          JOIN THE CELEBRATION WITH US .

posts.Title: LUKE ANNICHIARICO (Old Tappan,NJ) over 15' 6" @ STATE GROUP 3 !!!!
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus
Breaking Great News Department ….
     
   CONGRATULATIONS….AGAIN.. to Old Tappan,NJ senior vault specialist…LUKE ANNICHIARICO..for bring home the STATE VAULT GROUP 3  GOLD MEDAL last night at Toms River Air Dome.  The fast and humble ANNICHIARICO set a NEW ALL TIME MEET RECORD and takes NJ #1 into   Mondays Eastern States at Armory.. Team mate Marc O'Campo also kept the OT jersey flying  with his 13' 0" back up… and Sam Seigel(NV-Demerast) hit 13' 6" to advance  to Meet of Champs on March 1 .. Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood,NJ)  flew 13' 6" and great bar at 14' 0" !

    KATLYN RYMARZOW (Pope John,NJ) won another STATE TITLE in the Non-Public A division  at 11' 0"  and team mates Nicole Scarno placed additional points for the Indoor STATE TEAM CHAMPIONS…POPE JOHN XXII !!!
   
 …….. more  GREAT RESULTS coming this weekend…
 
    PLANT HIGH   and STAY TUNED !!!!
    <hr>

posts.Title: EASTERN STATES...TODD UNCKERMARK (16'0")...JENNA CALANDRO (12'0") TAKE GOLD / AMERICAN EAST...SARAH HALEY (11' 9'75)..ALFONSO SCANNAPIECO (17'1") WIN VAULT!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
Small Drills = GIANT VAULTS

  "BIG MONDAY on FIBERGLASS"
  February 24

   The 80th EASTERN STATES INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS  was packed  with Elite Performances in every event…as 22 FLYING CIRCUS Vaulters turned up the heat on the Super X Mondo Runway in the Boys and Girls Pole Vault.

  In the early Boys Division… Senior Todd Uckermark(Warwick Valley,NY) came back from  a warm up injury to win his first Eastern States Title at 16' 0"..to edge senior James Deutmeyer(Fordham Prep.NY) who also soared 16' 0" for a new school record. Both had close bars at 16' 6'!!  Warwick Valley junior Derek DiBona had a big night  with his 15' 6' clear and close at 16' 0" PR jump for the Purple Wave… Placing 4th was senior Luke Annichiarico(OT,NJ)  15' 0"…Travis Fountain(MW) 15' 0"   Chris Rough(Westhill,CT) 14' 6"  Matt Fay(Iona Prep) 14' 0"   Ryan Murphy(iona Prep) 14' 0"  Trevor Knowles(Hunterdon,NJ) 14' 0'  Pat Lynch(Cranford,NJ) 13' 6"  am Siegel(NV-Demerast,NJ) at 13' 6"

  The Girls  Championship  was also exciting for the 8 Circus Vaulters… with Senior Connecticut State Camp  Jenna Calandro(Newtown,CT) taking the vault crown with her 12' 0" first attempt  clear and  close bars at 12' 6"…Junior Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) was fast and powerful in 3rd place at 11' 6' ... Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY) is coming on strong with her long run and stiffer poles..hit 11' 6" for 4th place… Lalli Manly(Burnt Hills,NY)  was the Top Soph with her 11' 0"" 6th place..Erin Leahey(Warwick Valley,NY)  made 11' 0" PR and National Quals, after her blazing 60.8 relay  leg on DMR…  Christina Masciale(Pascack Hills,NJ)   made 10' 0"  easily..as did Carolan Frisina(Syosset).  Congratulations to all 21 CIRCUS VAULTERS!!!

  AMERICAN EAST CHAMPIONSHIPS @ ARMORY
<hr>
   Alfonso Scannapieco(Albany University)… won another American East Pole Vault Championship in the morning edition of "BIG MONDAY"…with his 17' 1"  vault and is starting his peaking phase now.. Team Mate  Nate Hiett(Freshman) placed  2nd at 16' 2.75 "   and Peter Fagan(Binghamton University Freshman) hit 15' 9' for Coach Mike Thompson Vault Team.  In the Girls Championship..former Circus Star.. Sarah Haley(Binghamton University) won the P{ole Vault Gold  with her 11' 9.75  jump  …as Grace Weisbecker(Vermont University-Freshman)  brought home Silver at 11' 3.75"   and Toni Werner(Albany) came thru at 10' 4"
  MACC  CHAMPIONSHIPS @ ARMORY
<hr>
    Manhattan College Freshman…Justin Farrenkopf   placed 2nd  with his 15' 3" leap for Coach Mecca….Marissa Robbins(Manhattan)  placed 5th in the Women's  Championship..followed by Bre Brucher(10'4")…Sarah Moore(10' 4"0  and Maddessen Weekes(10' 4") for the Jaspers!!!!

       BE MODEST…..
       BE HUMBLE ……
       BE THANKFUL ………

                          FLYING CIRCUS

The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
Warwick Valley, NY

   FLYING CIRCUS HEADS TO NATIONALS!!!!   
<hr>


    CONGRATULATIONS….. 21 VAULTERS from the FLYING CIRCUS have qualified for the NEW BALANCE INDOOR TRACK & FIELD NATIONALS  @ THE ARMORY on March 14-16 !!!!  It promises to be great fun and  we want you to enter yourself by Monday March 3 to be part of this SPECIAL MEET!.   

   Entry Fee just $45 per athlete   @ http.www.nationalscholastic.org
  
   SIGN UP TODAY .
   LET'S FLY @ NATIONALS

posts.Title: "TODD UCKERMARK WINS STATE VAULT"...MEGAN CLARK FLYS 14' 5.25" @ ACC CHAMPS!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
The Warwick Center
Warwick Valley,NY


   TODD UCKERMARK earned his STATE POLE VAULT CHAMPIONSHIP !!!!  The likable  and humble Warwick Valley  High School  senior has fought back hard  and steady from his disappointment at last spring's Outdoor State Meet at Middletown… with  a FALL  and WINTER training phase that was unmatched…. with  over 1200 Short  and Long Run Vaults under his belt …as he entered Barton Hall of Athletics on Saturday at Cornell University  ready for  the 4.5 hour vault competition. Using his "Purple Wave" speed  he  sizzled over 16' 0" with room to spare   and had great bars at 16' 6" meet record… Team mate Derek DiBona also was ready for the BIG STAGE…with a FLY-OVER at  15' 6" for the silver medal for the BIG 18 TEAM POINTS… to help lead  Coach Potter's  Wave to the 36 STATE TEAM POINTS Un-offical STATE TEAM TITLE!!!!
     Joe Crispi (Farrell,NY)  made the  victory stand with his 14' 3" jump…followed by Zack Lieberman(JD) 13' 6"  Mike Martello(Somers) 13' 0"  and Aiden Miller(Pearl River) at 12' 0"

  " 3 Circus Girls Take the Stand" ….. Junior Samantha Beyar(MW) came thru for Coach Goodwin again..with her 3rd place 11' 3" vault and very close bar at 11' 6' on her Biggest Pole in the bag….Kara Snyder(Colonie) placed 4th at 11' 0"…Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills) placed 5th as Top Soph in the meet…Leah Wachsmuth(RC Ketcham) 10' 6"  Erin Leadey(Warwick) 10' 0"  Carolan Frisina(Syosset) 9'0"  Matea Friedel(Rye) 9' 0"   and Kat vanLedtje(Cornwall)  9'0"

  New Jersey Meet of Champs….Toms River,NJ… Congratulations to Luke Annichiarico(Old Tappan) for his 15' 0" second place finish at NJ State Meet. Trevor Knowles (No Huterdon)  set his PR at 15' 0" for 5th place…. Sam Siegel(NV-Demerast)  also PR'ed at 14' 0" for 7th place…Andrew Ghizzone(Union Catholic) 14' 0"  Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood,NJ) 13' 6".
    In The Girls NJ State Meet… Junior Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John) placed 3rd at 11' 0"  and Christina Masciate(PH)   vaulted  10' 0"!!!!

   Virginia 6A STATE  MEET……Rachael Fasana(Lake Braddock,VA) was outstanding again..with her 11' 9" vault to take 2nd place  to Jackie Meeks…also at 11' 9"  Maggie Rudd also scored at 10' 3" for Coach Mike Mangum's Lady Bruins!!!!!

  At todays Flying Circus Last Chance Meet…Congratulations to Cara Kelly(Vernon,NJ)…Jessica Thornberry(Darien,CT)  and Kari Murnane(Lenepe Valley,NJ) for  making NB Nationals Emerging Elite Pole Vault standard  with their 11' 1" performances  !!!!   Cara  and Kari set New Indoor School Records!!!

  College Report…. "MEGAN CLARK  HITS THE ROOF" …..  Congratulations to Duke University sophomore Megan Clark  and Duke Pole Vault Coach Shawn  Wilborn for another sensational pole vault SCHOOL RECORD of 14'  5.25" at the ACC INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS at VT this weekend.  The Blue  Devils on Fiberglass are soaring !!!!Megan took 22 jumps  and broke her pole at 14' 7.5"…but kept on ticking …with a very close jump on a new pole!!!!!
    Sophomore Destiny DiStasio(Kutztown University) blasted over 11' 2.5" at conference and near bar at 11' 9.5"  for the never-give-up speedster from Tunkhannock,PA!!!!!.  Soccer star..Kayla Leahey(Rowan University) vaulted well again at the armory for Coach Ringo Addison !!
   Open….Congratulations to Circus Pole Vault Coach   Will Nesbitt…as her won the gold at the Armory USATF meet on Friday Night with  his 12' 4.25" vault   !!!! Will be in Boston on March 15 for USA Masters Championships !!!!

    <hr>
    FLYING CIRCUS….NOW  23 VAULTERS QUALIFIED for NATIONALS!!!!
   <hr>

posts.Title: COMING !!!!! JOIN-THE-LAUNCH
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC Warwick Valley Pole Vault Center Warwick, New York 10990 YOU ARE INVITED … to JOIN THE POLE VAULT LAUNCH with THE FLYING CIRCUS!!! Our Pole Vault Development Project here at Flying Circus continues to reach new levels of HIGH PERFORMANCE . If you are serious about your Pole Vault Development… then WE WANT TO HELP YOU this early spring season… We offer Beginner level ...Intermediate level and Elite level instruction…Team Clinics… Open Meets and Spring & Summer Camps. JOIN the FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT EXPERIENCE this March and April and FLY-OFF-THE-TOP !!!!
3 GREAT WEEKENDS COMING… * March 14-15-16 …The Flying Circus will be represented at the New Balance National Indoor Championships at The Armory…with 23 Boys and Girls jumping in the 3 day meet. The peaking stage schedule is in place for all vaulters. CONGRATULATIONS and HAVE FUN TOGETHER !!!! * March 21-22 …. The FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT EXPO MEET at THE BARN… this end of the year meet will produce BIG RESULTS for all participants and results will be recorded by MileSplit.com… Come jump at your own runway and pit….. It will make a difference in your performance! "EXPO -CIRCUS VAULT"…. The BEST MEET of the YEAR In the BARN !!!!! BOYS MEET…FRIDAY MARCH 21 @ THE BARN Barn Doors swing open at 4:30PM for Warm Up Boys Group 1… 5:30pm (Bar starts at 7 feet) Boys Group 2… 7:30pm (Bar starts at 12 feet) Register at the Door… $20 Entry Fee GIRLS MEET….SATURDAY MARCH 22 @ THE BARN Barn Doors swing open at 11:30AM for Warm Up Girls Group 1 …. 12:30pm..(Bar starts at 6 feet) Girls Group 2 …. 2:30pm..(Bar starts at 10 Feet) Register at the Door… $20 Entry Fee * SPRING CIRCUS CAMPS Friday March 28 Co-ed Boys and Girls 4 Hour Pole Vault Camp 5pm-9pm…. 8 spots left!!!! Application on Line at hvflyingcircus.com Includes…Camp T-Shirt…Drills Packet Cost $175 per athlete Saturday March 29 Girls Only 4 Hour Pole Vault Camp…NOW CLOSED!!! 12 noon-4pm….. Includes Camp T-Shirt…Drills Packet…Cost $175 per athlete
TEAM CLINICS FILLING FAST…. We now have 8 High Schools joining in our TEAM CLINICS for POLE VAULT PERFORMANCE. These are special 2 Hour Instructional Clinics for Boys and Girls teams. They include Introduction for the Non-Pole Vaulter. Team clinics reach out to 6-15 athletes per team. Spring Coaches should book their teams in now for Safety Instruction in the Pole Vault. Cost… $30 per athlete.. BEAT THE SNOW COVERED RUNWAYS and EARLY SPRING COLD…. JUMP WITH US in WARM and POLE VAULT FRIENDLY CONDITIONS @ THE FLYING CIRCUS !!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS NATIONALS"..... Todd UCKERMARK (16' 2") ALL-AMERICAN...Maddie SCHNEIDER (12' 1") !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC Warwick Valley, NY MADDIE SCHNEIDER INVERSION @ NATIONALS !!!!!
"23 TOUGH KIDS" CONGRATULATIONS to all 23 FLYING CIRCUS athletes representing our Pole Vault Club this weekend at The New Balance National Indoor Championships …. It was exciting and rewarding for all of us to watch you STRIVE for EXCELLENCE…. SUPPORT EACH OTHER and REACH FOR THE STARS!!!! The past 4 months have been filled with tremendous spirit and total effort and WE ARE MOST PROUD of YOU!!!! THANK YOU . EMERGING ELITE….. SAMANTHA BEYAR (11' 7") & CHRIS ROUGH(14' 10.25") take home ALL-AMERICAN HONORS!!!!! In Friday's National Emerging Elite Meet… Monroe-Woodbury,NY junior Samantha Beyar placed 5th with her 11' 7' personal best for Coach Goodwin and a close bar at 12' 1" on her 13' 1" UCS Spirit 145!!!! Chris Rough(Westhill,CT)…also just a junior placed 2nd in the Boys Section for Coach Neal Perry with his 14' 10.25 vault for Silver !!! Soph Kalli Manly(BH) made 11' 1" and moved up to her 12' 6' pole at 11' 7"…Kari Murnane(Lenepe Valley,NJ) made 10' 7 look easy…Catherine Walker(Monroe,NY) is back with her 10' 7" Erin Leahey(Warwick) 10' 7" Cara Kelly(Vernon) 10' 1" Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY) 10'1") Leah Wachsmuth 10' 1" and Jessica Thornberry(Darien) looked great all day in her first National Meet!!! BOYS CHAMPIONSHIP VAULT ….. Senior TODD UCKERMARK(Warwick,NY) completed a story book Indoor season with his 4th place finish and ALL AMERICAN honors with his 16' 2" vault and SUPER last jump at 16' 6" on his 15' 1" x 190 Spirit. Todd had 8 Meets over 16 feet this indoor and he is ready to fly this outdoor season!! Warwick Valley's Derek DiBona also looked SUPER over 15' 4" and placed 8th in the Nation !!! Fordham Prep's James Deutmeyer leaped 15' 10" for Coach Brian Carney and also hit ALL AMERICAN status!!!! Luke Annichiarico(Old Tappan,NJ) came thru again on his sprained ankle..with a near make at 15' 10" for the All State First Team vaulter. Travis Fountain(Monroe,NY) made 14'4" for Coach Glover and Joe Crispi(Farrell,NY) is moving up poles this outdoor!!!! GIRLS CHAMPIONSHIP VAULT…..Junior MADDIE SCHNEIDER(Darien,CT) came to the Armory with confidence… and soared over 12' 1" on her first jump and had 2 great bars at 12' 4.5" on her Biggest poles ever…13' 7" x 140 UCS!!!!…. Jenna Calandro(Newtown,CT) also looked SUPER over 11' 7" and BIG AIR at 12' 1" on her Biggest poles…. Pope John,NJ Multi-Event star..Katlyn Rymarzow kept the pole in front of her ay takeoff.. with a huge 11' 7" opening bar and close at 12' 1" for Coach Corcoran..as she lead all New Jersey Vaulters in the meet!!! Kari Stromhaug of Vestal,NY pushed to her biggest poles at 12' 1" for sensational jumps and will join in the FLYING CIRCUS BARN CHAMPIONSHIPS this coming Saturday at 12 noon !!! (Details below) WILL NESBITT (FLYING CIRCUS,NY) FLYS in BOSTON!!! *** COACH CAME THRU…….AGAIN!!! Flying Circus Coach WILL NESBITT place 2nd today in the USATF Indoor Championships at Reggie Lewis Track Center in Boston….with his 12' 9.5" jump and was Coached by the one and only" Belgium Wonder"…Ben Simonet!!!! Will had great jumps at 13'3.5" and is ready for his World Masters Championships in Budapest in 10 days!!!! JORDAN YAMOAH WINS NATIONAL NCAA II for 3rd TIME!!!! Congratulations to Soph JORDAN YAMOAH(Texas A&M-Kingsville) for winning his 3rd NATIONAL VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS this weekend at JDL FASTACK Arena… with a 17' 1" FLY-OVER and BIG POINTS for Coach Ryan Dall's Javelinas!!!!! YOU ARE INVITED…to "THE BEST MEET of the YEAR at the BARN" … This coming weekend….Bring your friends and enjoy the last Indoor Meet of the season …on the 'FASTEST RUNWAY on the Planet'……. Last chance for an INDOOR PR!!!!! BOYS MEET… FRIDAY MARCH 21, 2014 Doors open at 5PM… Cost $20 per vaulter Boys Section #1 6PM …. Beginners... Bar Starts at 7 Feet Boys Section #2 8PM….. Intermediate/Elite.. Bar starts at 11 Feet GIRLS MEET … SATURDAY… MARCH 22, 2014 Doors Open at 11 AM Girls Section #1 12 Noon…. Beginners…Bar starts at 6 Feet Girls Section #2 2 PM ……. Intermediate/Elite///Bar starts at 10 Feet JOIN the POLE VAULT SEASON ENDING BLAST..and SET a PR !!!! Starting Wednesday March 26…the Open Sessions resume EVERY WEDNESDAY Girls 5:30-7PM Boys 7-8:30PM $30 per vaulter

posts.Title: MEGAN CLARK FLYS 14' 7.25 @ CAROLINA RELAYS !!! & CIRCUS MEET RESULTS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC The Warwick Pole Vault Center Warwick Valley,NY Chapel Hill,NC ----- Megan Clark (Duke University) rebounded from her NCAA Indoor Pole vault… with a New Duke University All -Time Pole Vault record jump of 14' 7.25" at the Carolina Relays on Saturday. Using a 13' 6" grip on her 14'1 x 145 pole…she had close jumps at 15' 1" and now leads the NCAA Outdoor Performance List !!!!!! CONGRATULATIONS MEGAN !!!!! GREAT RESULTS @ CIRCUS INDOOR MEET…… The final indoor meet of the season was sensational for the 53 vaulters on Friday and Saturday at THE BARN. Special thanks to all parents... volunteers ….and athletes for another successful meet !!!! ON-TO-OUTDOOR!!!!! GIRLS …. JENNA CALANDRO (Newtown,CT.) & MADDIE SCHNEIDER (Darien,CT) fly 12' 1"… as 27 girls compete….Stephanie Duffy (HVFC) returns with 12' 7" vault….Monroe-Woodbury Middle Schooler…Kristin Lubeskie won the Middle School Division at 8' 7" (School Indoor Record!!) 12' 1" Jenna Calandro (Newtown,CT) 12' 1" Maddie Schneider (Darien, CT) 11' 7" Kara Snyder (Colonie,NY) 11' 7" Samantha Beyar (Monroe,NY) 11' 1" Kalli Manly (Burnt Hills,NY) 10' 7" Kari Murnane (Lenape Valley,NJ) 10' 7" Jessica Thornberry (Darien, CT) 10' 7" Kari Stromhaug (Vestel,NY) 10' 7" Katherine Walker (Monroe,NY) 10' 1" Cara Kelly (Vernon,NJ) 9' 1" Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) 9' 1" Matea Friedel (Rye,NY) 9' 1" Jorlene Messinco (Sachem,NY) 9' 1" Kerstyn Ciulla (Sachem,NY) 8' 7" Kristin Lubeskie (Monroe,NY) 8' 7" Gina Bogdanwicz (Sachem,NY) 7' 7" Amy Bravo (Park Ridge,NJ) 7' 1" Kayla Maas (Eldred, NY) 7' 1" Sara Rutigliano (Coleman,NY) 6' 1" Sara Drewett (Eldred,NY) 5' 1" Kat Nicholson (Eldred,NY) WOMEN'S OPEN 12' 7" Stephaine Duffy (HVFC) 11' 7" Sidney LeRoy (HVFC) 10' 7" Marissa Robbins (Unattached) BOYS…..TREVOR KNOWLES (North Hunterdon,NJ) takes GOLD…. Whitman Oehler-Marx won the Open section at 14' 1" from 4 Lefts…. and Nick Marino(Hatsboro,PA) took TOP FRESHMAN honors at 11' 7" !!!!! 13' 7" Trevor Knowles (North Hunterdon, NJ) 13' 1" Sam Siegel (NV-Demerast,NJ) 12' 7" Ike Osbun (Montclaire,NJ) 12' 1" Brett Croen (NV- Demerast,NJ) 12' 1" Ivan Miesis (Middletown,NY) 12' 1" Marc O'Campo(NV-Old Tappan) 11' 7" Nick Marino (Hatsboro,PA) 11' 7" Sebastan Camacho (New Providence,NJ) 11' 1" Jullian Gotllieb(Eldred,NY) 11' 1" Chris Babdedso (NV-Old Tappan,NJ) 10' 1" Josh Orrovitz(New Providence,NJ) 9' 1" Julian DeLeon( Eldred,NY) 9' 1" Mark DeFranco (Westhill,CT) 8' 7" Isaac Healey (Warwick,NY) 8' 1" Dan Lindstrom (Warwick, NY) 7' 1" Brendan McShane (Warwick, NY) MEN'S OPEN 14' 1" Whitman Oehler-Marx (HVFC) 14' 1" Tyler Savarese (HVFC) 10' 1" Bill Crouse (Unattached) Masters 50+ Winner !!!
CONGRATULATIONS to University of Albany's …ALFONSO SCANNAPIECO for his sensational Vault win at IC4A CHAMPIONSHIPS…His 17' 6.5" leap in Boston was no surprise!!!!!! On to 18 FEET this Spring!!!!! SPRING CAMPS SOLD OUT !!!!! MANY THANKS to the Boys and Girls enrolled in this coming weekend's SPRING POLE VAULT CAMPS @ FLYING CIRCUS…. The "NEW KIDS-ON-FIBERGLASS" are moving up !!!!!!

posts.Title: RHYTHMS - of - TEAMWORK @ FLYING CIRCUS
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development
Warwick Valley, NY 

     EVERYONE WANTS TO BELONG TO A TEAM ………..
<hr>
         
     Here at  the  FLYING CIRCUS VAULT ACADEMY……We celebrate "TEAMWORK"...  and the rewarding joys of training together…supporting each other and  the competitive  spirit of  pure athletic participation.  THANK YOU for making our club FUN  and  EXCITING !!!!
    
    TEAM-WORK   MEANS…
        Everyone counts ……meeting new friends….finding solutions together …. staying positive … caring for others ….being polite and respectful  …..exchanging ideas ….. modeling  sportsmanship …never-giving-up …..accepting challenges ….setting higher standards …. extra effort …. everyone pulls for each other.    Teamwork means..measuring up to the very best within us.
      ….. enjoy your season…TOGETHER.

  Early Spring Vault News/Results..
  April 13

  Congratulations to  senior  James Deutmeyer of Fordham Prep,NY !!! This Villanova University bound senior.. is coached by Brian Carney and flew to a NEW SCHOOL   Vault record of 16' 0" in winning the NY Mayors Cup  at Icahn Stadium on Saturday.  The State Record of 16' 8.75"  is in his sights!!! Placing second was the surprise vaulter in  New York State this  outdoor… Rahan Adekoga of JF Kennedy High School,NYC.  This dedicated senior was part of Flying Circus South(The Armory) project this winter with Coaches Ben Simonet…Dan Placentra  and Will Nesbitt. Rahan soared  14' 3" for  another personal best from this rising star!!!

   Weston High School,CT. senior…Nick DiBartholomeo flew 13' 3"  for his PR this weekend in his first meet of the season….. and senior Tim Schanstra of Pope John,NJ set a school record at Arcadia Invite in  the Decathlon  with his 6442 points  and PR vault at 12' 11.75" for Coach Corciran. Also scoring  big   …was Andy Ghizzone of Union Catholic at 6,579 points  and 13' 5,5" Vault!!

 The Cornwall Relays  produced 12' 6" vaults from Ivan Mieses(Middletown)  and Brandon Nebiker(MW)…. Only Echefu(No Rockland)  hit 11' 6" for the Raiders!!  At the Nanuet relays… Jake Diamond(Suffern) leaped 11' 0" and team mate Dylan Black teamed up for the silver relay medals  to Naunet's Gold Medal Performance.    Ian Allen(Chatum,NY) won the stillwater Relays  at 12' 6"  and  Joe Crispi(Farrell,NY) cruised over 14' 0" at Big Blue  Classic in Staten Island!!!

   The Jack Yocker Relays in River Dell was  a Circus Sweep…with Luke Annichiarico(Old Tappan) flying 14' 6"…San Siegel(NV-Demerast) 13' 6'  Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood) 13' 6"…Marc  O'Campo(Old Tappan) 11' 6"  and Jason Babbini(Old Tappan) 11' 6".

   In Girls Vault… Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) hit 11' 6"  in her dual meet  this past week…Samantha Beyar(MW) won the Cornwall Relays   and Kari Murnane(Lenape Valley,NJ)  won the Ranger  Relays at Wallkill Valley  and Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) set her PR  at 10' 0" for the win… Matea Friedel(Rye,NY) flew 10' 0" twice this week for a new School Record  for the Tuffs University bound scholar/athlete!!!!

   Congratulations to Jordan Yamoah(Texas A&M-Kingsville)  for winning gold at Miami Invite Saturday night  with his 17' 1' leap for Coach Ryan Dall. His best this spring is his 17' 6.5" fly-Over at the Texas Relays !!!!

  Congratulations to all….. Back to Vault Drills !!!

posts.Title: TODD UCKERMARK FLYS 15' 9" in RED RAIDER RELAYS TODAY !!!
posts.Content:
The FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT ACADEMY
Warwick Valley,NY

   NEWS FLASH……
       Warwick Valley,NY senior pole vaulter  .. TODD UCKERMARK…won the 27th RED RAIDER RELAYS Pole Vault today at North Rockland High School.  Amid 37 degree temperatures… and with  the overnight snow brushed back from the runway…the powerful Indoor State Champ flew  a meet record of 15' 9" for Coach Potter's Purple Wave Track Squad.   Taking all his 12  total jumps in  just 19 minutes…he broke  Ryan Dalls(No.Rockland)  and Mike Uhelsky(Monroe-Woodbury) meet record of 15' 0" from the early 1990's!!! He had super close jumps at 16' 1" in his opening invitational meet.
      Monroe-Woodbury,NY  junior  Samantha Beyar won her vault gold for Coach Chris Goodwin in the delayed morning vault section.   On to warm weather…..

         Flying Circus ……   Join the Movement

posts.Title: SAMANTHA BEYAR (Monroe-Woodbury, NY) SOARS @ PENN RELAYS !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC "Home of Pole Vault Development" Warwick Valley,NY The 120th Running of the PENN RELAY CARNIVAL …. The Greatest Track Meet on the Planet took place at Franklin Field this weekend and the cool temperatures and gusting winds could not hold back the spirited efforts of FLYING CIRCUS athletes. The tough pole vault conditions kept a lid on Elite Results for all three days of competition…but Samantha Beyar( Monroe-Woodbury,NY -Junior)……. coming off her New Balance EE Indoor Nationals super meet in mid-March…she again turned up vertical for a forth place finish in a personal best 11' 11.75 " for the Purple Pride Crusaders. Samantha battled the winds with her 13'1" UCS Spirit and 12' 7" grip and took 2 great attempts at 12' 3.5" in the final group. Also producing in the unfavorable conditions was Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) and Maddie Schneider(Darien,CT) both at 11' 1.75" and close at 11' 8.5"!!! In the Saturday morning Boys HS Championship…Old Tappan,NJ senior Luke Annichiarico soared 14' 9.25" for a 6th place finish and Travis Fountain(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) sailed 13' 9.25" for Coach Hemmer/Coach Glover Foundation. CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL VAULTERS!!! PAT LYNCH is BACK….. …Cranford,NJ pole vault star..Pat Lynch produced a gold medal performance at the Millburn Relays with a fly-over at 14' 0" on his BIG POLE and then brushed off 15' 1" on his last attempt. The Notre Dame bound sprinter never gave up his faith in his ability!!!! Team mate Dan Hannen cleared 10'0" for the Relay runner up medals and Peter Festante(Governor Livingston,NJ) made 12' 6" and team mate Ferris Harrison made 11' 6". KATLYN RYMARZOW FLYS @ RANDOLPH RELAYS… …Bouncing up high on Saturday was Junior Katlyn Rymarzow of Pope John,NJ. The hurdler/vaulter equalled the Meet vault record with her 11' 6" jump for the win…followed by Lenape Valley,NJ multi-sport star ..Kari Murnane and Nicole Sarano(Pope John,NJ) and Emily Phalon(Pope John) JULIA VALENTI …"NEW GIRL on the FIBERGLASS BLOCK" …. This North Reading,MA All-Around Track star has focused her sights on the Pole Vault this spring. The All State Gymnastic Star flew a school record 11' 0" this week and near missed at 11' 3" on all attempts for the sophomore sprinter/hurdler/jumper. She also hit 34' 7.5" PR in Triple Jump the same day!!!! ALFONSO SCANNAPIECO (Albany) hits 16; 6.75"" @ PENN!!! Albany University Multi-Event junior Alfonso Scannapieco placed 3rd in the Wind Tunnel at Franklin Field on Saturday before a roaring 52,000 Track Nuts……and Peter Fagan(Binghamton) looks sharp at 15' 11" for Coach Mike Thompson in the Eastern Vault…Tim Murphy(UCONN) also looked great over 15' 11" for the Huskies!!!!! BIG MEETS coming this weekend…. CRUSADER RELAYS…@ Monroe-Woodbury….All Day Saturday BRIAN AHEARN CLASSIC ..@ Warwick Valley….All Night Saturday

Our Pole Vault Drills Progression Program is in full swing and many athletes are now enjoying the transfer to their full runway jumps. Pole Vault Drills are the Backbone to Pole Vault Success….and the results are starting to pour in…. Small Drills…equal…GIANT VAULTS!!!!! Friendship Games ,Warwick,NY…. Senior Wave Todd Unckermark produced a NEW OUTDOOR SCHOOL RECORD/SECTION 9 RECORD with his 16' 1" clear in the light mist and then took three sensational shots at the ALL TIME NY STATE Record of 16' 8.75" (Jordan Yamoah,2012)… Derek DiBona(Warwick,NY) opened up his season with a 14' 6" clear for second..Travis Fountain(MW) hit 14' 0" into the head wind conditions…Brandan Nebiker(MW) 13' 0" Aidan Miller(PR) 12' 0" Liam McGarry(PR) 12'0" Matt Leanza(Suffern) 11' 6" Christian Madigan(PR) 10' 6" Matt Greenlaw(War) 10'6" Eddie Lopwz(MW) 10' 0" …In the Girls division… Catherine Walker(MW) won gold at 10'0" Erin Leahey(War) silver(10' 0" and 2:24.5/800m.)..Lexi Finn(MW) 9'0' Vivian Mroz(Bronxville,NY) hit 8' 6 PR!! 47th Glenn Loucks Games,White Plains,NY …Saturday morning the girls hit the Mondo Runway first in this traditional Meet of Champions…. with Darien,CT junior Maddie Schneider soaring huge over 12' 0" for the win into strong headwinds…This marks her 4th time over the 12 Foot Barrier this season…and she had 2 close shots at her school and meet record at 12' 7" on her biggest pole. Placing third was Kari Stromhaug(Vestel,NY) at 11' 0" Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield,CT) 10' 6" Jane Wall(Weston,CT) 10' 6" Matea Friedel(Rye) 9' 6" Dana Rokicsak(CS) 8'6" Kat vanLedjte(Corn) 8' 6"… In the Boys afternoon Division…Iona Prep.NY Junior Ryan Herrera Murphy won gold for Coach Cahill at 15' 0" Travis Fountain hit 14' 0" for Crusaders of Monroe. Johnstown Invite,Johnstown,NY…. Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY) crusied to another vault win in the Girls division and ben Vardi-Davidson(Fonda) placed second at 11' 0" for Coach Petersen. Hunterdon/Sussex/Warren Championships, Wallkill Valley,NJ….. Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) might be the most consistent vaulter this spring for the Circus…as she won her championship with her 9th 11' 6" jump of the outdoor season and was big over 12' 0" on all three jumps… She also tripled jumped 35'2" for a seasonal best… Club-mate…Kari Murnane(Lenape Valley,NJ) has also stepped her game up the past 3 weeks with her 10' 6" make and close bars at 11' 0".. Niki Claery(HC) hit 10'0" and 58.6 in open 400!!! Cara Kelly(Vernon) 10' 6" Sabrina Anderson(HC) 10' 6"!!! In Bergen County Champs Amy Bravo(Park Ridge,NJ) took silver at 7' 6"!!! Liberty Conference,NJ….. The SEC Championships was the scene for Ike Osbun(MKA,NJ) to shine…the All State Hockey Goalie… sped the vault runway for the win …with a new school record 13' 6" vault for Coach dan Placentra….He had great shots at 14' 0" on his new UCS Spirits!!!! The Union County Champs had the Cranford,NJ Vault crew pumped up…with senior Pat Lynch sailing 14' 0" for the third week for the gold medal..and team mate danny Hannen hitting 12' 0" for a personal best… The Northern Valley-Demerast vaulters continue to score big fiber points.. with Sam Siegel hitting 14' 0" Kevin Layne 12'6" and Brett Croen 12' 6' before the storm ended the fun before the finish.. Fallsburg Comets….The Wednesday Tri-Meet in Fallsburg,NY was filled with up and coming vaulters…as Adian Woolsey(TV) made 12' 1" on the new UCS Vault Pit…Adam Hurwitz(F) made 11' 6"..Josh Helzims(F) 9' 0"…Meagan Hurwitz won the girls meet at 8' 7'(School Record) and Kali Seastrand jumped 7'6" vault for silver. College Up Dates…. Congratulations to Binghamton University freshman…Peter Fagan for soaring 16' 4.75 " this weekend in the Albany Last Chance meet. Sarah Haley(Binghamton) placed second in Womens at 11' 9.75" and ToriAnn Werner(Albany) made 10' 8" !!!! SUMMER CAMPS …JOIN THE CIRCUS Boys June 3--July 1 Girls July 2-3

posts.Title: BIG MONDAY @ FIBERGLASS CIRCUS….
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC Scenic Warwick Valley, NY KATLYN RYMARZOW(Pope John,NJ)…..SAILS @ EAST COAST RELAY GOLD !!!!!! WELCOME to the …"CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON" ……. ********************************************************** We will be sending out all performances daily and our 'State-of-the-Art' Web Site (hvflyingcircus.com)... developed by Connor Mulcahey, is reposting all results and pictures the next 3 weeks of "CHAMPIONSHIP FIBERGLASS" action… Tune in and "Catch -the-Unbending Spirit" of FLYING CIRCUS VAULT CLUB athletes…… BIG MONDAY @ The East Coast Relays in Randolph,NJ …as Pope John,NJ junior Katlyn Rymarzow continued her Super Vault Outdoor season…with her gold medal win at 11' 6" into wind…and close 12' 2" bars with her low grip for Coach Brian Corcoran… Sabrina Anderson(HC) jumped 10' 6' and Niki Cleary(HC) 9' 6" handled the wind conditions well all day !! The Boys Individual winner was San Siegel of Northern Valley-Demerast,NJ..with a personal best of 14' 6" for the most improved junior Nordsman. He has now qualified for Emerging Elite Nationals!!! Brett Croen(NV-D) jumped 12' 6" for Relay points. Suffern,NY junior Matt Leanza punched high over 12' 6"…Jake Diamond(Suffern,NY) 11' 6" personal best… Spencer Llerandi 13' 0" for Ridgewood,NJ. Darien,CT….. The battle of the Unbeaten Girls Teams from Staples and Darien produced BIG MARKS in all events at Darien High School,CT. Junior Maddie Schneider won four events…with personal best in pole vault 12' 3"…100 Hurdles(15.8)..Triple Jump... and 4x 100 Relay!!! Darien took home the Team Trophy for Coach Steve Norris's Blue-Wave !!!!! Senior Rachel Morocknek(Ridgefield,CT) hit 11' 0" again this week. Section 2 Championships…… Colonie,NY senior Kara Snyder produced another 10 points for Colonie at her Sectionals today…with her 11' 6" leap of faith gold medal performance !!!! *Many Thanks to all athletes and parents who have supported our OPEN TUESDAY & THURSDAY VAULT SESSIONS…. They were sensational and packed with fun and will start up again this Fall Season…September 10th….. We hope you can join us again. * NEXT UP….. Our SUMMER CAMPS are nearly filled… and registration will CLOSE on June 15th….. Boys 2 Day Camp,,,June 30-July 1 4-8PM ….. posts.Title: "VAULTERS STEP UP" @ FAST TIMES…SECTIONALS… NJ STATE GROUPS!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC
Pole Vault Development Project

    GREAT PERFORMANCES…. along with GREAT HUMAN SPIRIT...  carry-the-day  for the Band of Flying Circus Fiber-Benders in all three  states this past  week.  CONGRATULATIONS to ALL ATHLETES …. WE ARE PROUD OF YOU !!!!!

  The busy week started with  the 20th FAST TIMES FESTIVAL at Warwick Valley Central on Tuesday night UNDER-THE-LIGHTS….as OLYMPIC CHAMPION JENN SUHR showed her Pole Vault  Warm Up Drills and delighted the 60 High School Teams with auto-graphs..posters  and some down home humble "Olympic Spirit". She found the time  to  meet and greet over 550 aspiring young athletes in her 2 hour celebration !!! Many thanks Jenn and Rick!!!!

  The Girls  took flight first…with Samantha Beyar(Monroe,NY) hitting her marks and a 12' 2" PR vault  for gold…Kara Snyder(Colonie,NY) has bounced back high this season…hit 11' 7"  and close at 12' 2" Section 2 All Time Record attempt…Erin Leahey(Warwick,NY) placed   with her 10' 10"..as did Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John,NJ) 10' 10"…Kari Murnane(Lenape Valley,NJ)  10' 2" Catherine Walker(Monroe,NY) 10' 2"  Leah Wachmuth(RCK) 9'6" …

  The Boys also beat the rain…as the" Warwick Flyers"…Derek DiBona  and Todd Uckermark both flew 15' 8"  and each had  close bars at meet record 16' 3.5"(Yamoah-2011)  Ryan Herra-Murphy(Iona Prep) look great over 15' 0"   as did Travis Fountain(Monroe,NY) at 15' 0" Matt Fay(Iona Prep) hit 13' 10" Luke Amiratri(Farrell) 13' 2"…Jahkeem Wheatly(Iona Prep) 13' 2" for Coach Cahill's Boomer  Giants!!!!

  Also on Tuesday night..across-the-border  at Danberry High School FCIAC Championships..Junior Maddie Schneider(Darien,CT) set a  meet record of 12' 0"..Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield)  took silver at 11' 0"..Jessica Thornberry(Darien)  9' 6"Kristen Mayhew(Darien) 8' 0"…Natlie Hartwell(Greenwich) 7' 0"…At the SCC East Champs… Laurel Bailey(Shelton,CT) sailed 10' 0" school record.. At the Southwest Conference Champs.. Indoor State Champ..Jenna Calandro(Newtown) won gold at 11' 6" Jane Wall(Weston) 11' 0"  and Ali Moraveck(Masuk,CT) set  a school record at 10' 0" for the soph!!! Hannah Campos(Weston) 9'0"..Christine Popp(Brookfield) 8'6" Emma Lloyd(Newtown) 8'0"  Hannah Gluck(Weston) 8'0" Emily Iatesta(Weston) 8' 0"  Danielle Cass(Weston) 8' 0" !!!!

  New York Sectionals… Section 1…Boys…Matt Leanza(Suffern,NY)  advances to state finals with his 13'0"PR .. Aidan  Miller(PR) 12'0"  Liam McGarry(PR) 12'0" Reggie St.Louis(NR) 12' 0"  Charlie Wilson(NR)12' 0" Chris Elliot(WP) 11' 0" Sean Powell(JJ) 11' 0" Mike Traynor(NR) 11'0"  Jake Diamond(Suf) 10'0" Pete O'Neill(CS) 10' 0"Shawn Cherian(Arl) 10' 0"  Samy Markowitz(Irv) 10' 0" !
   Section 1 Girls..Leah Wachmuth(RCK) takes gold at  10' 9"  Dana Rokiecsak(CS) 9' 6"  Matea Friedel(Rye) 9' 6" Alexx Vincent(Arl) 9' 0"  Maddy  Luksha(Url) 9' 0"
   Section 2 Girls…Kara Snyder(Colonie) advances to state with her 11' 7' leap   and Kalli Manly(BH) also returns to state at 10' 6"…. In Boys vault action…Ian Allen  wins vault at 12' 9" for Chatham and  makes 800m and 4x800 Relay to state finals.

  Section 9…@ Middletown…Todd Uckermark(Warwick) flew 15' 6" on small poles…as did team mate Derek DiBona at 15' 6" to advance to state..Travis Fountain(Monroe) also vaulted great at 15' 0"  and heads to Greensboro for the final  Scholastic Competition for Coach Glover. Ivan Mieses(Middletown,NY) 13' 6" Matt Greenlaw(Warwick) 11' 6"..In Division 2..Nile Abularrage(RV) took the top spot at 12' 6"  Adam Hurwitz(Fallsburg)  12' 0" for the Comets.  Catherine Walker(Monroe) won the Girls vault at 11' 6"…Samantha Beyar(Monroe) placed  second at 11' 3" and Erin Leahey(warwick) set a seasonal best at 11' 0" for the Purple wave. posts.Title: ANDREW GHIZZONE (UNION CATHOLIC,NJ) SOARS 16 FEET @ STATE!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC The Pole Vault Development Project Warwick Valley,NY

ST - MOC - Boys - PV - Andrew - 16'0 from Michael McCabe on Vimeo.

FLASH RESULTS… NEW JERSEY STATE MEET of CHAMPIONS There was a buzz of excitement and wonder at yesterdays South Plainsfiled High School Boys Pole Pit…at the New Jersey Meet of Champions State Finals…as Union Catholic 's versatile Decathlon star Andrew Ghizzone , set a huge personal best in winning the gold medal in the pole vault with his first try clearance of 16' 0": on his Flying Circus 15' x 170 UCS SPIRIT ROCKET!!!! After racing to a 54.73 400m Hurdles earlier in the afternoon….Andy, bound for University of Colorodo next fall, took 17 vaults in the competition…with 3 very near jumps at Will Nesbitt's meet record of 16' 4" . It was the first meet of the year on his 15' x 170 pole. Andrew will be in Greensboro Nationals in vault. Also hitting big performances was Luke Annichiarico(old Tappan) 15' 0" for silver medal….Ike Osbun(MKA) 14' 0" Sam Siegel(Demerast) 13' 6" Spencer Llerandi(Ridgewood) 13' 0: Tim Schanstra(Pope John) 13' 0" !!! Katlyn Rymarzow(Pope John) placed 5th in the Girls meet at 11' 0"…followed by Sabrina Anderson(Hunterdon Central) 10' 6" Lauren Bilali(Old Tappan) 10' 0" Kari Murnane(Lenape Valley) 10' 0" Cara Kelly(Vernon) 10' 0" . CONGRATULATIONS ALL!!!! *************************** State Champions were also crowned on Monday in Connecticut…with Jenna Calandro(Newtown,CT) winning the Class M State title at 12' 1" and Maddie Schneider(Darien,CT) winning the Class L State Title at 11' 8"(Meet Record). Up in North Reading,MASS..Sophomore Julia Valenti won her Class S State Vault Title at 10' 9" for Coach Eric Hastings!!!! Special Thanks to James Schuler of Byram Hills,NY for donating his High School Vault Poles to the Flying Circus for the future stars to soar!!!!!! Chris Rough(Westhill,CT) won the State Vault Title in Class M at 14' 6" for then speedy junior ..coached by Neal Perry!!!! NEW YORK STATE MEET…FRIDAY JUNE 6 in Syracuse…. ************************************************************************* PLANT HIGH…. and HAVE FUN !!!!!!!!!

posts.Title: BIG VAULTS @ STATE….WARWICK VALLEY BOYS WIN STATE TEAM TITLE!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC Pole Vault Development Project Warwick Valley,New York HAPPY VAULTERS…… Derek DiBona(Warwick Valley)….James Deutmeyer(Fordham Prep)…Todd Uckermark(Warwick Valley) celebrate the Pole Vault together at NEW YORK STATE FINALS CONGRATULATIONS!!!! (Photo-Gerry Byrne) NEW YORK STATE MEET June 6-7 , 2014 Cicero-North High School Syracuse,NY GREAT PERFORMANCES are a product of GREAT TRAINING !!! Welcome to the Wonders of STATE MEET COMPETITION….. The New York State Meet was filled with huge vaults…exciting finishes and sensational team spirit under clear and sunny skies in up-state Cicero-North High School this past weekend..as 17 Flying Circus acrobats delighted the spectators at the Pole Vault Pit all day. In the Boys competition…. senior James Deutmeyer(Fordham Prep) used his 15' 7" x 195 Spirit to the max in winning the Federation title at 16' 6" for Coach Brian Carney and assistant coach Gerry Byrne. The Villanova bound honor student had close attempts at the State Record of 16' 8.75"(Jordan Yamoah,Arlington) and is bound for Greensboro next week. Winning the STATE PUBLIC VAULT TITLE was senior Todd Uckermark at 16' 3" a new Section 9 and School outdoor record.. and Runner-Up was team mate Derek DiBona at 15' 6"…for 14 Team Federation Points for Coach Mike Potters Purple Wave…. STATE TEAM CHAMPIONS( 34 Points !!!) Ryan Murphy(Iona Prep) was strong again at 15' 0"..followed by Zack Lieberman(James Dewitt) at 14' 6" Matt Leanza(Suffern) 12' 0" and Ian Allen(Chatum) at 12' 0" !!! The Girls Meet was also loaded with talent and speed…as Karmen Auble(Warsaw,NY) won her Fereration title at 12' 3" and very close jumps at 12' 8" for the Xavier University scholarship bound multi-athlete for Coach Ryan Orner. Kari Stromhaug(Vestal) was the Top Underclass vaulter at 12' 0"..Catherine Walker(MW) placed 3rd at 11' 9" seasonal best…Samantha Beyar(MW) placed 4th at 11' 6'..Kara Snyder(Colonie) flew 11' 6" Leah Wachsmuth(RCK) 10' 6" Sophia Alter(RV) 9' 6' Samantha Kaplan(NP) 9' 6" Carolan Frisina9Sysosset) 9' 6" Kalli Manly(BH) 9' 6" Abby Uczen(WG) 9' 6" all competed well all day!!!! ******************************** WARWICK VALLEY BOYS WIN FEDERATION TEAM TITLE !!!! ************************************************************************ The last time Warwick Valley won the STATE TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP was in 1997!!!! In that meet at Kingston's Dietz Stadium…. Present Head Coach Mike Potter was the main scorer for the Purple Wave…and now he directs the Championship XC-Indoor and Outdoor Boys programs…along with Assistant Coach Curtis Akacki. The Purple Wave ..started out the meet slowly and with adversity…but bounced back high for the resounding TEAM TRACK & FIELD TITLE!!! CONGRATULATIONS PURPLE WAVE !!!!!! STATE CHAMPS !!!!!!!! ************************************************************** JENN SUHR…VAULTING ON BROADWAY,NEW YORK CITY !!!! Olympic Vault Champion.. JENN SUHR…is promoting the POLE VAULT AGAIN!!! This Wednesday June 11 at 12 Noon… some of the finest Women Pole Vaulters in the World will be jump in Times Square…at the Adidas Pole Vault Extravanga….a prelude to the Diamond League Meet at Icahn Stadium on June 14… Come join the fun. …….Also invited and competing will be our USA NATIONAL JUNIOR CHAMPION…MEGAN CLARK (Duke University) and FLYING CIRCUS Alumni…..This up and coming Vault Star will attempt to raise her 14' 7.5" University Record. The sophomore from Durham,NC will be celebrating her 20th Birthday on Broadway!!!!!! Gather the FAN CLUB and SEE YOU THERE!!!! BOYS & GIRLS SUMMER CAMP REGISTRATION CLOSES JUNE 15 @ FLYING CIRCUS…Don't be left out this year…. Join the 'CAMP OF VAULT CHAMPIONMS' Boys Camp June 30-July 1 4-8PM Girls Camp July 2-3 4-8PM Applications at www.hvflyingcircus.com 17 FLYING CIRCUS VAULTERS HEADING TO NATIONALS June 13-15 GREENSBORO,NC

posts.Title: "CIRCUS GIRLS FLY" @ CONNECTICUT STATE MEET of CHAMPIONS !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC The Pole Vault Development Project Warwick Valley, New York Connecticut State Open Middletown High School June 9, 2014 CONGRATULATIONS to ALL FLYING CIRCUS athletes at yesterday's rain-soaking STATE OPEN TRACK & FIELD FINALS in Middletown,Connecticut yesterday !!!! It's always pure sport when athletes from opposing teams…team mates and coaches cheer for each other in the heat of the battle at the STATE FINALS. This was the case yesterday in Middletown, Connecticut. …..Competitors helping each other… catching each others step.. lending poles and sharing support….. this is the ..'Joy-of-Athletics' that keeps it fun and memorable for years to come. Maddie Schneider(Darien) and team mate Jessica Thornbury(Darien) produced big point in the pole vault to launch Coach Steve Norris's BLUE WAVE Girls team to the TEAM TITLE 45 points over Staples 42!!! Pole Vault Points Win Team Title Again ….. Just like NY STATE MEET WARWICK VALLEY BOYS !!!!!! Darien junior Maddie Schneider flew 12' 0" before the BIG DOWNPOUR for the 10 points and gold…Jenna Calandro(Newtown) was sensational over 11' 6" for silver and Jane Wall(Weston) was solid over 11' 0" for third place at STATE!!! Circus-Flyer..Rachel Moroknek(Ridgefield) 10' 6"(5th place)… Ali Moraveck(Masuk) 10' 0"(Top Soph)…Jessica Thornbury(Darien) 10' 0" …Laurel Bailey(Shelton) 10' 0" Chloe Brown(Glastonbury) 10' 0" !!!! Schneider and Calandro will be taking it up at new balance Nationals this weekend… while Wall,Moroknek,Moraveck,Thornbury ,Bailey and Brown will hit the New England Championships!!! CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL VAULTERS ….THE CIRCUS NOW… HITS-the-ROAD !!!!
