posts.Title: "JOIN-the-RUSH" @ CIRCUS …. POLE VAULT MADNESS CONTINUES …..
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project The Warwick Center Fiberglass Barn Warwick,New York USATF Club # 06-1129 The Pre-Season on Fiberglass is now in the books….. It's time to line it up at the meets!!! The 106 Flying Circus vaulters..2016 Edition …. are ready..willing…. and able to move into the Indoor Track & Field Competitive season this week. Let the Games Begin !!!!! The Circus Tour will be on display in many different venues this coming weekend…starting with Friday Night (Dec. 18) at the OCL Meets at West Point at 6PM…Then on to Ocean Breeze,Staten Island on Saturday for the Bishop Loughlin Games and The New Balance Armory Hall of Fame meet on Saturday afternoon for some more Fiber-Fireworks. Some vaulters will be heading to Drew University and others to RCC,NY. We want to report any and all results every Sunday evening in this weekly VAULT NEWSLETTER.. You must e-mail your results by 6pm every Sunday to get you name UP-IN-LIGHTS to all 880 e-mail pole vault enthusiasts and college coaches. Let's get your performances world-wide recognition. We are proud of you and your commitment to our sport. E-MAIL Results to coachst@gmail.com !!!!!! Congrats to Kalli Manly of Burnt Hills,NY for flying to gold on Saturday at Union Section 2 meet with her 11' 4" clear in the No Spike meet. The Citadel bound Manly was close at National Standard of 11' 6" on all three jumps for Coach Duffy's speedster…. Up at West Point..it was John S.Burke 's Junior Colleen Leahey winning gold for the Eagles…. and Saturday Sophia Alter(Rondout Valley) set an official School Record of 10' 7" in flats also..followed by Soph Kristin Lubeski(monroe) 10' 0" and Warwick Valley's 8th grader Genevieve Reilly placing third in her first real HS meet. The Boys also enjoyed the new West Point Vaulting pit..with Isaac Heatly(Warwick) winning at 12' 7" ... Soph Dane Sorenson(Warwick) silver 11' 7" and Brendan McShane(Warwick) bronze at 10' 1". Left off our December 5th Andy Wasnik Meet results was..Jordan Schwartz's 11' 7" sail for Hackley,NY !!! GREAT NEWS from Rochester Institute of Technology…with the acceptance of New York State Division II(Small School) State Pole Vault Champ..Samantha Kaplan of New Paltz High School. Samantha will be coached by 4-Time All-American and RIT School Record-holder…Mike Dempsey(16' 8.75"PR) next fall !!!!! College Vaulters @ Brerak… Here are the days and times all College Vaulters can come to Vault Practice and get back together to catch up… Monday December 28 at 3:30-5:30pm Wednesday December 30 at 3:30-5:30pm Wednesday January 6 at 3:30-5:30pm Cost…Still just $30 per athlete. Congratulations to New York State Outdoor Pole Vault Champion…Tedi DeMari of Bethlehem Central,NY for accepting her invitation to compete in the 109th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES Jr.Womens Pole Vault Event on Saturday February 20 at 2PM. The 10 Girl Field is almost full in this…the "Greatest Indoor Track and Field Meet in the World" !!!!! Also accepting an invitation is Amanda McNelis of Commack,NY…. Coached by Jim Hendersen at The WAREHOUSE POLE VAULT. All girls will be representing their Clubs or unattached in this a Junior USATF Event!!!! TOP SEEDS are the sensational Margaret Ollinger of Mobile , Alabama at 13' 6.5" and Becky Arbiv of Atlanta,Georgia at 13' 3.5" !!! Get your tickets ASAP to watch this and the PROFESSIONAL WOMEN"S POLE VAULT @ The ARMORY !!!!!! WHAT FUELS PERFORMANCE in POLE VAULT ************************************* Positive Attitude Speed Strength Agility - Balance Fitness Flexibility Toughness Dedication Goals Focus Consistency Nutrition "Spirit" FLYING CIRCUS …….. "BUILDING CONFIDENCE"

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS  HOLIDAY MEET" .. DEC. 31  … ALL DAY LONG… FUN !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project USATF Club # 06-1129 You are invited to share the "Holiday Spirit" with us and bring in the new year on fiberglass. Join us at Flying Circus on Thursday December 31 for our 8th CIRCUS HOLIDAY MEET at the Vault Barn in Warwick, New York. It's the Boys/Men's day to get up early with their meet starting at 10:01AM sharp (Barn Opens at 8:31AM for sign in and warm up) and Girls/Women's meet begins at 2:01PM… Cost still just $20 per athlete..All Divisions. Wear your new holiday gear!!! FLYING CIRCUS HOLIDAY MEET Saturday Dec. 31 @ VAULT BARN WARWICK, N.Y. Boys/Men's Meet at 10:01AM Girls/Women's Meet at 2:01PM Barn Doors Open at 8:31AM….. FLYING CIRCUS …… "HAPPY HOLIDAYS" !!!!!

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS HOLIDAY MEET…. JUST 10 DAYS-TO-GO !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project      "HOLIDAY MEET" @ FLYIN' CIRCUS          JUST 10 DAYS-TO-GO ….. The Flying Circus Holiday Meet invites you and your team mates to join the celebration and holiday cheer ...on Thursday December 31 at the VAULT BARM on 3 Warwick Center Road, Warwick, New York. This annual powerful meet brings together the most dedicated pole vault nuts on the planet…. so why not join the fun !!!!!      Boys/Men's Meet starts at 10:01AM…Warm up at 8:30AM. All Divisions/Super Music/Great Stories/Free Parking      Girls/Women's Meet starts at 2:01PM..Warm Up at 1:01PM All Divisions/Crazy Music/Home Made Cookies/ Free Bathrooms      Entry Fee…. Still Just $20 per vaulter. Beginners Pit and Intermediate/Elite Pit       Stand TALL … Stay HUMBLE. *******************    FiberGlass News……       * Congratulations to our Newest College Acceptances….. Delbarton,NJ senior all around athlete…Peter Chan will be competing for Coach Steve Dolan's University of Pennsylvania Track & Field team next fall at Franklin Field.This humble and dedicated athlete is currently ranked #1 in returning New Jersey pole vault athletes this winter. Wallkill,NY senior vault champion… Matt DeLorenzo will be attending Cortland State University next fall and join Coach peter McGinnis deep vault squad. Talented dual-sport senior Ali Moraveck of Masuk,Connecticut.. will be taking her national class soccer and vault skills to The BIG RED ..Cornell University next fall !!!! Congratulations All !!!      * Vaulters heating up …. The early season meets are happening…with Junior Nick Marino(Hatsboro,PA) soaring 14' 4" this weekend at The jack O'Leary Lid Lifter… Penn bound Peter Chan(Delbarton,NJ) won the gold Vault Medal at Drew University in training flats and no warm up at 13' 6" and super close bars at 14'1"…. At the OCL Development meet on Friday night at West Point…Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) soared 13' 0" for the gold..Isaac Heatly(Warwick) 12' 6" Soph Dane Sorensen(Warwick) 12' 0" Brendan McShane(Warwick) 10' 0" .. Josh of Monroe-Woodbury… 11'0"…Austin O'Mally(Goshen) 10' 0"..Matt Wilson(Wash) 9'0" Andy Rubenstal(Wash) 12'0" ..the Girls Division. saw Colleen -Ann Leahey(Burke) win again at 9'0"…Crystal nelson(O'Neill) 7'0"…Genevieve Reilly(Warwick) 7' 0"…and Kayla Maas(Eldred) at 7' 0".        Sophia Alter(Rondout Valley,NY) won the New Paltz Running Camp pole vault at the Armory on Friday at 10' 6" and close bars at 11'0" for the Ganders…Team mate Romaguera added 8' 0".         Northern Valley,NJ Vault-Duo Michelle Rubinetti and Caitlin Reverand have started up the season on high notes the last 3 weeks at 11' 7" and 11'1" for Coach Mike Ives… came thru again at the Hall of Fame meet on Saturday with a winning Relay of 20'6" for the Nordsmen of Demerast.       The Bishop Loughlin Games produced some great early season marks…as NY State Vault Champ..Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem Central) flew BIG over 11' 6" for the Gold Watch first place on her longer UCS Sticks… Burnt Hills,NY star Kalli manly placed 3rd at 11' o" on her longer poles … Soph Kristin Lubeski(Monroe,NY) is busting out at 10' 0"…Maurin O'Conner(Doane Stuart,NY) look great at 9' 6"… Gabby Nebiker(Monroe) set her PR at 9' 0" for the up and coming freshman coached by Chris Goodwin. In the boys section… Coach Jerry Cahill(Iona Prep and Farrell,NY) came up with a few surprises agin…as Pat Caridad(Farrell) won the Watch at 13' 0" PR !!! Team mate Charles Crispi(Farrell) also 13' 0" and Joe Vigilante(Farrell) at 12' 6" for the "Sweep"!!!        Weston High School,CT is back to the Vault Circle for Coach Matt Meadve..with a sweep at the Hillhouse Invitational on Saturday as Hannah Campos taking top honors at 9'6" team mate Danielle Cass(Weston) 9' 0" Sophia Rico(Weston) 9' 0" Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich) 8' 6" Emily Iatesta(Weston) 8' 6". …Let the Connecticut Games begin !!!!      Up in Section 4 Age Group Champs… Soph Johannes Stromhaug(Vestal) took TOP SOPH honors at 13' 6" PR for Coach Jim Cerra…. and Ben Vardi-Davidson(Fonda) hit 11' 6" to start up his season.    Many thanks to all athletes for reporting results to Circus Media Headquarters!!!     COLLEGE BREAK PRACTICE SCHEDULE    ***************************************************         Monday Dec. 28 3:30-5:30pm Men & Women         Wednesday Dec. 30 3:30-5:30pm Men & Women         Wednesday January 6 3:30-5;30pm Men & Women          FLYING CIRCUS ….. HAPPY HOLIDAYS !!!!!

posts.Title: TEDI DeMARIA …VAULT RECORD @ ARMORY NORTH SHORE MEET… 12' 0" !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project "TRADITION NEVER GRADUATES" The" Holiday Spirit" brings out the best in all of us …… Circus athletes are pressing the poles up at takeoff and enjoying the early indoor season on the runways around the Tri-State area. The next 2 months are about to explode with high level performances from the 108 Indoor FLYING CIRCUS athletes!!!!! The weekend action started fast at the New Balance Armory in New York City's Washington Heights neighborhood…with the North Shore Invitational Girls Pole Vault…Bethlehem Central 's Field Event and Pole Vault specialist…Tedi DeMaria produced a series of sensational jumps in both the warm and the actual meet….. using her UCS Spirits 13'1(165) and 13'7"(155) series in progression…she blasted to a new meet record of 12' 0" and BIG JUMPS at 12' 6" for the Gold Vault Medal for Coach Ashley Gansel. Tedi used her 7 Step and small grip again till mid January. In the Boys division in the afternoon…it was all Isaac Heatley of Warwick Valley's Purple Thunder squad of Coach Mike Potter. Junior Speedster…Heatley blasted huge over 12' 6" for the Gold medal and Washingtonville senior Andy Rubenstahl also lifted a12' 6" PR for Coach White. Nate Llanos(Danbury,CT) looked great over 11' 6"..Josh Jeong(Monroe) 11' 6" season best…Logan Matthles(Monroe) 10'0"PR for Coach Glover/Hemmer!!! The Fun and great vaulting continued at the Armory on Saturday Night…as much improved Northern Valley-Demerast,(NJ) Michelle Rubinetti flew over 11' 6" for the win at the NYRR Sprint Night meet. She also held low(11' 8) and near missed at 12' 0" for Coach Mike Ives. Team mate Caitlin Reverand was super over 12' in the warm up and placed 3rd overall. NV-D junior Erin Yuder hit some great jumps in her first appearance at the 'Mecca' Armory!!! In the Men's Open… Dan Matson(HVFC) looked great making 13' 0" easily and Carlton Huff(Former Rutgers Great) zoomed 10' 6" to win his age group and Bill Crouse(Philly Jumps) hit 10' 6" to win his age division. Earlier in the week… belonged to Soph Seth Kricheff of Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ) with his gold medal win at the Spiked Shoe Meet at the Armory on December 22…Followed by Brian Rubenstein(Gov.Livingston,NJ) at 12' 0" Naeson Lim(Tappan Zee) 11' 6" and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood,NJ) placing at 10' 6" for the Maroons.. In the Girls Section… Ridgewood ,NJ Junior Maxine Earl soared to her first Armory Individual Victory with her 10' 6" Leap of Faith…. Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn) placed second at 10' 0" Leah Saifi(Gov. Livingston,NJ) 10' 0" for 3rd place..Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 0" and Grace Gardella(Ramsey) hit 9' 6" in her first indoor meet for the Rams!!! Up in Albany… It was the Kalli Manly show… as the speedy Citadal bound form Burnt Hills soared 11' 4" with Coach Duffy's improvements. Kalli moves to #3 in New York State Indoor Performance list !!!! Over in Penn land.. Holy Cross,PA fast improving Matt Marsh set his 3 rd Indoor School Vault record with his 13' 6" for Coach Sagen !!!! The University of Connecticut Vault squad will be one of the best in the east this year..both indoor and outdoor…with junior Craig Hunter(17'8.5") returning this spring for a shot at the Olympuic Trials standard of 18' 6.5"…. but freshman "New Kid on the Block" Derek DiBona (Warwick Valley,NY) soared a 16' 0" first jump clear at the inter-squad meet and former Circus strongman..TJ Murphy hit 15' 6" for 3rd place for the HUSKIES!!! Both plan to crank it up this Thursday at Flying Circus Holiday Meet at 9AM…JOIN THE FUN… and get a glance at FLYING HUMANS!!!!! Boys at 10AM Girls at 2PM …. ALL DIVISIONS!!!! ********************************* COLLEGE DAYS @ CIRCUS ********************************** Monday Dec. 28 3:30-5:30PM Wednesday Dec. 30 3:30-5:30PM Wednesday Jan 6 3:30-5:30PM HOLIDAY MEET @ BARN… Thursday December 31,2015 LAST CHANCE to put up a mark in 2015 !!! ******************************* ALL Divisions…. Middle School…High School…Open…Masters Entry Fee---$20 per athlete. Boys Meet starts 10AM Girls Meet starts 2PM.. USATF Sanctioned.. Marks will count! FLYING CIRCUS …… MORE THAN POLE VAULT.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS HOLIDAY MEET SOARING" …..TEDI DeMARIA  12' 8"  /  DYLAN SCRIBANI  14' 0" !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus  Pole Vault Project     USATF  Club # 06-1129
    Warwick, New York -   It was all about  'Friendly Soaring' at the  8th Annual  Flying Circus Holiday Meet at the 100 year old Dairy Barn Pole Vault  Facility in Warwick Valley, New York yesterday …as  55 young athletes gathered  for the explosive High School   and Open meet on the  Fastest Runway in the World!!!
    Highlights were produced all day long…with NY State  Outdoor Champion… Tedi DeMaria of Bethlehem Central,NY flew over 12' 8" for a  #4 National Mile Split Performance  and #6 All-Time Indoor New York State Performance.  Using her UCS Spirit 165 lbs pole to the max  and near missing at 13' 1"!!!  Also soaring in the Girls HS Division was Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) 12' 2" School Record  and Caitlin Reverand(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) at 11' 6' National Qualifier!!!  The Middle School Division for Girls produced a USA #1 performance  from Genevieve Reilly(8th Grade) from Warwick Valley Middle School,NY. Megan Jamersen from Trabuco Canyon,CA won the Women's Open at 12' 6"
   In The Boys High School competition…  New Paltz,NY junior Dylan Scribani sailed over 14' 0:"  for his new Indoor School Record    with air-to-spare…and Matt Mazzacario(NV-Old Tappan,NJ) claimed TOP FROSH honors at 10' 6" PR!!!  in the Open men..  Peter Fagean(Unattached-Westfield,NJ)  took gold at 15' 6"…and Todd Uckermark(Unattached-Warwick,NY) sailed 15' 0"  from small step!!!  Winning the Masters…was  Carlton Huff from Shore AC Vault Club at 10' 6" easily!!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FEVER" ….. HIGH FLYING !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project  Warwick, New York      CONGRATULATIONS to all vaulters for outstanding performances and spirit this weekend in our four bordering states…FLYING CIRCUS INDOOR VAULT TOUR . The 2016 Tour begins…. with NEW GOALS…NEW and IMPROVED TECHNIQUE and STRONG EMPHASIS on NEW FIBERGLASS FITNESS. Enjoy your success….YOU EARNED IT !!!!!   Fiber-Results….   January 4 …….. Utica,NY - The cool conditions in the brand new Utica College Indoor Track Dome could not hold back Circus team mates…Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem) and Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills) of powerful vault Section 2. Tedi DeMaria vaulted 12' 0" for Coach Gansel's Indoor squad and senior Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills) flew 11' 6" for the silver performance and her NATIONAL QUALIFYING mark !! On to the BIG DANCE this March at the New Balance Armory!!! Tess Klugman (Bethlehem) opened at 7' 0" .                          Providence,Rhode Island - The Rhode Island Classic was another sensational meet produced by Bob and Ann Rotherburg…as Ava Coleman(Mercy,CT) won the gold at 10' 6" for the powerful senior and super-soph Lia Zavattaro(Greenwick,CT) set her school record straight at 9' 0" to place 6th overall ..Devon Feuer(New Rochelle) sailed 8' 6" for Coach Capellan.                         Wilton,Ct - Weston,CT junior Danielle Cass was the winner at the SWC meet in Wilton high School gym..with her 10' 6" sail in sneakers!!! Team mate Hannah Campos placed silver at 9' 6" for Coach Meadve and Newtown High School junior Lauren Russo placed 3rd at 9' 0" to start up her season.                        Staten Island,NY - The Ocean Breeze Holiday Festival saw Charles Crispi(Farrell) sail to victory at 13' 2" for the strong soph Coached by Jerry Cahill… Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill,NY) hit 12' 0" Joshau Jeong(MW) cleared 11'6 and Nick Verboys(MW) broke-out with his 11' 0" PR for Coach Glover/Coach Hemmer's Crusaders.                        Camp Hill,PA - Congrats to Coach Matt Conconnan at his Vaultworx Winter Bonus Meet in Camp Hill on Saturday..as his Katie Jones(South Williamsport,PA) won at 12' 3" and team mate Alexis Baubitz(Central York,PA) also soared 12' 3" in the jump off.. Both Girls have accepted their Invite to NYRR Millrose Games Jr.Pole Vault!!! Also soaring was Coughlin,PA junior…Madisyn Hawkins at 10' 6" and close bars at 11' 0"!!!                        Hillhouse,CT - The WinterGreen Invite at Hillhouse Fieldhouse saw Westhill,CT. junior Marc DeLuca soar 13' 0" for the win for Coach Neal Perry and Ava Coleman(Mercey,CT) winning again at 10' 6" . Nate Lianos(Danbury,CT) made 12' 0" this weekend.     ***** " PROMOTING POLE VAULT" ……. There are some special media journalists promoting our pole vault event every week….. We ..here at FLYING CIRCUS... would like to salute and thank Kyle Brazeil (MileSplit-New York)…Doug Binder(Dyestat.com) , Don Rich(MileSplit-PA) and Connor Mulcahey( HVFC Web Master).. for all there wonderful support for our event. These are the guys following and reporting the "KIDS-on-FIBERGLASS" journey!!!!!!! Pole Vault Spirit moves up!!!!!    ******* UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT ….The Flying Circus will be taking 15 Vaulters to the" GREATEST POLE VAULT EVENT in the WORLD" on Jan 14-15-16-17 in Reno,NV. Our facility and all classes/open sessions/team clinics will be CLOSED on those days. We will bring back all the UP-DATED concepts and information for all our vaulters progression.   ********* 2016 NYRR MILLROSE GAMES Jr. Girls Pole Vault Event is now closed…with 10 of the finest High School Girls in the USA!!! Complete list coming…Get your MILLROSE tickets ASAP..as this Feb. 20 event at the NB Armory will be SOLD OUT soon. CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL SUPER TEN !!!!    * 2016. TRAINING for SUCCESS.       **************************************        * Establish and Define your GOALS.        * "Life without goals is meaningless." - Aristotle        * Dare to DREAM BIG.        * The body can never go…where the mind has never been."        * Little steps…to BIG IMPROVEMENTS.        * Make Training a PRIORITY.        * Reach for the stars.        * MOTIVATION is the NAME of the GAME.     FLYING CIRCUS…… ATMOSPHERE and FUN

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS FUN CONTINUES
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project   USATF Club #06-1129       IT's …"SUMMIT WEEK" ….. The Flying Circus will be traveling this Thursday-Sunday to Reno,Nevada for the one and only UCS Spirit NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT…presented by Steve Chappell (UCS) and Family!!!! We want to thank every parent and coach for sending the 11 High School athletes for this educational fiberglass trip.. We will bring back all the ever changing technique concepts for all our vault-crew!!!! Athletes attending…Maxine earl,Jessica Ippolito,Samantha Kaplan,Kalli Manly,Julia Valenti,Caitlin Reverand,Michelle Rubinetti,Matt Delorenzo,Dylan Scribani,Brian Rubenstein,Liam Ackerman. Coaches Stephaine Duffy,Megan Jamersen,Will Nesbitt and Ben Sinonet will also be chaperoning and taking it up this weekend!!!! Flying Circus hits-the-road!!!!! Fiber News….  Jan.11    LIAM ACKERMAN (14' 0") and JULIA VALENTI (12' 0") TAKE-IT-UP……. St.Anthony,NY junior Liam Ackerman won the Hispanic Games at the Armory on Saturday with his 14' 0" sail and close at 14' 4" for Coach Jim Hendersen Friars.. This former Monroe,NY youth star is coming out of the cave…North Reading,MA multi-Event Julia Valenti continues to thrive..with her 12' 0" win at the Dartmouth Relays and close at 12' 6". This soon to be Dartmouth University athlete heads west to the Summit this weekend. Burnt Hills,NY senior star Kalli Manly captured the silver medal with her 11' 0" and moving to longer poles now and Alana Carroll(Averial Park) sailed 11' 0" for TOP SOPH jump this indoor in New York!   Cornell,NY.. NY State Champ..Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem) won the gold at Cornell on Saturday and continues to move her grip up slightly every week for Coach Gansel…along with her Triple Jump emphasis. Amelia Legg(Sidney) 8'6" and Johannes Stromhaug(Vestal) won the Boys at 13' 6" for the state's TOP SOPH!!    Ocean Breeze,NY… Watch Out…West Coast… Megan Jamersen is back in full vault training!!! Our Flying Circus star set a new Ocean Breeze Fieldhouse record with her 13' 7.25" win this week. She will be reconnecting with her friends and coaches this weekend at Summit!!! Megan has her sights set at this years' Olympic Trials in mid June at Hayward Field,Oregon!!!!   East Stroudsberg,PA… Coughlin,PA junior Madesyn Hawkins looked great at 11' 0" to place 3rd at East Stroudsberg Invite and Super-soph Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) is improving fast this indoor at 10' 0".    Hillhouse,CT … Greenwich,CT... soph…Lia Zavattaro won her two meets this weekend and set her indoor school record at 9'6"…Ava Coleman(Mercy,CT) won her meets at 10' 0"…Danielle Cass (Weston,CT) won again at SWC at 10'0" Lauren Russo(Newtown) 9' 6"..Ali Moraveck(Mysuk) 9' 6' and Hannah Campos(Weston) 9' 6". Marc DeLuca(Westhill,CT) flew 13' 0" for gold at Staples Invite. Nathaniel Llanos(Danbury) hit 12' 6" PR!   Freedom Games @ Ocean Breeze….. Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ junior Michelle Rubinette sailed 11' 0" for the gold and best friend team mate Caitlin Reverand hit 10' 6" for the silver medal..NV-Demarest junior new-comer Erin Yuder made 9' 6" with big air… Kristin Lubeskie hit 9'6" and 300m winner… Kelli Zestanakis(TH) 9' 0" Devon Feuer(NR) 8' 0" Seraya Friedman(MW) 8' 0" Kerry Qualter(CS) 7' 6' . In the Boys Invite..Farrell Sop Charles Crispi made 13' 0" again for Coach Cahill and George Zakharov(Croton-Harman) PR'ed at 12' 0" Isaac Heatley and Dane Sorensen both made 11' 6" to spare for the Purple Wave. Kiernan McCarthy(Valley Central) made 9' 6" on his own. Team Mate Brendan McShane hit his PR at West Point at 11' 0" for our most improved flyer this indoor. Colleen Leahey sailed 8' 6" for the Golden Eagles of JS Burke on Friday Night.     FLYING CIRCUS WILL BE CLOSED THURSDAY-SUNDAY JAN. 14-17.           KEEP TRAINING with a PURPOSE.

posts.Title: "SUCCESS in RENO" …CIRCUS MOVES UP !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project     USATF Club # 06-1129        It's hard to explain the impact of attending the UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT every year . This year's version was perhaps the ..BEST EVER and the focus was Education…Inspiration and New Friendships. The Flying Circus,traveled with 12 athletes…5 coaches and 5 parents, and enjoyed every minute of the 3 day gathering of "pole vault nuts"…Thank you all for another wonderful trip ….. on to the next challenges!!!!!   News/Results/Up-dates   ***************************   January 19     Reno,NV …. Steve Chappell did it again… bringing us all together under the large roof of the Reno Livestock Center to learn new techniques of pole vault…and to learn about who we are and what we can achieve together in athletics. The summit was about "human spirit" and belonging to something just a little bigger than ourselves. The pole vault community is a close knit group of unbelievable friendly people who share the same dreams for each other…Long Live the Spirit.            Coach Ben "Sailboat" Simonet led the charge with his 14'9"(4.50m) sail over and close at 15'1" in the Masters Pit 4 before his Bermuda Sailing Race on Monday….Coach Will Nesbitt was super in his return to the fiberglass battleground on Pit 4 and Coach Stephanie Duffy and Megan Jamersen were ready to perform for old friends in there Open Women's Comp both days… Coach Cauthers and Coach St. had hamstring injuries preventing there Summit debut!!! North Reading,Mass senior Julia Valenti blasted over 11' 10 on Pit 2 Elite Girls comp and was solid at 12' 4"…Kalli Manly, Burnt Hills,NY was spectacular in winning her pit with a 11'8" sail and close at 12'0" for Coach Duffy… Michelle "Rube" Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) also won her Pit 7 with a Big 11'2" and close at 11' 9"…… Caitlin "Rev" Reverand(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) also cranked up 10' 6" on Pit 5…Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) 10' 6"…Maxine Earl(Ridgewood,NJ) 10' 6" and Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn,NJ) 10' 6" were all super on the elevated runways and fast music. Dylan Scribani(New Paltz,NY) had a great meet at 13' 2"…Brian Ribenstein(Gov.Livingston,NJ) sailed 13' 0"…Matt deLorenzo(Wallkill,NY) hit 12' 10" and Liam Ackerman(St.Anthony,NY) had huge jumps all day for Coach Jim Henderson !!!! Todd Uckermark(High Point University,NC) was spectacular sailing 15' 7" for Coach Scott Houston and close at 16' 5" on Pit 1 !!!    West Point,NY … Warwick Valley,NY junior Brendan McShane won the vault again at West Point on Friday night at 11' 0" for Purple Wave…Kiernan McCarthy(VC) 10' 6" Kesigh DeLoatch(Warwick( 9'6") and Isaac Heatley(Warwick) stretched out to 17'9 Long Jump duties …Sophia Alter(Rondount,NY) flew 10' 6" Colleen Leahey(Burke) 9'0" Kayla Maas(Eld) 8' 0" Genevieve Reilly(Warwick) 7' 0" .!!!    Armory,NY… The Molloy Stanner Games at the Armory on Saturday was electric..as Old Tappan,NJ Sophomore Seth Kritcheff sailed 13' 1.5" for the gold medal and is New Jersey's TOP SOPH this Indoor. ..Vinnie DePaolo(Monroe,NY) hit 12' 1" for Coach Hemmer's Crusaders…Josh Jeong(MW) made 11' 4"… In the Girls .. Commack,NY junior Amanda McNelis won at 10' 10" for the Warehouse…Soph Kristen Lubeskie(MW) made 10' 4" Gabby Nebiker(MW) 8' 8" Seraya Freidman(MW) 8' 0"..    Toms River,NJ….. The NJ State Relay Championships at Toms River was great..as the Governor Livingston Saifi sisters won the State Vault Relay Championships in Group II with Leah Saifi sailing a school record 11' 6" and Lauren Saifi hitting 9' 6" for the Indiago Gymnastic stars!!! Bridget Muller(Mahwah,NJ) 10' 6" and Marisa Entrup(Mahwah) 9' 0" combined for silver for Coach Rib Pasek!! Nicole Lester(Ridgewood,NJ) hit 10' 6" and team mate Kerry Callaghan his 8' 0" for the Maroons… and Dave Bausmith(HC) 11' 6" and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood,NJ) sailed 11' 0". Caroline McGann(Holy Angles) made 9'0' and team mate Darcy Ottomaelli hit 8' 0" in Non Public B. Jason Mezhibovsky(NV-Demarest,NJ) won the FDU Field Meet at 12' 0" and is improving fast… Dante D'Agostaro)Mahwah,NY) 12' 0" and Counting and Mark Lynch(Cranford,NJ) hit 9' 0" at State relays!!!    Glenn Mills,PA…. Nick Marino just keeps jumping higher each week… sailing 14' 9" at winning the Glenn Mills Invite for Hatsboro,PA Indoor Team… Madesyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) set another Indoor School Record by winning the Lebanon Valley Invite at 11' 0" in Annsville,PA.      Chapel Hill,NC… Watch out this year for Duke University senior Megan "Flips" Clark !!! Using just a 13' 0" grip at the NC Challenge… Megan flew 14' 4" and close at 14' 7" for Coach Wilbourn's Flyers!!! This former Circus Superstar is tough in the clutch!!!   Hillhouse,CT…. Congrats to Lauren Russo(Newtown,CT for her 10' 6" indoor PR this week…and Danielle Cass(10'0") and Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) 9' 6" at SWC meets this week.    NEW OPEN SCHEDULE @ CIRCUS coming Feb. 16 !!! Join Us!!!      The Flying Circus is expanding our Open Instruction Classes on February 16 thru March 22 for all vaulters of all abilities. Every Tuesday and Thursday Nights from Feb 16-March 22 ..there will be a 5:30-7pm and a 7-8:30pm Open Co-Ed Vault Class at Flying Circus. Cost is still just $30 per 90 minute Walk In sessions for all new vaulters and current vaulters … Join the Development Fun with us. Our Winter Training Package Groups end Tuesday Feb. 9.      FLYING CIRCUS….LIVIN' the DREAM.

posts.Title: MEGAN CLARK SOARS AGAIN… INVITED TO 109th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES !!!!
posts.Content: GET YOUR TICKETS NOW…… MEGAN CLARK IS VAULTING !!!       CONGRATULATIONS to Duke University .. senior All American Pole Vaulter MEGAN CLARK for ACC Athlete of the Week honors and being invited to the 109th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES on February 20 in the New Balance Armory Track Center. Megan has developed at Duke University under the watchful eye of National Multi Events Coach Shawn Wilbourn. His progression with all his vaulters is legendary and steady… Megan.. last indoor NCAA Runner-Up in the pole vault will also be jumping at The Armory Invitational on February 6th in the Armory. This former Flying Circus Champion will have her fan club at both events!!!! Get your tickets NOW!!!!   CONGRATULATIONS MEGAN!!!!!   FLYING CIRCUS….. "BUILDING CHAMPIONS" … ON and OFF the FIELDS.

posts.Title: MICHELLE RUBINETTI (NV-DEMAREST,NJ)  12' 3.5"  and MATES …. SAIL @ ARMORY !!!!
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project
 USATF Club # 06-1129

<iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dmusB_V1oT0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Armory,NYC --- It was HIGH FLYING last night in the one and only  New Balance Track and Field Center in New York City  …with 21 FLYIN' CIRCUS athletes from the North County,New Jersey competed  with high spirit. Leading the way was Northern Valley-Demarest ...Junior..Michelle Rubinetti with  a new county indoor all-time record of 12' 3.5"..surpassing former Ridgewood,NJ/Notre Dame vault star Kayla Polcari. The record stays in the Flying Circus family!!! Jumping with a low grip od just 12' 0" on her new 140 stick…Michelle near missed at 12' 6.25" on two jumps after placing 5th in the 55m Dash. Team mates Caitlin Reverand was a scoring machine all night..with her 11' 0" vault  for  2nd..55 Hurdles 5th place  and 6th place in Triple Jump  and High Jump!!!  and  new-comer Erin Yuder sailed 9' 6" for Demarest   for a combined  32' 9.5" 3 Girl Relay State Indoor best!!!

Congratulations to all… Full results are coming on Thursday night on both Monday-Tuesday  and Wednesday's meets!!!!!

posts.Title: NEW BERGEN COUNTY VAULT RELAY RECORD !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project "Just Let It Fly" The dust has settled at the NB Armory pole vault area..after the last two days of back-to-back competition by Bergen County athletes at the New Balance Hall of Fame Track Center at 168th Street,NYC. Coming off sensational Tuesday night performances from Michelle Rubinetti(NVD) of 12' 3.5" and team mate Caitlin Reverand(NVD) 11' 0"… they lit up the All Time Bergen County Relay scoreboard with their 21' 7" Relay County Record for the Demarest Nordsman squad at the Bergen County Relay Invite on Wednesday night …as 22 Flying Circus team mates enjoyed the competitive spirit of High School Indoor Track & Field. Everyone is gaining technique and the speed and run approach posture have improved by leaps and bounds….Congratulations to all vaulters and now it's time for the CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON to kick in. PLANT HIGH !! "Hope" grows a little when you give... ...and gives you back when your in need." - Neil Diamond Bergen County Vaulters..ON-the-RISE …. The dedicated vault coaches from Bergen County,NJ high schools are taking the pole vault to the next level..as many athletes hit lifetime bests this indoor. Such was the case in the BIG NORTH CONFERENCE Championships at the NB Armory on Monday and Tuesday night. In the American Division…Joe Kim(Ridgefield Park) won with his 13' 0" sail and Greg Fuerte(Paramus) won Freedom Division at 11' 6' and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood) placed 3rd at 11'0" for more Maroon Points. In the Boys National Champs..it was Soph Seth Kricheff(Old Tappan) winning again at 12' 0" Jason Mezhibovsky(Demarest) 11' 6" Jona Kim 11' 0" Noah Oliff-Lieberman(Demarest) 11' 0" and Freshman Matt Mazzacano(Old Tappan) over 10' 0". In Boys Patriot Division…Coach Pasek's Mahwah senior vaulter Dominic Roca come up big with the gold at 13' 6" Jack Muller(Mahwah) 13' 0" and Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) completed the sweep at 12' 6" for the ThunderBirds!! Winning the vault at Morris County Invite was Delbarton,NJ senior Peter Chan…Kevin Nam(Pope John,NJ) sailed 10' 0" for the Lions!!! In the Girls Night out with Mr.Fiberglass… Northern Valley-Demerest ,NJ speedster Michelle Rubinetti flew 12' 3.5" for a new Bergen Indoor record… Team mate Caitlin Reverand..the Galaxy Gymnastic Champion flew 11' 0" for second…Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley) 10' 0" and NV-D junior Erin Yuder hit 9' 6" for the Blue and white of Demerest. Their combined 32' 9.5" in a State best for 3 girl Indoor Relay!!! In the United Division..Caroline McGann(Holy Angles hit 9'0" and darcey Ottomanelli(HA) placed 3rd at 8' 6". In the Patriot Division..Mahwah senior State Group Champ..Bridgett Muller won at 10' 6" Grace Gardella(Ramsey) at 9'6" Emma Bogoenko(Ramsey) 8'6' Marissa Entrup(Mahwah) 8' 6" Julia Entrup(Mahwah) 7' 6"… In Freedom Division..It was Jackie Helms of Paramus,NJ sailing 10' 0"..Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) 10' 0" Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 0" and kerry callaghan(Ridgewood) 8' 0". FairLawn junior Jessica Ippolito look strong at 10' 0" for the silver medal. Bergen County Relay Championships @ Armory(Wednesday evening)…. It was time to "Hoot .. and... Hollar" as Part Two/Day Two kicked off… leading the charge was small school winner..Dominic Roca(Mahwah) winning at 13' 6"..followed by Joe Kim)Ridgefield) 12' 6"..Jack Muller(Mahwah) 12' 6" Jason Mazhibovsky(Demerest) 12' 0" and Noah Oliff-Lieberman(Demerest) at 11' 0". In the Large school division…Old Tappan's Super-soph Seth Kricheff hit gold at 13' 6"PR..jona Kim (OT) 11' 0" and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood) at 11' 0" !!! In the Girls Competition..Large School Champion was Ridgewood,NJ Junior Maxine Earl with her 10' 6" zoom..followed by Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10'0"(soph)….Kaia becker(No.Highlands) 6' 0". In the Non-Public Division..Caroline McGann(Holy Angles,NJ) brought home the gold at 9' 6" !!! The small school division Relay was won by NV-Demerest at record 21' 7" total from Michelle Rubinetti)11' 7") and Caitlin "Rev" Reverand (10'0")… Bridgette Muller(Mahwah) 10' 6"..Grace Gardella(Ramsey) sets new Indoor School record at 10' 0"…Marisa Entrup(mahwah) 9' 0" for the Blue Thunderbirds!!! Dates for Calendar Marking…

10th FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT 2 DAY CAMPS

Applications available March 1 @ WebSite (hvflyingcircus.com) BOYS CAMP…July 11-12 , 2016 4-8pm Warwick,NY (First 50 to Register Only) GIRLS CAMP..July 14-15, 2016 4-8pm Warwick,NY (First 50 to Register) CIRCUS SUMMER BBQ MEET…Saturday July 16 ALL Day Warwick,NY Special Thanks to Mrs Dawn Helm for providing the video of Michelle Rubinetti's 12' 3.5" record jump on Tuesday night. Check out the interview of Michelle at armory track.com following her performance. In her words… she credits her parents…her team mates and her coaches for her success…..HUMBLE WINS AGAIN !!!!! Flying Circus Winter Classes end Feb 9 and 10. Many thanks to all. Flying Circus will be closed Monday Feb. 8 for the Varsity Classic at Armory FLYING CIRCUS ….. IT'S WHERE I WANTA' BE.

posts.Title: MARGARET OLLINGER (Alabama)  Leads Strong  NYRR MILLROSE GAMES  Jr. Pole Vault Event !!!!
posts.Content:
January 29, 2016 (Press Release) New York-- The 2016 NYRR 109th MILLROSE GAMES Jr. Girls Pole Vault Event is Loaded with Talent and Speed and High Flyers again at The New Balance Armory Track and Field Center on February 20th. The rich history of the Men's and Women's Pole Vault at the MILLROSE GAMES is legendary…with National Champions…Olympic Champions..World Record Performances and Barrier Breakers on long steel…bamboo and fiberglass vaulting poles. The TRADITION continues this year at the "Worlds Greatest Track Meet"… NYRR MILLROSE GAMES !!!! Come join the excitement with us!!!! This edition of NYRR MILLROSE GAMES features three exciting and deep pole vault events. The FLYING ACTION begins on Thursday evening..February 18 at 7:01pm with the Boys Jr. Pole Vault Event consisting of 10 great Tri-State Champions on Fiberglass. The focus then turns to the Flying Circus Girls Jr. Pole Vault Event on Saturday February 20 at 12:31pm on the super fast Armory Mondo X Runway…with Ten TOP USA Girls from 6 States delighting the enthusastic pole vault crowd in the balcony Sections 444-445-446 . The main pole vault event takes place on National TV at 3:58pm… with the Fred Schmertz Women's Pole Vault..with an International Field of Elite Pre-Olympic athletes soaring. Join the 'Fiberglass Movement' with us at the 109th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES !!!!

Girls Jr. Pole Vault Event Preview … Saturday Feb. 20 at 12:31pm

Pictured here is the 6-Time Alabama State Pole Vault Champion…Margaret Ollinger (McGill-Toolen Academy,AL). This Mobile,Alabama senior All American vaulter and Honor Scholar student is top seed with a personal best of 13' 6.5". Competing unattached and coached by Drew Bentley. Commit to Vanderbilt University next fall. Bar Progression…3.30m/3.45m/3.60m/3.75m/3.90m/4.0m/4.10m/4.20m/ 13' 6.5" Margaret Ollinger(Unattached) Mobile,Alabama.. Senior …. 6 x State Alabama Champion Pole Vault/NB Outdoor All-American Coach-Drew Bentley 13' 3.5 " Becky Arbriv(Atlanta Pole Vault Club) Atlanta ,Georgia Junior Attends The Weber School .. Coach Hal Fairbanks 12' 8" Tedi DeMaria(Unattached) Albany,New York Senior Attends Bethlehem Central,NY NY State Outdoor Champ Club-Flying Circus,NY 12' 6.5" Katie Jones(VaultWorX) PA ..Junior…South Williamsport,PA .. posts.Title: CIRCUS HOORAY" !!!! …RISING -UP WEEKEND !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Neil Diamond Pole Vault Center  Warwick, Valley,NY        "STRONG THRUST" …… The UCS Spirit poles were in full recoil mode this past weekend at all levels…High School…College and Pro. Congrats to everyone carrying the sticks and chasing the dreams of Fiber-Flying! The Drills program at Flying Circus is showing BIG RESULTS in technique and performance. DRILLS….the BACKBONE of POLE VAULT DEVELOPMENT. Let's continue to master the movements and felling of positions in our drills. Small drills = GIANT VAULTS!!!!!       Mid-Season News …. JENN SUHR, USA ….. BREAKS INDOOR WORLD RECORD !!!! Congratulations to Jenn Suhr and Coach Rick Suhr for raising the mental bar in pole vaulting… Jumping in a small Brockport University Open meet on Saturday..Jenn sailed 16' 6" on her biggest poles to break her old WORLD RECORD of 16'5.25". Coming into this season with her best and strongest fall prep season ever… produced some more magic from SUHR SPORTS,INC Rochester,NY. This just proves that we all can produce BIG PERFORMANCES anytime we are in a meet…big or small….the bar is still the same! Jenn and Rick will be joining our club this spring for a question/answer sessions for all our vaulters///autograph session and small 1 hour clinic at the BARN !!! Don't miss this day… touch the Olympic Spirit !!!!    College News…. Megan "Flips" Clark… aka..'The Duke Flash'….is up to her old tricks again…with a sensational 14' 4" win at JDL Classic on Friday for Coach Wilbourn. Megan had very close bars at 14' 10 and travels to Armory this saturday for Jack Pfiefer's Armory Invite at 10:30AM event. She returns for the TV National NYRR MILLROSE GAMES on February 20!!! GO MEGAN!!!!!     Up at Boston,MA..The Terrier Classic was huge…with Craig Hunter(Unattached/UCONN) sailing strongly over 17' 4.25"…TJ Murphy(UCONN) 16' 1"…Derek DiBone(UCONN) 15' 6"..Erik Adamick(Rider) 15' 0" and Billy Thibulti(Rhode Island) 15' 0"…. At Camel City Invite,VA… Sean "Flying Bulls" Young hit it just right making 17' 4.25" easily before he went fishing…..Luke Annichiarico(Wake Forest) is cranking it up at 15' 5" for the Decons. The PennState National Open was exciting pole vaulting..with Circus Alumni Peter Fagan(Binghamton University) soars 16' 10"PR for Coach Thompson…James Steck(Va Teck) made 16' 2" with air to spare and Stefan Buechele(Albany University) went 14' 8"

posts.Title: LEARN-TO-POLE-VAULT-DAY"… coming again MARCH 19 @ CIRCUS !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project    Up-on-the-Hill …Warwick Center    Warwick, New York       CALLING ALL ATHLETIC CHILDREN !!!!! It's time to LEARN HOW TO POLE VAULT !!!!   The FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Project is reaching out to the younger generation… Young athletic boys and girls in graders 6-7-8-9-10 who want to LEARN HOW TO FLY!!! A beginner clinic in POLE VAULT FLYING will be offered to all on Saturday March 19, 2016 at The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development…Warwick, New York. These two clinics will feature a safe and progressive drills for beginners in pole vault…running mechanics and beginning positions of pole vaulting. The clinic is three hours in length and just $50 per athlete. MS and HS Coaches come FREE… and will receive their Flying Circus Safety Certification for Pole Vault Instruction. Here is the chance to develop your Pole Vault athletes at your Middle School and High School programs. Join the fun and friendship of FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT.       This is a walk in clinic… Register AT THE DOOR on March 19. Cost $50 per athlete.     Boys and Girls Grades 6-7-8-9-10 ONLY. Dressed for activity.    Each athlete must be a current member of usatf. Register for that coverage on line at usatf.com/membership ($25 for the entire year)    SATURDAY MARCH 19, 2016 LEARN-TO-POLE VAULT-DAY" CLINIC #######################    FLYING CIRCUS ..3 Warwick Center Road…Warwick,NY Web site .. www.hvflyingcircus.com    BOYS CLINIC 10AM-1PM (Grades 6-7-8-9-10 ONLY)    GIRLS CLINIC 2PM-5PM (Grades 6-7-8-9-10 ONLY)    FLYING CIRCUS …. A UNIQUE EXPERIENCE for your CHILD .

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS … "LEARN-TO-POLE VAULT-DAY" …Join the Flying Circus Class with us !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Scenic Warwick Valley, New York Every now and then ….. …somewhere…. somehow ...someplace…. you are going to have to learn to fly. You are invited to JOIN our FLYING CLASS…. on Saturday March 19, 2016 and take flight !!! The pole vault staff at Hudson Valley Flying Circus invites all 6th--7th--8th--9th--and 10th grade students…Boys & Girls to "LEARN-TO-POLE VAULT DAY" activities here at The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development, Warwick, New York. This three hour program introduces the new and beginner level athletes to the wonderful jumping event..aka - Pole Vault. The positive proactive progressions of pole vaulting will be taught… including the grip..run posture.pole carry..plant..takeoff .. drive and swing stages of the pole vault. Everyone is invited to join the fun and friendship of the tight pole vault community. The cost is $50 per athlete and it's a WALK-IN REGISTRATION only. Bring your friends and Join - the- Movement with us.

"LEARN-TO-POLE VAULT DAY"

Saturday March 19, 2016 Hudson Valley Flying Circus 3 Warwick Center Road…Warwick, New York 10990 Boys Class Only… 10AM-1PM Dressed for activity. Girls Class Only …. 2PM-5PM Dressed for activity. Cost… $50 per athlete. Registration… AT THE DOOR ONLY. Circus Thoughts for the Day * If you can dream it …. you can do it. * Dedication + Hard-Work = SUCCESS * CHAMPIONS are made…when no one is looking. * Take a measure of yourself. * Beware of the 'comfort zone'. * Champions take risks. * BIG THINGS happen…when you REACH HIGH. Flying Circus…. WHAT DO YOU DREAM TONIGHT.

posts.Title: CIRCUS …… "CELEBRATE GIVING" PROJECT …JOIN US !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLCThe Warwick Center

Warwick, New York
   Welcome to the 2016  FLYING  CIRCUS COMMUNITY SERVICE PROJECT

   ***************************

   Each year our little pole vault  club  here at FLYING CIRCUS takes on a "CELEBRATE GIVING" Community Service Project.  It our way of giving something back  in helping others.  We invite you all to  join us in a very special project this month…. that hits very close to home.
   On Saturday night and into the early morning on Sunday…the home of Tony and Patricia Majewski at 204 Pine Island Turnpike was consumed with fire and destroyed.  Tony,Patricia  and their daughter escaped the single family house…but all possesions  are lost and   are now homeless. 

    Tony and Patricia Majewski have enriched our Warwick community for the past 40 years with  all their wonderful  beautification projects  with their escalating business…. their donating projects at Warwick Valley Central Schools…. their leadership qualities in supporting all  athletic programs in our Youth..Middle School  and High School areas   and their spearing heading our "1997 LIGHT-the-LIGHTS" community project to light our athletic fields at Warwick Valley Central.  All their children represented our little town on many a  different  field.  Their two oldest sons were Champions of the Pole Vault at both Warwick Valley  and the University of Rhode Island.

    Now… they are in need…… and we are ready to help and return their good works.
    Our Project…The MAJEWSKI FAMILY PROJECT will help donate spirit..funds  .. and love.

     You don't have to be a millionaire to give …. most of the giving in this country comes  from  ordinary people ..like you and me and your neighbor down the street. It's not about how much you give… it's about how much you care that counts.
   Our hope is that you can join us in this …"CELEBRATE GIVING" PROJECT" .. and help get the MAJEWSKI FAMILY back on their feet again.
   ALL Correspondence ..Well Wishes   .. and …  Donations  Payable  to: The MAJEWSKI FAMILY ... can be  sent to:

  ***********************

     The FLYING CIRCUS LLC

     % The MAJEWSKI FAMILY PROJECT

     176 North Church Street

     Goshen, New York  10924
      Tim St. Lawrence / Hugh Cauthers

      Flying Circus ….. Helping Others.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS @ MILLROSE GAMES … FRIENDS & FUN !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, NY It was the 109th MILLROSE GAMES ….. and perhaps…"The Best Ever" …. Thank you all for supporting this weekends 109th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES at The New Balance Track & Field Center,NYC. The sold out…standing room only crowd was filled with inspiring athletes of all ages and enthusiastic track fans from the Flying Circus and beyond ... to ring in the "Olympic Year Spirit"….. Every event stacked… from youth age Rising Stars to Olympic Champions…competing with full efforts and pride. We salute all participants. On to the next level. NYRR MILLROSE GAMES… Thursday Evening Jr. Boys Pole Vault…. Greg Potter…a Junior representing VaultWorX,PA soared to the gold with his 14' 10PR for Coach Matt Concannon. Flying Circus/Warehouse Junior Liam Ackerman took home the silver with his 14' 3.25" sail and Top Soph honors came from Johannes Stronhaug at 14' 3.25" for Coach James Cerra. Flying Circus/Philly Jumps Nick Marino sailed big over 14' 3.25" and is ready for this weeks PA State Meet in State College!!! PA Soph Quarterback star ,Payton Morris sailed 14' 3.25" for VaultWorx..in only his 5th month of vaulting !!!! Amir Abdelnaky(Vertical Assault finished at 13' 3.5"…Charles Crispi(You Can Not Fail Vault Club) boomed over 13' 3.5" for Coach Cahill and Dylan Scranbani(Flying Circus) look great making 13' 3.25' on borrowed poles. NJ State Indoor NPA Champ..Peter Chen did not start due to State Meet. Saturday Afternoon Jr. Girls Pole Vault….. This day belonged to North Carolina Indoor State Vault Champion…Chesney Ward..representing Vaulthouse,Greensboro,NC ..coached by Eric Morell. Chesney flew over 12' 11.5" first jump to win her MILLROSE GAMES GOLD MEDAL and FLOWERS!!!! This humble and gracious athlete has committed to Duke University net fall. Also flying 12' 11.5" was junior Becky Arbiv of Pole Vault Atlanta,GA. Coached by Hal Fairbanks…former Rochester,NY legend. Placing third was junior Katie Jones of VaultWorx,PA. with a personal best of 12' 11.5" for Coach Concannon. Also soaring BIG ALL DAY was the 7- Time Alabama State Champion..Margaret Ollinger,Mobile,ALabama…at 12' 11.5"!!!! Placing 5th was our own..Tedi DeMaria(Flying Circus) with her 12' 1.5" sail and very close bars at 12' 7.5". Rachel Finn(Vertical Assault) cleared 11' 7.5" and Nathalie Elliot(VaultWorX) made 11' 1.75" Amanda McNeilis(NY) was solid and just a junior. Junior Michelle Rubinetti(Flying Circus) won her NJ State Group II Pole Vault Title in Toms River on Saturday morning with her team. Saturday Late Afternoon… INVITATIONAL ELITE WOMEN'S VAULT …. It was another historical Pole Vault Day at Millrose Games….. as former Flying Circus Club Super-Star..Megan Clark(Duke University) delighted the Vault Fans with her booming speed and height over 14' 9" and super close bars at 15' 1" for Coach Shawn Wilbourn. Megan heads to ACC Championships next week in Boston!!!! SECTION 2 STATE QUALS…VAULT FIREWORKS!!!! NY Section 2 also made some history last week..with 3 Girls sailing the 12 Foot Barrier together…. Burnt Hills,NY.. senior Kalli Manley won the gold..with a lifetime best of 12'0" in the Saratoga Springs HS Gym at Section 2 Championships. This speedy and dedicated all-around athlete never gave up on her dream and is coached by Flying Circus's Stephanie Duffy. Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) also had a wonderful day with her 12' 0' sail for silver for Coach Ashley Gansel … Alana Carroll…just a sophomore at Averil Park,(NY) complete the Circus Sweep with her break thru 12' 0" School Record !!!! SECTION 9 CLASS A CHAMPIONSHIPS…. West Point was the venue… as The Warwick Valley Purple Wave Boys team won the team title for Coach Mike Potter and Curtis Acaki over NFA in a tightly contested match of speed…endurance and strength. Taking gold(and 10 points) was Wallkill,NY senior Matt DeLorenzo at 13' 0"…Isaac Heatley(Warwick) placed 8 points at 12' 6"…Vinnie DeLaolo(MW) brought in 6 points at 12' 0'..Dan Sorensen(Warwick) added 4 points to the Wave at 11' 6" Andy Rubestahl(Wash) 11' 6" Chris Endrizzi(MW) 11' 0" Matt Warren(Wash) 9' 6" completed Circus action. for Boys Division. In the Girls meet that followed..it was a super night in 3 events for Super-Soph..Kristen Lubeski of Monroe Woodbury,NY.. Coming off great performances in the 300meter and triple jump..this "team-girl" picked up her vaulting poles for more points and brought in 10 points for the Champion Ctrusaders with her 10' 0" win..Freshman team mate Gabby Nebiker placed 8 points at 9' 6' Warwick Valley 8th grader Genevieve Reilly place 3rd at 7'6" and new kid on the vault pole..Kali Thompson(Warwick) placed 4th at 7'0"in her first vault meet !!!!

NEW JERSEY STATE CLASS CHAMPIONSHIPS… CIRCUS VAULTERS WIN 4 STATE TITLES!!!

Outstanding performances came out at the Toms River Complex on Saturday..as 10 Girls and 10 Boys advance to next weeks Meet of Champions from the Flying Circus !!!! Congratulations to all athletes!!! "STATE POLE VAULT CHAMPIONS" * Peter Chen ..Senior..Delbarton ,NJ… 13' 0" !!!! Non-Public- A * Michelle Rubinetti..Junior…Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ … 11' 6" Group II * Jessica Ippolito…Junior…FairLawn,NJ … 11' 0" Group III * Nicole Lester…Soph…Ridgewood,NJ… 10' 6" Group IV Complete Circus Performers…. Boys Group II Brian Rubenstein(Gov.Livingston) 2nd,,,13' 6"PR Joe Kim(Ridgefield) 13' 6" Dom Rocca(Mahwah) 13' 0" Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) 12' 6' Jack Muller(Mahwah) 12' 6" Group III-- Seth Kircheff(Old Tappan) 12' 6" Group IV.. Dave Bausmith(Hunterson Central) 12' 6" -Soph..Greg Fente(Paramus) 13' 6" Trevor Hazell(Vernon) 12' 6" Non Publib -A..Peter Chen(Delbarton) 13' 0" Kevin Nam(Pope John) 10' 0" Gir;ls…Group II..Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest) 11' 6' Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston) 11' 6" Bridgette Muller(Mahwah) 11' 0" Caitlin Reverand(NV-Demarest) 10' )' Lauren Saifi(Gov.Livingston) 10' 0" Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley) 10' )' Group III- 1-Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn) 11' 0" Jackie Helm(Paramus) 10' 0" Group IV 1-Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Group Non Public A- Caroline McGann(Holy Angles) 9' 6" Amanda Grieco(Union) 7' 6" Connecticut State Meet @ Hillhouse,CT…. Congrats to Weston,CT junior Danileel Cass. for placing at state with 10')..Alli Moraveck(Masuk) 10'0".. and Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich) 9' 6" Soph…..
SPECIAL SALUTE and THANK YOU for contributing to …The MAJEWSKI FAMILY FUND…. the response has been inspiring and every donation helps… This Flying Circus Pole Vault Community Project sets the example for…"CELEBRATING GIVING to OTHERS"…….This project ends on March 19. Many Thanks. FLYING CIRCUS….. More than Pole Vault.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS ….. PLANT HIGH… SOAR HIGH !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley Vault Barn, NY

"MAKING HISTORY" …. Another GREAT WEEK of POLE VAULT STORIES.

Congratulations and Thank You all for elevating our Pole Vault Club @ FLYING CIRCUS CENTRAL. Each one of you… in very different ways…have put us on the National Pole Vault Map…. You all have been focused and you all have delivered the goods…. and the real goods are GREAT FRIENDSHIPS and FULL EFFORTS. Keep looking forward…as there are more challenges and adventures to come. We are PROUD of YOU.

CIRCUS THOUGHTS

* BELIEVE in YOUR MIRACLE. TAKE A CHANCE on yourself. * FEEL the SPIRIT of TOUGHNESS in athletics….. Then RESPOND. * KNOW WHJAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE. GO AFTER IT EACH DAY. * Make Progress…. not mark time. * AVOID NEGATIVE PEOPLE. STAY POSITIVE. * SEE YOURSELF EXCELLING ….. * Don't MAJOR in minor things in life. THINK BIG. * Bio-Rhythms ….. Prepare for your breakthru * Be Consumed by the CONCEPT of TEAM…. It's WE..not ME. * KEEP-YOUR-PROMISES. New Jersey Meet of Champions- The Toms River Bennett Center was the site for the New Jersey State Meet on Saturday..as 20 Circus Pole Vaulters represented our little club with "Abundant Spirit"…. Governor Livingston HS Junior Leah Saifi won the gold medal with her first ever 12' 0" leap for Coach Anthony DeFranco. This Indigo Gymnastic Club Level 10 gymnastic star is making a fast climb in pole vaulting and stayed humble with her BIG DAY on FIBERGLASS. Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest) flew to 3rd at 11' 6", using her 8 step approach for the first time with BIG AIR at 12' bar… Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn) just a junior sailed 11' 0" for 5th….Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) junior placed 7th at 11' 0" ..Caitlin Reverand(NV-Demarest) sailed huge over 11' 0" for 8th place ..followed by Bridget Muller(Mahwah) 10' 6" Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Jackie Helm(Paramus) 10' 0" Caroline McGann(Holy Angles) 9' 6" and Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley 9' 6". In the Boys section.. Vernon,NJ junior Trevor Hazel placed 6th at 13' 6" for the Vikings…Brian Rubenstein(Gov. Livingston) placed 7th at 13' 6"..Joe Kim(Ridgefield Park) 13' 6" Dominic Roca(Mahwah) 13' 6" Peter Chen(Delbarton) 13' 0" Greg Fuentes(Paramus) 13' 0" .. Seth Kricheff(NV-Old Tappan) 13' 0" Dave Bausmith(Hunterdon Central) 12' 6' and Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) 12' 6' PA State Meet of Champions….Penn State University was the site…as Hatsboro HS junior Nick Marino took it up with a 15' 0" PR for 4th place finish…. and Madeysen Hawkins(James Coughlin,PA) soared 111'0" again for the 8th place vault medal in this deep state vault meet again this year with Katie Jones(South Williamspost) and VaultWorX leaping 12' 6' for the 'Fiber-Title'. Utica USATF Invite…. The new track facility at Utica University is pole vault friends…. as Virginia University…Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) flew 12' 0" in her tune up for Eastern States and NY State meet next week at Cornell. Elity Legg(Delhi) was solid at 9' 6" again. Both look forward to STATE VAULT. NY Section 9 Quals… West Point-Gillis Fieldhouse was ringing with the competitive spirit of real High School sport… Friday in the girls vault..it was Kristen Lubeskie(Monroe-Woodbury) soaring 11' 0" for the gold medal and her trip north next week…Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley) placed silver at 10" 6…and Colleen Leahey(Burke) makes her state trip and becomes the third Leahey sister to excel in the vault. Gabby Nebiker(MW) placed 4th at 8' 6" Genevieve reilly(Warwick Valley) 8'0" and Kayla Maas(Eldred) 8' 0" for the green and gold!! The Boys Section was a Saturday afternoon 'Fun-Fest'…as Washingtonville HS senior Andy Ruebenstahl winning gold at 13' 0" on his new poles…Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) taking silver at 13' 0" and Warwick Valley junior..Isaac Heatley making his state trip at 12'9". Top Soph honors went to Warwick Valley's Dane Sorensen…a first year vaulter with a PR 12' 6" leap..Josh Jeong(MW) 12' 0" Vinnie DePaolo(MW) 12' )" Chris Endrezzi(MW) 11' 0" Kniernan McCarthy(VC) 10' 0" and Brendan McShane(Warwick Valley) 10' 0" . College News….. MEGAN" Flips" CLARK (Duke University) soared to the ACC title with her 14' 10" jump and in perhaps her most consistent indoor season ever… James Steck(Va Tech) placed 5th with a 16' 9.5" fly-over Coach Phillips. Peter Fagan(Binghamton University) hit his new PR last week with a 17' 3.5" sail…pictured here at Take-Off with Hands Up and Chest Driven!!!!! SEC CHAMPS at Arkansas… Former CornwallHS pole vault star… Ariel LaChance never gave up on her dream..leaped 13''1"personal best in her senior year. BIG EAST CHAMPS… Freshman Catherine Walker9Villanova University) placed silver at 12' 6" at Ocean Breeze on Saturday.. IVY LEAGUE…. Here is a story that will warm your hearts… Harvard University senior Lexi Schachne (Staples,CT) has battled a hamstring injury for the past 4 years..returned to place 3rd at IVY CHAMPS with her 12' 5.5"PR!!!! Grace Shadid (Columbia University) placed 7th at 11' 9.75"! MAAC CHAMPS…at the Armory… Manhattan University junior Marissa Robbins won the vault with her 12' 6.5" clear and meet record!!! Bre Brucher(Manhattan) 10' 10" and Maddessen Weekes(Manhattan) 10' 4"' Winning the Men's Vault was Rider University junior..Erik Adamcik at 15' 3" !!! SUNY AC CAHAMP..at Brockport… Whitman Oehler-Marx(Brockport) won the gold at 15' 9" Matt Greenlaw(Cortlandt) 12' 9" and Jess Wheeler)Brockport) 11' 0" Dana Rokicsak(Geneso) 10' )" LAST CHANCE @ OCEAN BREEZE… Joe Crispi(Wagner University) won at 15' 3" Chris Guglielmo(TCNJ) 14' 9" and Bre Brucher(Manhattan) 11' 1.75"!!!! BIG DATES @ CIRCUS…. Saturday March 19 LEARN HOW TO POLE VAULT DAY Boys 10AM Girls 2PM Grades 5-6-7-8-9-10! $50 per athlete. Mon & Tues July 11-12 Boys Summer Pole Vault Camp Thur & Fri July 14-15 Girls Summer Pole Vault Camp Saturday July 16 "THE CIRCUS BBQ and VAULT MEET" All Day Fun. Flying Circus… Join the Movement

posts.Title: 20 VAULTERS SHINE @ EASTERN STATES …NICK MARINO(15' 0") / MICHELLE RUBINETTI(12' 6") TAKE GOLD !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson ValleyFlying Circus  Pole Vault Project
  Warwick Valley,NY

  The  82nd EASTERN STATES CHAMPIONSHIPS  was a FLYING CIRCUS TEAM EVENT….as 20  Pole Vaulters gathered together all night in support of each other …with cheering…clapping …sharing poles… and encouraging  the  'Spirit of the Pole Vault' ….  Congratulations to all for defining TEAM POLE VAULT @ FLYING CIRCUS.   New Records…New PR's….New Dreams.
  Boys   Recap…..    Pole Vault Coach Tim Wilson set the stage all night with his brother in presenting the perfect atmosphere for Boys and Girls Pole Vaulters to excel. The electric  spirit was contagious all night long  and the spark was set for  some unbelievable performances from our Rising Stars on Fiberglass.  Coming off a sensational PA State Meet on Sunday was Gold Medal  winner Nick Marino..just a junior  with a terrific plant from Hatsboro,PA…soaring over 15' 0" to equal his school record  and  very close bars at 15' 6" for the Flying Circus/Philly Jumps shared athlete.  Paramus,NJ 's Greg Fuerte was a great surprise with his  14' 0" sail for  4th place…Mahwah,NJ senior Jack Muller was dedicated this winter at club and placed 5th at 13' 6" for Coach Pasek and team mate Dominic Roca(Mahwah)  also  hit 13' 6" for 6th place tie.  St.Anthony's.NY junior Liam Ackerman  has been consistent all winter for Coach Jim Hendersen.. hit 13' 6"..along with Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill,NY) at 13' 6"  and Warwick Valley ,NY junior  Isaac Heatley   making 13' 6"  and close at 14' 0" . Nate Llanos(Danbury,CT) made 13' 0" again..Joe Kim(Ridgefield Park,NJ) 13' 0"  and Super Soph Charles Crispi(Farrell) was big over 13' 0"  for Coach Cahill.
  Girls Recap….. 10 Circus Girls took over the runway at 7:08pm  and it was all business… with the peaking  micro cycle  in place.  Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) junior  Michelle Rubinetti had some 'Unsettled Business" to attend to and put it all together  from her 8 step and biggest grip of the season..with her 12' 6" sail-over for a  School  and County Indoor Record.  She had 2  great shots at 13' 1" meet record  held by Danielle O'Reilly(Shawnee,NJ)  and Megan Clark(O'Neill,NY).  Also   showing her readiness  was the booming height from Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) at 12' 6" on her 14 x UCS Spirits 155 poles. Watch out for her the next 2 weeks.  Placing  4th was Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY)   coming off her 6th place at NY State Gymnastics meet on Saturday on Unevean Bars…. she hit 11' 6" for Coach jim Hendersen and close at 12' 0".  Sensational vaulting  also came  from Caitlin"Rev" Reverand of Northern Valley-Demarset,NJ .. one of the states  Best  Multi-Event  athletes  and Galaxy Gymnastics legend…hit 11' 6" again   and close at 12' 0"  with  her biggest grip and pole  ever  and a National Qualifier in 2  events this year.  Placing 6th  was  another success story…as Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn,NJ)  just a junior  and a Reno Summit  athlete this year.. puched  a school record of 11'6" for Coach Wilson and crew of cutters and a National Qualifier! Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills,NY) flew 11' 0"..Max earl(Ridgewood,NJ)   was ever so close at 11' 6'…Lauren Russo(Newtown,CT) set a personal best of 11' 0"  for Coach Duffy…Nicole Lester was the TOP SOPH at Easterns at 11' 0" PR   and Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA)   completed a  super indoor season  and becomes  our clubs Most Improved Indoor  athlete for 2016!!!!
     ALL in ALL …. It was pure athletics.
   Flying Circus … More than  Pole Vault.

posts.Title: 15 FLYING CIRCUS ATHLETES @ NB NATIONALS !!!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project  Warwick Valley, New York      The BIG FIBERGLASS WEEKEND is HERE!!!! Congratulations to our 15 Flying Circus Pole Vaulters for qualifying for this coming week's New Balance NATIONAL INDOOR TRACK & FIELD CHAMPIONSHIPS at the Armory in New York City. It all heats up on Friday March 11..with the Emerging Elite competition at 9:30am for Girls and 2:30pm for Boys. The action continues on Saturday at 12 noon with Nick Marino,PA …our Eastern States Champion from Hatsboro,PA looking to set another new school record. The Sunday Girls Championship section begins at 10AM with Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) Michelle Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) and Julia Valenti(North Reading,MA) carrying our singlet higher. Best to all National Athletes…..  * 7 Athletes Medal at New York State Meet…. Cornell University's Barton Hall Athletic Fielddhouse. It was a great NY State Meet in every event,,especially int pole vault….. as 7 athletes took home medals from one of the most competitive Indoor State Meets in the USA every year. Leading the charge was Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem Central) with a silver medal at 12' 0' for Coach Gansel…Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) soared 11' 9' for Coach Jim hendersen for th place overall… Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills)..coming off an injury flew 11' 6" for 6th place for Coach Duffy .. Sophomore Kristen Lubeskie(Monroe-Woodbury) set her PR at 11' 6" for 7th place and Top Soph honors and Nationals!!! Alanana Carroll(Averill Park) made 11' 0"..Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley) sailed 11' 0" School Record…Emily Legg(Delhi) and Colleen Leahey competed with class all day.   In the Boys afternoon section… Sophomore Johannes Stromhaug of Vestel ,NY cleared 13' 6' for 5th place for Coach Jim Cerra… Charles Crispi(Farrell) made 13' 6" for Coach Jerry Cahill ….Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) 13' 0" Andy Rubenstahl(Washingville) 13' 0" Aiden Miller(Pearl River) 12' 6" and Isacc Heatley(Warwick Valley) made 12' 0" for the Purple Wave. The Indoor State Meet moves to Ocean Breeze next March.     * Mark DeLuca(Westhill,CT) wins Armory Last Chance Meet at 14' 3" !!! Qualifies for NB NATIONALS!!!! There was no give up for Coach Neal Perry's junior Marc DeLuca this weekend…as the fast and strong junior flew 14' 3" for the gold medal…followed by Dylan Scribani(New Paltz,NY) 13' 6" PR… Dagi Tadesse(New Paltz,NY) 12' 6"PR…Brian Rubenstein(Gov. Livingston,NJ) 12' 6' and Dan Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY-Soph) 12' 0" !!!   * FLYING CIRCUS VAULT BARN will be CLOSED ….Fri-Sat-Sunday March 11-12-13 for NB Nationals. / Tuesday and Thursday evenings Open Vault Instruction continues for the next 5 weeks. 5:30-8:30pm !!! **************************   * The MAJEWSKI FAMILY COMMUNITY SERVICE PROJECT……. The Majewski Family wish to THANK EVERYONE who donated funds…furniture… and love these past 3 weeks. The Flying Circus Family donated $1500 to help the family get back on their feet following the complete loss of their home to fire. You don't have to be rich…to be a PHILANTHROPIST !!! Thank you all for giving and helping.   * A SPECIAL SALUTE and THANK YOU is send out to The Bob Schechter Family of Ridgewood,New Jersey for their wonderful donation of a brand new pole vault slide box for all Flying Circus athletes…and to the Cass Family of Weston,CT for donation new gymnastic mats for more safer for all our vaulters here !!!! Lending a hand is appreciated by everyone here at Flying Circus. Thank you.   * Our SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS are filling up FAST…. We hope all our athletes can join this Summer FUN and INSTRUCTION . Applications on our web site… www.hvflyingcircus.com ####################                  FLYING CIRCUS … PASSION is EVERYTHING.

posts.Title: NB NATIONALS….. Tedi DeMaria (12' 8.75") …Alana Carroll ( 12' 4.75")…Marc DeLuca(14'3.5") "ALL-AMERICANS" in VAULT !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC     Warwick Valley, NY       New Balance Indoor Nationals…. CONGRATULATIONS to all 15 Flying Circus athletes who competed this past weekend in the Armory at The Indoor National HS Championships. The thrill and honor of competing in a National Championship in any sport will last a lifetime. Very few athletes ever get a chance to fell this level of competition and our Flying Circus pole vaulters were sensational all three days. It was not about making a record or a personal best…this day was about belonging…belonging to the highest level of Track and Field in the USA!!!! Each athlete …parent and coach will rise up to a brand new level of performance and new levels of spirit of sportsmanship this spring ….. the "Spark" has been set ! DREAM BIG!   Friday…The Emerging Elite section of future athletes was fantastic!!! Sophomore Alana Carroll (Averill Park,NY)..coached by Hugh Cauthers set a New York State Sophomore Record with her 12' 4.75" leap of faith for her gold medal and All-American crown. Using her 12' 7" grip and UCS Spirit 150 series..she flew to new school records as well. Amanda McNelisof Commack,NY..coached by Jim Hendersen at the Warehouse Vault sailed big over 11' 7" for 8th place overall…NJ State Indoor Champ Leah Saifi(Governor Livingston) also sailed 11' 7" …Junior Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn,NJ) set another school record of 11' 7" for the Cutters..Kalli Manly(Burnt Hills,NY) made 10'7" along with Soph Kristen Lubeskie(Monroe,NY) and Caitlin Reverand(NV-Demarest,NJ). In the afternoon Boys Emerging Elite section..it was all Marc DeLuca of Westhill,CT..coached by Neil Perry. This junior had a big day in placing 6th for his All American honors at 14' 3.5" PR!!! Liam Ackerman(St.Anthony,NY)..also just a junior looked strong day to end is super indoor season.   Saturday….The Boys Championship of America Pole Vault was loaded and Hatboro Horsham,PA junior Nick Marino was sensational again with his 14' 9.5" sail to conclude a deep and productive Indoor season for the humble and dedicated vault star. On to Penn Relays!!!!!   Sunday…. The Girls Championship of America Pole Vault was another deep and closely contested event. Bethlehem Central,NY senior gymnastic star..Tedi DeMaria was ready for the final Indoor Meet of the Year. Using her 13' 7 x 165 UCS Spirits to the max..she flew to an All - American 4th place finish for Coach Ashley Gansel. Coming off small setbacks at Eastern States and State Indoor..Tedi moved back to her 7 Step Approach and was ' Oh-So-Close' at 13' 1" on her third attempt. She never gave up hope this past month…as she set a new school and Section 2 All time Record and becomes #5 on All Time Flying Circus Indoor Chart!!! Perhaps the best and most inspiring happening on Sunday belonged to Flying Circus team mates and Champions…Julia Valenti(North Reading,MASS) and Michelle Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ)…both State and Eastern State Pole Vault Champions..wwho had a rough day…but stayed on the infield all day in support of their team mate..Tedi deMaria… yelling and screaming and encouraging . This is the essence of true and pure sportsmanship that athletic participation aspires too achieve. Congratulations to all for a super indoor season. Bring on outdoor!!!!   Hershey National Age-Group Championships..@ Ocean Breeze…. More great vaulting came out of Ocean Breeze on Friday and Saturday.. as Charles Crispi(Farrell,NY) sailed to his National title with his 14' 1.5" for Coach Jerry Cahill …Placing third at Nationals was Sophomore Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY ) at 12' 1.5" for Coach Potter/Coach Acaki… and soaring to her Silver second place medal in the girls division was Greenwich,CT super-soph Lia Zavattaro at 10' 0" ..coached by Stephanie Duffy!!!!   NCAA Division I…… Congratulations to our own Megan Clark(Duke University) for another sensational pole vault meet at NCAA Champions in Birmingham,Alabama.. She flew to 14' 9" for her runner Up pole vault and another All American honors.   NCAA Division II…. Congratulations to a young man who put us on the National Map 5 years ago… that's right… Senior Jordan "Jeddy" Yamoah of Texas A&M-Kingsville soared to his 4th NATIONAL PV TITLE with his 17' 9" vault for the Javelina's of Coach Ryan Dall … and close bars at 18' 1"!!!!    FLYING CIRCUS OPEN NIGHTS..WALK IN SESSIONS..Every Tuesday and Thursday 5:30-7pm or 7-8:30pm till March 29!!!    FLYING CIRCUS SUNDAY OPEN SESSIONS resume 12:30-2pm Girls and 2-3:30pm Boys… CLOSED Easter Sunday March 27/ Open Saturday March 26 12:30-3:30 Make Up Day!!!     FLYING CIRCUS…. JOIN US for the FUN - of - IT !!!!

posts.Title: YOUNG STARS ARRIVE @ CIRCUS !!!!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC    The Scenic Warwick Valley in New York    USATF Club # 06-1129       March 19 ------ The call went out…..by word of mouth and digital electric air- waves…. and a talented and motivated young group of curious young athletes arrived at the Vault Barn on Saturday morning for the 2nd 'LEARN HOW TO POLE VAULT DAY'…. presented by Flying Circus. The 26 young stars ..ranging from grades 4-10…could not be held back…as they took up the flight of faith all day long. Staff coaches…volunteer HS pole vaulters were on hand to move our event up a few more levels. The future of pole vault has begun and we all would like to thank all parents and coaches for sending us some very inspired student/athletes. Yes… It was a glance at the future!!!!! More to come ………..    ***********************    * The FLYING CIRCUS would like to THANK EVERYONE for "Lending-A-Hand" in many different ways in helping The Tony & Patricia Majweski Family in recovering from their devastating loss of their house 3 weeks ago here in Warwick,NY due to fire. The Majewski Family… a life long and inspiring supporter of Warwick Valley Schools…Community Projects and Athletics are very touched by your donations and help …. our club and community members raised over $6,700 to help them get back on their feet. Thank you for reaching deep for them.    * EASTER WEEKEND SCHEDULE…. The Flying Circus will be CLOSED ALL DAY on Sunday March 27..so that we can all spent the day with family….but we are opening on Saturday March 26…. 12:30-2PM for Girls Open Session…. and 2-3:30PM for the Boys Open Session. We hope you can join us…as we move outside to our 4 pits for instruction and acclamation to the open spaces of spring vaulting.    * Our Tuesday and Thursday evening 's Open sessions will end Tuesday March 29…as our area meets will be starting up soon after that. Private sessions will continue on Wednesday and Thursdays' by appointment with Staff Coaches only.     * SUMMER CAMPS filling up F-A-S-T !!!! if you are serious about being with us the summer… enter ASAP!!!    * CIRCUS POLE VAULT "COACH-of-the-YEAR" ***********************         We are proud to announce our 2016 INDOOR COACH of the YEAR AWARD to one special person… BEN SIMONET .          It's hard to explain the impact that Coach Ben Simonet has had on so many young athletes here at Warwick Flying Circus and especially at The Armory Flying Circus in busy New York City. Ben has modeled the perfect coach/athlete positive influence and his developing of the Pole Vault Event in New York City has been inspiring to everyone he works with. His knowledge and his patience are his strongest traits and and his humility is contagious. He was the 3-Time Belgium Pole Vault Champion..with a PR of 17' 5.5" after taking up this event late in his career. He became a gymnastic and physical education teacher and continues to inspire all of us here. CONGRATULATIONS COACH SIMONET !!!!!!!!!!!!!         FLYING CIRCUS ……………CROSS-the-BRIDGE with us.

We re-open for SUPER SUNDAY April 3 .        FLYING CIRCUS … Please…Do Not Feed the Alligators

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FEVER " …. TEDI DeMARIA SOARS in SUNSHINE STATE !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project   Warwick Valley,NY        SPRING TRACK IS BACK !!!!! The 70th Running of the FLORIDA RELAYS at the Percey Beard Track Complex at The University of Florida was spectacular on Friday for All-American Pole Vaulter..Tedi DeMaria of Bethlehem Central's Lady EaglesTrack and Field. Coach Ashley Gansel 's multi- event senior captain flew BIG over 12' 0" and the silver medal in one of the south's Greatest Relay meets. Under sunny skies and 90' heat..Tedi was big over the meet record of 12' 6" on all three attempts and showed her sportsmanship grace all day. Tedi heads to the University of Virginia next fall to be coached by Mario Wilson.     "SUPER SUNDAYS" are in motion at Flying Circus…… Using 3 outdoor Pits and 2 Indoor Pits to the max..join us every Sunday for some TEAM POLE VAULTING ENERGY!!!!
  POLE VAULT PIT for SALE… Fordham Prep is selling their Pole Vault Pit…Good condition/Good price… Contact Coach Brian Carney at carney@fordhamprep.org .
Weekend Highlights on Fiberglass…. Duke University Megan Clark…our Flying Circus All Time Record Holder..broke her Duke University Pole Vault School Record again with her 14' 9.5" win at her home invite despite windy conditions all day…. High School prom date..Jordan Yamoah(Texas A&M-Kingsville) flew 17' 1" at the Texas Relays… Sophomore Circus Aerialist…James Steck flew an outdoor PR at Texas with his 16' 7.5" for Coach Bob Phillips… West Point Academy plebe Madeline Schneider placed 3rd at The STAR MEET vs Navy at 11' 6'5" for Coaches Jon Hill and Erik Roteich for BIG POINTS in the super close Team Battle at Shea Stadium on the Hudson River….. Andy Ghizzone is gaining points in his Decathlon development.. with his 6,845 total for the Colorodo Buffalos this weekend…. and Caroline McGann(Holy Angles Academy,NJ) set another school record at 10' 0" for the talented up-and-coming sophomore.
   FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER CAMPS are Filling up FAST… Registration forms at hvflyingcircus.com JOIN THE MOVEMENT with US!!!!

posts.Title: PACers Meet - 8/13
posts.Content: On Saturday, August 13th, the Parkside Athletic Club will be hosting the USA Track & Field National One Hour Racewalk Championship. The event will also feature the USATF Wisconsin One Mile Track Championship, a Pole Vault, and an Elite 5000m race (qualifying times apply). The event will be held at South Milwaukee High School, South Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Warm-ups will begin at 4pm, and the first vault will begin at 5pm. This is a great opportunity to end the summer with the best vaults of your season! For a limited time, entry is only $5! Ever before the price increases to $20. Entry into the Pole Vault, One Mile, and Elite 5000m --  https://www.usatf.org/Products---Services/Event-Registration-Form.aspx?e=106393 Matt De Witt Parkside Athletic Club - Head Coach & Race Director ccwalker_uwp@yahoo.com
