posts.Title: FLYING @ CIRCUS …… PERFORMANCES HEAT UP !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley,NY The warm spring days are now upon us… and the athletes on fiberglass are enjoying heated up performances this past week. The past 5 weeks have been filled with drills…short run up technical vaulting…sand pit straight vault drills and foundation work with small grips.. Now it's time to raise the bar and hit your mid-marks. The best part of the year is about to begin for the 112 Flying Circus Dare-Devils on Fiberglass. It's No Regrets Time!!! Reported results are coming in by e-mail everyday and we will post up as much as we can….. and as quickly as we can.. It's important to keep up with your team mates…because the day belongs to you. Keep training HARD!!! In todays Jack Yonkers Bergen County Relays Championships…the stars came out…as Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ Girls Vault team of Erin Yuder,Caitlin Reverand and Michelle Rubinetti set a New Bergen County Relay Record of 32 Feet and tied the New Jersey State 3 Girl Record of Hunterdon Central last year !!! Coach Mike Ives had the girls ready..with Erin sailing 9' 6" Caitlin leaping 11' 0" and Michelle soaring 11' 6" at Mahwah High School's track.. Over inRidgewood in the Relayy A Division.. it was Ridgewood,NJ vault crew and Pascack Valley tying at 28' 0" as Nicole Lester 10' 6" Maxine Earl 10' 6' and Kerry Callaghan 7' 0" for the Maroons. Up at Bethlehem High School… The Lady Eagles are scoring big points this spring in all events…but it was senior Tedi DeMaria(BC) soaring 12' 0" for Coach Ashley Gansel in the pole vault to set a New Track Best on the newly installed track complex ..along with her horizontal jump duties. She is one of 8 Circus Girls invited to the 122nd PENN RELAYS next Thursday at Franklin Field,Philly!!!! Just down the street…at good old Warwick Valley High …..the warm day produced 8 Personal bests at the Valley Central vs Warwick Valley Shootout…… Junior Issac Heatley…coming off his 3rd place finish in the New York relays on saturday..Flew 13' 7" PR for the gold…Sophomore team mate Dane Sorensen hit 12' 7"PR..Breandan McShane(Warwick) PR'd at 11' 7" and Jacob Becher(Warwick) cleared 8' 7" for the Wildcats. Kniernam McCarthy(VC) flew 11' 1" for the Vikings!! In the Girls meet..8th grader Genevieve Reilly hit 8' 1" PR for gold…Freshman Kaeli Thompson(Warwick) sailed 7'7" for silver and Jenny Prial(Warwick) hit 6' 1" for the sweep. Reilly had one close jump at the All Time Warwick Middle School record of 8' 7"!!! New Jersey's Caroline McGann(Holy Angles,nJ) just a soph is putting the vault together..with another school record jump of 10' 6"…and Pascack Valley's Melissa Purcell9Soph-) soared 11' 0" PR for Coach Tim Wilson Fair Lawn,NJ Junior Jessica Ippolito sailed 11' 0" as. did Madesyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) this week and Lia Zavatarrlo(Greenwich,CT) sailed school record in her first meet of spring!!! The New York Relays at Icahn Stadium on Saturday was a special day for Lauren Russo(Newtown,CT).. with her pole vault win at 11' 0" for Coach Duffy and Coach Russell… Also hitting Gold was Reese Schachne Charles of Staples ,CT with a huge Javelin win at 128' 3"!!!!!! All the way out West..it was a wonderful day of vaulting for Duke University senior Megan Clark…as she set another Duke Outdoor record of 14' 1" for the MT SAC Invite win!!!! Megan will be at this years PENN RELAYS on Thursday April 28th at 3PM Start !!!! "SUPER VAULT SUNDAYS"….. are just that !!!!! Join us every Sunday for the fun and friendship of group vaulting..We now run our 3 outdoor pits and 2 Indoor pits and NEW SAND VAULTING PITS !!! Girls Group Vaulting at 12:30-2PM….Boys Group Open Vaulting at 2-3:30PM … Cost …STILL JUST $30 and FREE PARKING,Wi-Fi, Music and Bathrooms!!!!!! "WHO YOU GONNA CALL" ….. FLYING CIRCUS !!!!!

posts.Title: BERGEN COUNTY VAULT RELAY WINNERS & RECORD 32 FEET !!!!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley,NY More Vault Results….. Here are the New Vault Record Setters from Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ…. Pictured from left-to-right…First year vaulter Erin Yuder(Junior) 9'6"…Caitlin Reverand(Senior) 11' 0" … and Michelle Rubinetti(Junior) 11' 6"…..combining for 32 Feet Relay Bergen County All Time Record and equals the New Jersey State Relay Record!!! The Demerast Vault program…one of the best in the state every year is coached by Mike Ives and Mike Theuerkauf and also includes up and coming freshman..Sydney Woods. Caitlin and Michelle will be competing next Thursday in the 122nd PENN RELAYS and the Demarest Vault Tour continues to compete in the Brian Ahearn Classic Twilight meet at Warwick Valley on May 7 at 6:01PM !!! Congratulations to Soph Sensation…Melissa Purcell of Pascack Valley High School.NJ…setting another school record of 11' 6" yesterday at the Jack Yonkers meet. This talented sophomore is coached by Tim Wilson and has moved to her longer poles and grips. !!! A special performance was recorded this weekend in long Island…as Junior Gymnastic Champion..Amanda McNelis of Commack High School set her outdoor school record ..with 12' 4" leap for Coach Jim Hendersen. Amanda split takeoff is paying off now !!! Watch Out Massachusetts … here come Julia Valenti of North Reading,MASS…. AGAIN in the Pole Vault. !!!! This outstanding Hurdler(2nd in the Indoor State Meet this year)… has pick up her fiberglass poles for the outdoor season… and hit 11' 6" in her first meet !!! Her personal best of 12' 7.75" last spring is in trouble .. She heads to Dartmouth University next Fall. Congrats to all… More results com ins as they happen…. FLYING CIRCUS ….. You Gotta' Believe.

posts.Title: "GLORY DAYS" … FIBERGLASS VAULTING @ CIRCUS !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project , LLC The Scenic Valley in Warwick, New York Join-the-Movement. It is one of the 'Simple Truths' in life…..Everyone wants to be a Pole Vaulter . Chasing the elusive crossbars…. flying down the runway with reckless abandon ….soaring thru the air like a cannonball…. Yes…It's the 'GLORY DAYS on FIBERGLASS' that we all seek…. and every Sunday at Flying Circus is considered a "SUPER SUNDAY". Today was one of those super days… with 45+ young athletes working together on our 5 Vault Pits in the meadow under strong sunshine… Boys and Girls from Elementary Schools..Middle School and High Schools in the Tri-State area… all working their craft…all giving up part of their Sunday..to pursue their dreams of flying. The improvements have been sensational… and quite frankly…UNBELIEVABLE !!!! Thanks to all our support parents and dedicated athletes…this Pole Vault Project has taken flight in many different areas ..Performance..Character Development …. and ..Friendships. CONGRATULATIONS - to - ALL !!!!!

FIBER-NEWS / RESULTS

Jack Yockers Bergen County Relays … This 3 Day Extravaganza started on Wednesday and concluded on Saturday…with outstanding performances from many vaulters.. The Ridgewood Boys Vaulters won their title with Luc Bontoux(13'0")-Ryan Vimba (12'0") and Danny Schechter(11' 6") combining for the win…Sophomore Seth Kricheff from Old Tappan flew 13' 6" for the individual win..Jona Kim(OT) 11'0" Greg Fuerte(Paramus) 11' 0" Matt Mazzacano(OT) 10' 6". The Ridgewood Girls vault team of Maxine Earl(10' 6") Nicole Lester(10' 6") and Kerry Callaghan(7'0") won gold…as Sophomore Melissa Purcell of Pascack Valley flew a school record of 11' 6" for Coach Wilson. Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn) hit 11' 0" for silver Kaia Becker(North Highlands) 8' 6' Katherine Sandt(PV) 7' 6" Jackie Helm℗ 7' 0" and Madison Brooks(Fair Lawn) 6' 0". In Mahwah,NJ section … Big results came from Demarest and Mahwah High School vaulters…Jack Muller(Mahwah) soared 13' 6"..Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) 13' 0" Joe Kim(Ridgefield Park) 13' 6" Noah Oliff-Leiberman(NV-D) 12' 0" Jason Mizhibovsky(NV-D) 11' 0"…The NV-Demerast Girls set the Bergen County Relays record of 32 Feet..with Erin Yuder 9'6"-Caillin Reverend 11' 0" and Michelle Runinetti 11' 6" for Coach Ives.Mahwah tied their School Record Relay with Bridgett Muller 11' 0" Julia Entrup 9' 6" and Marissa Entrup 9' 0" for Coach Pasek. Sophomore Caroline McGann(HA) won at 10' 6" Sch Rec Ava Borelli(HA) hit 6'0". Ramsey's Grace Gardella won her section at 10' 0" and team mate Emma Bogaenko made 8'6" Blue Devil Classic at Westfield,NJ… Brian Rubenstein(Gov. Livingston) hit 13' 6" and Nick Deluca(GL) made 12' 6" for the 26 foot Relay win. Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston) soared 12' 1" new school record..Stephanie Tack(HC) 9' 6"0 Lauren Saifi(GL) 9' 0" and Dave Bausmith(HC) placed 3rd in the Fr-Soph) at 11' 6". Albany,NY..Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem) soared 12' 0" and close at 12' 6 bar.. Amelia Legg(Delhi) placed at the Doug Quinney Invite at 10' 0".. Greenwich,CT sophomore Lia Zavattaro soared to gold again at the New Cannan meet. In the Big Blue Invite on Staten island..Soph Charlie Crispi won at 13' 6" for Coach Cahill…and Liam Ackerman(St.Anthony) placed second at 13' 2" for Coach hendersen. Jessica Fingers Monticello Invite,NY…. The boys meet came down to the pole vault…. and Monrow-Woodbury came thru with the final 24 point sweep to win the TEAM TITLE for the Crusaders of Coach Glover/Hemmer. Vinnie DePaolo won at 13' 0" Josh Jeong hit 12' 6"PR and Chris Endrizzi 12' 3"PR with Coach Duffy assisting!!! The Mountie Madness Invite @ Suffern,NY was a twilight meet at McConnell Field..Kerry Qualter(CS) won at 8' 9' Devon Feuer(NR) 8' 9' Gabby Nebiker(MW) 8' 6" Seraya Freidman(MW) 8' 0" Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suf) 7'6" (7th grader!!) Rebecca Baez(NR) 6' 0"…The Boys were lead by Daeseob Lim(TZ) at 12' 9" Aidan Miller(PR) 12' 0" Connor Burke(PR) 11' 6" Jack Chessman(PR) 9' 0" Chris Filator(Nan) 9' 0" Tom Qualter(CS) 9' 0" the 90th Jack Roddick Shippensburg Invite,PA…. Hatsboro,PA junior Nick Marino was ready to plant the pole high..with his win at 15' 6"PR at the Pre-State Meet site. Nick competes at penn relays on Saturday morning. The Girls section saw a coming out of the woodwork by Coughlin.PA junior speedster Madesyn Hawkins..as she placed 3rd overall with a New School Record of 11' 9" and a National Qualifer!!! Greensboro here she comes!! Team mate lexi Kowalski hit 8' 9" !!! College News.. Megan Clark(Duke) blasted over 15' 2.25 " in her final home meet at the Duke Invite and sets her school and ACC All Time Record for Coach Wilbourn. High School Prom date..Jordan Yamoah blasted 17' 3.75" at the LSU Twilight meet in Baton Rouge for silver medal… and Flying Circus BBQ Meet record holder Scott Houston blasted 18' 6.5" at Duke to officially qualify for the 2016 USA Olympic Trials!!!! posts.Title: MEGAN CLARK WINS GOLD @ PENN RELAYS !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC   Warwick Valley,New York      GREAT THINGS HAPPEN in the PENN RELAYS !!!!           CONGRATULATIONS to MEGAN CLARK(Duke University) for soaring to the gold on Thursday at the 120th PENN RELAY CARNIVAL in Franklin Field. This senior Duke Ambassador of Sport put on a real show in brutal rainy/windy and cold conditions on the newly surfaced Track complex in the Championship of America Pole Vault event. Coach Shawn Wilbourn moved her in to her 6 step approach on this bizarre day and she flew to the gold watch win at 13' 9.5" and called it a day. Team mate Madison Heath placed second at 13' 5.5" for the Blue Devil sweep. Megan …having step problems in her first 3 years at Penn…never gave up her faith and drive…and after 4 dedicated years of training ... realized her moment. NEVER GIVE UP wins again!!!!!   High School Girls Pole Vault Championship……   ***********************   Sophomore ALANA CARROLL(Averill Park,NY) led a strong charge of 8 Flying Circus girls in the loaded field ( A Flying Circus Record). Despite the constant rain downpour ..all our girls competed with big heats and strong minds. Our event is difficult enough…and with wind/cold and constant rain..it was survival day on fiberglass.. Alana Carroll placed second at 11' 11.75" for the silver medal… Circus Summer camper..Emily Harrison(Battlefield,VA) came thru with third at 11' 5.75"…Michelle Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) was forth at 11' 5.75"… Leah Saifi(Governor Livingston,NJ) tied for 5th place with sophomore Kristen Lubeski(Monroe-Woodbury,NY) at 10'11.75". Kalli Manley(Burnt Hills,NY) Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) Caitlin Reverand (Northern Valley-Demerast,NJ) and Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn,NJ) all completed tough all day. On to the next challenge!!!!!!    In the College Pole Vault on Thursday morning…Catherine Walker(Villanova) cleared 11' 11.75" and Grace Weisbecker(Vermont) hit 11' 5.75". Today ..James Steck set another Outdoor PR with his 16' 11.5" at Radford University for Coach Bob Phillips!!!!     More results coming Sunday Night…Stay tune in…..      Flying Circus ……. Each person is a special athlete.

posts.Title: NEXT GENERATION ARRIVES @ CIRCUS  !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, New York Every once in awhile….. we get a chance to see a little bit of the future…. Future stars heading out to the college levels…college athletes stepping into the professional level of sport… and yes.. the ever-so promising young 'Rising Stars' of Middle School/Elementary School ages taking a shot at the "Worlds' Greatest Event"…The Pole Vault. Such was the thrill this past two weeks here at Flying Circus and the 122nd PENN RELAYS CARNIVAL in Philadelphia. How can it be…that the evolution of pole vault has reach such great heights….. It's called…"HUMAN SPIRIT"..that drives these young athletes to greater performances week after week…and meet after meet. We salute this new generation of super dedicated kids on fiberglass vaulting poles!!! Keep the Spirit Flying!!!! Week Results…Flying Circus Family Members…. The Circus Bus traveled thru Connecticut…with Marc DeLuca(WestHill,CT) taking gold at O'Grady Relays in Danbury with a 14' 0" sail for Coach Perry… Nate Llanos(Danbury) 13' 6" Henry Vossler(Darien) soared 12' 6" and Kenny Yamaguchi(Darien) flew the coop at 10' 0". In Girls..It was all Danielle Cass(Weston) taking gold at 10' 6" for Coach Meadve…Lauren Russo(Newtown) taking silver at 10' 0" Hannah Campos(Weston) 9' 6" and Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich) at 9' 0". …..as the bus moved into Massachutes State 4-D Relays..it was steam victory for North Reading Girls and Boys… and vaulter Julia Valenti was the star of the day again.. with wins in Hurdles relay( 15.0/split) Pole Vault win/10' 6"0 and Shot Put win at 36' 7"!!! She has yet to move to her real run and grip!!! Her Shuttle Hurdle team qualifies for Nationals!!! ….. the bus rolled into the Penn Relay Mayhem on Thursday-Friday-Saturday… with already reported greatness from about 15 Circus Stars on all levels… Placing 6th in the Boys Championship High School was Nick Marino(Hatboro,PA) at 14' 0" after his 15' 6" from last weeks results …Liam Ackerman(St.Anthony,NY) 13' 5.5" for Coach Hendersen!!! The college boys turned up the heat on Saturday..with Lee Bares(West Point) placing 5th at 16' 6.75" for Coach Jon Hill…Peter Fagan(Binghamton,NY) 16' .75" for Coach Mike Thompson …..Nick Perez and Travis Fountain both hit 14' 5.5" ...all on UCS Spirits!!!! …after fueling stop…the bus traveled into New Jersey for some fun times…with Trevor Hazell of Vernon,NJ taking Gold Medal at 12' 6" for the Vikings….Brian Rubenstein(Gov. Livingston,NJ) finally soared 14' 0" for the Millburn Relays win..Nick DeLuca(GL) placed 2nd at 12' 6" Mark Lynch(Cranford,NJ) PR'd at 12' 0" and Brian McCarthy hit 12' 0". The Girls also won with Leah Saili(Gov.Livingston) blitzing 11'6" meet record…Lauren Saifi(GL) 9' 6". …. following a lunch stop at Chick-Fillet…. the bus headed west into Penn-Territory again… James Coughlin,PA junior Maddie Hawkins flew big over 11' 6" again for the silver medal at the Cougars Twilight Meet and was close at 12' goal… Rising-Sophomore…Abby Norwillo of Pittston Area,PA set another New School Record of 11' 0" and District 2 up and coming Corah Frantz(Lakeland,PA) made 9' 6 by a ton!!! …the bus crossed over to the Kingston Relays and New Paltz HS vaulters dominated the boys and girls meet..with junior Dylan Scribani(NP) winning the boys at 14' 0"..Dagi Tadesse(NP) 13' 6"PR Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) 13' 6" Andrew Matta(NFA) 13' 0"…The Girls division was won by Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz) at 11' 0" school record… Sophia Alter(RV) 10' 6" Crystal nelson(ON) 7' 0" and Claudia Kaplan(NP) 6' 0"!!! In The Kingston Middle School meet on Friday…7th graders Bill Finn(Warwick,NY) hit 6'6" for Coach Warnock and 7th grader Julia Mosier(Warwick) made 5' 6' for the Wildcats!!! …. with the gas tank heading to empty…. the last stop was the Gold Rush Relays at Clarkstown South HS,NY…. with the largest Circus group performing…yes.. 25 Circus Vaulters in the same place … and… contending with the 19 Mahwah,NJ VAULT CREW ATHLTES of COACH ROB PASEK's THUNDERBIRDS!!!! It was dark when the final jump was taken..Jack Muller(Mahwah,NJ) hit 13' 6" ..as 6 athletes from Mahwak HS went 13' 0" or better!!!! That's TEAM VAULTING!!!! Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) 13' 6" and heading to West point next fall….Amir Ansari(Mahwah) 13' 6"..Justin (Mahwah) 13' 0") Aiden Miller(Pearl River) 13' 0" Dominic Rocca(Mahwah) 13' 0" Connor Burke)Pearl River) 11' 6' Tom Qualter(CS) 9' 0" Adam Stavash(Bergen Tech) 9' 0" for Coach Cevoli!! The Girls were highlighted by Sophomore Kristen Lubeskie of Monroe-Woodbury…coming off 2 medals at the Penn relays (#rd in DMR-400 leg-59.1) and PV -5thplace at 11' 5.75") she won gold at 11' 7' PR for Coach Goodwin…Marissa Entrup(Mah) 10' 0"PR..Julia Entrup(Mah) 9' 6" Kyra Muller(Mah) 9' 0" Kerry Qualter(CS) 9' 0" Sarah Levitsky(Mah) 8' 0" Hannah Soloman-Hollander(Suf) 8' 0" Ginna Scancarello(MW) 7' 6" Serya Freidman(MW) 7' 6' Joella Chase(BT) 7' 0" Grace Simpson(TZ) 6' 6" Fiona Carroll(TZ) 6' 6"!!!! FLYING CIRCUS…… IT NEVER ENDS !!!!!!

posts.Title: " VAULT SEASON BEGINS " …..CIRCUS WEEKEND HIGHLIGHTS !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project The Scenic Valley in Warwick, NY The early cold spring is now in the rear view mirror ….. Welcome to the "POLE VAULT SEASON" in VAULT-TOWN,USA !!!! The first 6 weeks of small grips and short runs are now over…and the next 6 weeks leading up to STATE and NATIONALS are ALL ABOUT POLE VAULT PERFORMANCES and PERSONAL BESTS!!!!! Everyone here at Flying Circus is ready to Fly-the-Nest. JOIN - The - LAUNCH with us !!!! PEAKING-in-POLE VAULT. ******************************* * Details of OUT of the BACK POSTURE is now critical to all vaulters. PUSH OUT TALL> * QUALITY SESSIONS now take over from QUANTITY SESSIONS. * POLE DROP RHYTHM needs specific attention and drills * GRIPS MUST GO UP … RUNS MUST GO BACK. * TOUGHNESS ATTITUDES need to be SHARP. * SPRINT DYNAMICS MUST be EXPLOSIVE. * ATHLETES must be INSPIRED by PERSEVERANCE. * ATHLETES must do fewer things..in GREATER DEPTH. * FINISHING the TAKE-OFF DYNAMIC must become a mission. * REACHING-FOR-EXCELLENCE MUST HAVE FOCUS and "SPIRIT". NEWS…RESULTS…UP-DATES: ************************ Action continues on UCS SPIRITS …. Crusdaer Relays at Monroe-Woodbury Central ,Ny was another gala gathering on Saturday..with Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) soaring 13' 6" for the silver medal for the Cortland University bound senior captain. Vinnie Delaolo(MW) placed 3rd at 12' 6" Trevor Hazell(Vernon) 12' 6" and Logan Matthers(MW) 10' 0". Josh Jenong(MW) won Fr/Soph at 12' 6"PR Tom Qualter(CS) 9' 6" Chris Filotov(Nan) 9' 6" and Adam Stavash(BT) 8' 6".. Sophomore Sprinter/Vaulter..Kristen Lubeskie(MW) set a new Meet record in Frosh/Soph at 11' 0"..Gabby Nebiker(MW) 8' 6" Gianna Scancarello(MW) 7' 6" Rebecca Baez(NR) 7' 6" Hannah Soloman-Hollander(Suf) 7' 6" Grace Smipson(TZ) 6' 0" Fiona Carroll(TZ) 6' 0" Jusmine DeGuzman(BT) 6' 0". Coach Ashley Gansel's Bethlehem Lady Lions won the team title at the Rome Invitational..as Tedi DeMaria(BC) set a new meet record of 11' 9" into a stiff headwind. Kalli Manly(BH) sailed 10' 0" and Lauren Berry(Emma Willard) made 8' 6" in rough conditions. At the Race at the Oval Invite.. Rondout Valley,NY senior Sophia Alter won gold at 11' 0" Samantha Kaplan(NP ) 10' 6"…. The Boys were led by winner Dylan Scanbani(NP) with a PR at 14' 1"…team mate Dagi Tedesse(NP) 13' 6" for silver!!! The St Anthony Invite in Smithtown,LI was cheering for hometown hero Liam Ackerman(SA) as he won again at 14' 0" for Coach Jim Hendersen. Up in Massachusetts….North Reading continues to be one of the best teams in the state..as senior Julia Valenti soared to first place at 11' 6" in the Weston Twilight meet. In today's Andy Wasnik Meet in Mahwak,NJ… Fair Lawn,NJ junior Jessica Ippolito set another School Record with her 12' 0" leap to qualify for Greensboro Nationals!!! Full results coming from this explosive meet on Tuesday. The Somers Invite was won by Jordan Schwartz(Hackley School) at 11' 6' George Zakharov(Croton Harmon) 11' 0". The Union County Relays saw Nick DeLuca(Gov.Liv) win at 12' 6" Brian Rubenstein(GL) 12' 6" and Mark Lynch(Cranford) 11' 6"…Girls Division..Leah Saifi(GL) takes honors at 11' 0' Lauren Saifi(GL) 9' 6"!!! Over in the Pittston Area.PA…. watch out for fast improving Sophomore Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) at 11' 0" School Record at mid-week!!! The 17th Brian Ahearn Classic Twilight Meet was one of the best ever..with National USA Marks in almost every event…Under-the-Lights at Warwick Valley Central's Ultra-Speedy Track and Pole Vault Runways. This meet is a tribute to one of Warwick Valley's Finest young Track and Field stars…Brian Ahearn…who lost his battle with a brain tumor 17 years ago… His courage and spirit lingers forever at our Warwick Valley Track and Field Complex. It was hot vaulting on a cold night..with music blaring all night long… Issac Heatley..the junior Warwick Valley Vault Captain won at 12' 9" followed by soph team mates Dane Sorensen(WV) at 12' 9"PR Andy Rubenstahl(Wash) 12' 3" Brendan McShane(WV) 11' 9"PR Kevin Nam(PJ) 11' 9"PR and Luca Correra(PJ) 10' 0" Jacob Beckler)WV) also had a great night. The Girls division was also exciting as Northern Valley-Demerast,NJ) put on a Vault-Show for the Vault Nuts at the 50 Yard Line Vault Pit. Eastern States Indoor Vault Champ..Michelle Rubenitti(NVD) set a new school record at 12' 3" for Coach Mike Ives and had a last jump brush off at 12' 9.5"!!! Caitlin Reverand(NVD) the Bergen County All -Round Athlete of the Year this Indoor season…took home the silver at 11' 0"…Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lane,NJ) placed 3rd at 11' 0" Erin Yuder(NVD) 10' 6"PR Sydney Woods(NVD) 10' 0"PR Genevieve Reilly(War) 8' 0" Emily Welling(War) 8' 0" Kaeli Thompson(War) 8' 0" Lindsey Julien(Wash) 8' 0"PR for Coach Duffy!!! College News.. Marissa Robbins(Manhattan) won her MAAC Championships today at Rider University at 11' 6" Breanna Brucher(Manhattan) 11' 0" Maddessen Weekes(manhattan) 10' 0".. Erik Adamcik(Rider University) won gold at 15' 0". BIG News came from the Tim Farrell Classic at St.John's University as junior Dana Placentra(NYU) set a New University All Time School Record at 11' 0" for the BIG PURPLE!!!! A MEET NOT TO MISS…… Pole Vaulters have long enjoyed the FAST and UNIQUE Pole Vault set up at Warwick Valley High School. So many GREAT POLE VAULT PERFORMANCES have taken place.. including Jenn Suhr's 15' 6"..Jordan Yamoah's 16' 8" Megan Clarks 12' 9" and many ,,, many more. We invite your High School Coaches to enter you in this year F WARWICK FAST TIMES meet on Tuesday May 31. This Twilight meet can only be entered on line by your High School Coach. Girls staring height is 10' 0" Boys starting height is 12' 0" JOIN us for this ELITE HS Pole Vault Event!!! FLYING CIRCUS …. PROGRESSIVE DRILLS.

posts.Title: LAST CALL... FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER CAMP !!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy presents ……. … our 9th Edition of SUMMER POLE VAULT MANIA CAMP ……….. in beautiful Warwick Valley,New York. Join us for this unique presentation of Pole Vault Techniques and Drills. The experienced staff of Elite Pole Vault Coaches from 6 States will be presenting and instructing on all our 6 pits!!! This 2 Day Summer Camp is limited to the first 50 Boys and First 50 Girls to Register All aspects of Championship Vaulting will be included in all Ability Grouped Sections. All Progressive Drills will be presented for each athlete to take back to their High School programs. …….Also included…will be the Original Retro Flying Circus T-Shirt…featuring Olympic Bronze Medalist…Jan "Sky-Jumpers" Johnson on the front…and the Original Dave Johnston Step/Grip Chart on the back!!! Camp booklet is included….All High School Coaches included in instruction and come FREE!!!… Athletes cost is still just $275. Join the Pole Vault Circus Movement with us this summer !!!! Boys Summer Camp…. Monday and Tuesday July 11-12 3:45-8pm each day. Girls Summer Camp…Thursday and Friday July 14-15 3:45-8pm each day. * Camp Registration Forms at hvflyingcircus.com

Our SUMMER BBQ POLE VAULT MEET is on for Saturday July 16…ALL DAY LONG!!!

5 Competitive Pits in Action… All Age Groups..Middle School…Frosh/Soph….High School Beginners ..High School Intermediate…High School Elite…Open and Masters Divisions. BBQ Free to all athletes competing… Friends and Family…BBQ- $25 each. Athlete Entry Fee … $25 each. Rain or Shine Event ( Indoor 2 Pits) Music... Dancing Contests and Juggling and Ye Old Pole Vault Stories. Girls/Women's Events start at 10:00 AM Boys/Men's Events start at 2:00PM BBQ 2-4PM Original Circus T-Shirts on Sale. FLYING CIRCUS……. POLE VAULT PARADISE.

posts.Title: MIDDLE SCHOOL POLE VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS …Saturday May 28 @ CIRCUS !!!!

posts.Title: POLE VAULT FOCUS" …. Time-To-Sail !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC     The Warwick Valley, NY     Welcome to the finest time of the Fiberglass Season!!! It's CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON NOW!!! …. and the young lions of fiberglass poles are focusing in for their final performances. Yes… we all know that keen focus is the secret to Extreme Performances in Athletics… Let's GO-FOR-IT …. TOGETHER!!!!!   The Flying Circus will be a busy place the next 6 weeks…with State Championships….National Championships…Middle School Championships ….Summer Camp Magic and our Summer BBQ Pole Vault Jamboree Meet on July 16 !!!! Enjoy the Ride with us before the summer beach surfing begins!!!!!    News & Results :      PA Up Dates…. Congratulations to Madisyn Hawkins(James Coughlin,PA) for another 12' 0" vault win at District 2 Class III at North Scranton to advance to State Finals at Shippensburg State University next Friday. The junior sprinter/vaulter is also heading to Nationals in Greensboro. Super Soph Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) sailed 11' 6" last week for a School Record and heads to state finals with Corah Krantz(Lakeland,PA) after her Class AA gold medal win at 10' 0" !!!    NJ Up Dates … The Bergen County Meet of Champions featured 22 Flying Circus airialists at Del Torre Stadium in Hackensack,NJ. Coach Rob Pasek(Mahwah) and Coach Mike Ives(Northern Valley-Demerast) vaulters found the winner's circle…as Senior Jack Muller(Mahwah) won the boys at 13' 8" on the count back over Greg Fuerte(Paramus) 13' 8' and Junior Michelle Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demerast) vaulted 11' 8" for the count back gold with Jessica Ippolito (Fair Lawn) sailing 11' 8' also. Luc Bontoux(Ridgewood) 13' 8" Amir Ansari(Mahwah) 13' 8" Joe Kim(Ridgefield Park) 13' 4" Dante D'Agostaro(Mahwah) 13' 0" Dominic Roca(Mahwah) 12' 6" JasonMezhibovsky(NV-D) 12' 0" and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood) 12' 0"…The Girls also saw Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley) hit 11' 4" Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) 11' 4"PR Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 11' 0"PR Caitlin Reverand(NV-D) 11' 0" Bridgett Muller(Mahwah) 10' 6" Jackie Helm(Paramus) 10' 6" Caroline McGann(HA) 10' 6" Marissa Entrup(Mahwah) 10' 0" and Sydney Woods(NV-D) 10' 0". Old Tappan's Soph Seth Kircheff sailed to another win at 14' 0"…and Brian Rubenstein hit 14'0" and Penn bound Peter Chen(Delbarton) opened up at 13' 6' for his first meet this spring!!!     CT Up Dates … Congratulations to Weston,CT junior Danielle Cass for a super 11' 0" PR this week for Coach Meadve…. and Ava Coleman(Mercey) for her state leading 11' 4" School Record. Also setting a new Greenwich All Time School Record was Lia Zavattaro at 10' 0" for her FCIAC Champs win on her 13' 1" UCS series!!! At the Scc West Sectionals..It was another win for the Star Linebacker Nick Petruzzelli (Notre Dame,CY) soph with his win at 12'0" on his longer sticks. Also winning the gold medal at FCIAC Championships was junior Marc Deluca(Westhill,CT ) at 13' 6" for Coach Perry . Henry Vossler(Darien) placed 3rd at 12'6' Josh Appel(Westhill) 11' 6" Henry Spangler(New canaan) 11' 0". Cornell University bound Ali Moraveck(Masuk) and Lauren Russo(Newtown) sailed 10' 6" again !!!     NY Up Dates….. In the Mid-Hudson Athletic League Championships at Staasburg,NY… Junior Dagi Tadesse(New Paltz) is over 14' 0" again for the gold..Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill) hit 13' 6" for silver and Max Wieres(NP) and Mike Gagliardi(Wallkill) both scaled 10' 6". In the Girls section..Senior Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley) his 11' 3" for the gold medal..and close friend Samantha Kaplan also enjoyed her 11' 3" for silver.Noa Raskin(NP) 8' 0" Meg Romaguera(NP) 7' 6". Out on Long Island..Liam Ackerman (St.Anthony) bounced back big with his 13' 6' win for Coach Hendersen. at the NSCHSAA Championships. In New York City at the Ivy Prep Championships… Sam Henry()Collegiate) 11' 6" Jordan Schwartz(Hackley) 11' 0" Jack Hogan(Colligiate) 10'0" and Sam Karp(Collegiate) 10' 0"!!!     At the Northern Champs Jacob Baker(RCK) was the winner at 11' 6'…Maddy Luksha(Ursuline) won at 10' 3" for Coach Cahill..Devon Feuer(NR) 9' 0" Katie Melly(Somers) 9' 0" Melisa giglio(Valhalla) 8' 6' Gabby lepe(White Plains) 6'6" . posts.Title: POLE VAULT HISTORY ...DEMAREST Smashes  State Relay Record :  LEAH SAIFI(Governor Livingston,NJ) NJ #2 All-Time 12' 8" Vault!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley,NY Yesterday's EAST COAST RELAYS at Randolph High School was all about the Pole Vault Event for both Girls and Boys!!! CONGRATULATIONS to Northern Valley-Demarest Pole Vault athletes and Coach Mike Ives for smashing the All Time NJ State 3 Girls Pole Vault Relay Record with their 33' 6" combined total win.. breaking the old record of Hunterdon Central #@ 32.0" from 2015!!! NV-D Coach Mike Ives had them focused and ready for a shot at history..with junior Michelle Rubinetti sailing 12' 0"... Senior Caitlin Reverand hitting 11' 6" and junior Erin Yuder blasting over 10' 0" and into the history books !!! They now own both the Indoor and Outdoor State Relay Records!!! The rain delayed night was not over yet..as Governor Livingston High School junior Leah Saifi cranked up a 7" personal best and school record 12' 8" for the NJ #2 All Time best!!! State Record is 13' 3" by Danielle O'Reilly of Shawnee!!! .. and that is within sight!!! Using her 12' 7" grip and 13' x 150 UCS Spirit pole… this Indigo Level 10 Gymnastic Star has found her event! Leah is coached by former Rider University Vault Champion..Anthony DeFranco..The Ninja Warrior!!!! Boys East Coast… Brian Rubenstein(Governor Livingston) placed 2nd with a big 1`4' 0" sail..Peter Chen is back on the runways at 13' 0" for Delbarton.. Nick DeLuca(GL) 13' 0" Dominic Roca(Mahwah) 12' 6" Justin Walker(Mahwah) 12' 0" Henry Lockhart(NVD) 12' 0" Noah Oliff-Lieberman(NVD) 12' 0" Josh Mirabella(GL) 11' 0" . Relay win went to Governor Livingston at 38'0" !!! Girls East Coast Full Results.. Leah Saifi 12' 8" School Record Michelle Rubinetti(NVD) 12' 0" Caitlin Reverand(NVD) 11' 6" Lauren Saifi(GL) 10' 6"PR Bridgett Muller(Mahwah) 10' 6" Erin Yuder(NVD) 10' 0" Marissa Entrup(Mahwah) 9' 6" Kyra Muller(Mahwah) 9' 6" LEAH SAIFI MOVES UP to FLYING CIRCUS # 6 ALL-TIME LIST 1- Emily Savage(Weston,CT) 13' 2.5" National Champion! 2-Stephanie Duffy(Wash'ville,NY) 13' 1.5" 3x State Champ/ National Runner Up 3-Megan Clark (O'Neill,NY) 13' 0" 4 Time State Champion! 4-Michelle Kercado(Monroe,NY) 12' 9.75" National Champion !! 5-Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehem,NY) 12' 8.75" State Champion/#4 Nationals Indoor 6-Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston,NJ) 12' 8" NJ Indoor State Champion ! Connecticut Magic…. Yesterdays Connecticut Flying Circus Girls flew the coop… as Lauren Russo hit 11'o" PR…Danielle Cass(Weston) 10' 6" and Ali Moraveck(Masuk) 10' 6" !!!! OCL Frosh Championships.. Jacob Beckler of Warwick Valley won the gold in Goshen at 9' 6" from just 6 step.. Gabby Nebike(Monroe) won the girls crown at 9' 0" Kaeli "Sparky" Thompson(Warwick flew 8' 6" and Genevieve "Sunshine" Reilly flew 8' 6" for the 8th grader after her 61.6 open 400 meter run!!! More stories to come… stay tuned !!! Flying Circus.. Now 10 Girls over 12 Feet / 10 Boys over 14 Feet !!!!!

posts.Title: MIDDLE SCHOOL FLYERS" …GENEVIEVE REILLY(Warwick,NY) 9' 1" / CONOR REILLY(Scotch Plains,NJ) 11' 6" .. HOORAY !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC   The Warwick Valley, NY    There is something special about Middle School Athletics. Watching young kids stand up… compete and show class in the heat of competition is a genuine treat for everyone involved in sport. Such was the case this morning at FLYING CIRCUS OUTDOOR PITS in the scenic Valley of Warwick, New York.   Our first edition of MIDDLE SCHOOL VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS was a huge success and it's just the start of our" SPOTLIGHT on MIDDLE SCHOOL POLE VAULTING". Our event will grow…as many more young athletes find the joy of pole vaulting . Many thanks to Coaches,Parents, Family and Athletes for a super-day in the meadow!    GIRLS MIDDLE SCHOOL CHAMPIONSHIPS    May 28, 2016         Warwick Valley Middle School,NY eight grade running and vault star..Genevieve"Sunshine" Reilly vaulter to a New Middle School Record of 9' 1"..and a personal best. The old record was held by Lillian Greibesland in 2006. "Sunshine" Reilly…coming off a sensation meet on Monday with her 61.5/ 400m and 8' 6" vault ..had 2 great attempts at 9'4" on her longer stick. She now moves to US #15 in the vault for Middle Schoolers!!! Also setting a New Greenwood Lake Middle School record was 8th grader Madeline Sorensen at 6' 7" for Coach Chris Radon. Seventh grader Ana Pallis of Glen Meadow Middle School,Vernon,NJ set her school record at 6' 1" and Warwick Valley's Julia Mosier hit 6' 1" for the 7th grader Purple Wave.   The BOYS MIDDLE SCHOOL CHAMPIONSHIPS was exciting to watch…as Conor Reilly of Terrill Middle School, Scotch Plains,NJ flew to the gold medal with a meet record 11' 6" sail. This Union Catholic Prep bound athlete used his Level 10 Gymnastic tools to near miss at 12' 1" and moves up to US# 18 in Pole Vault. Traveling from Utica,NY was Sauquoit Middle School 8th grader Slater Costantine sailed over 10' 6" with room to spare. Kevin Chait of Washingtonville Middle School,NY made 7' 6" for the bronze medal… Nick Mirecki(Washingtonville,NY) made 7'0" and Alex Philpots(Sauquoit,NY) made 6' 0" for friend of the vault crowd!!!    FLYING CIRCUS is OPEN SUNDAY May 29 at Regular Times for some final vault tune-ups before Groups,Quals,States and Nationals. JOIN US !!!              Flying Circus…. "Reach-for-the-Sky" - Woody

posts.Title: "IT'S CALLED SPIRIT"  …JESS IPPOLITO(FairLawn,NJ) 12' 3" / CHARLES CRISPI(Farrell,NY)  13' 3" @ FAST TIMES !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley,NY It's called High School "Spirit" and it's more powerful than a speeding bullet ! Such was the display all night on Tuesday at the 22nd WARWICK VALLEY FAST TIMES meet Under the Lights at Warwick Valley High. This year's edition was rocking with music..super performances and friendship spirit from the 50 + teams attending. Another new school record came from Fair Lawn,NJ junior speedster..Jessica Ippolito,,as she blasted over 12' 3" to spare and was close on all three attempts at 12' 6.5" on her 13'1" x 155 UCS Spirit. This was her 5th school record break this season for the CUTTERS!!! She heads to Greensboro Nationals on June 17. Tedi DeMaria(Bethlehen) soared 11' 9" with plenty of air and Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) coming off her 12' 0" school record last week..placed 3rd at 11' 9" for Coach Al Ward and Tim Wilson. This super-Soph also heads to Greensboro Nationals! The Boys Vault was also exciting and powerful…as Farrell,NY sophomore Charles Crispi won the jump off a won the Catholic State Title last Saturday at 14' 8" and heads to State and nationals!.He closes in on the Crispi Family record of 15' 2" by older brother Joe from 2014!!! New Paltz,NY junior Dagi Tadesse also went 13' 3"..as did NFA Andy Matta @ 13' 3". In Connecticut last night… Weston,CT junior Danielle Cass placed 2nd in ClassM States at 10' 6". Team mate Hannah Campos(Weston) placed 3rd at 10' 0" in Boys Nick Petruzzelli(Notre Dame) placed 4th at 12' 6"PR and close bars at 13' 0".and advances to next Monday's State Open in New Briton. In PA STATE MEET on Saturday… Nick Morino(Hatsboro) placed 2nd at a PR 15' 9" for the speedy junior… Super-Soph Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area) broke her school record again..with her first 12' 0" sail for 5th place..Madisyn Hawkins went huge over 11' 6" for 6th .. IN MASS STATE GROUPS… Pole Vault history was in the making in both Boys and Girls Pole Vault. In Large School Division 4…it was Julia Valenti Day..as she led the North Reading Girls to the State Team Title…with 2 first place events and a runner Up event to win the team title at 99 points. The 12' 7.5" vaulter won the pole vault…won the 100m Hurdles at 15.03 school record and placed 2nd in Shot Put at 36' 9.5"!!! This marks her 4th pole vault State Title ..as she heads to Nationals and dartmouth University next fall. In Division 2 State Champs..the day belonged to North Andover High School Erick Duffy.. Using an improved take off position and drive phase..he sailed 16' .5" for a new school and meet record. Erick will be the top seed in this summers Flying Circus Pole Vault Camp in Warwick,NY on July 11-12. Join the excitement of Circus Summer Camp with us!!! Full Results..Fast Times Vault…..Girls Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn) 12' 3" Tedi deMaria(Bethlehem) 11' 9" Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley) 11' 9" Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz) 11' 3" Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley) 10' 3" Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley) 9' 3" Boys… Charles Crispi(Farrell) 13' 3" Dagi Tadesse(New Patz) 13' 3" Andy Mata(NFA) 13' 3" Vinnie DePaolo(MW) 12' 9" Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley) 12' 3" Isaac Heatley(Warwick Valley) 12' 3" Daeseob Lim(TZ) 11' 9" Josh Jeong(MW) 11' 9" Andy Rubersteahl(Wash'ville) 11' 9" Special thanks to Meet Director Mike Potter and all Pit Volunteers for a GREAT NIGHT @ THE TRACK! FLYING CIRCUS …. Find-Your-Light.

We are aiming for more pole vault development and these meets wil help keep everyone active and connected… we will have Middle School Sections..Beginners sections… Intermediate High School pits going and Elite HS and College/Open sections…. and special MASTERS DIVISIONS!!! Yes.. something for all Alumni and Friends of the Pole Vault. posts.Title: NEW JERSEY STATE FINALS….Michelle Rubinetti(NV-D) 12' 0" Seth Kricheff(NV-OT)… Lead-the-Charge !!!
posts.Content: It was a rainy start to the New Jersey State Track & Field Championships yesterday at the super facility at Central Regional High School…but the athletes were ready to compete. Gusty winds all day prevented all vaulters their consistent runs and plants….but it was another great day of fiberglass pole vaulting. Athletes competing hard…yet..helping and encouraging each other is a glorified sight to witness. Congratulations to all athletes…coaches and parents!!!!    The Girls section was loaded with 46 aspiring young athletes battling the conditions and moving up poles and grips …Northern Valley-Demarest junior Michelle Rubinetti…Group 2 Champion sailed 12' 0" on her second jump to claim the silver medal for the Lady Nordsman of Coach Mike Ives. Moving up to her biggest pole at 12' 6" was the right move with two close big air jumps. Placing 4th overall was TOP SOPH..Melissa Purcell of Pascack Valley..with her 11' 6" first attempt clear for pole vault coach Tim Wilson. Placing 5th was junior Jessica Ippolito of Fair Lawn High School Cutters…with he 11' 6' clear… Finishing off a brilliant High School All Event Career was Caitlin "Revy" Reverand. of NV - Demarest. Fighting a knee injury all season..this Group 2 Runner-Up blasted 11' 0" for 8th place for the Galaxy Gymnastic Champion. Caitlin heads to Lehigh University next fall for pole vault. One of our most improved vaulters at Circus was caroline McGann of the Academy of the Holy Angels of Demarest,NJ. Using her big plant and extended run.. this Non Public A Champion placed 9th at 11' 0" and very close at 11' 6' Junior Jackie Helm of Paramus was solid at 10' 6" and Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) went big over 10' 6" before she heads west to Pole Vault Camp. Coach Jacob Brown captured all the photos!!!!   The Boys section was just located 20 feet away…traveling in the opposite direction. The 20-25 MPH winds hurt all performances in both sections but the vaulters never complained. TOP NJ SOPH… Seth Kricheff of Northern Valley Old Tapan used his biggest ever pole to sail a personal best of 14' 6" to place 3rd overall for Coach Jeff Clark and Coach Alex Eckmayer !!! Also placing in the medals was Junior Brian Rubenstein of Governor Livingston..with a sensational 14' 0" leap for Coach Anthony DeFranco. Greg Fuerte of Paramus..just a junior sailed 13' 6' John Otters of Hopewell Valley made 13' 0" for Coach Jackie Chester and Peter Chen blasted over 13' 0" coming offf a full injury season for Delbarton. Peter joins a great incoming freshman class of pole vaulters at UPENN next fall.    STILL WANT ANOTHER PR this season…..        …..the join us at Flying Circus every Tuesday for our Summer Meet Series June 14-21-28 at 4:30pm on our 3 runways..with the wind to your back!!! POLE VAULT MEETS LIKE NO OTHER !!!!            Cost still just $25 per athlete…. It's not over yet!!!!        FLYING CIRCUS ….The place to be.

posts.Title: CIRCUS SMILES @ NEW ENGLAND CHAMPIONSHIPS & NY STATE MEET !!!!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure    Warwick Valley, New York     The Flying Circus smiles were bigger than ever at the New England Championships in Middletown,CT and The New York State set in Syracuse,NY this past weekend.It's called the 'Fun-Thru-Hard-Work Program' and continues to grow. Pictured here are the New England Circus Girls enjoying the medal ceremony in New Briton… Junior Danielle Cass(Weston,CT)… Senior Julia Valenti(North Reading,MASS) and senior Ali Moraveck(Masuk,CT) !!! Congratulations !!!! … on to the summer meets and camps !!!!!    Middletown,CT… Williowbrook Park,CT was the scene on a rain delayed and chilly day for the 5 State New England Track & Field Championships for this years High School preps… North Reading,MASS senior hurdle/vault champion Julia Valenti breezed over 12' 3" for the gold medal and had 1 close bar at 12' 9" after a 90 minute mid competition delay.. Julia heads to Greensboro…Weston,CT junior Danielle Cass was a consistent vaulter all season..and placed 3rd at 10' 9" for Coach Duffy/Meadve…. Masuk,CT senior Ali Moraveck has come on strong this season and placed 5th at 10' 3" in the bad conditions…as she heads to Cornell University next fall to concentrate on her pole vaulting specialty….. Soph Rachel Hill(North Reading.MASS) backed up team mate Valenti..with her 10' 9" 4th place finish. In the Boys section.. North Andover,MASS. record holder Erick Duffy easily won gold at 15' 0" and heads to Greensboro for this Indoor All American vaulter with his 16' 1" personal best this outdoor season. He heads to Flying Circus camp/meet this summer !!!    Syracuse,NY…. Cicero-North High School was full of elite athletes in every event at the New York State Championships and the results were unbelievable. New York High School Track is one of the Best in the USA every year…deep results..elite performances are tradition and this year was no different. Coming thru BIG TIME in the delayed Boys Pole Vault was the up and coming sophomore Charles Crispi of Farrell Prep and coached by Elite Pole Vault Coach Jerrry Cahill. The likable and respected strongman Crispi knows how to compete…and flew 14' 9" and kept moving up poles for the gold. He heads to Greensboro and wins this years Camp Scholarship. Coach Jerry Cahill..the former NYAC pole Vault Champion will also help at Boys camp July 11-12. Charles is still chasing the Family pole vault record of big brother Joe at 15' 2"!!!! New Paltz,NY junior Dylan Scribani was sensational with his 14' 0" clear to place in D0II…Soph Johannes Stromhaug(Vestal) 13' 6" for Coach Cerra…Mat delorenzo(Wallkill) flew 13' 6"…Adian Miller(Pearl River) was sensational at 13' 6" for Coach Hawkins… Dagi Tadesse(New Paltz) made 13' 0"…Junior Isaac Heatley(Warwick) made 12' 0" for Coach Potter's strong team showing of Warwick Valley Boys & Girls all day… George Zakharov(Croton-Harmon) was strong over 12' 0'…Daeseob Lim(Tappan Zee) made 12' 0'…Junior Jordan Schwartz(Hackley Prep) moved up 3 poles for a sensational 12' 0" PR!!!!     The Girls Championship pole vault was deep with talent…as New York Sophomore of the Year..Alana Carroll(Averill Park) flew 12' 0" for Coach Cauthers for the coveted silver state medal. Alana won this years NB National Emerging Elite at 12' 4.75" and heads to Greensboro for next Saturdays Championship Pole Vault.. Coming thru with a sensational meet was Commack's Amanda McNelis..coached by Jim Henderson at The Warehouse of Long Island. Turning her ankle again 2 days before the meet could not stop this Gymnastic/Vaulter champion.. she place third overall at 12' 0"..Coming up Big also was Monroe Woodbury Super-Soph Kristin Lubeski..coached by Chris Goodwin… Kristin..using her 58'5/400m speed and her elite diving skills flew 11'3' after a 2 wek injury break for 7th place overall. Burnt Hills senior School record holder Kalli Manly placed8th at 11' 0" Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz) placed 2nd in D0II with her 11'0"… Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley) finished a strong spring season at 10' 6"… Lauren Berry(Emma Willard) hit 10'0" PR then won state medal on her 4x100 Relay… Kelli Zestanakis(Townsend Harris) 9' 0"..Amelie Legg(Delhi) finished a story book season at 9' 0"Maddfy Luksha(Ursaline) 9' 0" and junior Maurin Oconnor(Rensselar) completed a super season again !!!     SUMMER FUN AHEAD… Tomorrow's CIRCUS SUMMER MEET 4:30 Warm Up/Registration …… 5:31pm START the FUN !!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLIGHT" ….. @ …. SUMMER SERIES POLE VAULT MEET !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure The Warwick Center Meadow , NY It was all about..'Taking Flight' at our 2nd CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT SERIES at the The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development. Basking under bright blue sunny skies and light tail breezes.. the record number 28 vaulters flew the coop on three separate runways. This Twilight gathering of the fast and agile pole vault crew from Flying Circus enjoyed the blasting music sets and friendships were strengthened again. We would like to thank every parent…every grand-parent..every volunteers at the three pits in helping this meet be athlete friendly' Prizes were donated by Jerry Cahill's YOU CAN NOT FAIL Foundation. Coach Cauthers edged Coach Jimbo Henderson for BEST DRESSED Male Coach… and Stephanie Duffy won the Women's BEST DRESSED COACH for the day!!! Special thanks go out to Coach Ken Cevoli for assisting medical attention and Coach Rob Pasek for helping with pit donations. Yes..it was about impacting others in a positive way. posts.Title: CIRCUS GIRLS TAKE CENTER STAGE ….BLAST OFF !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure    "VAULT-TOWN U.S.A." ….Warwick,NY    The Girls have blasted off @ the 9th Flying Circus Summer Pole Vault Camp in Warwick,NY.. Converging at The Warwick Center Circus Vault Playground…they came from a record 9 states to learn just a little bit more about flying on fiberglass. The 56 Girls represented grades 4 thru 12 and the hot conditions could now hold their spirit back… It was all about fundamental drills and short run vaulting… We move to 5- 6 step tomorrow before the councilors vault exhibition at 7:30-8:00PM. The 22 member staff coaches were unbelievable with there positive approach style..and it's on for tomorrow.    Congratulations to our Boys Exhibition Vault on Tuesday night…as Circus Alumni and 5 time National Champion JORDAN YAMOAH soared 17 '6" for the campers and North Andover,MASS, high school junior …. Erick Duffy soared clean over 17'0" for a new PR!!! Great jumping also came from Seth Kricheff,Brian Ruberstein,Todd Uckermark,Samantha Bayer,Marisa Robbins,Brian Leggett,Pat Lynch,. More jumping Friday Night at 7:30-8pm for the ladies only exhibition !!!!    SATURDAY JULY 16… DON'T MISS THE FUN and HALF-TRUE STORIES at our BBQ Meet for all Comers… All Ages..AllAlumni…All Wanna-Beee Vaulters… Join us..    Girls/Women Meet at 10:01AM 3 Pits All Groups $25 Entry Fee at the door..(Includes Free BBQ at 1-3PM)      Boys /Men's Meet at 2:01PM 3 Pits All Groups $25 Entry Fee at the door..(Includes Free BBQ at 1-3PM)    Family Members/No Vaulters…$10 Donation for Picnic (1 Hamburger-1 Hot Dog--1 Watermelon…1 Drink)    FLYING CIRCUS Dedicates this meet in honor of one of the GREATEST POLE VAULT COACHES in New Jersey History…COACH PAUL RICHARDS..The ORIGINAL FLYING CIRCUS LEGEND.    FLYING CIRCUS…… WE GROW TOGETHER. posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure BARNYARD BBQ MEET …. July 16, 2016 It was a happening !!! The 2016 Circus Barnyard Meet was filled with UNBELIEVABLE ATHLETES…FRIENDS….SPIRIT and FUN !!! They say that a gathering of pole vaulters is a dangerous situation that sometimes needs security….. but… this gathering was about belonging and friendships. Thank you all..athletes..volunteers ..coaches and family for a super enriched day at Flying Circus !!! Onto the BEACH VAULT !!!!!

They also say that …"RECORDS are only borrowed…"

….. Here are some of the NEW RECORDS from BBQ Meet. * Record 101 Vaulters taking it up (old Record 82 Vaulters in 2015 meet) * 7 New Meet Division Records !!!!! * Record 37 Personal All Time Personal Best Performances !!!! * Record… 11 Water-Mellons Consumed….Easily!!!!! * New Boys High School Record…ERICK DUFFY(North Andover,MASS) 16' 6" (New MASS STATE RECORD for this Junior) * 3 Runways At the Same time with LAUGHTER ABOUNDING !!!!! * BEST MUSIC ..ON -the-PLANET !!!!!

posts.Title: LEAH SAIFI SOARS 12' 6" for GOLD @ SEASIDE HEIGHTS BEACH VAULT …. PLUS  35 OTHER "CIRCUS-CATS" SIZZLE !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Adventure Warwick Valley, New York SEASIDE HEIGHTS BEACH VAULT GLORY …The FLYING CIRCUS send 36 sun-tanned athletes to the New Jersey Shore for their final Pole Vault Adventure of the "Spectacular Season". Coach Hugh Cauthers and Coach Stephanie Duffy enjoyed the Fun & Sun all day at the BIGGEST BEACH VAULT MEET in the U.S.A!!!! CONGRATULATIONS to all athletes… WE ARE PROUD of YOU.
The High School Girls Championship Section had 15 Circus Girls battling to the final meet of the year and placed 4 girls in the Top 6 Finish… Leading the charge was LEAH SAIFI of Governor Livingston High School.NJ. This senior-to-be this fall blasted to 12' 6" equaling the meet all-time record and had close bars at 13 foot Barrier!!! This New Jersey Indoor State Champion is ready for her senior year. Placing third was James Coughlin High School ,PA. junior…Madisyn Hawkins with her 11' 6" sail…Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn,NJ) a junior this year also sailed 11' 6" and Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest,NJ) another senior-to-be this fall ripped over 11' 6" easily for her spirited cheering section!!! Sophomores Caroline McGann(Holy Angles,NJ) and Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) both made 10' 6" ..as did Cornell bound Ali Moraveck(Monroe,CT) 10' 6' Soph Sprint star..Kristin Lubeski(Monroe,NY) hit 10'0"..Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) looked solid after her sensational spring season Nicole Lester(Ridgewood,NJ) 10' 0" Jackie Helm(Paramus,NJ) 10' 0" Danielle Cass(Weston,Ct) 9' 6"Sophia Alter(Rondount Valley,NY) 9' 6" Grace Gardella(Ramsey,NJ) 9' 6" Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) 9' 6". The High School Boys Championship Section had 6 Flying Circus Flyers… with Junior Marc Deluca(West Hill,CT) placing 4th at 14' 0" Nick Marino(Hatsboro,PA) using short run 14' 0" Seth Kricheff(Old Tappan,NJ- Soph) 13' 6' Peter Chan(Delbarton,NJ) 13' 6" Brian Rubenstein(Gov.Livingston,NJ) 13' 6' Nate Llanos(Danbury,CT) 13' 0" ! Novice Girls Runway Section… 3 place Lauren Saifi(Governor Livingston,NJ) 10' 0" 4th place Amelie Legg(Delhi,NY) 9' 6' Kerry Qualter(New City,NY) 8' 6' … Novice Boys Runway Section… Runway Winner..Henry Vossler(Darien.CT) 12' 6" Dane Sorensen(Warwick,NY) 11' 6" Jona Kim(Old Tappan,NJ) 11' 0" Tyler Hrbek(Old Tappan,NJ) 11' 0" Brendan McShane(Warwick,NY) 11' 0" Tom Qualter(New City,NY) 9' 6' ! Open Women's Section… Marisa Robbins(Goshen,NY) 12' 0" Samantha Beyar(Monroe,NY) 11' 6" Open Men's Section … Joe Crispi(You Can Not Fail Foundation) 15' 6" Peter Fagan(Westfield,NJ) 15' 6" Ryan Wilkes(PA) 15' 0"
Eugene ,Oregon Summer Track Series… MEGAN "Flips" CLARK…now a professional represented by super-agent..Karen Lockie..soared 14' 1.5" for 5th place in her first ever pro-meet. posts.Title: "The NEXT BAR" … CIRCUS FALL TRAINING SCHEDULE !!!!! JOIN US !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Adventure Warwick, New York

JOIN-the-FUN …… The FLYING CIRCUS is BACK !!!!!

Welcome to our FALL VAULT PROGRAM @ Flying Circus. This Pre-Season 2 Month Cycle is about to take off and you are invited to begin your foundation work for the exciting Indoor Season ahead. This cycle is about DEDICATION and IMPROVING TECHNIQUE. Let's get a jump on our competition and let's get started together.

THE FALL SCHEDULE of 2016

Our season officially begins on Sunday…September 11 with two open class instruction sessions. These are walk in sessions that include proper Dynamic Warm Up Drills…Apparatus Drills….Sand Vault Drills…Short Run Vaulting and a strict emphasis on Posture Alinements. Each athlete must have a current USATF membership number for all Flying Circus activities. Girls Class is 12:30-2pm every Sunday and the Boys class is 2-3:30pm every Sunday. Our 3 outdoor pits and our 2 indoor pits will provide great runway time for all. Cost is still just $30 per athlete per class. Our Tuesday and Thursday evening classes begin September 13 thru November 3. These classes are Co-Ed for all levels of ability. There is a 5:30-7pm class and a 7-8:30pm class. These walk in classes are also still just $30 per athlete. These Walk In classes end on Thursday Nov. 3, 2016.

FALL CIRCUS PROGRESSIVE MEET SCHEDULE

Our Fall meets are progressive Ice Breakers that emphasise Technique….Sportsmanship and Friendship. Saturday..October 15…CIRCUS 5-STEP MEET… Girls @ 11AM Boys @ 2PM Entry Fee- $30 per athlete Saturday ..October 29..HALLOWEEN CIRCUS 6 STEP MEET..Girls @ 11AM Boys at 2PM Entry Fee-$30 per athlete Saturday..December 3..ANDY WASNIK CLASSIC MEET..Girls @ 11AM Boys @ 2PM Entry Fee-$30 per athlete WINTER FLYING CIRCUS CLUB SCHEDULE (November 7-February 2) Our WINTER CIRCUS CLUB BEGINS on Monday NOVEMBER 7 and is LIMITED to the first 20 Boys and the first 20 Girls to register. The Registration Forms will be e-mailed out on October 1 and also posted on our web page…www.hvflyingcircus.com on the same day. This LIMITED CLUB MEMBERSHIP sells out in 48 hours…so... Register with form and full fee immediately. Cost of this 3 Month program of two vault days per week is still just $450 per athlete. There are no make up classes in this program package. A missed class is a missed class. BEGINNING Monday ..November 7..BOYS CLASSES every Monday and Wednesday evenings 5:30pm-7pm Class and 7-8:30pm Class BEGINNING Tuesday..November 8 GIRLS CLASSES every Tuesday and Thursday evenings 5:30-7PM Class and 7-8:30PM Class

FLYING CIRCUS….. ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES/

posts.Title: "DISCOVER POLE VAULT" @ FLYING CIRCUS
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project   "Progressive Techniques"   Warwick Valley,NY    The FLYING CIRCUS has RE-BOOTED with our "DISCOVER POLE VAULT PROJECT"… PROGRESSIVE TECHNIQUES !    This is a Fall Training Cycle for setting a solid Vault Foundation for the up-coming Indoor Season just ahead. This past week… a record 135 pole vaulters started up their basic drills for improving technique and confidence in our most complex event under the direction of Hugh Cauthers, Will Nesbitt, Stephanie Duffy,Ben Simonet and Rob Pasek.     "The Flying Circus has taken off"…with new athletes…seasoned veterans and exciting new focus providing the fuel and atmosphere for success. Board the Flying Circus Plane with us… and Discover Flying this Fall !!!!    FLYING SCHEDULE …    ************************      SUPER SUNDAYS …. Every Sunday Girls Session 12:30-2PM / Boys Session 2-3:30PM $30/Athlete      EVERY TUESDAY …. CO-ED Sessions 5:30-7PM Class or 7-8:30PM Class $30/Athlete      EVERY THURSDAY … CO-ED Sessions 5:30-7PM Class or 7-8:30PM Class $30/Athlete          All athletes must be current members of USATF (On Line @ usatf.org/membership)    POLE VAULT PROGRESSIVE MEET COMING…  *********************     Who has the very best technique from just 5 Step Approach ??? Let's find out !!!! Join us in just 32 days on Saturday October 15 for some bonding friendship and small pole technical meet. Girls Sail Off the Runway at 11AM… Boys Hit-the-Deck at 2PM and remember it's ALWAYS FREE PARKING and LIVELY MUSIC !!!! Entry Fee Still Just $30… No Exit Fee!!!!!     UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT is coming…and we are going… Early Bird Sigh Up now to save…       Date---Friday & Saturday January 13-14 Reno,Nevada @ 2017 Pole Vault Summit.        Helpful Hints in Athletics        ****************************       * A person with BIG DREAMS …is more powerful than a person with all the facts.       * Know that GOOD MANNERS …MATTER.       * Keep-Your-Promises.       * Follow that 'little voice inside of you'.       * Keep yo golas "personal".       * EXTRA-ORDINARY EFFORT = EXTRA ORDINARY RESULTS.       * Stand Your Ground.       * Demonstrate Dedication.       * Skip Drills lubricate-the-joints.       * Today --- "I WILL BE MOTIVATED".                   FLYING CIRCUS…On-The-Move.
