posts.Title: CIRCUS 5-STEP MEET MAGIC …… MADISYN HAWKINS(Wilkes-Barre,PA) 12' 0" ../..MARC DeLUCA(Westhill,CT) 14'0" !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC      The Pre-Season has officially begun…and the 33 athletes attending the Circus 5 Step Meet each produced their own magic on 100 year old oak wood floor at the VAULT-BARN. Using the small approach run of just 5 lefts..the athletes demonstrated fine motor techniques without big speed. Taking the spotlight in the Girls morning session was James Coughlin High School(PA) senior sprinter/vaulter Madisyn Hawkins..soaring 12' 0" to match her long run personal best last year. Madisyn also had 2 good bars at 12' 3" on just her 12 foot UCS Spirits!!! Runner-Up Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) just a junior.used her 12' x 130 to hit 11' 0"PR School Record!!!! Top Freshman was Genevieve Reilly(Warwick,NY) at 8' 0"!!    In the afternoon Boys/Mens session… It was West Hill,(CT) senior strongman…Marc DeLuca delighting the crowd with his 14' 0" leap to edge Brian Rubenstein(Berkley Heights,NJ) also at 14' 0".. The Open Winner was Chris Rough(Stamford,CT) at 14' 0" and the Masters section was all Circus Coach .. Coach Ben Simonet(NYC) at 13' 0" . Special thanks to all parents and athletes for helping with the meet…Bob Sorensen…Beth Belcher…Denice Robbins…Dane Sorensen…Vinnie DePaolo…Jim Henderson….. Volunteers move the world again !!!!!!     Girls HS Division     ********************     1-Madisyn Hawkins(Wilkes-Barre,PA) 12' 0" =PR 2-Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) 11' 0" School Record PR 3T-Danielle Cass(Weston,CT) 10' 0" 3T-Julia Nomberg(Deer Park,NY) 10' 0" 4-Grace Gardella(Ramsey.NJ) 9' 6" 5-Cassis Groncki(Scranton,PA) 9' 0" 6-Irene Park(Pequannock,NJ) 9' 0" 7-Kaia becker(Haskall,NJ) 9' 0" 8-Genevieve Reilly(Warwick,NY) 8' 0" 9-Sydney Tomaine(Hyde Park,NY) 7' 6"    Boys HS Division    ********************    1-Marc DeLuca(West Hill,CT) 14' 0" 2-Brian Rubenstein(Berkley Heights,NJ) 14' 0" 3-Henry Vossler(Darien,CT) 13' 6" 4-Milan Spisck(Easton,CT) 13' 0" 5-Jason Mezhigorsky(Demarest,NJ) 12' 0" 6- Joe Antaya(Orange,CT) 12' 0" 7-Brendan McShane(Warwick,NY) 12' 0" 8-Tyler Hrbek(Old Tappan,NJ) 12' 0" 9-Trevor Hazell(Vernon,NJ) 12' 0" 10-Vinnie DePaolo)Monroe,NY) 12' 0" 11-Dane Sorensen(Warwick,NY) 11' 6" 12-Jacob Belcher(Warwick,NY) 9' 6"    Open Men/Masters    **********************    1-Chris Rough(Stanford,CT) 14' 0" 2-Matt Greenlaw(Warwick,NY) 14'0" 3- Ben Simonet(NYC) 13' 0" Masters Winer 4-Matt DeLorenzo(Wallkill,NY) 12' 6"     CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!!!!!   *********************     NEXT CIRCUS MEET… Saturday October 29, 2016 FULL RUN LENGTH MEET     Girls Meet 11AM Boys Meet 2PM JOIN-the-VAULT CREW.

posts.Title: "THE BARN" MEET …FULL RUN APPROACH …Saturday…October 29 !!!  JOIN-the-SHOW !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley,NY

PRE-SEASON IS THE REASON !!!!

The Flying Circus ' Acrobats on Fiberglass' have enjoyed their finest Pre-Season ever ….. and they are ready to roll out their Long Run Approach on Saturday October 29 at THE VAULT BARN. EVERYONE IS INVITED to join the early season competitive fun and friendship. Wanna Be ready for that first meet at the Armory or West Point…. then join us for the final pre-season meet. The Girls Kick off their Warm up at 10AM followed by san 11AM Meet Start Time… and the Boys Zoom in for their 1PM Warm Up and their 2PM Meet Start Time. Entry Fee is still only $30 per athlete!!!!! Music…Parking… Seating ...Bathrooms…Heat .. and Comedy all included in Entry Fee!!!!!!

SPECIAL NOTE

The FLYING CIRCUS pre season has always been a main part of all our athletes Indoor Success…..it's the main reason for our DEEP ALL- TIME LISTS of UNBELIEVABLE PERFORMANCES. This year's groups of dedicated young athletes are our most focused ever….they will all be pushing up the ALL-TIME PERFORMANCE BOARD in the coming months…CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU to all vaulters!!! We have just two more weeks of Open Tuesday and Open Thursday Classes…and then we will be concentrating on our Winter Club Athletes…all 65 athletes…from 5 different states beginning Monday November 7. All athletes who are not in the Winter Club Package , will be able to get instruction every Sunday here at Flying Circus… Girls Open at 12:30-2PM and Boys Open at 2-3:30PM. IT's going to be a SUPER WINTER TRACK SEASON this year for all vaulters !!! "THE BARN" MEET..FULL RUN APPROACH … Saturday October 29 @ The Barn ..Girls Warm Up 10AM Boys Warm Up 1PM Entry $30/vaulter

"THE ANDY WASNIK CLASSIC" MEET

Saturday December 3 @ The Barn… Girls Warm Up 10AM….. Boys warm Up 2PM Entry $30/vaulter

Coaching Position

The ARMORY is seeking an experienced Pole Vault Coach for this Winter. Job description is for Every Tuesday and Thursday Training sessions for High School Vaulters whose teams are part of the Team Training Winter Package at the Armory in New York City. Time commitment is 3PM-6:30PM and involves teaching safety in the Pole Vault Area and basic Pole Vault Teaching Progressions for Beginner and Intermediate athletes. Compensation provided. Interested coaches should contact Coach St. ASAP at coachst@gmail.com.

CIRCUS HISTORY LESSON

The Flying Circus Staff has enjoyed helping some SENSATIONAL ATHLETES the Past 30+ years…. With 3 Girls over 13'+ and 46 other girls over the magic 12 foot bar … 1 Boy over 17'1" … 10 other boys over 16 feet and 26 more over the 15 foot barrier !!! The ALL TIME ALUMNI TOP PERFORMERS are Jordan Yamoah at 17' 8.5" for the Men and Megan "Flips" Clark at 15' 2.5" this year. WHO WILL JOIN THE ALL TIME LIST PERFORMERS THIS YEAR ????? See you all soon….. Flying Circus Staff

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLYERS"….NATHAN CRANE 14' 7" … LEAH SAIFI ..12' 1" Lead-the-Pre-Season Fun !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project    Warwick Valley Conference Center for Pole Vault    USATF Club # 06-1129      The Flying Circus Pre Season Meet was a great gathering of 37 serious pole vaulters of all ages…from 5 different states… pressing up their fiberglass poles at The Vault Barn on Saturday morning and afternoon together. The "spirit" and friendly atmosphere of athletes helping athletes…parents helping with registration/scoring …vaulters helping with standards and bar replacements…all coaches helping all athletes … and all parents cheering every athlete was truly an inspiring sight . It was as pure as athletics can be. Thank you all for sharing your "Spirit of Sport" with us on Saturday!! On to the next challenge!!!!   The Girls Competition was exciting… as Leah Saifi of Mountainside,NJ flew to gold with her 12' 1" first attempt sail-over for the Governor Livingston,NJ senior vaulter in the Main Red Pit competition. Taking the gold in the Intermediate Green Pit was Monroe-Woodbury.NY sophomore Gabriele Nebiker at 9' 7" !!!!   Girls Full Results -- Red Pit- 1-Leah Saifi,Mountainside,NJ 12' 1" 2-Jessica Ippolito,Fair Lawn,NJ 11' 7" 3-Madisyn Hawkins,Wilkes-Barre,PA 11' 7" 4-Danielle Cass,Weston,CT 11' 1" 5-Lia Zavattaro(Stanford,CT 10' 7" 6-Julia Nomberg,Deer Park,NY.. 10' 1" 7-Lauren Saifi,Mountainside,NJ 10' 1" 8-Amy-Erin Zadroga,Tolland,CT 10' 1" 9-Maddy Luksha,Irvington,NY 9' 7" 10-Caroline McGann,Old Tappan,NJ 9' 7" 11-Cassie Grancki,Scranton,PA 9' 7" 12-Grace Gardella,Ramsey,NJ 9' 7" 13-Kaeli Thompson,Warwick,NY 9' 1" 14-Jamie Maggio,Rocky Point,NY 9' 1"    Green Pit- 1-Gabby Nebiker,Monroe,NY 9'7" 2-Arianna Cavalli,Old Tappan,NJ 9' 1" 3-Kaia Becker,Haskell,NJ 9' 1" 4-Irene Park,Pequaneek,NJ 8' 7" 5-Sydney Tomaine,Hyde Park,NY 8' 1" 6-Genevieve Reilly,Warwick,NY 8' 1"     The Boys Afternoon Meet was also full of grace… as Nathan Crane of Pike,NY finally arrived at the Barn…This talented senior coached by Mike Auble at PVP was ready to fly with bios 14' 10" grip…as he won gold at 14' 7" and near missed all 3 bars at 15' 1"!!! He will be a force at the NY State Indoor Meet this year @ Ocean Breeze on March 4!!! Old Tappan,NJ junior Seth Kircheff was solid at 14' 1 and Marc DeLuca,West Hill,CT sailed over 14' 1" for Coach Perry. Taking bragging rights in the Open Division was Chris Rough,West Hill,CT at 14' 7" and Barn Favorite ..John "Doc" Andresen flew 9' 7" easily and had close shots at 10' 7" World Record for 75 Age Group!!!    Boys/Men's Full Results --- HS Division 1-Nathan Crane,Pike,NY 14' 7" 2-Seth Kircheff,Old Tappan,NJ 14' 1" 3-Marc DeLuca,West Hill,CT 14' 1" 4- Brian Rubenstein,Berkley Heights,NJ 14' 1" 5-Issac Heatley,Warwick,NY 13' 7"PR 6-Charles Crispi,Staten Island,NY 13' 7" 7-Dane Sorensen,Warwick,NY 13' 1"PR 8-Jason Mezhiborski,Demarest,Nj 12' 7"PR 9-Tyler Hrbek,Old Tappan,NJ 12' 7"PR 10-Joe Antaya,Orange,CT 12' 1"PR 11-Trevor Hazell,Vernon,NJ 12' 1" 12-Conor Reilly,Scotch Plains,NJ 11' 7"(Top Frosh) 13-Louis Logsdaail,Stanford,CT 11' 7" 14-Justin Manne,Mahwah,NJ 10' 7" 15- Jacob Becher,Warwick,NY 10' 1" 16-Tom Giuzio,Staten Island,NY 10' 1" 17-Teddy Grancki,Scranton,PA 8' 7"    Open Men…. 10Chris Rough,WestHill,CT 14' 7"    Masters- John "Doc" Andresen,Aquabogie,NY 9' 7" (75+ Age Group!!!)    NEXT BARN MEET…Saturday December 3, 2016 The ANDY WASNIK HOLIDAY CLASSIC !!!!      FLYING CIRCUS…. COME FLY WITH US.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS … "FIRES-UP" …JOIN-the-ENERGY !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club,LLC   "VAULT-TOWN"…Warwick, New York     "The POLE VAULT FIRE has been LIT"…by the 66 Up-and-Coming Winter Club Flying Circus athletes and 40 additional Pole Vault Rising Stars' attending our "SUPER SUNDAYS" Open Sessions every weekend. The energy…enthusiasm and positive focus on these technical training sessions has been AWE-INSPIRING every session and the technique improvements have been huge already. We here at Flying Circus believe in the "POWER of POSITIVITY" … as each athlete inspires other team members to reach for HIGH STANDARDS of ATHLETIC PARTICIPATION. We believe …that there are NO SHORT CUTS to the TOP PERFORMANCES in POLE VAULTING. MAKE TRAINING -A-PRIORITY EVERYDAY!!!!!       WE BELIEVE each athlete must build and grind out the work... in the Weight Room… in the Sprint Workouts…in the Drills Progressions and in 3 Days a Week vaulting sessions. Put in the work and then… GREAT THINGS CAN HAPPEN. MOTIVATION…is the Name of the Game!!!!!! TRAIN INSANE…or…REMAIN-the-SAME !!!!!   *SPECIAL THANKS DEPARTMENT ….We would like to salute the many volunteer teachers…coaches and parents that help make FLYING CIRCUS a unique experience for your child. Volunteer Coaches …Stephanie Duffy.. Will Nesbitt…Rob Pasek…Ben Simonet…Ken Cevoli…Jim Glover….Michelle Kercado ... Volunteer Parents..Bob Sorensen..Beth Becher…Eddie Duffy…Marcus Zavattaro…Dave Kircheff… and our entire supporting parent staff each night assisting in every which way possible. Our club and athletes appreciate every volunteer who has created this 'Positive Atmosphere' here @ Flying Circus.    * MORE DONATIONS …. There were three GREAT DONATIONS this month in regard to equipment and supplies…Coach Will Nesbitt has donated 3 New UCS Main Pit Covers for our 1800 Series Pit..making our main pit more safe for all athletes…Coach Ken Cevoli continues to donate Medical supplies for our depleted Medical Kits …Bob Sorensen(Warwick,NY) has donated New Standards/Uprights for our Indoor Green Pit !!!    * ALUMNI -COLLEGE ATHLETES RETURN…… We have blocked out" BLACK FRIDAY"... November 25 for a GET TOGETHER VAULT TRAINING SESSION during the Thanksgiving break for all college/Open athletes. This 2 hour session is scheduled for 3:30-5:30PM. Bring your SPIKES and STORIES!!!!! WELCOME HOME!!!   * JUST 14 Days to the ...."ANDY WASNIK POLE VAULT MEET" at The FLYING CIRCUS…. Yes… Saturday December 3, 2017…. The Girls Meet starts at 11AM… with Green Pit Competition Bar starting at 5' 0" and the Red Pit Competition Bar starts at 9' 6" !!! Spikes up for all the fun..Entry Fee-$30 per athlete at the door. SUPER FAST RUNWAY!!!!! Warm Up begins at 10AM. The Boys Meet Starts at 2PM…with the Green Pit Competition Bar starting at 7' 0" and the Red Pit Competition Bar starting at 10' 6" !!! Entry Fee - $30 per athlete at the door… All Divisions/Open /Masters ... 1/4" Spikes for Clawing!!!   * "CHASING DREAMS" …….       - RUN TALL = TAKE-OFF TALL       - RUN POSTURE WINS in POLE VAULT       - FIRM BODY @ TAKE-OFF = FAST SWING       - ACCELERATION IS POWERFUL…NOT QUICK.       - FOOT STRIKE with COCKED ANKLE= STABILITY        - SOFT HANDS =RELAXED SHOULDERS and EASY PLANT.     FLYING CIRCUS ….SHARING POSITIVE ENERGY.

posts.Title: "TIME-TO-SOAR" …FLYIN' - CIRCUS MEET… Saturday , December 3…JOIN-the-FUN !!!
posts.Content:
The Indoor Pole Vault season is officially here….. and the warm and friendly athletics atmosphere at Flying Circus Pole Vault Club cordinally invites you and your pole vault buddies to join the 'Soaring Humans' at this years edition of the COACH ANDY WASNIK Pole Vault Meet on Saturday, December 3, 2016 for an early season opener on fiberglass. Our meet is named after one Great Coach of the Pole Vault…Andy Wasnik of Park Ridge High School Track & Field,New Jersey. Coach Wasnik was one of the most caring and beloved Track and Field Coaches ever in New Jersey High School Athletics….. and always found the time to encourage and inspire each one of his athletes. His "spirit of positivity" still rings the rafters at our old pole vault barn. Join us to celebrate his legacy.

COACH ANDY WASNIK POLE VAULT MEET

When: Saturday… December 3, 2016 Girls Warm Up at 10AM Boys Warm Up at 1:30PM Where: The Flying Circus Pole Vault Barn 3 Warwick Center Road & Hoyt Road Warwick, New York 10990 Time: The Girls Meet will be staged on 2 Indoor Runways and Pits at 11AM… (Warm Up begins at 10:00AM) Green Pit Competition Bar starts at 5 feet…. Red Pit Competition Bar starts at 9' 6". The Boys Meet will be staged on 2 Indoor Runways and Pits ay 2PM..(Warm Up begins at 1:15PM) Green Pit Competition begins at 7 feet….Red Pit Competition Bar starts at 10' 6". Registration: At the door only. Each athlete must be a current member of USATF. Entry Fee: $30 per athlete. We hope you can join us this Saturday @ Circus!

posts.Title: "FLYING HUMANS" @ CIRCUS BARN MEET….THE VAULT SEASON BEGINS !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying circus Pole Vault Academy, LL:C The Warwick Center NY The magic and wonder of the Indoor Track & Field season for pole vault athletes is now in session! The Flying Circus athletes, coming off their best Fall Prep season ever..flexed their muscles and fiberglass poles to the max on Saturday at the 5th COACH ANDY WASNIK MEET. The meet featured a mix of beginning vaulters and fully experienced high school champions on two separate runways. The results from both pits were sensational in the Girls morning competition and the Boys afternoon meet. It's time to …'Start-the-Bus" !!!!! We would like to thank the many wonderful parents who volunteered to work the meet and all the parents who entered their children in our last winter home meet. Pure athletic experiences do not just happen…they are build on the support of parent's shoulders….. Thank you all for moving our kids forward in every way. Let-the-Fiber-Games Begin!!!! "GIRLS FLY BIG"…… Leading the way in the girls pits were Leah Saifi of Mountainside,NJ with her 12' 7" Indoor PR for this Northeastern University recruit next fall. Taking the silver runner-up honors ..was senior Michelle Rubinetti of Demarest,NJ with a 12' 1" sail -over for this UPENN bound athlete next fall. Both girls had 1 solid attempt at 13' 1"!!! The Green Pit competition was full of 'Rising Stars of the Vault..as Sophomore Irene Parks of Pequannock,NJ hit 9'1"PR ..along with Kaia Becker of Haskell,NJ at 9' 1". Freshman honors went to Genevieve Reilly of Warwick,NY at 8' 7" and Chloe Pasek of West Milford won the Middle School division at 7' 7"!!! "BOYS BRING -the-HEAT" ….. Leading a three way jump-offf ..was Harsham,PA senior Nick Marino of Philly Jumps…. after breaking his first pole ever..Nick sailed over 15' 1" for the gold…edging out another senior vault champion..Marc Deluca of Westhill,CT..also leaping 15' 1" PR . Defending Series Champ..Nathan Crane (Pike,NY) was solid again with his 14' 7" bar. Warwick Valley,NY sophomore ..Jacob Becher won the Green Pit competition at 10' 1" for Coach Duffy. Washington,NY Nick Mirecki won Freshman honors at 7' 7". The " Grand Vault Master"…John Andresen of Aque Bogue.NY won the Masters at 9' 1" for the 75 years young champion Coached by Jim Henderson.

Full Results:

Girls Results… Red Pit - 1-Leah Saifi,Mountainside,NJ 12' 7" 2-Michelle Rubinetti,Demarest,NJ 12' 1" 3-Madisyn Hawkins,Wilkes-Barre,PA 11' 7" 4-Francesea Porumbo,Basking Ridge,NJ 11' 7"PR 5-Jessica Ippolito,Fair Lawn,NJ 11' 7" 6-Caroline McGann,Old Tappan,NJ 11' 1" PR 7-Danielle Cass,Weston,CT 11' 1"PR 8-Grace Gardello,Ramsey,NJ 10' 1" 9-Julia Nomberg,Deer park,NY 10' 1" 10-Sydney Woods,Demarest,NJ 9' 7" 11- Erin Yuder,Demarest,Nj 9' 1" 12-Lauren Saifi,Mountainside,NJ 9' 1" Green Pit - 1-Irene Parks,Pequannock,NJ 9' 1"PR 2-Kaia beckerHaskell,NJ 9' 1" 3-Genevieve Reilly,Warwick,NY 8' 7" 4-Annabelle Springer,Mahwah,NJ 8' 7" 5-Katherine Sandt,Hillsdale,NJ 8' 1" 6-Daniela Raymond,Washingtonville,NY 7' 7" 7-Chloe Pasek,West Milford,NJ 7' 7' 8-Madeline Sorensen,Warwick,NY 7' 1" 9-Sydney Tomaine,Hyde Park,NY 7' 1" 10-Shay Ross,Wallkill,NY 5' 7" Boys Results… Red Pit - 1-Nick Marino,Harsham,PA 15' 1" 2-Marc Deluca,West Hill,CT 15' 1" 3-Nathan Crane,Pike,NY 14' 7' 4-Brian Rubenstein,Berkley Heights,NJ 13' 7" 5-Jason Mezhibousky,Demarest,NJ 13' 7"PR 6-Milan Spisek,Easton,CT 13' 7' 7- Seth Krischeff,Old Tappan,NJ 13' 1" 8-Trevor Hazell,Vernon,NJ 13' 1" 9-Dane Sorensen,Warwick,NY 12' 7" 10-Brian Nagako,Mahwah,NJ 12' 1"PR 11-Vinnie Depaolo,Monroe,NY 12' 1" 12-Devin Kusmider,East Brunswick,NJ 12' 1" 13-Kevin Nam,Sparta,NJ 12'1"PR 14-Dylan Scanbani,New Paltz,NY 12' 1" 15-Tyler Hrbek,Old Tappan,NJ 12' 1" 16-Ezra Finn,High Falls,NJ 11' 7" 17-Brendan McShane,Warwick,NY 11' 1" 18-Andrew Freendman,Mahwah,NJ 11' 1" 19-Justin Manne,Mahwah,NJ 10' 7" 1- Masters Division- John Andresen,Aqua Bogue,NY 9' 1" (75 Age Group) Green Pit- 1- Jacob Becher,Warwick,NY 10' 1" 2-Nick Mirecki,Wash'ville,NY 7'7" 3- Kevin Chait,Wash'ville,NY 7' 1"

NEWS & NOTES...

* The Indoor HS Meets are now ready to take-off… and Flying Circus will be on the meet tour for the next 3 months and we will be now closed every Friday and Saturday. * Our "Super Sunday" Instructional classes are still available for Girls at 12:30-2PM and Boys class at 2-3:30PM . Our 11AM Girls Advanced Class on Sundays is cancelled due to all the Saturday Meet activity. * Holiday Schedule….. BARN CLOSED December 24-25-26. Classes resume Tuesday December 27. College Vault Day Practice will be Friday December 30 at 2-4PM. Join us! FLYING CIRCUS …..More than Pole Vault.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS VAULTERS SIZZLE"….MADISYN HAWKINS.. 12' 0"…MARC DELUCA..14' 0".. DAGI TADESSE.. 14' 0' !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC Warwick Valley, New York CONGRATULATIONS to "ALL 48 CIRCUS VAULTERS"... who started up the Indoor season this past weekend in the Tri-State area on a successful note. There were many great stories and improvements from our beginning vaulters to our elite Boys and Girls group. This is just the starting launch to the great season ahead. Keep showing "Competitive Spirit" and "Sportsmanship" in every situation. These are the real traits of a Championship Athlete. Leading the way in this week's GIRLS VAULT.. was Madisyn Hawkins(James Coughlin.PA) a senior sprinter/vaulter heading to Lehigh University next fall..with a new Meet Record & School Record 12' 0" on Friday Night at the Armory meet. Joining the spotlight was Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest,NJ) for silver at 11' 6" and Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) taking the bronze at 10' 6" . Senior Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) won the Bishop Loughlin Games at Ocean Breeze with her 11' 6"…Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn,NJ) won the gold today at Armory Youth meet at 11' 6" and Lia Zavattaro(Greenwick,CT) soared 10' 6" in the win at the Large School AT&T Invitational at Armory on Saturday morning..equalling Michelle Rubinetti's meet record from last year. Ih the BOYS VAULT…WestHill,CT senior…Marc DeLuca used his power and speed to win Loughlin Games at 14' 0" and close bars at 14' 6"..Circus Travelmate..Milan Spisek(Joel Barlow,CT) won silver at 13' 6"…Warwick Valley,NY senior Isaac Heatley won the gold at Friday Night at the Vault meet with a 13' 6" Big Sail and Jason Mezhibovsky(NV-Demarest,NY) flew 13' 6" for silver… Watch -Out for New Paltz,NY senior Dagi Tadesse this indoor…as he flew the rafters at West Point Field-house on Friday night..with his new Indoor School Record 14' 0"PR!!!! Deeper-Results….. Girls…Friday @ Armory….1-Madisyn Hawkins 12' 0" 2-Michelle Rubinetti 11' 6" Melissa Purcell 10' 6" Kristen Lubeskie 10' 6" Gabby Nebiker 9' 6" Kaeli Thompson 9' 6" Genevieve Reilly 9' 6" Erin Yuder 9' 6" Sydney Woods 9' 0" Julianna Schroer 8' 6" Allison Sumereau 8' 0" Katherine Sandt 8' 0" Asha Grossberndt 7' 0" AT&T Armory Meet…1-Lia Zavattaro 10' 6" 3- Kaia Becker 9' 0" Small School Division - 1-Haley Merchant 8'3" Armory Youth Classic… 1-Jessica Ippolito 11' 6" 3-Stephanie tack 9' 6' Loughlin Games@Ocean Breeze.. 1-Amanda McNelis 11' 6" Lauren Berry 8' 6" Boys @ Friday Armory… 1-Isaac Heatley 13' 6" 2-Jason Mezhibovsky 13' 6' 3-Dane Sorensen 12' 6" Vinnie Depaolo 12' 6" Brendan McShane 12' 0" Josh Jeong 11' 0" Sam Pitkowsky 11' 0" Chris Endrizzi 11' 0" Boys @ West Point… 1-Dagi Tadesse 14' 0" more results coming… Loughlin Games @ Ocean Breeze…1-Marc DeLuca 14' 0" 2- Milan Spisek 13' 6' AT&T Armory Meet… 2-Kevin Nam 12' 0" Conor Reilly 10' 0" Most of these results are the direct result of athletes mastering the small drills of pole vault. The mechanics of the pole vault positions must be felt in the small drills program…. then they will show up in your full vaulting with bigger grips!

HOLIDAY VAULT SCHEDULE @ FLYING CIRCUS

The great holiday season is about spending time with your family and friends. We will be closed the next two Sundays(December 25 and January 1) for our Open Vaulters. We have scheduled Friday December 30 at 2pm-4pm for our college vaulters to get together for practice.. We are closed on Monday December 19 and Monday December 26 for Winter Club athletes in order to help almost 40+ Circus vaulters at the Armory meets. Boys Winter Club athletes make up day will be Wednesday February 8th. Regular Class times.

HOLIDAY CIRCUS CLUB T-SHIRTS are in !!!!!!

Perfect Holiday Gift for you and/or your sweetheart!!! It's the original…DEEP PURPLE BODY /NEON YELLOW PRINTING!!!! Sold at Club this week..STILL JUST $16 each(while they last) !!!

CIRCUS REMINDERS

* Be alert and ready for you Warm Up activities. This 20 minutes is critical for success. * Show kindness and thanks at every meet to your event official after you have finished competing. tall. * Respect - your - opponents. Demonstrate radical humility in every situation. * Dress Up for every competition. Present yourself…many people are watching you. * Bring your 'competitive toughness' to the meet. This is not a field trip setting! * Don't fall to pieces after a rough night of vaulting. Stand up tall and stand your ground. * Enjoy the privilege of taking part in interscholastic athletics. HAPPY HOLIDAYS from your FLYING CIRCUS STAFF.

posts.Title: 'CIRCUS SWEEP @ ARMORY" … MICHELLE RUBINETTI (12' 0")… SETH KIRCHEFF (14' 3.5")  !!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLYERS @ ARMORY"…. MILAN SPISEK( CT)..14' 7.5"… JESSICA IPPOLITO(NJ) 11' 9" !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure,LLC   New Balance Armory Track Center,NY    The New Balance Track & Field Center on 168th Street was filled with eager young athletes in every event on Monday with the North Shore Invitational 50 team meeting. The holiday celebrations turned into fierce and spirited competition, especially in the pole vault area near Section's 444-448. The balcony spectators enjoyed great awe…as Joel Barlow High School, CT… senior.. MILAN SPISEK put on a show with his 14' 7.5" school record gold medal win and now qualifies for this years NB Nationals in March. Using his 14' 6" grip ..this humble strongman had 2 good bars at 15' 0". Warwick Valley,NY senior Isaac Heatley also used his 14' UCS series for the first time this year..took home the silver at 13' 0"…Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley) junior also moved up in poles placed 4th at 12' 6"…Brendan McShane hit 12' 0" for 6th place for Coachj Potter's Purple Wave! Henry Spangler(New Canaan,CT) 11' 6" Matt Warren(Wash'ville,NY) 10' 0"    In the morning edition of early sunrise vaulting….JESSICA IPPOLITO(FariLawn,NJ) was sensational with her big fly-over win at 11' 9" New School Indoor Record for the Millrose Games bound athlete. This also qualifies Jess for NB Nationals this March. Placing silver was fast improving Julia Nomberg(HHH-West,NY) at 10' 0" and Top Freshman was again Genevieve Reilly(Warwick Valley,NY) at 9' 0" and solid bars at 9' 6" for the Lady Wildcats!!!   …Just down the turnpike…two great performances were turned in at the Robert Burnett Holiday Classic at Lehigh University Fieldhouse. MADISYN HAWKINS(Coughlin hs,PA) flew 12' 0" from her 8 step and then was ever so close at 12' 6" with her new poles in hand. This speedster tied her indoor school record and heads for Lehigh University Track and Field team next fall. Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) is now on the pole vault elite scene this indoor.. This championship diver and vaulter… set a new School record in her first indoor meet with a solid 11' 6" clear and near missed for this junior flyer. Abby placed 5th here and in last years PA State Meet. She needs just 3 more inches for Nationals… CONGRATULATIIONS to all CIRCUS VAULTERS!!!!   Circus News…     Our regular Winter Pole Vault classes resume today (December 27)..Tomorrow (December 28) and Thursday (December 29) at regular times. Our college Alumni Vaulters are scheduled for Friday(December 30) from 2-4PM… Flying Circus will be CLOSED Saturday(December 31 and Sunday January 1 for the holidays.     FLYING CIRCUS …. HAPPY HOLIDAYS !!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS SIZZLES"…..Marc DeLuca(West Hill,CT  14' 6" …Leah Saifi(Gov. Livingston,NJ)  12' 3" !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC Vault-town,USA It's a holiday rebound !!!!!! The Flying Circus athletes continued there after-the-holiday surge in many venues again yesterday and today. The 'Fiber-Beat' goes on and the day-to-day grinding out of specific pole vault drills continues to produce….BIG RESULTS!!!! Here is the latest rebounding…. Today at the historic New Balance Armory Track & Field Center…West Hill,CT senior Marc DeLuca won his second Big Invitational of the early season..with his 14' 6" sail at the Marine Corp Invite. Also jumping super were George Zakharov(Croton-Harmon,NY) 13' 0" and Josiah Spain(O'Neill,NY) at 12' 6". Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) coming off her 11' 6" Ocean Breeze win.. placed second and Lauren Berry(Emma Willard,NY) flew 9' 0" !!! The Coach Glynn Holiday Classic @ Ocean Breeze was the site for Governor Livingston,NJ senior Leah Saifi to own the runway with her new school and meet record of 12' 3" . This Indigo Gymnastic Level 10 athlete heads to Northeastern University next fall. Lauren Saifi placed 4th at 9' 9" and Kaia Becker(North Highlands,NJ) 8' 9' Juliana Schraer(Pascack Valley,NJ) 8' 3" for the Indians. The Boys vault winner was Brian Rubenstein(Governor Livingston,NJ) with his 13' 6" gold medal performance…Placing second was Vinnie Depaolo(Monroe,NY) 12' 6" and Josh Jeong(Monroe,NY) 11' 6" Rhode Island Classic@ Providence …. A New School Indoor Record came from Greenwich,CT Junior…Lia Zavattaro.. with a big clear at 11' 0" and close bar at 11' 7"… Placing third was Flying Circus Summer camper ..Rachael Hill(North Reading,MA) at 10' 6" !!! The Pearl River Invite at RCC was another great meet and a Cricus Sweep..with Monroe-Woodbury,NY junior Kristin Lubeski taking gold at 10' 6"..Gabby Nebiker(Monroe,NY) 9' 0" Kerry Qualter(CS) 8' 0" Fiona Carroll(TZ) 7' 6' Rebecca Baez(NR) 7' 0" Gianna Scancarello(Monroe,NY) 7' 0". Congrats to Suffern ,NY Middle Schooler Hannah Soloman-Hollander with her new Middle School Record 8' 0" Vault. Taking the Boys Vault was Vernon,NJ senior Trevor Hazell with a 12' 6' Josh Jeong(MW) 11' 6" Tom Qualter(CS) 11' 0" Daesob Lim(TZ) 11' 0" Conor Burke(PR) 11' 0" Logan Matthes(MW) 10' 0" The Wilton Wright Invite @ Southern,CT belonged to Weston,CT senior Danielle Cass with a 10' 6" win for the gold medal for Coach Matt Medve!!!! FLYING CIRCUS will be CLOSED Saturday December 31 and Sunday January 1. Regular classes resume Monday January 2 @ 4:30-9PM. FLYING CIRCUS… JOIN-THE-ATHLETIC MOVEMENT.

posts.Title: "SPIRITED VAULTING" WEEKEND @ FLYING CIRCUS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC "Vault-town" ..Warwick,NY You can't touch it…. you can't photographic it….. you can't massage it into your body. It's called.."Human Spirit" … and it is the only thing you need in athletics. ……….This weekend was filled up to the brim…with the 'High Spirit' of High School athletes reaching for the stars….. Some of them hit their marks… some fell just short and some refused to give up on the 'Spirit of Athletics". It's not about the medal or trophy won, that drives young athletes to go beyond themselves…to put themselves on-the-line in the competitive arena … it is all about the incredible feeling of joy and a sense of self worth that brings athletes back to the grinding practice routines and the awesome atmosphere of competition. Congratulations to every Flying Circus athlete and parent for sharing this spirit. More great moments just ahead!!! Weekend Recap…… North Andover,MASS ..senior Erick Duffy was the vault winner at the Dartmouth Relays in Hanover,NH on Saturday…with a soaring 15' 6" fly over and close at 16' 2"!! This Harvard University commit for next year .. will also be in the line up at the 'Greatest Millrose Games Jr.Pole Vault Event" ever assembled with .. Armand Duplantis 18' 5" Riley Richards 17' 6"… Zack McWorter..17' 2… Billy Williamson 16' 9" and Duffy at 16' 6"... as the top 5 entries in the 10 man field on February 11th.. Get you tickets for this historic vault now!!! Also completing the Circus Sweep in Hanover..was Alana Carroll (Averill Park,NY) with an 11' 6" sail for Coach Cauthers on sight!! Ocean Breeze Freedom Games was exciting…with Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest,NJ) breaking her own meet record by a foot..with her 12' 0" gold and Amanda McNeils(Commack,NY) equalling 12' 0" on her third attempt. Both athletes had solid jumps at 12' 6" bar. Sophomore new-comer Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley,NY placed third at 10' 0"PR and Freshman Genevieve Reilly(Warwick Valley,NY) placed 4th at 10' 0" PR for the Lady Purple Wave. Kristin Lubeskie(MW) flew 9' 6" Arianna Cavelli(Old Tappan,NJ) 9' 6" Gabby Nebiker(MW) 9' 6" Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest,NJ) 9' 0" Erin Yuder(NV-Demarest,NJ) 9' 0" Colleen Leahey(JSB) 8' 6" Grace Simpson(TZ) 7' 6" Fiona Carroll(TZ) 7' 6"..The boys were led by Old Tappan,NJ junior Seth Kricheff flying 14' 0" by a ton… Tyler Hyrbek(Old Tappan,NJ) 13' 0"PR Jona Kim(Old Tappan,NJ) 11' 0" Ryan Olesky (Wallkill Valley,NJ) 10' 6". The 23rd Hispanic Games @ Armory…. Smithtown East,NY) senior long jumper/vaulter..Kylie Strzelczyk placed 3rd at 10' 6" for a seasonal best for this 17' 3" long jumper East Stroudsburg Warrior Classic at Koehler was filled with "spirit" on Friday night.. as Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) won gold with 12' 0" vault and big air at 12' 3" for this much improved sprinter heading to Lehigh University next fall. Circus mate--Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) also is making a move up pole vault levels.. as she placed 2nd at 11' 6" in vault and 16' 1" in long jump and both are heading to Reno Summit this weekend. Nick Marino(Hatsboro,PA) continues to dominated his early season meets with another win for Philly Jumps Club! Connecticut Girls and Boys sizzle…as Lia Zavattaro(Greenwick,CT) won again ..Lauren Russo(Newtown,CT) and Danielle Cass (Weston, CT) moving up this week. Dick Wilson Classic Beginners Pole Vault Meet @ Circus…The Thursday afternoon Monrow Woodbury Inter-squad meet was a blast..as 7 new vaulters from Monroe enjoyed their first ever pole vault meet at Flying Circus. After just 5 practice sessions…the real bar went up..Danny Depaol0 7' 6" Anthony Cortez 7' 0" Owen Kelly 7' 0" Nick Villanvena 7' 0" Aidan Wallace 7' 0" Eric Wallace 6' 6" Danny Jeong 6' 0". Welcome to pole vault!!! The Flying Circus will be traveling to the National Pole Vault Summit..sponsored by UCS Spirit Vaulting Poles on Thur-Monday January 12- January 16 with 22 athletes and 4 coaches and many parents taking part in the "GREATEST SINGLE EVENT in TRACK and FIELD" . … The Flying Circus will be CLOSED THUR-FRI-SAT-SUNDAY Jan 12-13-14-15. We will reopen for regular classes on Monday January 16.

HIGH PERFORMANCE THOUGHTS

*Flying Circus Pole Vault is a …Athlete Centered Project. *Your Pole Vault Warm Up dictates your Pole Vault Performance. *Athlete must be coachable…Accept Feedback Graciously. *The athlete must take chances and willing to take risks. *The athlete must set short range goals. *The COACH has 1000 careers..the ATHLETE has just 1 Career.. Make it count. * A missed workout CAN NEVER BE MADE UP. * MOTIVATION changes the life of an athlete. * Triple your Work Ethic. * EXTRA-ORDINARY EFFORT = EXTRA -ORDINARY RESULTS. * SPEED is a SKILL… It can be taught. FLYING CIRCUS ….. KINETIC LEARNING .

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLYS"   @  NATIONAL VAULT SUMMIT !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club, LLC Vault-town, USA

The Pole Vault Train stopped in Reno, Nevada this weekend!

…… and loaded on board were 2,156 Pole Vault enthusiasts from around the world. The biggest UCS Spirit National Pole Vault Summit ever was inspiring…educational and encouraging for the 23 Flying Circus pole vaulters…their 5 Circus Coaches and the 12 proud parents making the trip of a lifetime to the Mecca of Pole Vault….Reno, Nevada. We would like to thank all the athletes… and parents who traveled or who sent our most focused and spirited group ever. The new techniques learned here will help each athlete and coach reach for the skies this indoor and outdoor season. This was our .."Best Summit Ever" and the BEST IS YET TO BE!!!! Highlights and Full Results …. Senior Madisyn Hawkins of James Coughlin,PA won the Pit 4 Competition with a personal best and school record 12' 8" to finish second overall among the High School Girls in the entire meet. This sprinter finished on her big pole from 8 lefts and had 3 shots at 13' 0" for the Lehigh University recruit. Circus team mate Abby Norvillo of Pittston Area,PA also set her school record with a runner up on Pit 4 with her 12' 4" clear on her 13 x 160 UCS Spirit. This diver/vaulter now qualifies for Nationals Champion section and just a junior. Pit 2 vaulters had a short warm up period ..but Michelle Rubinetti of Norther Valley-Demarest,NJ sailed high over 12' for 6th place and a 1 foot PR from last year here. Danielle Cass of Weston ,CT sailed 11'0" for the top 4 Circus Award. The boys were also moving the poles to vertical well… with Johannes Stromhaug of Vestel,NY winning his Pit #3 with a school record 14' 9" for this likable junior athlete Coached By James Cerra . Pit #4 saw Milan Spisek of Joel Barlow High School, CT soar 14' 9" to place 2nd and Liam Ackerman of Miami,FL and formerly of MW Circus,NY made 14' 5" … Marc DeLuca of Westhill,CT was super over 14' 4" and big at 14' 11" for Coach Neil Perry. Brian Runenstein(Gov. Livingston,NJ) was solid at 13' 10"… All in all…… EVERYONE CAME THRU with BIG SPIRIT…BIG BEHAVIOR…BIG PERFORMANCES!!!! Girls Results… Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) 12' 8" School Record….. Abby Norwillo (Pittston Area,PA) 12' 4" School Record… Michelle Rubinetti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) 12' 0" Danielle Cass(Weston,CT) 11' 0" Jesssica Ipolito(FairLawn,NJ) 10' 7"... Lauren Berry(Emma Willard

posts.Title: "BIG - FIBER WEEKEND" @ CIRCUS…ERIC DUFFY(MA) 16'4.75"…LEAH SAIFI(NJ) 12' 6" !!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, NY The spotlights were on the pole vault runways this weekend…as Circus athletes turned up the heat with strong performances in five states. This weekend marks the half-way mark to this indoor tour of Fiber-Bending Winter Track & Field. CONGRATULATIONS to all our athletes and parents for another GREAT SHOW!!! In all 12 Personal Bests… 5 School Records…. 6 State Relay Champions… and many wonderful stories of toughness…sportsmanship and friendships!!!! Boston,MA…leading the boys results this weekend was ERICK DUFFY of North Andover High School,MA. This talented senior captain flew to a NEW ALL TIME MASSACHUSETTS HIGH SCHOOL INDOOR POLE VAULT with a clean 16' 4.75"(5m) and 1 very close jump at 16' 10.75" New England Record!!! Erick is heading to his 16' 1 UCS Spirit Poles this week ... for the NYRR MILLROSE GAMES on February 11th at the Armory. This performance took place at the Greater Boston Track Club's meet at Harvard University today!!! Erick was on his 8 step run and had the 13' 1" Takeoff for club coach Brenner Abbot!!!! Another notable performance came from Dagi Tadesse of little New Paltz High School,NY. Jumping at West Points historic Gillis Fieldhouse on Saturday and in just training flats…Dagi sizzled over 15' 0" for a New School Record and now leads NY State Indoor List. Dagi Tadesse now becomes the 50th FLYING CIRCUS athlete over the 15 Foot Barrier!!! The Circus Girls also were ready-to-fly…as LEAH SAIFI (Governor Livingston,NJ) set her School Indoor Record at 12' 6" (USA#10) and teamed up with her sister Lauren(10' 6") to set a All Time Group II State Relay Record of 23' 0"!! This sister act of Indiago Gymnastic Champions keeps getting better each week!!! Over in Kutztown University,PA..It was another meet record for James Coughlin.PA senior Madisyn Hawkins sailed 12' 0" for the 5th time this indoor season and was close at 12' 6" bar. She heads to NYRR Millrose Games on February 9th at Armory!! Taking the gold medal at the Yale Invitational was senior Lauren Russo of Newtown,CT. This all-around senior athlete at Newtown went big at 11' 0" for Coach Russell. Sisters Caroline and Jennifer McGann of Holy Angels ,NJ won their State Championship Relay title at Toms River on Friday..with Caroline jumping 10' 6" on borrowed poles and Jenn sailing 7'6" for the Non-Publiv A State Title> Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood,NJ) was the class of Group IV with his 13' 6" PR!!! posts.Title: "COME FLY WITH US  …@   FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT
posts.Content:
YOU ARE INVITED….to our 3rd  …""LEARN-HOW-TO-POLE VAULT- CLINIC"

Calling all Track & Field Athletes… Sprinters…Hurdlers…Jumpers

        DATE:      Saturday   March   25,  2017

        REGISTRATION:     At-The-Door Registration

        WHERE:    The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development
                          Flying Circus Vault Barn
                          3 Warwick Center Road & Hoyt Road
                          Warwick, New York

        TIME:          BOYS POLE VAULT  CLINIC… 10AM-1PM
                           GIRLS POLE VAULT CLINIC …… 2PM-5PM

        WHAT TO BRING :     SWEATS…SPIKES….WATER

        GROUPS:        BEGINNER VAULTERS   & INTERMEDIATE VAULTERS

        COST:        $100 per Athlete…… $50 per Coach

posts.Title: "FRIENDSHIPS" Prevail  @ NYRR MILLROSE GAMES !!!!
posts.Content: New York,New York….. 2017 NYRR MILLROSE GAMES Report… The 14 inch snow storm could not over-power the FRIENDSHIPS ! The Girls Jr. Pole Vaulters at last nights 110th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES put on a dazzling show of "Spirited Friendship" in the unique and historical setting at the 168th Street New Balance Armory Track and Field Center in New York City. The loaded field of' fiberglass flyers' put on the deepest and most entertaining show in Girls Jr Pole Vault event history… as Katie Jones of South Williamsport,PA flew high over 13' .25" for the Vaultworx's Crew Coached by Matt Concannon. It was much more than a Vault Meet….. It was all about a gathering of Pole Vault Friends. Many thanks to all meet management…parents…coaches and athletes for a Super Night together. Results…. 1-Katie Jones,South Williamsport,PA………………… 13' .25" 2-Leah Saifi,Mountainside,NJ…………………………. 12' 8.25" School Record!! 3-Alana Carroll,Averil Park,NY ……………………….. 12' 4.5" 4-Michelle Rubinetti,Demarest,NJ……………………. 12' 4.5" 5-Carena Nottoli,Landisville,PA………………………. 12' 4.5" 6-Amanda McNelis,Commack,NY……………………. 12' .5" 7-Nathalie Elliot,Spring Grove,PA……………………. 11' 8.5" 8-Madisyn Hawkins,Wilkes Barre,PA ………………. 11' 8.5" 9-Jessica Ippolito,Fair Lawn,NJ……………………… 11' 4.5" 10-Abby Norwillo,Pittston ,PA ……………………….. 11' 4.5" 11-Courtney German,Lancaster,PA…………………. 11' 4.5" 12-MacKenzie Horn,Lancaster,PA …………………. 11' 4.5" CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!!!!!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS BIG @ NJ STATE GROUPS ….  7 "STATE CHAMPIONS"  & 22 POLE VAULT MEDALISTS !!!!
posts.Content: Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC   Warwick Valley, NY    There's no mountain too high.    This is especially true in athletic participation. Congratulations to the 35 Flying Circus Pole Vault athletes this past weekend at the New Jersey State Groups Championships at the Toms River Bubble. Each and every one has climbed the mountain this past three months with unbelievable motivation and dedication….the results are inspiring…but ..the real treat is in the effort and spirit of each athlete. The cheering and support by every club mate is what drives the athletes in our little club. Thank you all for rising above.. just the performance barometer and into the world of shared joy. Now..it's back to work and chasing dreams!!   New Jersey State Groups Championships   Toms River,NJ   Feb 17-18      35 Vaulters…. 22 Medalists…. 7 "State Champions"      Group I … Girls 1-Irene Park(Pequannock) 9' 6" Boys- 3-Jared Forer(Glen Rock) 12' 6"     Group II… Girls- 1-Laeh Saifi(Governor Livingston) 12' 0" 3-Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest) 11' 6" 4-Lauren Saifi(Governor Livingston) 11' 0" 6-Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest) 10' 6" 10-Grace Gardella(Ramsey) 10' 0" Boys- 3-Brian Rubenstein(Governor Livingston) 13' 6" 4-Trevor Hazell(vernon) 13' 6" 8-Andy Freedman(Mahwah) 12' 0" 11- Brian Nagotko(Mahwah) 12' 0"    Group III Girls - posts.Title: MILAN SPISEK WINS CONNECTICUT STATE VAULT …. GIRLS  also SOAR!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley,NY BREAKING NEWS…. Connecticut State Indoor Championships Feb. 20 / Hillhouse Field house,CT MILAN SPISEK of Joel Barlow High School soared today to the Connecticut Indoor State Pole Vault title…with a 15' 0" clear sail for the gold medal. The likable and strong senior used his UCS Spirit 15' 1" x 165lbs to the max and had close bars at 15' 5". Coach Cauthers and Coach Duffy provided the technical assist all day for the Boys and Girls Circus Vaulters!!! ALSO SOARING @ STATE was Danielle Cass of Weston High School… with her second place 11' 6" personal best and a trip to the NB Nationals on March 10 at the NB Armory in New York City. Placing third was junior Lia Zavattaro of Greenwich,CT with another new school record of 11' 6" and third place and a ticket to NB Nationals Emerging Elite. Placing forth was Newtown,CT senior star distance/vaulter..Lauren Russo.. with a super 11' 0" night. Full Results coming soon…. Flying Circus.

posts.Title: "IT'S POSSIBLE" @ CIRCUS !!!!
posts.Content: "IT'S POSSIBLE" @ CIRCUS !!! The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick, New York CONGRATULATIONS to all vaulters for a super weekend of vaulting in four states. The Circus Bus Tour was impressive…as college and high school athletes stepped up to the Championship Indoor Series with their biggest poles and longest run ups. Nationals now just 14 days-a-way !!!! Big jumps came from our college vaulters in far away places… as Virginia University freshman..Tedi DiMaria set a personal best of 13' 0" at the ACC Championships at Notre Dame for Coach Mario Wilson. She had a close bar at 13' 3.5" on her biggest poles of the season. Dartmouth freshman..Julia Valenti placed 3rd at the HEPS at the Armory with her 12' 7.5" leap… and James Steck of Virginia Tech placed 4th at 17'' 1" for Coach Bob Phillips strong vault crew. At American East Champs… Binghamton Junior..Peter Fagan placed 2nd at 16' 6.75"…Travis Fountain(Bing) 16' 2.75"PR in 3rd place and Stefan Buechele(Albany) hit 16' 1.5" to win the Heptathlon Title for the Purple and Gold. Stefan also placed 5th in the open vault at 15' 9" the next day!!!! New Hampshire junior Kari Murnane hit the 12 foot club status with her 3rd place 12' 0" at conference meet..Grace Weisbecker(Vermont) placed 2nd at 12' 5" Samantha Beyer(Binghamton) 12' 0" Sabrina Anderson(NH) 11' 0" and Sophia Alter(V) 10' 6" Coach Cauthers travelled to Penn State University on Saturday to help at the PA STATE MEET…as Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin) jumped to a 3rd place medal at 12' 0'… and Pittston Area…Junior Abby Norwillio placed 8th at 11' 6". Hatboro,PA senior Nick Marino had a dream meet with his first 16' 0" vault ever to win the crown for Coach Brian Monschein . Payton Morris leaped 15' 6.75 for Coach Matt Concannon!! The New Jersey Meet of Champions was loaded with real life drama in both the boys and Girls sections… Seth Krischeff of Northern Valley Old Tappan was sensational for Coach Jeff Clark and Coach Alex Eckmeyer ..with his 14' 6" win for his first state title. Brian Rubenstein (Gov.Livingston) was also ready to fly..with his Runner Up 14' 0 vault silver medal. Hunterdon central junior Dave Bausmith placed 3rd at 14' 0"..Ryan Vimba placed 7th at 13' ^' Greg Fuerte(Paramus) 13' 6" Trevor Hazell(Vernon) 13' 6" Kevin Nam(Pope John) 13' 0" School Record) Jared Forer(Glen Rock) 12' 6" rounded out the boys on Saturday.. The Girls Meet on Sunday was close and exciting… with every girl reaching deep within at Toms River Bubble. Fair Lawn senior Jessica Ippolito placed 2nd with her 12' 0" second attempt and forced a jump off for the gold. After breaking a pole at 12' 3"..she came right back with a make. She heads to University of Rhode Island next fall. Michelle Rubinetti of Northern Valley Demarest was also ready to roll..with a 12' 0" clear and nearly stole the show at 12' 6" second bar brush off… Placing forth was Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston) at 11' 6" Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 11' 0" Lauren Saifi(GL) 10' 6" Max Earl(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Sydney Woods(NVD) 10' 6" Caroline McGann(Holy Angels) 10' 6" Grace Gardella(Ramsey) 10' 0". Section 1 State Quals at the Armory..George Zakharov(Croton Hudson) placed 1st at 13' 0" and Conor Burke(Pearl River) 12'9" PR advance to states this coming weekend at Ocean Breeze!!! Section 9 State Quals at West Point on Friday night was filled with loud clapping and cheering..as Kristin Lubeskie of Monroe Woodbury defended her girls title at 11' 0" for the Crusaders…Sophomore Kaeli Thompson of Warwick Valley vaulted 10' 6" for Coach Mike Potter and Colleen Leahey jumped 10' 0" to return trip to State finals. Gabby Nebiker(MW) looked great over 10' 0" Lydsey Julian of Washingtonville set her personal best at 8' 6' for Coach Duffy GenevieveRreilly (Warwick Valley) 8' 6" Julia Penna(MW) 8' 6"PR Noa Raskin(NP) 8' 0" Daniella Raymond (Wash) 8' 0". The Boys Comp was close also..as Dagi Tadesse of New Paltz won at 14' 6' and close at 15' 3" Vinnie Depaolo(Monroe Woodbury) 13' 0"…Isaac Heatley(Warwick Valley) 13' 0" Dylan Scribani(NP) 13' 0" Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley) 13' 0" Josh Jeong(MW) 12' 6" Josiah Spain(ON) 12' 0" Isaiah Ramirez(PB) 12' 0" Mike Gagliardi(Wall) 11' 0" Austin O'Malley(G) 11' 0" Justin Smith(PB) 11' 0" . " The Warwick Valley vs Monroe Woodbury Vault Shootout" meet on Thursday at the Barn took place on the outdoor pits..as Chris Endrizzi(MW) flew 12'0" for the Crusdaer win… Logan Matthews(MW) soared 11' 0" for silver and Jacob Becker(Warwick Valley) placed 3rd at 10' 0"…. Dan Jeong(MW) 9' 0" Aidan O'Connor(Warwick Valley) 9' 0" Anthony Cortez(MW) 9' 0" Dan Depaolo(MW) 9' 0" Owen Kelly(MW) 9' 0" Nick Villanuena(MW) 8' 0" Aidan Wallace(MW) 8' 0" Eric Wallace(MW) 6' 0". Special Thanks to Beth Becher(Warwick) for scoring!!! FLYIN' CIRCUS …. LIVE MORE…SERVE BEST.

posts.Title: The 83rd  EASTERN STATES…LEAH SAIFI SAILS  13'  .5" …NICK MARINO SIZZLES  15' 6" !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley,NY To watch young kids compete is a real treat. ……..and there were so many treats last night at the 83rd EASTERN STATES CHAMPIONSHIPS …as the finest athletes from 9 states came to the track and field mecca…The New Balance Armory on 168th street for some competitive fun!!!! The Flying Circus brought all the poles and the 30" CIRCUS MIRACLES" put on their 'BEST FIBER-SHOW" EVER for the excited crowd of Track & Field "Nuts"!!!! CONGRATULATIONS to all athletes…coaches and parents for a sensational night together!!! …on-to-nationals!!!! The stage was set and the peaking vaulters were ready-to-sail…. Pole Vault Chief…Tim Wilson kept the competition flowing all night with his brother and pit crew…as the girls field of 30 vaulters set the spark for the entire night…. Governor Livingston High School legend…Leah Saifi.. became the Greatest Girl Ever at Easterns with her NEW ALL TIME MEET RECORD 13' .5" vault on her third attempt for the gold. The personable senior , heading to Northeastern University next fall spanned her ankle on the winning vault and X-Rays provided the good news of no fracture!!! James Coughlin ,PA senior Madisyn Hawkins,,coming off a super PA State Meet on Saturday.. was also clean all night with first attempts.. took the silver at 12' 6" and moved up poles all night. Taking the Bronze medal was Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ senior Michelle "Rubeeee" Rubinetti ..with a hugh sail over a school record 12' 6" and ever so close bar at 13' .5" for the PENN UNIVERSITY bound gymnast/vaulter. Join the 12 Foot Club for her first time ever was Greenwich,CT junior…Lia Zavattaro with her 5th place 12' 0" make on her biggest UCS Spirit pole ever. Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn,NJ) still covering from a broken pole at State on Saturday placed 6th at 12' 0" for the Cutters ..as CIRCUS GIRLS placed 5 girls in the Top 6 for the best ever!! The Boys were determined to measure up to the Girls success… Nick Marino of Hatboro-Horsham,PA.. Coming off his 16' 0" PA State Meet win… flew the coop with a 15' 6" win and big height at 16' 0:" for the Philly Jumps Club senior , coached by Brian Monschein. Colin Duigan of Fordham Prep , coached by Brian Carney was the TOP JUNIOR with his 2nd place 15' 6" Personal best and 1 great shot at 16'0"!!! Seth Kricheff of Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ was close at 15' 0" again and placed 5th . Robby Saligman(Friends Academy,PA) was great at 14' 6' and Marc deLuca(Westhill,CT_ hit 14' 0" for Coach Perry. Isaac Heatley(Warwick Valley,NY) blasted 14' 0"..Trevot Hazell(Vernon) set a new school record of 14' 0" for the Vikings..Greg Fuerte(Paramus) 13' 6' and Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood) 13' 6". Full Girls Results… 1-Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston) 13' .5" New Meet Record!!! 2-Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) 12' 6" 3-Michelle Rubinetti(NV0Demarest,NJ) 12' 6" =School Record ! 5-Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) 12' 0" New School Record!! 6-Jessica Ippolito(FairLawn,) 12' 0" Amanda McNelis(Commack) 11' 6" Danielle Cass(Weston,CT) 11' 6" Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 11' 0" Maxine Earl(Ridgewood) 11' 0" Kristin Lubeski(Monroe,NY) 11' 0" Caroline McGann(Holy Angels) 111' 0" = School Record! Sydney Woods.(NV-Demarest) 11' 0" Personal Best!

CONGRATULATIONS to ALL !!!

Late news… Congratuations to Sarah Haley of Binghamton University for winning the American East Pole Vault Championships this weekend at 12' 5" for Coach Thompson.. This former Dover,NY standout vaulter/hurdler continues to thrive. Also a shout out to Samantha Kaplan of RIT for 2nd place this weekend at State 11' 1.75 " !!! FLYING CIRCUS… You can't make this stuff up.. it's real.

posts.Title: CIRCUS SPIRIT PREVAILS  !!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project "Powered by JOE TEA" Warwick, NY "MAKING HISTORY…with SPIRIT" ….The true measure of the athlete…lies in the effort and inner spirit to excel. This was the most important lesson developed this Indoor Season at Flying Circus. It was never all about winning the gold medal..but more about an athletes commitment to human spirit. Spirit can never be defeated..as it is the awesome by product of participating with all your might. CONGRATULATIONS to all our 108 Indoor Pole Vaulters this winter… Keep looking ahead to the challenges and adventures to come. CIRCUS THOUGHTS ……… * Know what you want to accomplish. See yourself excelling. BELIEVE in YOUR MIRACLE. TAKE A CHANCE on yourself. The SPIRIT of TOUGHNESS and BIG HEARTS GET IT DONE. Make progress ….. not mark time. Don't MAJOR in MINOR things in life. AVOID NEGATIVE PEOPLE. CHAMPIONS demand results. A slacker asks when is practice over…A CHAMPION asks.."CAN I STAY LATE". Bio-Rhythms … Prepare for your break-thru. Be CONSUMED by the CONCEPT of TEAM…IT'S WE..not ME. KEEP-YOUR-PROMISES. NEW YORK STATE MEET Results…Ocean Breeze,NY… Girls ..2-Amanda McNelis(Commack) 12' 3" 4-Alana Carroll(Averil Park) 12' 0" 6-Kristin Lubeskie(Monroe-Woodbury) 11' 3" 7-Kaeli "Sparky) Thompson(Warwick Valley) 11' 3" PR Julia Nomberg(HHH) 10' 0" Amelia Legg(Delhi) 10' 0" Maddy Lukska(Ursiline) 10' 0" Kylie Strzlezyk(Smithtown East) 9'6" Kelley Townley(Liverpool) 9' 6" Patriyca Lis(Townsed Harris) 8' 3" Boys…. 2-Charles Crispi(Farrell) 15' 0" SB 3-Johannes Stromhaug(Vestel) 15' 0" PR Dagi Tadesse(New Paltz) 14' 0" Vinnie DePaolo(Monroe-Woodbury) 13' 6" Isaac Heatley(Warwick Valley) 13' 0" George Zakhavov(Croton) 13' 0" MEGAN CLARK & SCOTT HOUSTON SOAR at USATF INDOOR NATIONALS!!!! Congratulations to Megan Clark for placing 6th today at Nationals with her 14' 11" sail for the Olympic Training Center group …coached by Kris Mack…. and Scott Houston,,PV Coach at High Point University..scaling 18'4.5" to place 4th in USA !!!! " BACK-TO-BASICS" …. ************************ The next training cycle here at Flying Circus( March 5-April 5) will be devoted to Pole Vault Techniques Development from short 4-5 lefts and light poles. It's time to re-build the foundation for the up coming outdoor season.. Circus will be open every Tuesday-Thursday evening with 2 classes(Co-Ed) Class #1 5:30-7pm Class #2 7-8:30pm for all levels of pole vaulters. Cost $30 per athlete per session. Please join us for your development. CIRCUS will be CLOSED Fri-Sat-Sun March 10-11-12 for INDOOR NATIONALS. FLYING CIRCUS …. DEDICATION….TEAM CONCEPT…TRADITION.

posts.Title: "HALLELUJAH" …FLYIN' CIRCUS ROLLS @ NATIONALS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flyin' Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick, New York JUST WHEN WE THOUGH... WE SAW -IT-ALL……. Welcome to the NEW POLE VAULT GENERATION. It's funny how some kids approach the endless limits of movement. It happens in all events..in all sports across the broad board of athletic expression. It's called ..'Joy thru Movement' in the text books on athletics and physical education. CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU to all our NATIONAL PERFORMERS this past weekend for showing us all…Joy…Sportsmanship and Gracious Class. "Keep your dancing shoes on"….it's on to outdoor fun!!!

ERICK DUFFY 16'1.25" …..MADISYN HAWKINS 12' 2.5" Lead the way.

It's hard to believe…but there is no pole vault in the Massachusetts Indoor State meets… but that did not stop Erick Duffy of Andover,MA from placing 8th in the USA!!!! His 16' 1.25" clear was strong and this Harvard University bound strongman was very close at 16' 5" bar…he also set his fastest high hurdle anchor in the morning warm up Shuttle Hurdle Relay. Leading our Girls was Madisyn Hawkins of Wilkes Barr,PA with a big 12' 2.5" clear on Sunday for the Lehigh University bound speedster. Hawkins produced 8 meets over 12' 0" this indoor with her personal best of 12' 8" at the UCS Summit. posts.Title: "RISING VAULT STARS" ARRIVE … @ … CIRCUS !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC    Warwick Valley Indoor Pole Vault Facility    Warwick, New York      The Future stopped in…. at Flying Circus Pole Vault Headquarters!!!!       The 51 multi-talented young athletes and coaches arrived on Saturday …from 5 different states …ranging from 5th graders to high school seniors to get their "Flying Lessons" on Fiberglass pole vaulting poles @ Flying Circus. The spirited and attentive group represents the growing interest in Track & Field's most thrilling event….. POLE VAULT FLYING. Special thanks go out to our parents … volunteers and coaching staff for all their work in promoting our fiberglass kids and their dreams. "MAGIC HAPPENS" when humans VOLUNTEER THEIR TIME. CHEERS!!!!!       Our clinic today presented great content for Beginning and Intermediate pole vaulters to take back to their High School Programs. Drills… that transfer…. Warm Up Specificity…Volume Intensity…. Pole Drop Mechanics…Bio-Motor Running posture and angles…. and dedication routines for championship athletes. The development cycle and self-motivation culture were also highlighted all day. CONGRATULATIONS ALL and THANK YOU ALL FOR ATTENDING.    NEXT UP….. SUMMER 2 DAY CAMPS REGISTRATION OPENS APRIL 1.    ******************************************************************************************    Our Summer 2-Day Pole Vault Camps fill up lighting fast… we take only the first 60 Boys and first 60 Girls to register. Applications at our web site www.hvflyingcircus.com on April 1.. JOIN THE SUMMER FUN!!!     Boys Camp… Monday & Tuesday July 10-11 , 2017 4-8pm each day. Early Bird Cost $300 per athlete.     Girls Camp…. Thursday & Friday July 13-14 , 2017 4-8pm each day. Early Bird Cost $300 per athlete.     Saturday July 15, 2017     End of the Year…FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT MEET and PICNIC     *********************************************************************************      Great Music… Great Friendship… Great Food…

posts.Title: LIA ZAVATTARO(Greenwich,CT)…WINS NEW YORK RELAYS  //  SUMMER CAMPS FILLING UP FAST !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Pole Vault Center Warwick,New York Winning is fun. Sure . But winning is not entirely the point in athletics. Striving to compete to your ability and preparing yourself for the challenges of competition is the point of athletics. Never giving up is the point. Never letting each other down is the point. Competing with class and dignity is the point in scholastic athletics. Measuring up to the very best that is in you is the real point. Here at FLYING CIRCUS we have been blessed with dedicated and focused athletes over the years. This has been the key to your success….Keep you spirit alive and enjoy your adventure together !!!!
The Sun is starting to peek out and the performances are starting to take shape. Greenwich,Ct Indoor State Class Vault Champion, Lia Zavattaro(Junior) won the Vault Plaque at Saturday's New York relays with a clean and big sail over 11' 6" for the Cardinals of Greenwich. She also leaped 11' 9" school outdoor record earlier in the week. Taking Silver medal was ever so improving Kaeli Thompson (Sophomore) of Warwick Valley's.Purple Wave..with a seasonal best of 11' 0" for Coach Mike Potter. In the Boys vault.. It was Isaac Heatley(Warwick) placing 3rd at 13' 0" and team mate Brendan McShane(Senior) entering the 13' foot club in the red division and 4th place overall. Both were close at 13' 6".. Soph Jacob Becher(Warwick) leaped 10' 6" at the world class facility. It was a solid week in duals …with Madisyn Hawkins(Coughlin,PA) soaring 12' 6" at Tunkhanneck meet and every so close at 13' 1"… Abby Norwillio(Pittston Area,PA) set a new outdoor school record of 12' 6" for this powerful junior…Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest,NJ) leaped 12' 0" for Coach Mike Ives and brushed offf12' 7" school record attempt.. Syd Woods(Sopr-NV-D) sailed 10' 6" ..as did team mate Erin Yuder(NV-D). Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) hit 11' 6",,, along with Alana Carroll at 11' 6" this weekend. Holy Angels,NJ junior Caroline McGann..sailed 11' 0" in 40 degree weather. At the Warwick Valley Middle School meet on Thursday… 8th grader Julia Mosier of Warwick Valley sailed 8' 0" before an buzzing crowd @ Warwick Valley. Vinny DePaulo(Monrow-Woodbury,NY) continued his unbeaten spring with another 13' 6" win..and Josh Jeung(MW) backed it up at 13' 0"!!! CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL VAULTERS.. Continue to send results of PR's..School Records…Big Improvements to coachst@gmail.com for this newsletter.

SUMMER CAMPS FILLING UP FAST !!!

Our Summer Vault Magic Camps are 70% Full !!!!! Everyone wants to join the circus this summer in the Warwick Valley. Our limited (60 Boys and 60 Girls ) Pole Vault Camp features 6 Vaulting Pits.. 20 Elite Coaches…2017 Camp Circus Shirt and Circus Pole Vault packet of Magic ….. The Early Bird rate of $300 per vaulter ends May 1. Price moves to $350 after May 1…. SAVE THE FIFTY…. JOIN NOW!!! Applications at the forms page. Many thanks for supporting our club again this summer. "THANK YOU SALUTE "…. We are proud to announce two wonderful gifts from two great pole vault families. Our new 1900 UCS Spirit Red Vault Pit and Standards have been donated by Marcus and Marie Zavattaro Family of Greenwick,CT and have been set up on our main Outdoor Runway for everyone's practice and development. We also are grateful to Bob and Lisa Sorensen Family of Warwick, NY for gifting our New Super Fast Indoor Runway for the Main Pit and New Standards for our outdoor Pit. The Indoor Purple Runway…a firm Sport Flex X product that will truly be… "The FASTEST RUNWAY on the PLANET"!!!!! THANK YOU for POLE VAULTING @ FLYING CXRCUS

posts.Title: MADISYN HAWKINS (Coughlin,PA) Takes  123rd  PENN RELAYS VAULT TITLE !!!
posts.Content: The HV Flying Circus Pole Vault Project NEWS FLASH ------ April 28 123rd PENN RELAY CARNIVAL Franklin Field,PA The eight Flying Circus Pole Vault Girls took the Penn Relay's by storm on Thursday under clear skies at the World's Greatest Track and Field Meet. Congratulations to all for a wonderful day together. It is always a thrill for coaches,parents and spectators to watch you all interact and compete. This experience, in front of 20, 000 Track Nuts, will last a lifetime... More big days just ahead!!! James Coughlin,PA senior captain...Madisyn Hawkins used her 7 step approach perfectly to win the High School Championship of America event with a clutch last attempt sail at 12; 7.5" for the gold watch. This super fast gymnast takes her talents to Lehigh University next fall. The Circus Gilrls were helping and encouraging each other all day..as Flying Circus placed 4 Girls in the TOP 5 for our best team showing ever @ Penn! Piston Area,PA junior Abby Norwillo used her us spirit 155 to the max with her 12' 3.5" third place medal. In forth was Averill Park,NY junior ...Alana Carroll, using her new 13' 7" pole for Coach Cauthers and sailing 12' 3.5" seasonal best outdoor school record. Taking home the 5th place medal before her prom night ..was Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ senior Michellle "Rubee" Rubinetti..with a blast over 12' for Coach Mike Ives. Michelle enters UPENN next fall !!! Fair Lawn,Nj senior Jessica Ippolito leaped 11' for the Cutters on her 160 UCS and heads to University of Rhode Island next fall. Great vaulting also came from Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) senior Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) and Leah Saifi( senior ) Governor Livingston,NJ) Congratulations all.... now---back-to-training! You are invited to join the exciting Andy Washing Pole Vault Meet at Mahwah High School on Sunday morning May 7. This open meet honors one of our greatest pole vault coaches ever from New Jersey. Meet director..Rob Pasek(Mahwah High School) welcomes all vaulters for an exciting tribute meet. More details on how to enter coming on Sunday Newsletter.... Flying Circus... More than Pole Vault.

posts.Title: MEGAN CLARK Sails @ DRAKE RELAYS  !!!!
posts.Content: The FLYIN' CIRCUS POLE VAULT ADVENTURE Warwick Valley, New York Professional Pole Vault Artist…Megan "Flips" Clark returned to one of her famous sites this weekend for some good old pole vault leaps. It was back in 2013 at this Drake Relays site that she and her Duke Coach Shawn Wilbourn made their first USA National Jr. Team… now just four years later.. Megan..representing Oiselle/NYAC club flew 15' 0" in the Elite Rio Reunion of Pole Vault Pro's!!! Megan is now at the US Olympic Training Center and coached by World Renowned Kris Mack !!! She was ever so close at 15' 3.5" !!! Keep soaring Megan!!!! Back east at the 123rd PENN RELAY CARNIVAL @ Franklin Field…there was more history made in all 6 Sections of the FLYING POLE VAULT. Thursday Championship of America High School event..saw Madisyn Hawkins(Wilkes-Barr,PA) soar to a last attempt win at 12' 7.5" for her outdoor school record and the gold watch…. Best friend Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) place 3rd at 12' 3.5" for this junior…Alana Carroll of Averill Park,NY punched over at 12' 3.5" for 4th place and senior Michelle Rubenitti(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) leaped 12'0" for the Lady Nordsman. Emily Harrison of battlefield,VA came thru for 6th at 12' 0" and Jess Ippolito of Fair Lawn,NJ looked good over 11' 0". In the Earlier college section… Sarah Haley of Binghamton University flipped over 12' 0"…Kari Murnane(New Hampshire) 11' 6" and Samantha Beyer(Binghamton) looked great for Coach Thompson. Saturday morning Boys Championship High School..it was all Nick Marino of Hatboro-Horsham,PA sailing to gold at 15' 9" for Coach Brian Monschein of Philly Jumps. Nick took shots at Jordan Yamoah's meet record at 16' 7" and remains undefeated this spring. Also coming up BIG was Vestal,NY junior Johannes Stronhaug with a 15' 5' pr and School Recrd for the Golden Bears of Coach James Cerra. Milan Spisek of Joel barlow,CT was ready with his 4th place 14' 9" leap for Coach Jeff Dumas. Colin Duignan of Fordham Prep ..just a junior made 14' 6" for Coach Brian Carney and Seth Kricheff of Old Tappan made 13' 6" for Coach Jeff Clark. The University Championship of America was spectacular on Saturday Afternoon… as PENN freshman Sean Clark thrilled the home crowd with his 17' 1" explosion for Coach Joe Klim. This left handed Floridian is for real> Coach Jon Hill's standout Lee Bares(Junior0 was super over 17' 1" for 4th place overall ..Ryan Wilkes(URI) placed 5th at 16' 6.75" as did Circus favorite Peter Fagan(Binghamton) at 16' 6.75"!!! @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ HIGH SCHOOL NEWS… AMANDA McNELIS(Commack,NY) Sizzles over 12' 6"!!! Bouncing back high from PENN…was Villanova bound Amanda McNelis of Commack,NY with a PR and School Record win at 12' 6' at the Bob Pratt Invite. Using her 13' x 150 UCS Spirit for Coach Jim Henderson.Also soaring was Kylie Strzelczyk of Smithtown East,NY at 10' 3" recovering from and early season injury. Westhill,CT senior Marc DeLuca has added another championship to his trophy room..with his 14' 0" win on Saturday. At Kingston Relays.. Wimnning the Fr/Soph Pole Vau;lt was Keira Coulard-Smith(New Paltz) at 8' 6'..Syd Tomaine(FDR) 8' 0" and Cornwall ,NY with grader Ava DeFelice placed 3rd at 7' 0" . Dagi Tadesse(New Paltz) won Boys Varsity at 14' 7' Meet Record ..Dylan Scranbani(NP) 13' )" Max Wiers(NP) 10' 6".. Noa Raskin(NP) placed 2nd in Girls Varsity Gold Rush Invite,NY…Brian Nagotko(Mahwah,NJ) won gold at 12' 6" Andrew Freedman(Mahwah) 12' 0" Jordan Schwartz(Hackley( 11' 0" Connor Doyle(Bergeb Teck,NJ) 10' 6" . In Girls It was the talented Kristin Lubeskie of Monroe-Woodbury,NY taking gold at 11' 0" Marisa Entrup(Mahwah,NJ_ 10' 0" Victoria Hill(Mahwah,NJ) 9' 6' Alex Ryan(Nanuet,NY) 8' 0" Kerry Qualter(CS) 8' 0". Andy Washnik Meet at Mahwah High School this Sunday May 7 at 10AM!! TEDI DeMARIA…last year's Indoor All-American from Bethlehem High School.. is taking it higher for CoachMario Wilson at the University of Virginia… Placing 5th at the powerful Virginia Grand Prix meet at 12' 10.75" on Saturday!!! Flying Circus….. Summer Pole Vault Meet- July 15!!!! Join us!!!

posts.Title: ISAAC HEATLEY Blasts  14' 9"PR …. KAELI THOMPSON Sails  11' 2" @ WIZARD DUAL TODAY !!!
posts.Content:
The FLYIN' CIRCUS in ACTION
 Warwick Valley Central
 May 9 - 2017



  The Warwick Valley - Washingtonville Dual meet is always  filled   withe exciting competition  and results.  Today ..that TRADITION CONTINUED..as hometown host... Warwick Valley Central  enjoyed  spirited vaulting  from the Boys Fiber-Benders   and the Girls Fiber-Cats.  The 16 person VAULT SQUAD at Warwick Valley  pushed their  runs back and picked up their bigger poles vs undefeated Washingtonville Wizards.
….  Warwick Valley  senior…Isaac Heatley had a double PR Day… with his 14' 9" blast   and 3 very close bars at 15' 1".. Heatley now moves up to #2 on the NY State Boys list for this  spring. Adding another Pr ..is the  Warwick Valley junior..Dane Sorensen..at 13' 3" inversion… and adding to the deep meet was senior Breandan McShane9Warwick) at 12
' 9"… Freshman  Mack Hallet sailed 10' 6" again  Soph Aidan O'Connor jumped 10' 6" in his  first Pole Vault meet. !!!!  Sophomore Jacob Becher…the solid and fast soph did not jump.

The Girls Vault was also outstanding for both teams… as  Warwick Valley sophomore  Kaeli  Thompson soared to an 11' 2" outdoor PR   and had   very close bars at 11' 10"  from 8 lefts.  She also had an outstanding anchor leg on  the   winning 4x100 Relay.  Soph Lindsey Julian of Coach Duffy's Vault crew  placed  second overall a 8'6"…and Soph Daniellia Raymond(Wizards) PR at 8' 6"  for this fast improving rising star.  Freshman Madeline Sorensen placed  forth at 7'0"  Caroline Fatta leaped 7' 0"  Kalie Mezzetti made 7' 0"   and Courtney West made 6' 0" in her first pole vault meet.. Freshman star..Genevieve Reilly Did Not Jump.

   CONGRATULATIONS  to all vaulters today supporting each other   and  cheering for each other!

posts.Content: The Flyin' Circus Rides Again… May 19 "RECORDS ARE MADE…TO BE BROKEN" !!!! Such was the case this week at the many championship pole vault pits in the Tri-State area. Here's the latest recoil action on fiberglass….. Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ… senior Michelle "Rubee" Rubinetti used her 8 step speed to set a New School and All Time Bergen County record of 12' 6" for Coach Mike Ives deep vault team. Rubinetti, using her 4x100 Relay speed, broke Kayla Polcari(Ridgewood,NJ) county record and had close bars at 12' 9" on this 90' day at River Dell HS. Also setting a new school outdoor record was senior Jessica Ippolito of Fair Lawn,NJ. Leaping 11' 9" on her 13' 7" UCS Spirits for the Cutters and Qualifying for Nationals. . Fast improving Holy Angels,NJ junior..Caroline McGann set her school record PR of 11' 4" on her biggest oles and was close at 11' 9".Placing forth was Old appan's Ariana Cavalli..with her school record at 11'0 for Coach Jeff Clark. The up-and-coming sophomore..Sydney Woods is more than elite volleyball athlete. ..as she was TOP SOPH at 11' 0" for Northern Valley-Demarest. Placing 6th was super senior Jackie Helm of Paramus,NJ with another 10' 6" sail.. Maxine ear(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 6" Erin Yuder(Northern Valley-Demarest) 10' 6" Grace Gardella(Ramsey) 10' 6" and Marisa Entrup(Mahwah) 10' 0". Seth Krichell of Old Tappan,NJ was the star of the Boys Meet of Champs..with a big fly-over win at 14' 6" for the speedy junior..Jason Mezhibovsky of Northern Valley-Demarest flew 14' 0".. Soph Justin Manne of Mahwah,nj set a school soph record of 13' 0" for Coach Rob Pasek. Ryan Vimba(Ridgewood) 13' 0" Tyler Hrbek(OT) 13' 0" Sam Pitkowsky(Pascack Valley) 13' 0"PR and Liam Landau(Pascack Hills) 12' 6" completed the magic in the solid Bergen County Pole Vault territory! Orange County Champs.. Kaeli Thompson(Warwick) and Isaac Heatley(Warwick) Defend-the-Pit!!! Warwick,NY - Sophomore Kaeli Thompson defended her pole vault title on a hot spring afternoon at her home pit at Warwick Valley Central…with her 11' 0" sail for the Purple Wave of Coach Mike Potter. She then turned in a blistering anchor 4x100 Relay split on her 49.85 Relay team!!! Taking silver was Monroe-Woodbury's Kristin Lubeski at 11' 0" for Coach Chris Goodwin. John S Burke standout ..Colleen Leahey soared 10' 0" for third..Gabby Nebiker(MW) also hit 10'0" for the medal… Lindsey Ju;lain(Washingtonville) came up big at 9' 6"PR for Coach Duffy and soph Samantha Becker(Sullivan West) set school record at 9' 0".. Genevieve Reilly(Warwick) 8' 6" comeback and Ava DeFelice(Cornwall) hit 8' 0" PR for Coach Feuer Green Dragons!!! The Boys saw Warwick Valley senior Isaac Heatley soar all day long..with clean jumps thru 14' 7.5" to defend his title. This New haven University bound athlete used his BIG STICKS all day long. Placing second with a PR was Vinnie DePaolo(MW) at 13' 9" for Coach Glover. Josiah Spain of James O'Neill soared 13' 6" Brendan McShane(Warwick) PR'ed at 13' 0" Dane Sorensen(Warwick) flew 13' 0" for 16 big points for the home team. Joshus Jeong(MW) 13' 0" Austin O'Malley (Goshen) looked great at 12' 0" for Coach McEntee!! Leah Saifi Flys 12' 3" School Record!!! Northeast University recruit..Leah Saifi of Governor Livingston sailed 12' 3" for a new outdoor school record at the Union County Championships .. Younger sister..Lauren Saifi placed second for the family sweep at 10' 6"!!! Daeseob Lim of Tappan Zee's Flying Dutchmen won his Rockland Championships with a 13' 6' vault..followed by Tom Qualter(CS) 13' 0" Chris Filatov(Nanuet) 1' 0" Conor Burke(PR) 12' 0" Eugene Em(Nanuet) 11' 6" for Coach Beckerle!!! Girls vault today..full results coming Sunday. Flying Circus… CONGRATULATIONS!!!!

posts.Title: ABBY NORWILLO (PA)  Silver …ISAAC HEATLEY(NY)  14' 7.5" Gold !!
posts.Content: The Flyin' Circus Tour Warwick,NY The VAULT TRAIN has left the station …. and the Flyin' Circus is now on their..'Championship Tour' . Congratulations to all our 135 athletes for stepping up at the start of the final 3 weeks of Championship Vaulting. Here is just some highlights from the weekend..full results coming after Tuesday Night's Warwick Fast Times Extravaganza at Warwick Valley High. The Rain fell hard at the PA STATE MEET in Shippensburg all morning..as Pittston Area High School junior Abby Norwillo sailed clean over 12' 6" to place second in the 3A state championships and had a very narrow miss at 13'0" for all the marbles..James Coughlin senior..Madisyn Hawkins fell victim to the un-timely heavy rain at 12' 0" bar but still brought home her state medal. Lakeland High School..junior Corah Frantz was super on saturday..setting her school record of 11' o" for fifth place and now joins her dad…Frank, as the Female and Male school record holders at Lakeland High School!!! Hatsboro senior..Nick Marino won another PA STATE TITLE..with his 16' 0" sail for the Hatters!! This Bucknell University recruit has had an unbelievable senior victory tour on fiberglass!!! Congrats Philly Jumps !!! Big Bergen Vaulters at it again… sensational vaulting is deep in Bergen County… as Michelle Rubinetti takes sectional goal at 11' 6"..Arina Cavalli(Old Tappan), just a junior sets school record 11' 6" for Jeff lark.. Seth Kricheff(OT) takes title..Soph Sidney Woods(NV-D) hits 11' 0"..Erin Yuder(NV-D)10' 6" for Coach Ives… Holy Angels,NJ junior Caroline McGann sets school record of 11' 6" to win gold… Jason Mezhibovsky(NV-Demarest) punched his NB Nationals ticket w..a 14' 7.25" win for the Nordsmen!!! Section 9 is the New York Hotbed for vault champions every year..and Warwick Valley,NY senior Isaac Heatley flew the coop in Class A Championships at 14' 7.5" Nationals Standard!!! His tour will hit Greensboro this year. Vinnie DePaolo(MW) broke into the 14 foot club for Coach Glover'''. Freshman Nick Villanovea of Monroe-Woodbury set a double PR with his 13' 0" Dan Sorensen(Warwick) Brendan McShane(War) and Josh Jeong(MW) all sailed 12' 6' into the new pit!. Kristin Lubeski(MW) was sensational all day..with a gold medal sizzle over 11' 6" for Coach Goodwin and Kaeli Thompson took silver at 11' 0" for the Wave. Erick Duffy(North Andover,MA) ..the NB All-American pole-vaulter/hurdler..sailed 16' 0" at his State Sections and close at the New England record of 16' 10.5"!!! Alana Carroll(Averill Park,NY) just a junior won her Section 2 Class meet with 12' 6" and close at 13' 0"!! Leah Saifi(Gov.Livingston,NJ) won her gold medal at 12' 0" for the Northeastern University recruit!! Sis..Lauren added her 10' 6" points. Danielle Cass(Weston) flew 11' 6" again..Lauren Russo(Newtown) also looked great over 11' 6" Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich) 11' 0"…head up the CT CIRCUS GIRLS this weekend. Full Results coming… from NY-NJ=PA-CT-MA at mid week. FLYING CIRCUS VAULT MEETS START Wed, JUne 7 at 4PM…JOIN the FUN.

posts.Title: "FAST TIMES"…KAELI THOMPSON (11' 9") .. SETH KRICHEFF (14' 6")  ///   4 "STATE CHAMPS" @ CONNECTICUT GROUPS
posts.Content:
HV FLYIN' CIRCUS WARWICK, NY This early week of Fiber-Catapoling was filled with seasonal bests..school records..National Qualifiers and State Champs !!! What will the weekend bring next! Congratulations to all vaulters on blasting thru the rain again…. we think the sun is about to come out !!! Raise your grip!!! 23rd Warwick Fast Times @ Pole Vault Paradise… Warwick Valley Central is the place to vault..with it's dual direction runways..Big UCS Pits and 50 Yard Line viewing for the pole vault crowd…. In the first girls section..it was hometown hero time..as Sophomore Kaeli Thompson of Warwick Valley won the gold with a personal best 11' 9" on her biggest pole and grip of the season.. She now heads to Greensboro for the Emerging Elite Nationals. . The Boys battled light mist all thru the competition under the 58 Musco Stadium Lights..and Seth Kricheff(NV-Old Tappan,NJ) prevailed with a sensational 14' 6" fly-a-way for Coaches Jeff Clark and Alec Eckermeyer!!! Full results below…. In the Connecticut State Meet action at various sites.. the Flying Circus was strong with 4 new STATE CHAMPS crowned…. In the Class M… Weston High School's Danielle Cass provided the 10 team points for Coach Medve at 10'0" for this 11' 6" flyer and team mates Ellise Russell placed second and Sophia Rico placed third for 24 Weston Points!!! In the Class LL… Westhill High School senior Marc DeLuca set a PR and State LL all time record with his 15' 3" Sailover for Coach Perry…The Girls LL was a sensational jump off competition..as Greenwich High School junior record holder Lia Zavattaro won gold at 11' 6" and Newtown High School senior placed second with her 11' 6' sail..Placing forth was Megan Murphy(Greenwich,CT) for the Cardinals at 10' 0"!!! In Class MM… Joel Barlow High School senior..Milan Spisek did it again…taking state title at 14' 0" for Coach Dumas. In the L Class… Nick Petruzzelli of Notre Dame,CT placed 4th at 13' 0" Henry Vossler(Darien) 12' 6" Kiernan Daly(Darien) 12' 6' and Zack Matson(New Milford) 11' 0" !!! OUR FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER MEET SERIES STARTS THIS WEDNESDAY JUNE 7 at 4PM!!! JOIN the FUN!!
