Girls… 1-Kaeli Thompson(Warwick) 11' 9" 2-Jess Ippolito(Fair Lawn) 11' 3" 3-Kristin Lubeski(Monroe) 11' 3" 4-Michelle Rubinetti(NV-Demarest) 11' 3" 5-Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley) 10' 9" Caroline McGann(Holy Angels) 10' 9" Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest) 10' 9" Arianna Cavalli(NV-Old Tappan) 10' 9" Juliana Schraer(Pascack Valley) 9' 9" Gabrielle Nebiker(Monroe0 9' 9" Fiona Carroll(Tappan Zee_ 9' 3" Mariossa DiGia(NV-Old Tappan) 9' 3" Katie Melly(Somers) 9' 3" Boys… 1-Seth Kricheff(NV-Old Tappan) 14' 6" 2-Jason Mezhibovsky(NV-Demarest) 14' 0" 3-Isaac Heatley(Warwick) 14' 0" 4-Josiah Spain(Oneill) 13' 6" 5-Vinnie DePaolo(Monroe0 13' 6" Dane Sorensen(Warwick) 13' 6"PR Tyler Hrbel(NV-Old Tappan) 13' 6" SB Daeseob Lim(Tappan Zee) 13' 0" Josh Jeong(Monroe) 13' 0" Tom Qualter(CS) 12' 6" Nick Villanueva(Monroe) 12' 6" Sam Pitkowsky(Pascak Valley) 12' 6" Brendan McShane(Warwick) 12' 6" !!!@ FLYING CIRCUS …. more -than-pole vault.

posts.Title: ALANA CARROLL(Averill Park,NY)  13' 0"   ERICK DUFFY(North Andover,MA)  16' 7" … 4 STATE CHAMPS @ NJ GROUPS !!!
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus Scenic Warwick Valley,NY The sun came out…. and…the Vault Bar went UP ……the Circus Flyers came ready yo bend this weekend in five states and the performances were .."off-the-charts". Many new titles…personal bests…school records..state medals and new "grips" highlighted the action. Here is some sensational scoop …. Averill Park,NY junior.. Alana Carroll set the Section 2 pole vault record straight, with her big 13' 0" sail for her school record and now moves way up the Flying Circus All Time Girls list to #4 with Megan Clark. Alana used her 13' 6" x 155 fiber rocket and heads to the NY State Meet on Friday at Union -Endicott High School. Moving up to Flyin Circus #3 All Time performance was North Andover High School,MA senior …Erick Duffy..with his 16' 7" first attempt clear for a new MA STATE VAULT RECORD. He the had 2 great attempts at 16' 10" for the New England Record. He was not done at the pole vault pit… and also won the MA STATE 110 HURDLES Gold Medal with a personal best 14.10 performance. He also heads to Greensboro in 2 weeks and to Harvard University in the fall!!!

posts.Title: "CONNECTICUT MEET of CHAMPS"….Milan Spisek  15' 6"  &  Marc DeLuca  15' 6" .. Lia Zavattaro 11 6" Lead Circus Team !!!
posts.Content: Circus Flyers @ Willowbrook Park, CT June 5 - 2017 It was all about .."Educational Based Athletics" on Monday at the Connecticut State Open Track & Field Championships at the world class level 12 facility at New Britain High School. This facility hosted the USA vs Great Britain Jr. Dual meet 25 years ago and it's been refurbished again to ..Stateof the Art!!!! There was unbelievable sportsmanship and high performances..as the Top 6 in each event advance to the 72nd New England Championships next Saturday at Norwell High School,MA. Circus Boys Milan Spisek of Joel Barlow HS (Coach Jeff Dumas) won the friendly Boys Vault from best friend…Marc DeLuca(Westhill HS)(Coach Neal Perry)…as both flew personal bests of 15' 6" and close bars at 16'0". Chris Ruff's State Meet Record of 16' 0" remains intact. The sportsmanship displayed by both boys was impressive all day and gives us hope. Placing 9th was junior Nick Petruzzelli(Notre DameHS) made 13' 0" Henry Vossler(DarienHS) 12' 6' and Josh Appel(Westhill) 12' 6" for Coach Perry. Circus Girls helped each other thru out the competition…as Greenwich HS junior Lia Zavattaro placed second overall at 11' 6" for the Cardinals… Weston HS senior Danielle Cass placed 3rd for Coach Medve at 11' 0"..Lauren Russo(NewtownHS) placed 5th at 11' 0" Megan Murphy(Greenwich HS) was the states' TOP FRESHMAN at 10' 0" Sophia Rico(Weston) 9' 6' and Elise Russell(Weston HS) 9' 0" SUMMER CIRCUS MEETS ..Begin tomorrow at 4pm and continues thru the month not June..Join Us.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS SWEEP"  @  New Jersey State  &  New England Championships !!!
posts.Content:
Flyin' Circus Pole Vault Fun Warwick Valley, NY It's called…"Finding Joy thru Sport" ….. There was plenty of joy to go around at the "BIG THREE CHAMPIONSHIPS" this weekend at The New York State Meet…The New Jersey State Meet and the 72nd New England Track & Field Championships ! Here at Flying Circus …. it has never been about winning the medal. It has been more about ..."Belonging"... than anything else. After-all-is-said-and-done … the dust from the meet has landed…and the clean up crew has finished taking care of the site…the memories of competing well… enjoying your own and your team mates successes…and representing your High School team to the fullest competitive spirit and sportsmanship … then… and only then… can you feel the ..'joy-of-sport'… Thank you all… parents…athletes…coaches and families for sharing your "Spirit" with us here at Flying Circus Pole Vault.
The Roller Coaster starts it's climb…Friday.. at the New York State Championships , at tradition rich Union Endicott High School Track and football stadium .. The fast Recktan runways helped battle the gusting cross wind for the Boys and Girls fiberglass getogether. Circus strongman…Dagi Tadesse of New Paltz flew to his Division II State Title with his 15' 0" win.. Junior Josiah Spain(O'Neill) followed with his state medal in 4th place at 13' 3" and George Zakharov(Croton) finished his HS career at 13' 3". In the Division I Championships… Warwick Valley's finest vaulter this year was ready ..as he placed 5th with a 14' 6" leap to make your eyes water!!! Vinnie DePaolo(MW) sailed 13' 3"..as did Tappan Zee's Daeseob Lim at 13' 3". In the afternoon Girls meet…The Division I crown went to NY State Gymnastic star..Amanda McNelis of Commack High School with her 12' 3" sail for Coach Jim hendersen!!! Alana Carroll(Averill Park) took home the silver medal at 12' 0" and placing 3rd was the Top Soph in the meet…Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley) at 11' 9" for the Track Wave's Coach Mike Potter. Kristin Lubeski(MW) 10' 0" Colleen Leahey(JSB) 10' 0" Lauen Berry(Emma) 9' 0" Kelley Townley(Liverpool) 9' 0' . Saturday June 10… The sun comes up strong at Norwell High School,MA for the loaded 72nd New England Championships. Taking the Girls pole vault crown and gold medal…was Greenwich,CT junior scholar..Lia Zavattaro with her 11' 9" sail…bouncing high up from her silver performance last week. Placing third was Weston,CT senior Danielle Cass at 11' 3" ..as she heads to Nationals this week and placing forth was Lauren Russo of Newtown,CT at 11' 3" for the Bucknell University bound athlete. Haley Lightbody(North Reading,MA placed 8th at 9' 9". The Boys Division was sensational.. as part time Circus Vaulter..Erick Duffy of North Andover flew 16' 4.75" for a new meet record and was close at the next bar. Erick also placed second in 110 Hurdles in 14.24. He is seeded 4th at NB Nationals next week. Marc DeLuca(Weston,CT placed 3rd at 15' 3" for Neal Perry and Milan Spisek(Joel barlow,CT) placed 6th at 14' 3"!!! The New Jersey Meet of Champions is one of the strongest State Meets in the USA every year…. and this year was no exception at North Burlington Regional High School state of art facility. The competition was tight all day in both the Boys and Girls runways….but the sportsmanship and togetherness of the vaulters was the best gift of the day for each spectator..parent and coach. . The Girls meet was the "greatest and deepest Ever" as 7 girls flew 12'0… 4 girls equalled he All Time Meet record and the Top 4 Girls supported each other right to the end… Taking the crown was Governor Livingston's Leah Saifi with her comeback 12' 6' first attempt win.. Michelle Rubinetti of Northern Valley-Demarest made Coach Mike Ives proud again with her 12' 6" silver performance.. Jessica Ippolito(Fair Lawn) was also sensational in setting her school record to 12' 6" for 3rd place and Melissa "Sunshine" Purcell of Pascack Valley set her new school record of 12' 6' for the always smiling Coach Tim Wilson. Caroline McGann of Holy Angels was super over 11' 6" for 8th place Lauren Saifi(GL) 10' 6' Grace Gardella(Ramsey) 10' 6' Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest) 10' 6' Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) 10' 6' Jackie Helm(Paramus) 10' 6' Erin Yuder(NV-Demarest) competed tough for the Emory University bound star and Arianna Cavalli(Old Tappan ) will be back next year!!! The Boys were making noise also on the adjacent runway..with Jason Mezhibovsky of Northern Valley-Demarest wins his first state title at 14' 6" on misses for Coach Mike Ives. Junior Seth Kricheff of Northern Valley-Old Tappan was super over 14' 6" also but had 1 more miss in the competition,placing 4th overall. Brian Rubenstein(Governor Livingston) had his best day and nearly stole-the-bacon..with a big 14' 6" clear for 5th place. Dave Bausmith(Hunterdon Central..just a junior 14' 0" Liam Landau of Pascach Hills was the states TOP SOPH at 13' 6" for 11th place. posts.Title: 16 CIRCUS FLYERS'  @  NB NATIONALS !!!!
posts.Content: HV FLYIN' CIRCUS Warwick Valley,NY Greensboro,NC - Flyin' Circus salutes the …"SWEET SIXTEEN" !!! The 2017 Outdoor Circus Vault Tour .. set another record on the final Fiberglass stop… yes… 16 Fiber-Athletes from little ole Flyin' Circus represented our club with pride and dignity..and … and special moments. Each athlete produced their own success story this year… with deep performances from all national qualifiers. This record number of 16 vaulters breaks our old record of 10 National Vaulters in this meet . CIRCUS leads the nation this year in depth…and there is strength in numbers…. CONGRATULATIONS to all vaulters and families!!! "ELEVATING- our- SPORT" …. There comes a time in every athletes career…to raise up the " glory of sport"…to measure up with all our mite…to reveal character and…leadership…and a "true spirit" of competitive athletics. This was never more evident than this entire weekend in Greensboro, North Carolina. THANK YOU for KEEPING YOUR PROMISES !!!!!! Friday…The Rising Stars Emerging Elite Pole Vault was sensational despite the 95' temps /humid conditions. Warwick Valley Soph..Kaeli Thompson flew big over her highest starting height and was super close at 11' 6.5" for the WAVE. New England Champion..Lia Zavattaro(Old Greenwich,CT) also was solid at 11' 6.5" for the Cardinals! Weston,CT senio Danielle Cass , heading to High Point University next fall and Soph Elise Hall(Raleigh,NC) competed tough and look forward to our summer girls camp on July 13-14. Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) senior Jason MMezhibovsky,this years MOC New Jersey Champion flew 14' 9.5"PR and place 9th overall in the 42 boy field. Part Time Ryan Lawless(Commack,NY) also flew 14' 9.5' for Coach Hendersen. Warwick Valley,NY senior Vault Captain completed a stories career on his biggest pole ever for Coach Potter. Saturday … The GIRLS NATIONAL USA POLE VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS…. Anna Watson,Orange,Ohio senior sets a new Championship Record with her 13' 9" sail and ever so close at 14' 0"!!! The Circus junior..Abby Norwillo(Duyea,PA) continued her solid vaulting..with a 12' 10" official school record for 9th place on her biggest pole of the year to win her runway. Bear Creek,PA senior and Penn relays Champion , Madisyn Hawkins flew 12' 2 and used her biggest stick…Alana Carroll(Averill Park,NY) sailed 12' 2" for Coach Cauthers… Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) went big over 11' 10" for Coach Tim Wilson..NV-Demarest,NJ senior Michelle Rubinetti capped a brilliant HS career for Coach Mike Ives at 11' 6.5"..and Amanda McNelis(Commack,NY) looked solid at 11' 6.5" for Coach Jim Hendersen. Jess Ippolito(Fair Lawn,NY) heads to University of Rhode Island next fall!!! Sunday….The BOYS NATIONAL USA POLE VAULT CHAMPIONSHIPS…. ERICK DUFFY,North Andover,MA) was ready-to-Roll down the runway… This talented and most humble senior completed a senior year in Massachusetts like no other athlete ever. He won both the huddles and pole vault at MA STATE,.. set school record open 110 Hurdles 14'10..then punched out a 13' 9" in the 8th place Shuttle Hurdle Relay..before he VAULTER 17' 1" for the NATIONAL POLE VAULT TITLE!!!! His run and plant were in line all day for Coach Brenner Abbot and he heads to Harvard next fall to join the Crimson!! Also having a great field day was Ambler,PA senior State Champion..Nick Marino of Philly Jumps. Nick placed 3rd at 16' 1.25" with air-to-spare for Coach Brian Monschine and heads to Bucknell next fall. Placing 8th was Johannes Stronhaug of Vestel,NY at 15' 3.5' for Coach Jim Cerra. Milan Spisek(Easton,PA)..the CT STATE CHAMP flew 14' 9.5' for Coach Jeff Dumas ..Colin Dunigan(BronxvillemNY-Junior) made 14' 9.5" for Coach Brian Carney.. Senior strongman..Marc DeLuca of West Hill was big all day for Coach Neal Perry and heads to UCONN next Fall!!!! CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!! FLYING CIRCUS NEXT MEET..Wed. June 21 4pm Warm Up/5pm Start FLYIN' CIRCUS…"BELIEVE in your MIRACLE"

posts.Title: SUMMER CIRCUS BARNYARD MEET #4 -----  MADISYN HAWKINS(PA) .. 12' 8" ….JOHANNES STROMHAUG(NY)  14' 8"  !!!!
posts.Content: The Flyin' Circus Summer Vault Series The BarnYard Pits Warwick, NY It was all about lawn chairs and friendships at the 4th Summer Circus meet at the Vault Headquarters at the Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development on Wednesday… with 25 acrobatic vaulters and 8 Volunteer Parents and Coaches helping fuel the Vault Spirit under clear blue summer skies!!! With down home country music blasting and rhythmic clapping on the third jumps… the show was on in the outdoor barnyard pits. Madisyn Hawkins(Wilkes-Barr,PA).. this years Penn Relays Vault Champion. set another school outdoor record..with her big 12' 8" sail and close jumps at 13' 2" on her BIG GIRL POLE!!! She will be back for the BBQ Meet on July 15!!! Super jumps also on the main runway came from Lia Zavarraro(CT) 11' 8'…Caroline McGann(NJ) 11' 8" and Danielle Heine(PA) 11' 8" School Record!!! Taking the gold honors on the Red Pit…was Warwick Valley's Genevieve "Sunshine" Reilly at 9' 8" and near 10' 2" PR! The Boys Main show was headed up by Johannes Stromhaug of Vestel ,NY. This junior leaped 15' 7" this spring for Coach Cerra and he used borrowed poles for his 14' 8" win. Martin Desmery(New Paltz) was sensational at 14' 2" PR!!!… The Red Pit winner was Warwick Valley freshman…Mack Hallett @ 9' 2"!!! Full Results…… June 28 #4 Girls… 1-Madisyn Hawkins(PA) 12' 8' Sch.Record 2-Lia Zavattaro(CT) 11' 8" 3-Caroline McGann(NJ) 11' 8" 4-Danielle Heine(PA) 11' 8" Sch.Record 5-Nicole Lester(NJ) 10' 2" 6-Samantha Kaplan(NY) 10' 2" Girls Red Pit… 1-Genevieve reilly(NY) 9' 8' 2-Sydney Tomaine(NY) 8' 8" 3-Catherine Sandt(NJ) 7' 8" 4-Keira Coulard-Smith(NY) 7' 8' 5-Carmen Sullivan(NJ) 6' 2" 6-Juliana Spisek(CT) 6' 2". Boys… 1-Johannes Stromhaug(Vestel,NY) 14' 8" 2-Martin Desmery(NY) 14' 2"PR 3-Dane Sorensen(NY) 13' 8" 4-Brian Rubenstein(NJ) 13' 8" 5-Milan Spisek(CT) 13' 8"(5 Step) 6-Trevor Hazell(NJ) 13' 2" 7-Kevin Nam(NJ) 12' 8" 8-Nick Villanueva(NY) 12' 8" 9-Zack Matson(CT) 11' 2" Chad Regan/Alex Baretz--NH Special thanks to Bob Sorensen,Laura Spiesek,Marissa Robbins,Marcus Zavattaro,Jessica IppolitoMaryl Hallett for helping with all meet registration and management. ## Special Note… Pictured above is vintage photo of 2 Time Olympic Vault Champion and 11 Time Millrose Games Champion… The Reverand Bob Richards… vaulting 15' 4,5" @ Millrose Games,NYC..into the sawdust pit on a steel pole at Madison Square Garden!!!!!   The good old CIRCUS BARNYARD BBQ MEET was  filled  with  joy, spirit   and  laughter all day long...as  85 pole vaulters enjoyed  the perfect conditions  and atmosphere at the  3rd BBQ Meet.  The food  was  outstanding from Greg's BBQ spit grill...the vault stories were half-truths  ..the family gathering was  special ...the music  was  'country'  and the  drinks  were chilled...JOE TEA !!!!!

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS BEACH PARTY ... 36 HAPPY BEACH VAULTERS!!!!
posts.Content: Hudson Valley Flying Circus Beach Fun Day..Seaside Heights,NJ < It is never about punching out a big height...but..rather about spending a great day together at the beach. CONGRATULATIONS to all 36 HV CIRCUS athletes...coaches...and families at this past weekends Seaside Heights Vertical Pole Vault Adventure. This togetherness is what the intent of athletic participation was designed for.... everyone striving for they own best performance...and cheering everyone along the path. Our club was built on this premise and our mission of supporting each other is a powerful and holistic dream come true. Thank you for passing on the TRADITION !!!!! Coach Cauthers and Coach Duffy made all the right adjustments on this 25 MPH wind-blown day on the hot sand at the Steel Pier at Seaside. 36 Vaulters closed out a fantastic season at HVFC... with great promise ahead for next indoor at all levels. posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS …POLE VAULT PARADISE" ….ARE YOU READY   ?????
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Warwick Valley,NY

TRADITION …. MAGIC ….MYTH …. LEGEND ………of the "FLYING CIRCUS".

The past 25 years @ Flying Circus Pole Vault have been filled with rich traditions of "spirit" and unbelievable levels of "motivation". The 'Kids on Circus Fiberglass' ... have set some very high standards for all our incoming Pole Vault athletes of 2017-18 . .. as each will strive to add to the legendary stores and performances of dedication….spirited preparation and total effort. These are the qualities that endure and are most respected. Are you ready to write your story of success. It all begins this Sunday…September 3rd…as our 25th Year of Fiber-Flying takes off!!!!! Join us for all the action and fun. FLYING CIRCUS is BACK-in-SESSION!!!!! Our Fall season is an 8 week program of progressive drills and short run vaulting …. 3 days per week in an open setting for all levels. Ability grouping on 3 pits at short run for the first 4 weeks and moving to mid-long run approaches the final 4 weeks. Our Super Sunday Vault programs are gender based instruction…Girls Class 12:30-2pm and Boys Class 2-3:30pm @ $30 per athlete at the door registration. Our Tuesday and Thursday open evening instruction classes are mixed gender at 5:30-7pm and 7-8:30pm @ $30 per athlete at the door registration. It's your time for pole vault development now….Join us for some Championship Pole Vaulting !!!

FALL POLE VAULT MEETS @ CIRCUS…

We are offering two exciting Pre-Season Circus Pole Vault Meets for all vaulters…. Saturday October 28, 2017 Circus #1 Fall Vault…. 10AM… Girls Meet /// 2PM Boys Meet on the "FASTEST RUNWAYS on the PLANET".. $30 Registration/Athlete At-the-Door!!! Saturday November 4, 2017 Circus #2 Fall Vault.. 10AM.. Girls Meet /// 2PM Boys Meet on the "FASTEST RUNWAY on the PLANET".…$30 Registration/Athlete At-the-Door!!!

ARMORY 1 DAY POLE VAULT CAMP

Join the fun…all levels of vaulters… Pre Season 1 Day Pole Vault Camp at the World Famous…New Balance Track & Field Center Armory!!!! Saturday November 18, 2017. Site of the National Track & Field "Hall of Fame" and 2018 NB Indoor Nationals!!! This camp staffed by the Flying Circus…..Join Coach Duffy…Coach St...,Coach Cauthers and Coach Nesbitt for some technical instruction. Limited to the first 20 vaulters to register at the armory track.com … Cost $150 per athlete!!!!

"CIRCUS TRADITION"…… 25 Years of Magic!!!

CIRCUS BOYS TRADITION…. Circus Record Holder-- Jordan Yamoah --- 17' 1" 10 Other Vaulters Over 16' + 28 Other Boys Over 15' + 25 "All Americans" …. 52 "State Vault Champions" CIRCUS GIRLS TRADITION …. posts.Title: "GET-READY-TO-FLY" …WINTER CLUB REGISTRATION OPENS OCTOBER  1 !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club Warwick Valley,NY USATF Club # 06-1129 Welcome to the "House of Fiberglass" @ FLYING CIRCUS CENTRAL, Warwick, New York. Our Fall Vaulting 'Macro Cycle' is in full swing now with our Sunday-Tuesday and Thursday Sessions filled with motivated and serious athletes learning the basic pole vault techniques from drills…apparatus and short run vaulting. Our Base Foundation is being built for the up-coming Indoor Track & Field season and already the results and improvements are …" Off-the-Charts"…with unbelievable success stories awaiting our Fall Vaulters. Emphasis has shifted to posture….run dynamics and pole drop plant areas for this fall. Our Fall season has just 5 more weeks…so grab your spikes and join the chase with us every Sunday-Tuesday and Thursday's at The Flying Circus Vault Barn at The Warwick Center.

WINTER CLUB REGISTRATION OPENS OCTOBER 1, 2017

Our most sought after Pole Vault Instruction Package …. CIRCUS WINTER CLUB (November 6- February 6) Registration Forms will be on line at our web-site… www.hvflyingcircus.com and e-mailed to all members on Saturday October 1, 2018. This is a limited 3 month training package that is only open to the first 24 Boys and first 24 Girls to register with full payment. Last year we sold out in the first 2 days…so if you are serious about being with us this Winter..you must register ASAP.. The waiting list last year was 42 vaulters deep. The sessions are gender based, with Boys Classes Monday and Wednesday nights and Girls Classes at Tuesday and Thursday nights November 6-Febuary 6... Session #1 will be 5:30-7pm and Session #2 will be 7-8:30pm. There will be ability grouping instruction on all pits. The cost of this package is $475 per vaulter for the 3 month season…our most economical package we offer here at Flying Circus. Each athlete must be a current member of USATF for all activities. All accepted athletes will be posted at our web site when our classes are full.

"MAKINGS of CHAMPIONS"

Many things have changed the past 25 years here @ Flying Circus. Pole Vaulting at most high schools and clubs in this country is a loner's sport…with only a few daring boys and girls participating in pole vault on every team. But, then you pole vault here and everything is different. At Flying Circus…our concept is about TEAM POLE VAULTING. Helping each other becomes the beauty of our participation. Each vaulter pushes in the team direction…. assisting…motivating…. encouraging and caring for each other all the way. Practice sessions are filled with positivity and spirited leadership . Our motto is "Dedication trumps Talent" and the journey of pole vault development is shared. Winning is fun. Sure. But winning is not entirely the point. Preparing yourself to excel is the point of sport. Never giving up is the point. Never letting each other down is the point. Competing with Spirit…Class ... and Dignity is the point of athletic participation here at Flying Circus. You develop a real sense of responsibility to each other and to your school. You begin to measure up to the very best that is in you…your focus and goals take on a special meaning. Things have changed at Flying Circus since that first November evening in 1992 at the Warwick Valley Middle School Pole Vault Gym session….when Coach Cauthers and Coach St. combined efforts to begin a true pole vault club for all athletes…..all ages…all schools…… The Flying Circus has launched based on the spirit and attitudes of many focused dedicated and tough kids committed to supporting each other at very turn….. Thank You for making FLYING CIRCUS a positive happening!!!!

UP-COMING FLYING CIRCUS PRE-SEASON MEETS

Come Join-the-Mix…. and have some great fun together….Flying Circus Home barn Meets just 4 weeks away !!!!! CIRCUS #1 ..Saturday October 28, 2017 Girls Meet at 10:01AM Boys Meet at 2:01PM… Cost ..Still Just $30/Athlete CIRCUS #2 ..Saturday November 4, 2017 Girls Meet at 10:01AM Boys Meet at 2:01PM . Cost..Still Just $30/Athlete Doors Open 1 hour before meets…Low starting heights…."Fastest Runways on Planet"..Great Music.. Joe Tea Flying Circus… " I will get ready…and then …..perhaps my chance will come."

posts.Content:
The HV Flying Circus Pole Vault Nuts Warwick Valley, NY The Steel…Bamboo and Fiberglass Flyers are almost ready for the Grand Tour of Indoor Track & Field. Our Fall Prep season has never been better and it's time to have some FUN!!!! Please join us this year for some good old 'Ramblin' Fiber Stick Vaulting. The Flying Circus coaching staff will be at the following meets to help all vaulters ... from all schools. Ask your High School coach if any of these meets fit your High School schedule.. Most of these meets are school entered meets……. communicate with your High School Coach early and let's fly -the- rafters!!!!!!

2017-2018 "FLYING CIRCUS RAMBLIN' INDOOR POLE VAULT TOUR"

Saturday… October 28 ….. CIRCUS Pre-Season #1 Meet… Warwick,NY Girls @ 10:01am Boys @ 2:01pm Saturday …November 4…. CIRCUS Pre-Season #2 Meet .. Warwick,NY Girls @ 10:01am Boys @ 2:01pm Saturday …December 16.. AT&T Invitational @ NY Armory,NYC….. 9am Friday …… December 29. Marine Corps Games @ NY Armory,NYC …9am Fri/Sat ….. January 5-6 …. HispanicGames Invite @ NY Armory,NYC…. 9am Fri/Sat…… January 11-12 .. UCS Spirit National Pole Vault Summit, Reno,Nevada 9am Fri-Sat ….. January 19-20 .. New Balance Games @ NY Armory,NYC….. 9am Monday…. February 5 …….Varsity Classic @ NY Armory,NYC……. 4pm Tuesday …February 20 …. Eastern States Championships @ NY Armory,NYC… 4pm Saturday …March 3 ……… New York State Championships@ Ocean Breeze,NY… 9am Fri-Sat-Sun…March 9-10-11 ..New Balance Indoor Nationals @ NY Armory,NYC… TBA WINTER TRAINING PACKAGE….CLASS ASSIGNMENTS/GROUPS will be sent out this week to all and posted. Thank you for entering again this year.. We have 48 talented and dedicated young athletes starting on November 6 and we will be deep with motivation and improvements. Our Tuesday and Thursday Open sessions will end on November 2. All vaulters not in the Winter Training Package can get Vault Instruction every Sunday at Circus… Girls Class 12:30-2pm Open… and Boys Class 2-3:30pm Open … Cost..Still just $30 per athlete. Our Winter Training Club athletes should avoid the Sunday Open Sessions to allow other vaulters runway time/instruction. Reaching for EXCELLENCE …… * Everyday is a training day. Full time commit. * Progressive Drills must be mastered… Drills make the vault champion. * Goal setting works. Establish your training goals. * Positive attitudes beat Negative attitudes every day of the week. Stay POSITIVE and UP-BEAT. * Appreciate your abilities…. use your "gifts" to the fullest. * A person with "A Driving Spirit" …is more powerful than a person with all the facts. * Train beyond your boundaries…. Train "outside-the-box" … Increase 'Comfort Zone' DREAM IT….. SEE IT ……. FEEL IT …… TRUST IT ……. Flying Circus ….. Come Fly With Us.

posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON… 11' 6"   &  SCOTT RATHBUN… 15' 1"  SOAR  @ CIRCUS #1 MEET !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault, LLC Warwick,NY Flying Circus #1 Meet The Pole Vault Season has officially started!!!! The 21 athletes gathered up their spirit and courage…to produce super results at the real bars at the Flying Circus Pre-Season #1 Meet in the Vault Barn hayloft on Saturday. The positive atmosphere and constant cheering and support clapping provided the adeline to fly. Congratulations to all athletes and parents for a great start to the season. Special thanks to meet managers Bob Sorensen and Beth Belcher for another organized fun day. Next Pre-Season meet….next Saturday..November 4 !!!!!

"9 TOUGH GIRLS"

It's not easy opening the pre-season on the real bars…." but toughness took over and won again". Warwick Valley,NY junior Kaeli Thompson… used her balanced long run speed to hit 11' 6"indoor PR …. a two foot improvement from last years opening meet!!!! She had a close look at 12' 1"…. Caroline McGann(Holy Angels,NJ) flew 11' 0" by a foot and Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) opened big also. Top Middle School athlete was West Milford,NJ Chloe Pasek…at 8' 0" for the rising Highlander 8th grader!!!! Girls Results…. Taking the Green Pit win was Old Tappan,NJ freshman..Shaun Herlihy at 8' 0"… Bennett Hemphill(Fairfiled,CT) won Top Middle Schooler at 6' 6"!!! Check web site for assignment….Come dressed for training…spikes/water/warm sweats/tights and a positive attitude for some new and never seen drills and progressive techniques. The Girls Groups will push up the fiberglass on Tuesday's and Thursdays' 5:30-7pm class and 7-8:30pm class… Be 15 minutes EARLY and READY TO FLY… NO Class switching/No class make-ups…Plan to commit to excellence…… It's going to be a SUPER SEASON AGAIN @ FLYING CIRCUS!!!!

FLYIN' CIRCUS GEAR & APPAREL

It's time to represent… we are most proud of you being on our little Pole Vault Club and you will represent us this year. Our fund raising project this year is "GEAR and APPAREL" Sale for all members and alumni… Check out our CIRCUS GEAR on our web site and try to order something if you can.. This generates funds for our new poles and equipment this indoor!!!! We are only taking pre paid orders till Sunday November 12…so that we can deliver before the holidays….. JOIN the CIRCUS APPAREL FAMILY FUN with us this winter. Thank you in advance for all your loyal support in all our projects this past year. All envelopes with athletes name/order and payment due NOVEMBER 12 at the Barn. FLYING CIRCUS ……. POLE VAULT PARADISE. JOE TEA ….. "LIGHTING-in-a-BOTTLE" …The official drink of FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLUB.

posts.Title: WARWICK VALLEY CENTRAL'S….POLE VAULT MEET …DANE SORENSEN  14' 7" …. KAELI THOMPSON  12' 1" !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC The Warwick Valley VAULT BARN IT WAS "BIG-FRIDAY" at the Flying Circus VAULT BARN all day…as our College Alumni continued to soar from their short run approaches and our Warwick Valley Central High School athletes vaulted their real bars in their first intra-squad VAULT MEET of the INDOOR SEASON . The college/alumni athletes were impressive…better run mechanics…better posture…stronger and more focused than ever. They are meeting the challenge of the next level of sport. It was fun being back together and we will schedule 2-3 more COLLEGE DAYS during the Winter Holiday break. THANK YOU all for coming Back-to-the-Barn Wednesday and today!

Warwick Valley High School Inter-Squad VAULT MEET …. WILDCATS OPEN BIG!!!

The traditional UCS Spirit purple fiberglass crossbars kept going up all day for the Boys and Girls team of vaulters fueled by … "JOE TEA". Senior Vault Captain..DANE SORENSEN looked sharp coming off his 10 day rest period from an extensive summer and fall program. Using small length poles to his advantage….hit 14' 7' easily and great bars at 15' 2"!!!! Junior team mate…Jacob Becher..was super close at 12' 1" bar, using his speedy approach from just six steps…. Sophomore…Mike Moore..coming off his football success…placed 10' 7" to equal his all time personal best. These three boys will be on Coach Mike Potter's traveling team this indoor!!! Watch for them!!! The Girls VAULT TEAM is also loaded and ready to compete at West Point and The Armory!!! Junior Vault Captain…KAELI THOMPSON is leading-the-way with spirited leadership and took the trials with a 12' 1" Fly-Over personal best and did not try any higher!!!!! Sophomore…Genevieve Reilly…one of the Wildcats top distance runners proved she can also fly… with her 10' 1" clear on her bigger poles… and watch out for the up-and-coming sophomore Caroline Fatta ..who just narrowly missed her 10' 1" PR bar!!! Warwick Valley " VAULT TRADITION " continues this Winter!!!

ARMORY POLE VAULT CAMP…HUGE SUCCESS !!!!

The Flying Circus Pole Vault Staff would like to THANK Armory Assistant Track Director Aaron Robinson and the Armory Foundation for promoting our event last saturday at the ALL DAY POLE VAULT CAMP at the Armory Center.. The 24 athletes and coaches enjoyed the super day of drills…video…Olympians talks and the unbelievable atmosphere that only the New Balance Armory can provide. The improvements were many and the athletes were humble. TRAIN HARD … SERVE BEST!!!!!!

"SUPER SUNDAYS" …. POLE VAULT DEVELOPMENT CONTINUES!!!!!

If you want to vault higher…..in the most positive atmosphere on the planet… then join us every Sunday-At-The-Barn Revival….. New drills are making an impact and we want you to ..JOIN-THE-DEVELOPMENT…. Girls Instruction… 12:30-2PM… All ability levels…. Boys Instruction… 2-3:30PM …All abilities …. Cost… $30 At-the-Door per athlete. ONLY CLOSED…SUNDAY January 14 for NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT, Reno,NV !!!!! FLYING CIRCUS……. Athlete Centered Athletics.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLYER'S " …. READY-FOR-LAUNCH  ….  THIS WEEK  !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Crew, LLC Scenic Warwick Valley, New York The Flying Circus '12 week Prep Phase' …. is over !!!!! Congratulations to all vaulters on a super fall and early winter phase of base work for our up-coming indoor competitive meet schedule. Your positive attitudes… unbelievable spirit … and toughness are about to shine in all the venues across our five states. You will effect many other athletes on your journey with your positive kindness and unbelievable team and individual sportsmanship. Athletic participation is a unique opportunity to display your character and moral ethics. Let's show the world how we can compete with class and dignity. Support each other every chance you get…. after-all… we are all in this TOGETHER!!!! READY- to- LAUNCH- the- ROCKET……. fueled by the one and only….. JOE TEA !!!!!!!

NEWS @ CIRCUS

COLLEGE VAULT HOLIDAY PRACTICE…… Let's get together again…. we miss you!!!! Thursday December 21 …. Men & Women…. 2:30-4PM AT-THE-BARN. Wednesday December 27 … Men & Women… 3:30-5PM AT THE BARN. CIRCUS APPAREL IS IN!!!!! Pick Up will be from the Barn beginning Wednesday ,,,December 13 at practices. Thank you for ordering this year and funds will be well used for heating the Barn and equipment for all. SPECIAL THANKS to Flying Circus parent…BETH BECHER for organizing and making this project a HUGE SUCCESS. Our brand now reaches out to all would be athletes needing help with their vaulting. Wear it well!!!! HOLIDAY CLOSINGS @ CIRCUS…… Our regular Winter classes will be running thru the Holiday School Break at Regular times.. we will be CLOSED on Super Sunday.. December 24 and Monday Christmas Day …December 25…. Super Sunday December 31 and Monday January 1 and Super Sunday January 14 for National Pole Vault Summit trip. MADISYN HAWKINS BREAKS LEHIGH VAULT RECORD….. Lehigh University freshman…Madisyn Hawkins(Wilkes Barre,PA) sailed 12' 0" at her indoor meet on Friday night at Rauch Fieldhouse from just 5 steps!! This engineering freshman is making an impact already!!! Congratulations Madisyn !!!! LOOKING for the NIKE POLE VAULT SPIKES…. We have found some for you to purchase at half price!!!! This Nike $120 value PV Spike is selling as a close out for just $60 …while they last.. Contact Bill Mongovan at RUNNERS ROOST in Darien.CT at 203-655-9937. Runners Roost…Goodwives Shopping Center…. 25 Old Kings Highway North…Darien,CT also at RUNTHEROOST@gmail.com
FLYING CIRCUS …….. Achieving 'Arete'…. in athletics and in competition…the memorable thing, is not to excel against others…but against yourself. The real contest is within. We strive for excellence the ancient Greeks called..'arete' … to be the best possible you.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS ATHLETES OPEN.....Abby Norwillo 12' 6"....Kaeli Thompson 12' 6"  ///  Dane Sorensen  14' 6"....Seth Kricheff  14' 6" LEAD-THE-CHARGE!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC Warwick Valley,NY The Flying Circus Jet is now ..."In-the-Air" !!! Congratulations to every athlete on our little pole vault club and our High School teams in the five surrounding states this past weekend at 5 different meets. They gathered at West Point Gillis Fieldhouse on Friday/Saturday...at the New Balance Track Center Armory in NY City both days and Ocean Breeze on Saturday in Staten Island. They all came to express themselves thru the joys of movement and the unity of teamwork. The concepts of spirit..kindness and helping each other were the main goals achieved in all the venues. Thank you all for making pole vaulting a team event...... sharing poles...catching steps..helping each other with stress and anxiety...thanking officials ...honoring you schools with sportsmanship and humanity..... These are the traits that last forever..long after our careers are over... Thank you all for a GREAT SEASON start up!!!

7 Athletes hit National Quals Standards... 5 New School Indoor Records..... 21 Indoor Personal Bests...

.....Welcome to the 2017-18 Indoor Fiberglass Magic Girls Highlites... Friday Night Fun at the Armory Meet saw Senior Abby Norwillo(Piston Area,PA) set a Meet and School Indoor Record at 12' 6" for the gold and USA#2 Performance.and close bar at 13' 0" from her 8 step..Warwick Valley Junior..Kaeli Thompson placed second with a school record 12' 6" for the junior sprinter and close bar at 13' 0" for Coach Potters Purple Wave. Coming out of the shadows..was junior Sydney Woods(Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ) with her 12' 0" personal best for the Lady Nordsman/women and NB National standard mark. Washingtonville Daniella Raymond and Ava DeFlice(Cornwall took the West Point titles.. Alana Carroll(Averill Prk,NY) took silver at Ocean Breeze at 11' 6" for the Harvard bound Section 2 record holder..Danielle Heine of Abington Heights,PA..just a junior...sailed big over 11' 6" and close bars at 12'0" !!!! Boys Highlites.... Friday Night Fiberglass Action @ the Armory...12 Circus athletes supported each other..as Warwick Valley,NY Senior Dane Sorensen placed second to Colin Duggan...with a big sail over 14' 6" at 10:30pm and ever so close at 15' 0" bar for the third time this season!! Placing third was senior Seth Kricheff of Coach Jeff Clarks Northern Valley Old Tappan,NJ vault crew at 14' 6" clear and close at 15'0".. Team mates Tyler Hrbek(14'0) and Jona Kim(13'0" completed a sensational 42' 6" 3 Man Team Relay score !!!! James O'Neill,NY senior ...Josiah Spain won West Point at 13' 6" in flats and Tommy Qualter of Clarkstown South,NY flew a school record 13' 8" last week in Section 1 Kick-Off meet!!! ****You can't make this stuff up.. it's REAL NEWS!!!!!

posts.Title: 18 CIRCUS VAULTERS SOAR @ ARMORY !!!.. Dane Sorensen  15' 0".PR ....  Abby Norwillo... 12' 8" PR !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Tour Warwick Valley,NY Armory Meet Track Director...Tim Fulton and Dream Big Athletics put together another .".FRIDAY NIGHT AT THE VAULT " gathering with The Jim Mitchell Invitational and our 18 Circus Vaulters enjoyed fling thru the holiday air and supporting each other all night. The very best part of the night was the friendship shared by every athlete.... not just our club athletes...but all athletes chasing their dreams.... Congratulations to all on a fun night and Happy Holiday!!!! The Girls flew first.. yes.. almost 40 girls taking to the fast Mondo runway...with USA#2 Vaulter..Abby Norwillo of Piston Area,PA sailing to the winners' interview after the dust had settled with her New Meet and Indoor School Record of 12' 8" and ever so close at 13' 1" for this humble speedster heading to UPENN next fall. After clean clearing 13' 0" in her warm up..she handled her biggest pole of the early year(165) to the max for a meet and school record.. She returns next Friday for Marine Corp Armory meet!!! Warwick Valley,NY junior...Kaeli "Sparkie" Thompson placed second with her 12' 0" zoom over and close bars at 12' 8" for this USA # 4 Purple Wave... Melissa Purcell of Pascack Valley.NJ Indians cleared huge over 11' 0" for third and Abington Heights,PA junior Dani Heine crushed all her new poles from eight steps placed fourth at 11'0" and Kaia Becher (Northern Highlands,NJ) set her new school indoor record at 10'0"PR for the fifth place for this energized senior. Gabby Lepe(White Plains) 7' 0" Molly Palma(Bronxville) 7' 0" Sophia Felix(Pope John) 7' 0" Jules Gravier(Bronxville) 7' 0" Ava DeFelice(Cornwall) 7' 0" Bridgette Inserra(Northern Highlands) 7' 0"...... The Boys took over the runway late...and the holiday vault fireworks lasted to 10:30pm... as Warwick Valley,NY senior pole vault specialist...Dane Sorensen finally entered the FIFTEEN FOOT CLUB at Warwick Valley... with his last jump sail over 15' 0" for the event win for Coach Mike Potter's Purple Wave Vaulters!!! Dane's summer work ethic and fall season dedication prevailed for this pole vault leader....... Conor Reilly of Union Catholic,NJ also came up big ..as her hit 13' 6" PR for TOP SOPH in NJ this winter..Team mate Obadare Animashaun(UC) hit 11' 0"PR Jacob Becher(Warwick Valley) 9' 6' and Lucas Khowayko(Northern Highlands,NJ) 9' 6" !!! Special thanks to Coach Doug Heine for helping coach all vaulters...all night!!! Keep Training...Keep Lifting...your next pole is awaiting....... Enjoy your Holidays!!!!!!!! Thanks again .......Circus Vaulters!!!!!

posts.Title: "CIRCUS TOUR".....DESTINATION ..."POLE VAULT PARADISE"...RENO,NV!!!!!
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Fun, LLC Warwick Valley, NY It's that time of year again....... it's time to link up with the West Coast Pole Vault community. It's called..The UCS Spirit---National Pole Vault Summit...but..it might be better called.... "The Steve Chappell Fiberglass Motivation Gathering"!!!! Yes...the main man behind the modern pole vault revolution has gathered the best athletes...best coaches and best volunteers to promote our great event again and raise the pole vault to the next level... The Flying Circus will be making it's 15th Straight Trip to the Dance with 16 motivated athletes... 7 dedicated coaches and 8 devoted parents ... we will bring back all the newest theory and technique the West Coast can offer.... We are truly gratefull for everyone making this special trip with us this year. On to the next bar............ Flying Circus Vault Barn will be CLOSED on Thursday January 11, 12, 13, 14. We will reopen Monday January 15 for Regular Winter Classes in the regular time sessions. Weekend News Jan. 3-6 Rockland Coaches @ RCC... Arlington,NY junior...Kristen Kolarik flew to a new PR at 9' 9" for the Girls Varsity gold medal... Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern) placed second at 9' 2"PR..Fiona Carroll(TZ) also 9' 2"PR Rebecca Baez(No Rockland) 8' 6' Lauren Hancher(TZ) 8' 6" Kelly Rattigan(JJ-EF 8' 0" Cassie Wishner(Nyack) 8' 0' Haley Merchant(HH) 7' 6" Gabby Lepe(White Plains 7' 6' ... In the Boys Varsity..Chris Filatov of Nanuet set his new PR at 14' 0"..Tommy Qualter(CS) 13' 6" Will Grady(Arlington) 11' 6" Ron O(Nanuet) 10' 6" Henry Pennella(Valhalla) 9' 0'. Ocean Breeze Games ..... Dave Bausmith(Hunterdon Central,NJ) 14' 0" Tom Qualter(CS) 13' 0" Engene Om(Nanuet) 12' 0" Matt Warren(Wash'ville) 11' 0" Girls...Kristin Lubeski)MW).. 11' 0" for gold... Gabby Nebiker(MW) 10' 0" Julia Penna(MW) 9' 6" Rebecca Baez(NR) 8' 6" Lindsey Julian(Wash'ville) 7' 6" Hispanic Games @ Armory..... The pole vault took center stage at the 23rd Hispanic Games on Saturday before an overflow crowd of spectators and athletes.... Charles Crispi of Farrell Prep was laser focused all day and flew BIG over 16' 1" meet record for Coach Cahill. He was ever so close at 16' 5"...and is now TOP SEED for the Jr. Pole Vault Event at NYRR MILLROSE GAMES on Thursday Febuary 1. Congratulations Charles and Jerry!!! Placeing a solid and tough 3rd place was senior Dane Sorensen of Warwick Valley,NY.. After his 23.9 relay carry..her punched over 14' 6" with air and close bars at 15' 0" for Coach Potter. Liam Landau (Pascack Hills) 13' 6" Enis Rama (Wagner) 12' 0" Will Grady(Arlington) 10' 0" Jacob Becher(Warwick Valley) 10' 0" Lucas Klowaylo(North Highlands) 10' 0" Girls... 18 Circus Girls stayed together after a packed warm up...Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) hit a New Meet Record at 12' 6" and then was close at 13' 3.5" for the USA #1 lead. She heads to Reno on Thursday.... Warwick Valley,NY junior Kaeli Thompson went 12' 0" and raced the 4 x 400 Relay for the Wave... Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest,NJ) came up big over 11' 7" for Coach Mike Ives...Dani Heine(Abington Heights,PA) is making her move up to the 13' 1' pole series and placed at 11' 0" and close bars at 11' 7" Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) looked best of seson at 11' 7" Caroline McGann(HA) 10' 6" Juliana Schraer(PV) 9' 6" Sydney Tomaine(FDR) 9' 0" PR Kaia becker(N Highlands) 9' 0" Jamie Rossig(PH) 8' 0" Cassie Wishner(Nyack) 8' 0" Gabby Lepe(WP) 7' 6" Bridgette Inserra(N.Highlands) 7' 0" Jenn McGann(HA) 7' 0" Olivia Touftounijian(HA) 7' 0" Ava DeFelice(Cornwall) 7' 0" !!!!!

"MOTIVATED YOUNG ATHLETES"

Some people set higher standards for themselves. They come out early for practice and they stay late. They always seem to find the time to do things right. They have that 'inner spirit' and that positive approach to every set back... they lead others by example...they encourage others with soft words.... The motivated athletes take an interest in others.... they are respected by all for their HARD WORK ETHIC..... they actually pole vault for each other and never look back. This is the true beauty of Flying Circus Pole Vault. NEVER GIVING UP IS THE POINT COMPETING with CLASS ..IS THE POINT. CARING for OTHERS >>>IS THE POINT. STAYING HUMBLE>>>IS THE POINT. MEASURING UP TO YOUR BEST...IS THE POINT. ... THANK YOU FOR POLE VAULTING @ FLYING CIRCUS

posts.Title: 2018 RENO SUMMIT POLE VAULT FUN !!!  SUPER RESULTS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Family, LLC Warwick Valley, NY The FLYING CIRCUS FAMILY WENT WEST!!!!!! YES------- 32 Flying Circus ATHLETES---PARENTS---COACHES traveled to the ..." 8th WONDER-of-the-WORLD " ... The UCS SPIRIT NATIONAL POLE VAULT SUMMIT this past weekend in Reno,Nevada and what a learning experience it was. It's true.....when young teams start bonding together... building mutual respect for each other...and showing compassion for each other...... the world gets brighter in every way. This is the character building blocks of scholastic athletics. Character development is the mission of sport @ Flying Circus. Let's pass -it-on to everyone!!!!! CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU ALL for a SUPER SUMMIT!!!!!!

ALANA CARROLL...12' 8" ....TYLER HRBEK... 14' 6" lead a STRONG CIRCUS TEAM !!!

There were 17 athletes competing... and... 17 wonderful stories to be told at this 30th NATIONAL SUMMIT sponsored by UCS Spirit and directed by Mr. Steve Chappell. The 2018 version was perhaps..the best ever and largest ever (over 2, 2000 athletes/coaches/parents) treated to 2 days of non-stop pole vault excitement. From the Beginner athletes ..to the Olympic Champions...the Hall-of-Famers ... to the Rising New Stars... IT WAS A HAPPENING !!!! We will make the technique adjustments and apply them to each member of our little club.... It's time to raise - the- bar in training!!!!! Leading Girls department was Alana Carroll(Averill Park,NY) with her 12' 8" New Indoor School Record in Pit #1... This Harvard bound scholar was close at 13' 2!!! Backing her up on Pit #1 was Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA) at 12' 0" and big all night at 12' 8"!! Kicking up her speedy heels...was Coach Stephanie Duffy...coached by Sparky Thompson all night...and 12' 0" jump for 3rd on Pit #5 Open.... Taking the gold medal on Pit #3...was Warwick Valley,NY Kaeli Thompson at 11' 8" and big over 12' 2 bars. Winning Gold at Pit #5 was Ridgwood,NJ senior gymnast..Nicole Lester with her all-time PR 11' 6' leap for the Maroons.. Backing her up on Pit #5 was Lauren saifi(Gov.Livingston,NJ) with a second place 11' 2" PR. Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ junior... Sydney Woods looked fast again with her 11' 4" soaring... Holy Angels,NJ senior..Bucknell bound honor student ..Caroline McGann was ready and made 10' 8" by a ton on her bigger poles of the early season... Greenwick,CT Champion..Lia Zavattaro flew 10' 4" from short run.light pole for next years Bison recruit... Making some great jumps at Pit #11..was 8th grader,,Chloe Pasek of West Milford,NJ... with 7'8" make and close at PR 8' 2" !!! The most exciting new on Friday Morning and Friday Night Pro vault was our very own Megan "Flips" Clark of the Olympic Training Center's Chris Mack group. After a national "shout out" in the morning session.. Megan flew big all night over 14' 2 and 14' 7" brush off.... her positive attitude was the class of the field!!! She will be in the 111th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES on February 3 at the ARMORY!!!! The Boys/Men's group was lead by Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ...senior Tyler Hrbek... with his 14' 6" zoom over for Coach Jeff Clark on Pit #4. Tyler was invited to NYRR MILLROSE GAMES jr. Valet Event on Thursday February 1 at 6PM!! Also sailing was warwick Valey,NY senior sprinter/vaulter..Dane Sorensen over 14' 4" by a foot!!! Dane was also invited to NYRR MILLROSE GAMES based on his 15' 0" Armory Vault. Jona Kim(NV-Old Tappan,nJ) was solid at 12' 10" bar... Coach Will Nesbitt(Garrison,NY) ..came off his flu sick bed to place 2nd on Masters Pit #6 at 12' 6" and close at 12' 10 for the former Dukie....Jacob Becher was ruling Pit # 11 in the late afternoon.. and produced his best on indoor at 10' 8" and 11' 0" for the Warwick Valley Flash(Junior)... Carlton Huff.. of Vault Factory was inspiring all weekend and hit 10' 4" in Masters Comp for Coach Carl. "Big Air" was Seth Kricheff of NV-Old Tappan,NJ... this senior also is one of the 14 athletes invited to NYRR MILLROSE GAMES next month!!!

TRAINING EMPHASIS for January-February...

We will be taking of technique training up to and include all UCS Summit Clinic Level 3 Drills and Progressions. *Including Take Off Pent Step....Double Arm Strike...Left Arm Drills....Chest Drive Up-Dates and Grip Adjustments.... Soft Bar Vaulting Get ready for some Mid Season changes!!!! "If it is to be...... then..'''it's up-to-me." --------- Flying Circus

posts.Title: The 11th  NYRR MILLROSE GAMES...JR.POLE VAULT  BOYS and GIRLS.."READY-TO-FLY" !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club, LLC Warwick Valley, New York POLE JUMPING NEWS FLASH ... January 29, 2018 Welcome to the 111th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES POLE VAULT SPECTACULAR. The NYRR MILLROSE GAMES history is rich in Pole Vault Tradition and this year's three separate pole vault events are loaded with it's deepest and most competitive fields ever. Meet director, Ray Flynn and Company ...has provided the highest flyers in meet history for this edition at The New Balance Track & Field Center Armory on Thursday Evening, February 1 and Saturday February 3. It will be a blend of the up and coming.." Future Stars" in the John Catsimatidis Jr.Boys Pole Vault Event taking place on Thursday evening at 7 PM...with New York Star,,,Charles Crispi of Staten Island heading the field of 15 athletes with his 16' 3" Indoor best this winter and three Virginia Jr. Stars over 16' 0"+ !!! The John Catsimatidis Jr. Girls Pole Vault Event takes place on Saturday, February 3 at 12 Noon and fast Mondo X runway with 12 of the finest Junior Rising Stars in the USA and the fast improving Swedish Youth Champion,Alva Sundins making this event International for the first time ever. Top seeds in the Girls Jr. Pole Vault are Erica Ellis of Rochester,New York..with a personal best of 14' 1.5" this winter and MacKenzie Hayward of Flower Mound,Texas at 13' 6" (Pictured below). The John and Margo Catsimatidis Womens Professional Pole Vault Event will kick off at 3:58PM on Saturday before a pack house and National NBC TV coverage. Top seeds are 2016 Olympic Gold Champion Katerina Stefanidi of Greece...American 2016 Olympic Silver Medalist Sandi Morris and 2012 Olympic Gold Medalist Jenn Suhr. Also competing with the "Millrose Games Spirit" will be Katie Nageotte,Alysha Newman and Megan Clark. Get ready for some high flying!!!!! Boys Jr. Pole Vault..Thursday February 1 at 7PM (Meet Record -- Armand Duplantis,LA 18' 10.25") Charles Crispi,NY , William Chapman,VA, Harrison Rice, VA Alex Slinkman,VA, Johannes Stromhaugh,NY Payton Morris,PA Joe Jardine,PA Charles Dever,PA Seth Kricheff,NJ Dane Sorensen,NY Colin Duigan,NY Joe Weaver,NY Luke Knipe,PA Zack Stump,MD,Tyler Hrbek,NJ Girls Jr.Pole Vault..Saturday February 3 at 12 Noon (Meet Record -- Desiree Freier, Texas 14' 0" ) Erica Ellis,NY MacKenzie,TX Alex Potts,GA MacKenzie Horn, PA Abigail Norwillo,PA Alana Carroll,NY Adara Christensen,UT Alva Sundins,Sweden Carena Nottoli,PA Kaeli Thompson,NY Lindsey Reed,PA Melissa Purcell,NJ

posts.Title: "NYRR MILLROSE MAGIC"  for CIRCUS VAULTERS ...ALANA CARROLL..NEW RECORD  13' 1.5" !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley, NY The 2018 edition of the ... " Worlds Greatest Indoor Track & Field Meet " was sensational in all the 60 different events... the sell out crowd...the new World Record.. the Youth Champions and the Olympic stars and electric energy was a special treat for all spectators, athletes, coaches and national TV viewers!!! Our 7 Flying Circus pole vaulters came ready to Rock & Roll... Alana Carroll of Averill Park,NY used her 14' UCS Spirit to place silver with a new school and Indoor #1 All Time Circus Club leap of 13' 1.5" for Coach Cauthers and Coach Duffy (Old Circus Indoor Record..Abby Norwillo 13' .05" and Lia Saifi,NJ) 13' .05"). Alana had a close bar at 13' 5.25 ". MacKenzie Hayward of Flower Mound, Texas was the Jr Girls Event winner at 13' 5.25 ". Taking fifth in the loaded 11 girl field was UPENN Bound senior Abby Norwillo of Pittston ,PA at 12' 5.75". Adopted Circus Vaulter .. 16 year Alva Sundins of Sweden placed 6th at 12' 5.75" for Coach Carl Alm.. and Kaeli Thompson of Wave Track Club of Warwick,NY placed equal 8th at 11' 5.75" for Coach Potter Club. Melissa Purcell of Pascack Valley,NJ.. took care of business at Toms River at her SNJ Sectionals for Coach Tim Wilson. The Thursday Night Pole Vault Spectacular at the NYRR Millrose Games Jr. Boys Pole Vault was deep in talent and deep in results. Payton Morris of VaultWorX,PA Club (Coach Matt Concannon) set a personal best at 16' 1.5" to edge Harrison Rice of Aim High Vault Club,VA also hit PR 16' 1.5" for Coach Kyle Bishop. Circus Flyers Dane Sorensen(Warwick,NY) and Seth Kricheff(Old Tappan,NJ) both flew 14' 7.5" with room and close bars at 15' 1.5"... Tyler Hrbek(Old Tappan) soared 14' 1.25" for Coach Jeff Clark. The best part of the Millrose Weekend..was the friendships our vaulters/coaches /parents developed with Sweden's legendary Coach..Carl-Johan Alm and his prize 16 year old student vaulter..Alva Sundins. This part is what sport is all about. Congratulations All!!! Weekend Review.... Feb. 1-4 New Haven,CT---- The Greenwich,CT Cardinals used their powerful balanced scoring attack to win the team title at the FCIAC Championships at Floyd Little Fieldhouse on Thursday night.. Senior leader..Lia Zavattaro won her 5th FCIAC pole vault title to lead the charged up Cardinals. This Bucknell University bound honor student will be teaming-up with fellow Circus Pole Vault star Caroline McGann(Holy Angels,NJ) next fall. Senior Zack Matson of New Millford,CT also won the gold medal at Southwest Conference Championships at 12' 6" PR on that old Black pole her found in the PV shed!!! West Point Division Championships ------ Warwick Valley Central had the bus and "Circled-the-Wagons" again with theier best meet of the indoor season... Girl;s win title..Boys runner-up in the team concept system at Purple Wave High School. Kaeli Thompson punced out 22 team points with her pole vault win..3rd in High jump and 3rd in triple jump.. Caroline Fatta placed 4th in vault (9'0) Sydnet Tomaine(FDR) set school record 9' 6" in Vault . Lindsey Julian of Wizard Pole Vault Club hit 9' 0" Kara Sucato(FDR) 6' 0" . Samantha Becker(Sullivan West) won vault 8' 6"' Dane Sorensen(Warwick) won the vault..hit 37/6 in 300m and split 23.8 in relay duty for big pointsd... Jacob Becher(Warwick) flew 11' 6" in vault(2nd) Matt Warren(Wash'ville) 11'0" NickMirecki(Wash'ville) 10' 6" for Coach Duffy. Josiah Spain (O'Neill) hit 14' 0" in his division...Nick LoForo(Marl) 11' )' . In Saturday's meet. It was ALL MONROE_WOODBURY with the Pole Vault sweep in boys and girls.. Nick Villanueva thw win at 13' 6" and Josh Jeong at 13' 0" for 18 points for Coach Glover/Coach Hemmer crusaders.. Austin O'Mallet of Goshen won his Division at 10'6" Freshman Louis Martinez(Wallkill) placed at 10' 0"PR . Gabby Nebiker(Monroe0 won gold at 10' 6"PR Kristen Lubeski 10' 0" Kaira Coulard-Smith(New Paltz) won at 8' 6" Violet Bachorik(Goshen) 7'0" Ava DeFelice(Cornwall) 7'0" Shea Ross(Wallkill) 6' 0" New Jersey Groups-- Toms River Bubble was exciting ..with Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley ) taking gold at 11'0" in Group 3 Arinia Cavalli(Old Tappan) 10' 6' Marissa DiGia(OT) 10' 0" Kyra Muller(Mahwah) 10' 0" Julia- Schraer(Pascack Valley) 10' 0" Kaia becker(No Highlands) 10' 0" Allison Sumereau(PV) 8' 6' ... Sydney Woods came thru again. This NV-Demarest junior Rising Star won gold at 11' 6" for Coach Ives..Mue Carroll hit 10' 6 in her groups. The Boys were equally sensational..as Seth Kricheff(Old Tappan) flew 15' 0"..Tyler Hrbek(Old Tappan) 14' 6" and Jona Kim(Old Tappan) 13' 0" for powerhouse crew of Jeff Clark. Sam Pitkowsky(Pascach Valley) 12' 6' Mike Parisi(PV) 10' 6" Mark Lynch(Cranford) 10' 6' Justim=n Manne 12' 6" Liam Lamdau(Pascack Hills) won gold at 13' 0".. Lucus Zemser(W Milford) 10' 6".. Chris Hora(Mahwah) 10' 6" Mateo Zemer) W.Milford) 10' 0" More Results coming tonight from Varsity Classic!!! Flying Circus... Friendship and Performance.

posts.Title: ABBY NORWILLO SETS EASTERN STATES VAULT RECORD... 13' .75" !!!!  42 CIRCUS FLYERS ZOOM TOGETHER!!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Warwick Valley,NY " POLE VAULT TOGETHERNESS" ... That was the theme last night at the Boys & Girls eastern States Championships at the Armory on Dr.Sander Boulevard. The 42 Flying Circus Athletes made it a "TEAM EVENT " again with sensational support in the pre event warm up .. .. the real time event competition support and post event festivities.... It's sensational to watch yound kids support each other... CONGRATULATIONS to ALL 42 VAULTERS!!! On to the next challenges together!!! ABBY NORWILLO(Pittston Area,PA) SETS NEW VAULT RECORD at 13' .75" in the deepest field of High School female vaulters EVER!!! This Pittston Area High School Scholar athlete ..bound for PENN UNIVERSITY next fall was clean on her first attempts thru 13' 4" and used her 8 step/big pole to break Leah Saifi's record of 13' .5" set last year in this meet. It also is a new District II PA Indoor All Time Mark and School/Personal Best. She had 2 close bars at 13' 4" and heads to PA State Meet on Sunday. In total ..there were 17 Girls over the National Standard and 7 Girls over 12 Foot Barrier... True Fiberglass fireworks... The Circus had 4 New Vaulters make NB Nationals in the meet... Kristin Lubeski(Monroe,NY) 12' 0"PR... Lauren Saifi(Gov.Liv) 11' 7"PR....Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) 11' 7'.....Trina Barcarola(Western Wayne,PA) and Caroline McGann(Holy Angels,NJ) 11' 7" PR !!! Here is Full Circus Girls.. 1-Abby Norwillo 13' .75" (Record) 2- Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley,NY) 12' 6" 4-Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ) 12' 0" Kristin Lubeski(Monroe,NY) 12' 0" Sydney Woods(NV0Demarest,NJ) 11' 7" Lauren Saifi(Gov.Liv,NJ) 11' 7" Dani Hein(Abington Heights,PA) 11' 7" Lia Zavattaro(Greenwich,CT) 11' 7" Trina Barcarola(Western Wayne,PA) 11' 7" Caroline McGann(Holy Angels,NJ) 11' 7" Corah Krantz(Lakeland,PA) 11' 0" Nicole Lster(Ridgewood,NJ) 11' 0" ..Solid Bars....Arinan Cavalli-Marissa DiGia-Kaia Becker-Gabby Nebiker-Kyra Muller. In the Boys shotout..it was another sensational night for Charles Crispi of Farrell,NY and You Can Not Fail Vault Crew od Coach Jerry Cahill.. Charles won gold at 15' 6' and huge jumps at 16' 0" Tyuker Hrbek of Old Tappan placed second at 15' 0" for Coach JeffClark and team mate Seth Kricheff(OT) was big over 15' 0" also for 4th place medal... Super Sophomore Conor Reilly of Union Catholic continues to improve for the 3 week in a row.. with his 14' 6" PR leap.. Liam Mandau of Pascack Hills,NJ hit 14' 0" ffor the Cowboys and Josiah Spain(On'Neill,NY) sailed 14' 0" ... Solid Bars-- Dane Sorensen-Callunm Howald-Jona Kim-Jared Forer-Justin Manne. CONGRATULATIONS ALL VAULTERS...PARENTS...COACHES.....

posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON SETS INDOOR RECORD @ 13' .025" !!!! TYLER HRBEK SAILS TO STATE GOLD @15' 0" !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, NY The Vault Bar is still going up !!!!! Congratulations to all Flying Circus Vaulters this past weekend at all venues in our five state area. It's a treat to watch real focus and full effort and true sportsmanship in athletics. This is the real prize we all seek.... It's time to regroup for Nationals and our" BEST OUTDOOR SEASON EVER" !!!! THANK YOU ALL !!!

KAELI THOMPSON SETS NEW SECTION 9 INDOOR POLE VAULT RECORD @ WEST POINT!!!

There have been sensational female pole vaulters in Section 9 the past 25 years!!!! Michelle Kercado(Monroe-Woodbury)...Stephanie Duffy(Washingtonville)..Sydney LeRoy(Port Jervis)...Megan Clark(O'Neill) to name just a few who have set the standards high for this new generation on risk taking girls of pole vault. Saturday afternoon at Gillis Fieldhouse a new girl arrived to take the All-Time Section 9 Vault Record up a notch.... Warwick Valley Central High School's All purpose junior athlete...KAELI THOMPSON flew to 13' .025" for a trip to the NY State Meet next weekend at Ocean Breeze for Coach Potter's Purple Wave. Using her 8 step/big grip on her 13' 7" x 165.. "Sparkie" flew to her first 13 foot Bar ever. This breaks Megan Clarks(O'neill) 13' 0" record set at the Eastern States at the Armory on the All Time Indoor List!... Monroe-Woodbury Snior Kristin Lubeski also had a super night..with her 12' 0" for the Crusaders...Gaberilla Nebiker(MW) also advances to State with her 10' 6" Julia Penna(MW) 10' 0" Syd Tomaine(FDR) 9' 0" Lindsey Julian(Wash) 9' 0" Daniella Raymond(Wash) 8' 0" Keira Coulard-Smith(NP) 8' 0" Caroline Fatta(WV) 8' 0" Violet Bachorik(Gos) 7' 0" The Boys Vault was equally exciting all day..with Josiah Spain of O'Neill ,NY setting a seasonal best of 14' 9" for the West Point bound seniopr... Yesterday at Toms River Track Bubble..Tyler few 15' 0" to win his first State Title for Coach Jeff Clark and Coach Alex Eckermeyer. With his team mates cheering him on.. he was clase at 15' 6" and takes it to Nationals in two weeks. posts.Title: ALANA CARROLL  Sails  to NY STATE VAULT TITLE  &  RECORD .. 13'  6" !!!    19 CIRCUS VAULTERS-to-NATIONALS !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley, NY March 3, 2018 Ocean Breeze Track Facility New York State Indoor Championships New York State Boys & Girls flexed their muscles and fiber poles at Ocean Breeze,Staten Island on Saturday at the New York State High School Indoor Championships... and there was plenty of joy and fun for all . Out Flying Circus was well represented on both runways... with 16 athletes pushing their limits on one of our most productive seasons. The Girls flew first.... as Averill Park,NY senior...Alana Carroll ... followed her plan perfectly in winning the gold vault medal with a new AllTime Meet Record of 13' 6" to surpass Mary Saxer's meet record of 13' 5" (2005). The powerful and humble Carroll also set a new Section 2 Record,School Record and Personal Best... to go along with her Sportsmanship Award during the meet.. Alana moved to her 14' 1" UCS Spirit for her jumps at 14' 0"...with a few close bars!!! She heads to NB Nationals next Sunday with 17 other Flying Circus Vaulters!!! Warwick Valley Junior..Kaeli Thompson placed 3rd at 12' 9" and Monroe-Woodbury senior Kristin Lubeski flew a personal best at 12' 6" for 4th place medal. Kristen Kolarik(Arlington) 10' 0" Gabby Nebiker(MW) 10' 0" and Rebecca Baez(No Rockland) 10' 0" all return next year. The Boys Vault winner was senior Charles Crispi of Staten Island Farrell Prep at 15' 9" for Coach Cahill... James O'Neill High School senior Josiah Spain placed 5th overall .. with his 14' 9" for this Eagle Scout heading to West Point next year. Warwick Valley senior..Dane Sorensen placed 8th overall in Federation at 14' 0" clean for this Eagle Scout.. Jacob Baker(RC Ketcham) 13' 0" Josh Jeong(MW) 13' 0" !!! Congratulations to all vaulters,families,coaches!!!!

This home away from home is the Flying Circus Headquarters for outstanding l performances. This 3 Day meet is a blessing for any young athlete to be a part of... the "Spirit"...the "Thrill" and the "Magic" of the National Stage will last forever... Here are our entries from Flying Circus. posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS.."YOUTH POLE VAULT DAY"…. GRADES 6-7-8-9-10 JOIN US !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project The Warwick Center Warwick, New York

WELCOME YOUTH ATHLETES ...... To FLYING CIRCUS NATIONAL YOUTH POLE VAULT DISCOVERY DAY !!!

You and your friends in Grades 6-7-8-9-10 are all invited to "DISCOVER POLE VAULTING DAY" in Warwick, New York on Saturday... March 24, 2018 @ Flying Circus Headquarters. WE are calling in all youth athletes from all different sports(Soccer,Football,Track & Field,Cheerleading,Diving,Snow Boarding,Swimming,LacrosseGymnastics,Basketball,Rock Climbing and Skate Borading and all others) to take up the Vertical Challenges of Modern Day Pole Vaulting!!! It's a talent search and introduction for the greatest athletes on the planet. There will be two different sessions based on gender...so get ready to fly with us... and learn one of the greatest events in Track & Field. Expert staff and facilities... Cost ..just $75 for the 2.5 Hour session... All details below!!!!

FLYING CIRCUS NATIONAL YOUTH POLE VAULT DISCOVERY DAY

Where : The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT ACADEMY The Warwick Center 3 Warwick Center Road & Hoyt Road Warwick, New York 10990 When: Saturday March 24, 2018 Boys Discovery Time 10:30AM -1PM (Grades 6-7-8-9-10) Girls Discovery Time 1:30- 4PM (Grades 6-7-8-9-10) How to Register: All Registration is .. AT-the-DOOR Registration 20 minutes prior to listed start time. ( All participants must be current members of USATF .. Register on line at usatf.org/membership) What to Bring: All athletes should be dressed for activity. Shorts/Sweats.Running flats or spikes. and Bring Water for this 2.5 hour session. Cost: $75 per athlete.... Payable to HC Flying Circus or Cash ..... No Credit Cards. Web Site: Directions and Information at www.hvflyingcircus.com <>strongEach Youth Athlete receives Pole Vault Information Booklet and Flying Circus Original T-Shirt !!! FREE PARKING .... FREE MUSIC ..... FREE BATHROOMS. JOIN US FOR SOME FLYING FUN.

posts.Title: " NATIONALS " ... MORE-THAN-FLYING !!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault www.hvflyingcircus.com The 2018 New Balance Indoor Nationals was far more than "Just- Flying" for the 19 athletes.. their parents...their coaches and the pole vault officials . Yes- this was a celebration of the hard work ethic by all parties involved in this spectacular Indoor season....2018 edition !!!! We believe that the journey..the everyday pushing of individual limits in training and preparation are the joys of being in the National Championships in any sport. Results are only part of this journey. CONGRATULATIONS to the entire Flying Circus Family for our BEST INDOOR SEASON IN HISTORY!!! .... On-to-the-next Challenges!!!!!!!!!!!!! " HATS OFF" to... The Greatest Pole Vault Officials on the Planet.... Pictured above are the Men and Women that make our event AWESOME for our athletes. Thanks to Sport Journalist..Eddie Yaker for the gathering and the Celebration of our proud crew of our National Pole Vault Officiating Crew at New Balance Nationals. We salute their "Spirit" !!!!

New Balance Nationals @ The Armory

March 9-11 The Armory was A-buzzin'..... at the pole vault pit all three days... as four Circus athletes became .."ALL-AMERICANS" in their Divisions of Emerging Elite and The Championship of American. .. Leading the way on Friday in the Girls Emerging Elite Event was Monroe-Woodbury,NY ..senior sprinter/vaulter..Kristen Lubeski..with her All American 3rd place finish with a PR at 12' 6.25" for the Lady Crusaders. She came off her 56.8 Relay Split on her Sprint Medley Relay and charged down the vault runway with her 13' 1 x 160 Spirit. She was close at 12' 10.5" bar. Sydney Woods of Northern alley-Demarest,NJ also fly high all day with close bars at 12' 2.5".... Junior .. Dani Heine of Abington Heights,PA took great bars at 12' 2.5" for a super indoor season.. Governor Livingston,NJ senior.. Lauren Saifi was great over 11' 8.5" ..Holy Angels,NJ senior Caroline McGann was so charged up..that even her new Big pole came up short at 11' 8.5" ...Junior adopted Circus super star.. Elise Hall,Raleigh,NC of Pole Vault Carolina ..this years North Carolina State Champ.. flew 11' 2.5" for Coach Jose.... Trina Barcarola of Coach Bob Amos's Western Wayne,PA was super at 11' 8.5"... Corah Krantz..the Lakeland,PA school record holder was close at 11' 2.5' .. Lia Zavattaro,..the Greenwick,CT Captain of the State Champs Cardinals.. was solid at 11' 2'5" for the Bucknell bound star!!! The Boys Emerging Elite followed in late afternoon on Friday... and Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ Pole Vault crew of Tyler Hrbek and Seth Kricheff and Coach Jeff Clark came a callin'... Thyler Hrbek,,The tall and powerful senior..flew 15' 3.5" for a new personal best and became All American with his 4th place overall finish. Team Mate Seth Kricheff was also solid all day with his 14' 9.5" 10th place... Pascack Hills,NJ junior Lian Landau came thru for Coach Ross Koehler..with his 14' 3.5" zoom... Warwick Valley,NY ..senior Dane Sorensen was big at 14' 3.5" to complete his 16th indoor meet and perhapes our most consistent club vaulter this indoor. Josiah Spain of O.Neill,NY hit 13' 9.75 " and Sophomore Connor Reilly,Union Catholic,NJ was close at 13' 9.5". Sunday... Girls Vault Championships of America began .. with four Circus Girls in the loaded Championships. Averill Park,NY .. senior .Alana Carroll and Coach Cauthers came ready for the fun.. Alana hit 13' 2.5" for her All American finish and marked her 8th Straight Meet over the 13 foot Barrier. She ran out of pole at 13' 6... Kaeli Thompson of the Purple Wave of Warwick Valley Track Club... set her new personal record with her 13' 2.5" for 5th place and All American status for Coach Mike Potter. Abby Norwillo..our senior leader. .. put on a great display of competitive spirit and fighting all day and ever so close at 13' 2.5' for the Penn bound super star.... Senior ..Melissa "Sunshine" Purcell of Pascack Valley,NJ ..the all time record holder on Bergen County ,NJ was solid for Coach Tim Wilson. It's time to REST... and RE-BOOT the Spirit..Strength and Technique for Outdoor!!!! Bring it on !!!!

"CALLING ALL YOUTH".... It's time to learn the Pole Vault

If you like an athletic challenge ...then... COME JOIN US on Saturday March 24 at the FLYING CIRCUS BARN. All Boys & Girls in Grades 6-7-8-9-10.....It's TIME-TO-LEARN-TO-FLY!!! Jump out of the nest with us... Just $75 for the 2.5 hour push... Registration at the door only... All Coaches Come FREE!!! Boys Youth Day Pole Vault Discovery Hours... 10:30AM-1PM Girls Youth Day Pole Vault Discovery Hours.... 1:30PM-4PM FLYING CIRCUS..... ARE YOU READY for OUTDOOR POLE VAULT SEASON ??????

posts.Title: CIRCUS BARN RE-OPENS ...... NEW SPRING SCHEDULE !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project The Warwick Center Warwick, New York The Repair and Recovery period is now over...it's now time to refocus and rededicate to our exciting outdoor spring Track & Field season at Flying Circus. The Flying Circus vaulters completed their 18 Meet Indoor" Vault-Mania Tour with huge improvements and unbelievable " spirited togetherness " at every meet. It was wonderful to watch and be a part of by athletes... all staff and all parents ..... and now..it time to go to the outdoor runways and pits to spread the word about the fun of bending fiberglass vaulting poles and taking air flight. One of the joys of pole vaulting is the day-to-day journey of consistent training ....consistent improving of basic drills... consistent strength and speed development. Find your High School Weight Room...Find your Sprint Training group....mark your meet schedule on your BIG ROOM CALENDAR and get excited to be a focused and dedicated High School athlete. You only get a few golden opportunities to be a HIGH SCHOOL ATHLETE.... " LEAVE BIG FOOTPRINTS".

GET UP -- QUICK !

Success in athletics and in life is determined not by how many times you get knocked down... ..but..by how quickly you get back up. It's unrealistic to think that you can avoid all the problems and challenges which will certainly block your path. YOU WILL GET KNOCKED DOWN. GET UP. GET OVER IT. GET BACK IN THE GAME.
Here's some Spring News/Schedules/Camps/Bus Guidelines With the Spring Meets starting next week for High School and Middle School athletes on various days per week.. our new schedule for Open Vault Days for all athletes will be limited to Open Sundays and Open Wednesday Nights for vault help. Most of our staff will now be helping coach at their High Schools and with beginning vaulters. Our Super Sundays Open Instruction will now move to our outdoor pits and 2 indoor pits on all Sundays(except Easter Sunday-Closed April 1) Girls Open Sundays is 12:30-2pm...Boys Open Sundays is 2-3:30pm. Our Wednesday Nights Open Co-Ed Sessions will be 5:30-7pm and 7-8:30pm.. All Open sessions are still $30 per athlete per session. Our Insurance Policy does not allow us to lend used poles to athletes., See your High School Coach for all your spring pole needs ASAP!!!! THANK YOU to all athletes and staff/parents helping us today at CIRCUS YOUTH DAY. It was a huge success, with many new and exciting young athletes taking up the pole vault challenge. Keep an eye on the future champions @ Flying Circus. THANKS to a great donation by Bob and Lisa Sorensen Family ... The Flying Circus Outdoor Backyard Pole Vault Pits will be Lit-Up this summer for some cool evening vaulting/meets ..UNDER-the-STARS !!!!! SUMMER VAULT CAMPS..... Applications coming on our Web-Site on April 1. This is a limited Camp...so act fast if you are interested for the 2 Day Camp... Boys Camp July 9-10 3:45pm-8pm each day Girls camp July 12-13 3:45pm-8pm each day. CIRCUS BBQ BARNYARD MEET..... Saturday July 14..Final Activity of the Summer... Girls Meet 10AM ... Boys Meet 1PM .... Elite Pro Meet 4PM... Music..Joe Team...Dancing Fun.

BUS TRAVEL GUIDELINES/THOUGHTS

* Always remember ...it is a special privilege to travel and represent your SCHOOL...Your TEAM...your FAMILY and your COMMUNITY. * CONSERVE YOUR ENERGY and FOCUS ON YOUR COMPETITION. Many High School athletes leave their best performances on the bus. Your actions and language should reflect your character and your family values. * LEADERSHIP should be modeled by the UPPER CLASSMEN and WOMEN ALWAYS. * ACT LIKE A CHAMPION ON THE BUS and ON THE TRACK ! Be Polite and Show RESPECT. * Do not board the bus without the COACH before or after the meet. Do not board another schools bus at any time. * Report any damage of the bus to your coach as you board the bus. * CLEAN YOUR AREA following the trip....Leave the Bus cleaner than BEFORE!!! * ALWAYS let the BUS DRIVER KNOW YOU APPRECIATE them taking you to and from the meet. ALWAYS THANK YOUR DRIVER when leaving the bus. IT MAKES A DIFFERENCE!! * TAKE GREAT PRIDE IN YOUR BEHAVIOR. ALWAYS SHOW THAT YOU ARE A CLASS ACT IN EVEREY SITUATION. "FLYING CIRCUS RIDES AGAIN".... JOIN the FUN.
