posts.Title: ABBY NORWILLO OPENS  with MEET RECORD... 12' 8" Pole Vault...17'10.5" Long Jump....36' 10" Triple Jump !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy Warwick Valley, NY The Spring Pre Season Pole Vault phase is complete. The 5 week Re-Set for Flying Circus Pole Vaulters is in the books and we can now start to focus on solid vaulting from longer approach for the remaining month of April. Re-connecting the positions and posture is now in place and watch out world...here we come with performance. Thank you all for staying with the plan.... it will produce personal bests in the coming months. The Warm conditions the past weekend opened up the door for some of our athletes on fiberglass..... perhaps the most striking multi-event performance came from senior Abby Norwillo of Pittston Area,PA.on Saturday at the Ice Breakers meet at Lake Wallenwalpack ,PA. The UPENN bound sprinter/vaulter/jumper led her team to the team title....with her 400Relay gold..her Long Jump Silver///Triple Jump Silver and her Meet Record pole vault at 12' 8" Gold. The six jump rule prevented her from taking some jumps at 13' barrier. She was on her 170 pole for the first time since Nationals. She will be joining 7 other Flying Circus girls and 4 Circus Boys at the Penn Relays next Thursday at world famous Franklin Field stadium @ UPENN !!!! Many other Circus Vaulters are producing massive points for their teams in other events this spring... adding to their overall fitness and athletic cross over skills. These other events makes BETTER POLE VAULTERS!!! Sprint development and take-off jump development are enhanced for the pole vaulter in the short relays..sprint group training...long jump/triplejump events and sand jumping drills during the week... it's not all just pole vaulting every day. Ak your coaches to experiment with some cross event training for training variety and refreshment of weak area drills/skills. YOU WILL BECOME A BETTER POLE VAULTER !!!!

124th PENN RELAY CARNIVAL ... The World's "GREATEST TRACK & FIELD MEET".

That's right...... no other Track & Field experience can match the pure excitement and wonderful joy of THE PENN RELAYS. If you ever get a chance to be in or even just watch the "Magic of PENN"... then you have lived your dream. The Flying Circus is proud to announce a record number of 12 vault athletes that will live the dream nerxt week on the pole vault runway at the 50 yard line at famous Franklin Field. Catch the bus...jump on the train... beg a ride..take a field trip..treat yourself to the ultimate level of sport. Enjoy your moments. CIRCUS GIRLS..Thursday April 26 at 1pm... Sydney Woods(Northern Valley-Demerest,NJ - Junior).... Lauren Saifi(Governor Livingston,NJ-Senior) .. Alana Carroll(Averill Park,NY-Senior) .... Melissa Purcell(Pascack Valley,NJ-Senior).... Dani Heine(Abington Heights,PA-Junior)..... Abby Norwillo(Pittston Area,PA-Senior ...Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley,NY-Junior)...... Kristin Lubeski(Monroe-Woodbury,NY-Senior) CIRCUS BOYS..Saturday April 28 at 10am... Tyler Hrbek(Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ-Senior).... Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY-Senior)...Seth Kricheff(Northern Valley,NY0Senior)...Johannes Stromhaug(Vestal,NY0Senior) CONGRATULATIONS ALL and enjoy your experience. THE GREATER THE CHALLENGE ------
....THE MORE GLORIOUS THE TRIUMPH !!!!! Self-confidence is the miracle worker for all ages..... it is that mighty invisible power that drives athletes to do the impossible performance. Your success or failure is determined by your faith or lack of faith in yourself. There are so many challenges waiting for you to accept: Be a positive thinker... a positive leader.... a positive force for your team. The ultimate challenge is to compete to your capacity..both PHYSICALLY and MENTALLY. MAKE your participation in athletics...PERSONAL. "What lies behind you.... and what lies before you.... are tiny matters compared to what lies within you." ----- Emerson FLYING CIRCUS ---- COME FLY WITH US.

posts.Title: ALANA CARROLL(Averill Park,NY)   &  PAYTON MORRIS(East Pennsboro,PA)...FLY@ PENN...!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley,NY CONGRATULATIONS to all CIRCUS VAULTERS this past weekend in all five states!!!! It's now official.....The Pole Vault season has begun to heat up on all the runways..as performances...school records and personal bests are taking shape. Strong wills and tough attitudes still are the main ingredients for pole vault success. The positive temperament athlete still prevails over the talented athlete. UNLOCK YOUR POWERS ..with a SUPER POSITIVE ATTITUDE in YOUR ATHLETICS !!!!!!!

THE 124th PENN RELAYS...... 24 CIRCUS FLYERS @ FRANKLIN FIELD.

The Flyin' Circus was strong and deep in both the High School and College Pole Vault Events at #124 PENN RELAY CARNIVAL , under mostly sunny and warm skies at Franklin Field. The knowledgable crowd of 'Pole Vault Nuts' rocked the stadium for every successful fly-over and gave a thank you applause to every vaulter following there performance. Yes--large appreciative spectators filled the stadium with "The Spirit of Penn" and supported the athletes with hope and promise. Every athlete who participated in the Wonderful 3- day Penn Gathering ...together... will be influenced and lifted up to the next level of performance. It's your turn now...to...STEP UP and meet your challenge. THANK YOU ALL for a GREAT PENN RELAYS !!!!!!!!!!

Kristin Lubeskie (Monroe-Woodbury,NY) flew 11' 11.75" for the Crusaders ..coached by Chris Goodwin.... and will enroll at the University of South Florida next fall...Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ..junior..Sydney Woods came thru big on her biggest poles ever for Coach Mike Ives at 11'11.75" and ever so close at 12' 3.5"!! This UPENN recruit put on a show with his 16' 4.75'(5m) sail for the Gold Watch and then took 2 shots at Jordan Yamoah's Meet Record of 16' 6.5"!!!! Coached by Matt Concannon of VaultWorX and HS Coach Mark Morris !!!!! Placing forth was Charles Crispi of Farrell,NY. with his 15' 5' sail for Coach Jerry Cahill. Placing 6th was the return of Johannes Stromhaug of Vestal,NY at 15' 1" for this Cornell University bound vault specialist coached by James Cerra. Johannes had 2 very close bars at 15' 5"!!! Tyler Hrbek od Northern Valley-Old Tappan,NJ was super over 14')" for Coach Jeff Clark and heads to UCONN next fall to continue his athletics and academics. Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY) was solid all day in his first Penn relays appearance for the Cortland University bound Sprinter/Vaulter of he Purple Wave Crew. Circus College Vaulters Soar @ Penn.... Congrats to 8 former Circus Vaulters competing well in the vault...Samantha Beyar of Binghamton University flew to a silver medal at 12' 5.5" .....Michelle Rubinetti of hometeam UPENN sailed 12'0" and close bars at 12' 5'5"... Amanda McNeil of Villanova made 12' 0" and Madisyn Hawkins of Lehigh University Mountain Hawks ..sailed 11' 5.5" and then 12'0" at the Saturday Invite. The Men were led by Travis Fountain of Binghamton University at 1' 5'...Chris rough (UCONN) 15' 0" Marc DeLuca(UCONN) 15' 0" and Martin Desmery (Ithaca University) 15' 0"!!!! posts.Title: ABBY NORWILLO…13'0" SCHOOL RECORD…DANI HEINE 12' 0" SCHOOL RECORDS TODAY in POLE VAULT !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure Warwick Valley, NY It was hot pole vaulting today in PA District 2 ... as all athletes get ready for Monday's District 2 Championships at Scranton's Veterans Stadium. Pittston Area's senior ABBY NORWILLO flew to a New School Outdoor Pole Vault Record..with her 13' 0" on her 13' 3" x 170 pole and close bars at 13' 6" on her 13' 6" series !!! She also popped a 17' 4" long jump win in her farewell High School meet at her home track. This UPENN bound multi-Event athlete has produced five great meets over the 13' 0" barrier !!!!! She will be traveling to NB Nationals in mid-June to complete an unbelievable scholastic track & field career. Dani Heine ...just a junior at Abington Heights has produced BIG POINTS for her undefeated team all year... including a 16' 10" long jump and today's 12' 0" New Outdoor School Record for Coach Mike Ludka and Staff!!!! Dni was using her 13' 1" UCS Spirit 145 for her magic clear and came from 8 steps all day. Best friend.team mate Rachel Klein also produced a seasonal best for the Comets!!!! Dani will be traveling to NB Nationals with the Circus next month !!!!! Congratulations !!!!!

posts.Title: TYLER HRBEK (Old Tappan) Sets Bergen Record  15' 5"  &  MELISSA PURCELL 12' 3" @ Bergen County Champs!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, NY They are still .."Flying High" in Bergen Country, New Jersey !!!! The most northern county in New Jersey has produced some of the states finest High School Boys and Girls pole vaulters the last 20 years. The magic continues this spring...as Northern Valley-Old Tappan senior...TYLER HRBEK...soared to a New School and Country Record of 15' 5" on Friday at the Bergen County Championships for Coach Jeff Clark and staff. Tyler...who will attend UCONN next fall on scholarship had close bars at 15' 7.5" and was voted the Ed Church Award following the meet!! !!! Pushing Tyler all the way was Pascack Hills junior...Liam Landau... who also soared to a new school record at 15' 1" for the Indians coached by Ross Koehler and the silver vault medal!!!! Placing third was Adam Stavash(Hasbrouck Heights) 13' 3"...Jared Forer(Glen Rock) 13' 3" Jona Kim(Old tappan) 13' 3" Sam Pitkowsky(PV) 12' 9" Justin Manne(Mahwah) 12' 3" for Coach Pasek. The Bergen Vault Girls showed equal spirit and performance...with MELISSA PURCELL of the Pascack Valley Pole Vault Team...headed up by Coach Tim Wilson. Melissa sailed 12' 3" for her championship crown and gold medal.. Hot on vault runway was junior .. Sydney Woods(NV-Demarest) at 11' 9" and Senior..Nicole Lester(Ridgewood) at 11' 9"PR for the bronze . Sophomore Marisa DiGia of Old Tappen hit a PR at 11' 3" for a 4th place..Samantha Cioppio(Glen Rock) 10' 9"...Kyra Muller(Mahwah) 10' 9" .. Ariana Cavalli(Old Tappan) 10' 9". The Bergen County Frosh Champs had Randi Conroy from Northern Highlands as the vault winner at 8' 6'...Jordan Hecker(NV_Demarest) 8' 6" Mary Flahive(Holy Angels) 8' 0" Abigal Fowler(NV-Demarest) 7' 0". The Orange Country Championships,NY ... had 24 Circus Vaulters in action at Warwick Valley Central on Friday. All athletes battled strong head winds in both the Girls and Boys competition. KAELI THOMPSON(Warwick Valley,NY-Junior) pulled off the first Three-Peat Pole Vault winner ever, with her 12' 0" leap of faith... and big height at 12' 6" for the Purple Wave. She also placed third in Long Jump and 4x100 Relay!!! Monroe-Woodbury,NY..senior Captain..Kristin Lubeski flew 11' 6" for the silver medal..Gabby Nebiker(MW0 10' 0" Julia Pena(MW) 9' 6' Daniella Raymond(Wash'ville0 9' 0" Caroline Fatta(Warwick) 9' 0" Lindsey Julian(Wash'ville) 8' 6' Sam becker(SW) 8' 6" Ava DeFelice(Corn) 8' 0" Kayla Maas(Eld) 8' 0" Courtney West(War) 7' 6" Violet Bachovik(Gosh) 7 ' 6' !!! The Boys Vault Winner was senior- DANE SORENSEN of Warwick Valley at 14' 6" into strong gusts of wind and close at 15' 1"PR for the Cortlandt State University recruit. Josiah Spain(O'Neill) took silver at 14' 0" ..Josh Jeong(MW) 13' 6" .. Nick Villanueva(MW) 13' 6"..Austin O'Malley(Goshen) 12' 6"PR..Nick Mirecki(Wash'ville-Soph) 12' 6"PR for Coach Duffy...Justin Smith(PB) 11' 0" Kevin Chait(Wash'ville) 11' 0" Matt Warren(Wash'ville) 11' 0" Jacob Becher(Warwick) 10' 0" Mack Hallett(Warwick) 10' 0". The Rockland County Championships, New City,NY --- Clarkstown South senior...Tom Qualter sailed 13' 6" on his home pit to win gold for Coach Mondferri.. Chris Filatov(Nanuet) 12' 6" Ron O(Nanuet) 12' 6" Conor Burke(Pearl River) 12' 0" Eugene Om(Nanuet) 12' 0" Steve Nostro(CS) 11' 0". The Girls were led by Rebecc BAEZ(NORTH ROCKLAND) AT 9' 6" .. Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern) 9' 0" Lauren Hancher(TZ) 9' 0" Fiona Carroll(TZ) 9' 0" Grace Simpson(TZ) 8' 6" Cassie Wishner(Nyack) 8' 0" Maeve Loughran(Pearl River0 8' 0". Congratulations to Vestal,NY -senior---Johannes Stromhaug... is back in his flying mode. Coming off a shortened indoor season...this Cornell University recruit blasted over 15' 0" on Thursday and had big height over 15' 7" for Coach Jim Cerra and the Golden Bears Vault Team!!!!! District 2 Championships,Scranton,PA---- Great results again out of District 2 Circus Girls and Boys in 3A......with Pittston Area senior Abby Norwillo flying four events all day with her sister... Abby blasted 12' 0" for gold in the vault ,placed in long jump and 4 x 100 Relay for big team points. Abington Heights ..junior Dani Heine flew 11' 6" for her ticket to state meet next week and long jumped 17' 1" for the Comets!!! Dani McGrane of James Coughlin was the TOP SOPH in 3A..with her 8' 6'..as did Rachel Klein(Abington Heights-Soph) at 8' 6" Megan O'Neill of Honesdale looked super over 8' 0"!! Dalton Yeust ...just a Sophomore at Tunkhannock Central sizzled over 13' 0" for the gold medal at State berth.. Keep an eye on this strongman from Tunk!!! Trenton Zavada(Coughlin) 11' 0" TOP FROSH!!!! The 2A Group was led by Vaulter hurdler Trina Barcarola of Western Wayne, This sophomore won her section at 11' 7.5" School Record and flew 15.84 in 100m Hurdles for Coach Bob Amos. Corah Krantz(Lakeland) moves to Stae with her 10' 6' and Sydney Bryla(Lakeland) 8' 6" for Coach Krantz!! HOT WEATHER COMING THIS WEEK......... SCHOOL RECORDS / PERSONAL BESTS ....GET THE TEST!!!!!

SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS @ THE FLYING CIRCUS

Don't let your pole vault development end early this year. Flying Circus will be open till July 14. Then CLOSED till September 5!!!! Join us for 3 GREAT POLE VAULT MEETS... and 2 AWESOME POLE VAULT CAMPS.... WEDNESDAY and SUNDAY OPEN VAULT SESSIONS!!! It takes 1500-1800 Jumps per year to develop the CHAMPIONSHIP POLE VAULT ATHLETE!!!! JOIN-US-AS-OFETN-AS-POSSIBLE !!!! GIRLS CAMP has 4 Spots Left !!!! BOYS CAMP has 11 Spots Left !!! " WANNA-JUMP-HIGHER " ....................... JOIN THE CIRCUS POLE VAULT ACTIVITIES THIS SUMMER!!!

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS WEEKEND FIREWORKS @ STATE MEETS & NEW ENGLAND CHAMPIONSHIPS !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick Valley, NY CONGRATULATIONS to ALL VAULTERS from FLYING CIRCUS this weekend and this entire AWESOME SPRING SEASON!!!!! Working with over 115 Vaulters this season was a blast for our entire Pole Vault Staff of Coaches and we wish to extend our sincere THANK YOU to every Vaulter...every Parent...every supporting High School Coach for making our club a unique positive experience . There is no pole vault club without YOU and Your Great Support and "Spirit". The Goal again this year was about improvement ...friendship and fun and we hit the moon on all accounts . As we wind down our Open Sessions..our Private Sessions..our Team Clinics..our Barn Meets..... we want you all to know how much we appreciate everything you have done to make our club successful this year. We hope you all can join our final party together... The BARNYARD BBQ CELEBRATION of FRIENDS of the POLE VAULT on Saturday---July 14. SEE YOU ALL SOON !!!!

FLYING CIRCUS SOARS @ NB NATIONALS ...ALANA CARROLL TAKES GOLD  13' 6.5"/////  4 ALL-AMERICANS CROWNED...17 VAULTERS TOGETHER!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick,New York

The little ole Flying Circus Pole Vault Project.... JUST GREW ANOTHER SET OF WINGS!!!!

C-O-N-G-R-A-T-U-L-A-T-I-O-N-S ..... to ALL 17 CIRCUS VAULTERS who competed off -the-charts this weekend at The New Balance National Track & Field Championships in Greensboro !!!!! Words can not describe how proud we are of you and all our other club members at all levels this past year. You have all proved that "Spirit" and "Togetherness" moves athletes to new levels of confidence and performance. YOU MAKE OUR CLUB GREAT!!!!! .... THANK YOU ATHLETES....PARENTS....STAFF COACHES for everything you do for FLYING CIRCUS !!!! Here's the scoop -- Averill Park.NY senior...ALANA CARROLL won her NATIONAL POLE VAULT TITLE on Saturday with a tough mindset and personal best leap of 13' 6.5" on her 14 foot sticks. Competing into a varying headwind all day could not stop this Harvard bound gymnast...as she took close bars at 14' 0" for Coach Cauthers. This marks the third National Pole Vault Champion at our club... including Michelle Kercado(Monroe Woodbury,NY and Emily Savage,Weston ,CT) !!!!! Kaeli "Sparkie" Thompson of hometown Warwick Valley Track Club also hit All American honors for The Purple Wave with her 6th place 12' 6.5" and clean thru 12' 10' 5", Kaeli used her biggest pole for no regrets!!! Abby Norwillo...of Pittston Area,PA was sensationall into wind again..placed 7th at 12' 6.5" and heads to the Ivy Womens Championship team at PENN this fall... Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ...junior ..Sydney Woods came up BIG in the Championship Section for Coach Mike Ives... with a PR 12' 6.5" for this scholar athlete and returns for her senior year next fall. !!!! Perhaps the best motivation was provided by Abington Heights,PA junior vaulter Dani Heine...with her foot in a boot from injury last week...she provided the spark and help for all others in her club on the infield. It's more than just jumping high!!!!

Heads to Rutgers next fall!!! 8-Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY)........ 14' 9'5" ..Heads to Cortland State Next Fall!!! -Conor Reilly(Union Catholic)...Soph... 13' 9.75" NJ State Non Public Champ..2 Years-to-go!!! -Nate Llanos(Danbury,CT)...Senior...CT State Vault Champ !!!!! -Seth Kricheff(NV-Old Tappan.NJ)/// Senior...DNS...Heads to Purdue Next Fall!!!! posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS....."THE NEXT GENERATION ARRIVES"...2018 GIRLS POLE VAULT CAMP
"FLYING HUMANS" @  CIRCUS BBQ MEET  !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project Warwick,NY ....'Vault Town" .... USA It's called...."VAULT WEEK".... at the Hudson Valley Flying Circus in Warwick Valley,New York. The week is dedicated to celebrating the " spirit and the joys' of the pole vault. It begins with 4 days of Circus Pole Vault Camps and concludes with the new friendships at the BBQ Barnyard Meet for all families. 95 Campers came in from 9 different states from Monday thru Friday and the BBQ entry was 91 athletes of all ages...all spirits and all abilities. The display of 'Flying Humans' was breathtaking!!!!! CONGRATULATIONS to ALL VAULTERS...COACHES...VOLUNTEERS and FAMILIES for a SUPER-FUN......."VAULT WEEK" together !!!!! BBQ BARNYARD MEET.....Saturday July 14...... The morning Girls/Women's meet was packed on two runways...Taking the High School honors was Vaultworx's/PA sophomore star..Sydney Horn at 12' 1" into wind for Coach Mat Concannon. Sydney had close bars at a PR 12' 7". Placing silver was Megan Biscoglio of Southington,CT..also at 12' 1" and super close at 12' 7 bar for this UCONN recruit New England Champion. Taking the honors on Pit #1 was Megan Murphy,VA...Caroline Fatta,NY and Julia Wasmund,PA ...all at 9' 7". Open Women's Champion was Nikki Carroll of Tampa,Florida at 12' 1" for Coach Don Marsh. !!!!! The Boys/Men's Open/Men's Masters took over the runways and pits at high noon and the music volume was cranked up a few levels. The 92 degree temperatures and light tail wind encouraged large poles and the "Flying Humans" continued to try to win the "Woo Contest" thru out the warm up and the serving of the awesome BBQ Chicken and JOR TEA chilled drinks!!!! The meet produced 33 Personal Bests ...with 7 Pole Vault Clubs participatinoing together in what is called..."PURE SPORT". ..... Cheering for each other all day was... 'contagious humankind'...... and that was the goal of the Flying Circus BBQ!!!! Taking the High School Gold Medal was senior Payton Morris of Vaultworx Pole Vault Club in Camp Hill,PA. Payton Morris won everything this year...Indoor and Outdoor PA State PV Titles...Millrose Games Jr.Vault... Penn Relays...and yes...now the Circus BBQ Meet!!! He sailed 16' 1" easily from just his six step for Coach Concannon and Coach Mark Morris and took great bars at 16' 7"!!! He heads to UPENN next fall to continue his academics and athletics. Taking the Open.. Gold Vault Crown was Appex Pole Vault Club,NJ... Peter Roach..sailing clean over 16' 7" for the former Cornell University champion..now coached by Bronko Meric. The Masters Division was stacked with former vault legends and provides the inspiration and motivation for all our young athletes competing... Will Nesbitt of Garrison,NY/Flying Circus... came up big with his 13' 1" Masters Age 56 Personal Best and taking over #1 spot on this years WORLD LIST for his age group!!!!!! He grabbed his heaviest pole for his record fly!!! Taking the honors on Pit #1...was Tunkhannock,PA ..sophomore...DaltonYuest(Flying Circus)... at 12' 7" with room to spare!!!!

posts.Title: DANE SORENSEN . & . WILL NESBITT ...... TAKE VAULT TITLES !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Club, LLC "VAULT-TOWN"..... Warwick Valley,NY . USA MID-SUMMER . Pole Vault News. July 31 CONGRATULATIONS to "CIRCUS FLYERS"..... Dane Sorensen Warwick,NY) and Will Nesbitt(Garrison,NY) . for launching to new . titles . this past week at the pole vault pits on both coasts. Dane . won the . gold medal . at the Northeast PoleVault Club Championships meet at Apex Vault Club...with . yet another . 15' 0" . sail over . for this Eagle Scout bound . for Cortland State University next month. He again took great bars . at 15' 5" . and heads . to the Vertical Adventures Beach Vault . this Saturday at Seaside Heights. *** . Will Nesbitt took on All-Comers at the National Masters USATF Championships on the West Coast . and brought home the NATIONAL POLE VAULT TITLE . for the . former Millburn,NJ standout. Will, still the New Jersey MOC State Meet Record Holder at 16' 4" had . close bars . at 13' 0" . and his 13' 1" @ Circus BBQ leads the World List for Masters . 56 Age Group!!!!

FALL VAULTING ATTACK SCHEDULE @ CIRCUS

We invite . you to train . with us this fall at FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLUB!!!! Our FALL VAULTING SESSIONS are designed .for you to get a huge jump on your Indoor season. All our serious athletes will start up their small run vault program...filled . with run posture routines . and . small pole technical sessions every Wednesday Evenings and Sunday Afternoons on our 6 Pits . and Apparatus. These fall sessions are designed . for improving pole vault positions . for the beginner to the advanced pole vaulter. Also . included . will be the off-site routines . for running workouts. and strength development routines . for each vaulter. This . 8 week progressive fall program will get you ready early and is a must . for all serious pole vault athletes in both middle school . and high school levels. Each session is still just $30 . at the door per athlete for the 90 minute sessions. ATTACK FALL VAULTING with us . in September . and October . @ . FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLUB!!!!!!

WEDNESDAY FALL VAULT SESSIONS EVENINGS CO-ED VAULTERS Begins Sept 12 Ends October 24 Session #1-5:30-7pm . Fall-Winter-Spring Cost ---- $30/athlete FALL POLE VAULT CIRCUS MEET Tuesday . -- Oct. 30 Boys & Girls --All Levels Warm Up at 5pm . Meet Begins . 6:01pm Cost -- $30/athlete

WINTER POLE VAULT CLUB PACKAGE

Nov. 5- Feb. 7 . LIMITED ENROLLMENT. Forms on Web Site . Oct. 1. -- 3 Month Package COST -- $450 /athlete. This package sells out the first 24 hours! BE READY . OCT. 1 to secure . your spot for Indoor Instruction. FLYING CIRCUS RE OPENS SEPT. 9 !!!!!!!!!! JOIN US this FALL!!!!!!

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS OPENS" ...Sunday, September 9  ...  REJOICE !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy Warwick Valley, NY Pole Vaulting is back in Vault Town , USA !!!! You are invited to the 2018 FYLING CIRCUS FALL VAULT PROGRAM. Please join us every Sunday afternoon and every Wednesday evening in the months of September and October , for a detailed progressive foundation building phase of pole vault skills for the up-coming Indoor Track & Filed season. Each 90 minute session is filled with specific drills to enhance modern day pole vault techniques for the Beginner vaulter..the Intermediate level vaulter and the Advanced ability pole vaulter. Each session is still just $30 per athlete...at the door registration/payment. Just bring your spikes and positive spirit!!!!! All activities and directions on our web site ---- www.hvflyingcircus.com

SUNDAY SESSIONS BEGIN September 9

GIRLS GROUPS ---12:30-2pm Bring spikes/water --- Cosy $30 per athlete BOYS GROUPS ----2-3:30pm Bring Spikes/water --- Cost $30 per athlete

WEDNESDAY SESSIONS BEGIN September 12

CO-ED SESSION #1 ----- 5:30-7pm Bring spikes/water --- Cost $30 per athlete CO-ED SESSION #2 ----- 7-8:30pm Bring spikes/water --- Cost $30 per athlete

NEW POLE POLICY:

All athletes may use Flying Circus Poles at our facility. If an athlete breaks a pole...they will be responsible for replacement of that pole. Our Insurance Carrier does not allow the lending or borrowing of our poles off our site. All athletes should see their school coach to order your poles for the coming season. Below are the two BEST and FASTEST DELIVERY POLE VAULT COMPANIES to take care of your vaulting pole needs for both the Indoor and Outdoor seasons.

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS ...... "SCHOOL-IS-IN-SESSION"  !!!  JOIN US !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development Warwick , New York www.hvflyingcircus.com The Barn Doors opened at Flying Circus Pole Vault headquarters this past Sunday at The Warwick Center...as 52 young and motivated pole vault athletes began their FALL POLE VAULT PREP SEASON in style. The Four Sessions were filled with the positive spirit needed to take on Track & Fields most exciting and complex event. Our Sunday afternoon and Wednesday evening Open Pole Vault instruction takes place on four runways with ability grouping instruction. Our Fall Program returns to the basic fundamentals of safe and progressive pole vaulting techniques. Apparatus drills...posture running dynamics and short approach vaulting will be in place for the months of September and October. Our only Fall Pole Vault Meet will be our "VAULT-MANIA" Fun meet on Tuesday evening...October 30 at 5pm and everyone is invited to celebrate the Pole Vault Spirit with us. YES---- POLE VAULT SCHOOL IS BACK IN SESSION !!!!!!!

FALL PREP WORKOUT ROUTINES

All Flying Circus Pole Vaulters can pick up their 2018 Fall Workout routines at any OPEN SESSION. In this POLE VAULT NEWSLETTER...each athlete can find exactly how to train on days not vaulting. Details on Weight Lifting Progressions .... Macro-Cycles ...Micro-Cycles ...Running sequences for pole vault development....Stretching...Recovery workouts....Rest Day emphasis.... and the Benefits of Pole Vault Specific Warm Up Drills. Learn the secrets of attaining the next level of pole vault performance. Let's be organized again this fall and set your plan in motion. MOTIVATION is the NAME of the GAME ------ LET'S GET MOTIVATED THIS FALL !!!!!!!!

WINTER FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CLUB

We will be celebrating our 15th FLYING CIRCUS WINTER POLE VAULT TRAINING CLUB this year. This Training Club Package is unique and VERY LIMITED in SIZE. The Winter Club takes the first 24 Boys and the first 24 Girls who register with full payment. The application forms will be posted up on our web-site(www.hvflyingcircus.com) on October 1. The Winter Club package usually sells out the first 24 hours... Our SUNDAY OPEN SESSIONS will still be available to all other pole vaulters in our four state region. The Boys Winter Club will again be every Monday and Wednesday evenings from November 5 thru February 4...This 3 month package is still $450 per athlete. The Girls Winter Club will be Tuesday and Thursday evenings from November 6 thru February 5 at $450 per athlete.These Instructional Training Packages are gender based for specific progressive instruction and 90 minutes in length. There are no make up days in this training package. A missed class ...is a missed class . We look forward to teaching you this Fall...Winter and Spring season @ FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT !!!!!

ATHLETIC PARTICIPATION THOUGHTS ....... HITTING-YOUR-TARGET !!!!

* Participation in athletics is a privilege . Appreciate your gifts of sport. * Temperament is more important than talent..... You must stay positive. * Make Training a Priority. Look forward to working HARD at your sport. * Allow yourself to be coached. Ask questions. * Model humble behavior. Help others succeed . * Take care of injuries immediately. * Get proper sleep each night. Train HARD...Sleep HARD. * Athletic Nutrition.---- Eat a balanced diet. This is the fuel for championship performance. * Stay up with your academics... there is life after pole vault. * Be On Time.... this is learning discipline in life. * Communicate with your coaches. Build an athletic partnership. * Make it Fun...with NO REGRETS. FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT...................... "I'm Gonna' Be Somebody."

posts.Title: "TIME-TO-JOIN-THE-CIRCUS" ..... WINTER TRAINING PACKAGE INFORMATION   !!!!
posts.Content:
IT'S CIRCUS TIME....... ...and we are calling all vaulters to JOIN OUR WINTER POLE VAULT TEAM @ HV FLYING CIRCUS, Warwick Valley.New York!!! Our Winter Training Package is our most economical opportunity for you to improve your pole vaulting in a Dynamic Training Atmosphere . This Group Training Package is very limited in size for more personal learning. The Training Package is limited to the first 24 Girls and the First 24 Boys who register with full payment. The package offers 3 months(Nov. 5-- Feb.5) of pole vault instruction... 2 Days per week for Boys(Monday and Wednesdays) and 2 days per week for Girls(Tuesday and Thursdays) from Nov. 5--Feb.5. The last 5 years this Vault Package sold out in the first 48 hours!!! If you are serious about vaulting with us this winter..you must act fast with your registration and payment. Winter Training Package Registration forms will be sent to all Flying Circus current members on our e-mail list and posted on our web site(www.hvflyingcircus.com) on Saturday September 29, 2018. Download the form and drop it off at our Sunday September 30 OPen Session at our Pole Vault Barn to guarantee you will be included... You may also Over night Mail it to address listed on registration form. They was a waiting list last winter of 34 Boys and Girls who did not make this training group. All pole vaulters who do not make the first 24 Registered..must then be restricted to our Open Sunday Training Groups(Girls every Sunday 12:30-2pm....Boys every Sunday 2-3:30pm sessions) . The Winter Training Package is $450 per athlete , paid in full with registration form.

We look so very forward to helping you develop your Pole Vaulting Skills this Winter

YOUR FLYING CIRCUS COACHING STAFF ********************** Coach Stephanie Duffy..Coach Ken Cevoli ...Coach Bob Sorensen....Coach Will Nesbitt .... Coach Bob Pasek....Coach Hugh Cauthers.... Coach St.

posts.Title: "FLYIN' CIRCUS" ... WINTER CLUB CLASS PLACEMENTS.... NOV. 4 -- FEB. 5 ----'Feed-Your-Spirit'  !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC Warwick , NY USATF Club # 1129

THANK YOU for joining our WINTER CLUB TRAINING PACKAGE.

This year's edition is packed and loaded with 83 young and talented Middle School and High School athletes ready to take up the awesome challenge of Modern Day POLE VAULTING!!!! It's going to be another exciting experience for all athletes...parents and coaches. Our Winter Club kicks off on November 5 with our Boys groups and November 6 with our Girls groups and concludes on February 5. This three month training package is ability grouping basic fundamentals and drills for pole vault success. Most of our registered vaulters were placed in their preferred class...... some athletes were placed in our new class at 4pm-5:30pm. ALL CLASSES ARE COMPLETELY SOLD OUT.... There is no class switching at this time. All athletes not vaulting in the Winter Club Training Package can still get pole vault instruction every Sunday afternoon in our Girls Open 12:30-2pm Class and our 2-3:30pm Boys Class. * All athletes should arrive 10-15 minutes before scheduled class. * All athletes should dress warmly... Sweat pants ....tights...spikes..warm up flats. Store all gear under seats...Off the main training area. * Athletes may bring their own poles to train with. We have 300+ poles for your use. * There are No Class make-ups.... A missed class ... is a missed class. * Cancellation due to extreme snow/ice conditions will be sent out to all e-mails by 2pm. posts.Title: LIAM LANDAU (15' 0")... KAELI THOMPSON (12' 6") Lead "CIRCUS VAULT-MANIA" Meet ...36 Athletes..."OUT-of-the-GATE" TOGETHER !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson valley FLYING CIRCUS Pole Vault Academy, LLC Warwick,New York USATF # 06-1129 The Flyin'Circus Pole Vault athletes are off to a FAST START!!!!! The 8 week Fall Prep cycle at Flying Circus was a huge success.... and in tonights Fun Meet....the 36 athletes treated parents...coaches and volunteers to a pre Halloween Party at the Vault Barn..... with 15 vaulters setting All-Time Personal Best performances and all others enjoying the fun of our first club gathering before the formal Winter Club starts up next week. We would like to THANK all meet volunteers for making the meet run smooth and fast on the two pits.... Hats off to Stephanie Duffy...Bob Sorensen,Beth Becher, Jim Henderson,Brett Carey,Nick Mirecki, Mike Carey,Will Nesbitt,Rob Pasek and all the parents and grandparents supporting their kids and dreams...... It takes the entire village to run our large club and we APPRECIATE EVERYONE HELPING..... BRING ON THE WINTER TRAINING CYCLE!!!!! GIRLS/WOMEN SOAR in all divisions..... Taking top honors was two-time All American Pole Vaulter..Kaeli "Sparkie" Thompson of Warwick Valley,NY. This senior honor student flipped over 12' 6" by a foot on her 8 Step approach and close at 13' 0"... posts.Title: "CIRCUS DRIVE" ....  "SHARE-the-SPIRIT" !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC USATF Club # 06-1129 Warwick, New York "The DRIVE-IS-ON" ...@ FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT. YES... our 83 Pole Vaulters are in motion with early season prep drills for some great leaps this winter into the foam pits in our five Metro -States of the BIG EAST!!! Our kick-off week was 'full of wonder'...as the 'New Kids on the Block" laced up their spikes with the excitement of the new pole vault challenges that are just around the corner. When kids are internally MOTIVATED...there ARE NO LIMITS in SPORT. IT'S GOING TO BE ANOTHER FUN YEAR @ CIRCUS!!!!!

The DRILLS PROGRAM @ CIRCUS

REPETITION...is the MOTOR of LEARNING . The strength of our pole vault instruction is our drills program. We use 365 + pole vault drills at various cycles during our 10 month pole vault development program here at Flying Circus. Each athlete is training for drill mastery in each 21 day macro cycle and then moves up our progressive drills... These drills are the backbone of our pole vault development and have proven the 'European Style" still prevails in the pole vault training method. Drills on Run Posture/Stride Length,Stride Balance...Gymnastic Drills on High Bar,Rings,Trapeze,Ropes are a must for each pole vaulter to "feel-the-positions" that will transfer to the in flight mechanics on the fiberglass pole. PRACTICE SMALL = VAULT BIG !!!!! CIRCUS NEWS .......... * Special thanks to Jon Russell of Weston, CT. for up-grading our BARM MUSIC SOUND SYSTEMS to the professional level. We will now enjoy the lively beat and atmosphere of spirit at every practice. * Our Apparel Fund-Raiser has taken flight..as family orders are rolling in. Hats off to Apparel Chairwomen..Beth Becher for all her organizing of this Fund Raiser again this year. Deadline for all orders is just 7 days away--November 21. Order forms at hvflyingcircus.com . * NEED -A-POLE PROGRAM..... Thanks to Coach Bob Sorensen.. We now have a Rental Pole Program and New Sales Program... ESSX...UCS SPIRIT... and ALTIUS VAULTING POLES.... Get your orders in as soon as possible for this indoor season.. BEST Prices and FASTEST delivery in USA!!! Contact Bob Sorensen at SORENSEN CONSULTING .. b.sorensen@optonline.net or 914-557-1458 . * College Thanksgiving Break Training Together Again.... Join the Alumni Practice... Saturday November 24 AT-THE-BARN from 12 Noon-2PM... 2 Hours of FUN!!!!! * We welcome this indoor season.. Two great new Assistant coaches... Isaac Heatley(Warwick,NY) and Bob Sorensen(Warwick,NY) ... New Ideas...New Spirit...New Drills!!!!! * INDOOR SEASON IS ALMOST HERE... Our first meet is Saturday December 8th at West Point........ YOU ARE READY !!!!! FLYING CIRCUS.... PASSION CHANGES EVERYTHING.

posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON (Warwick Valley,NY-Pole Vaulter) …..SIGNS on @ DUKE UNIVERSITY !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC Warwick Valley, New York The FLYIG CIRCUS Pole Vault Club of Warwick, New York is proud to announce this week's latest scholarship signing by two-time All American Pole Vaulter....Kaeli Thompson of Warwick Valley Central High School,New York. Kaeli will be joining the DUKE UNIVERSITY Blue Devils Track & Field program next fall for her academic and athletic development. Kaeli is school record holder both Indoor and outdoor seasons and All-Time Section 9 Pole Vault record at 13' 2.5" in last years New Balance Indoor Nationals. She has been developed in all events at Warwick Valley Central by Head Coach Mike Potter...Curtis Akacki, Kirk Thomas...Dr.Frank Welling...Assistant Coaches Tori Pennings and Gene Burns under the direction of Athletic Director Greg Sirico. She is a High Honor Roll student and National Honor Society and will be coached in pole vault at DUKE by one of the finest pole vault coaches on the planet---Associate Head Coach - Shawn Wilbourn. She follows former Flying Circus All American Pole Vaulter ...Megan Clark to the DUKE TRACK & FIELD family... Kaeli is the proud daughter of Greg and Heather Thompson of Warwick, New York .... CONGRATULATIONS

CIRCUS-NATION NEWS

* Our ARMORY POLE VAULT CAMP was FUN and PRODUCTIVE on Saturday.... Our staff of Hugh Cauthers...Brian Leggett....Ken Cevoli and Bob Sorensen were outstanding all day with the 30+ pole vault athletes of the future. Special Thanks to Armory Track & Field Director..Aaron Robinson for inviting us to be a part of this exciting program again this year... It's all about grass roots development for our pole vault event. * CONGRATULATIONS to West Point Pole Vault Star Leader ...MADELINE SCHNEIDER of Darien,CT. for being a TOP 14 Finalist for this years RHODES SCHOLARSHIP.. This senior Honor Student has accepted the MARSHALL LEADERSHIP SCHOLARSHIP for her next two years in the United Kingdom for our US Army Department !!! * Our Flying Circus Apparel Orders deadline close out is this Wednesday,,,November 21. Thank you all for taking part in this fund raising project. * HOLIDAY COLLEGE VAULT DAY.... We are all gathering for a Holiday 2-Hour workout and story telling ...on Saturday November 24 at 12 noon-2pm at the Barn Headquarters.. Bring your spikes and stories...($30) for heat!!! * MUSIC Up-Grade @ Barn!!!! We salute Jon Russell of Weston CT. for his spirited work on bringing our Music Sound System to the upper-Professional level this week.. You won't believe your ears...."SURAND SOUND @ CIRCUS".... providing the 'Greatest Pole Vault Atmosphere in America" ---- THANK YOU JON RUSSELL !!!! * Congratulations To Pole Vaulter Sydney Woods of Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ for leading her team this week to another NJ STATE VOLLEYBALL TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP. Her 9 Kills and MVP of the tournment was huge and she now will hit the pole vault pits with more power. This UPENN signee has accepted her invitation to the 112th NYRR MILLROSE GAMES Jr, Girls ole Vault on February 9th at the Armory!!!! * FLYING CIRCUS STAFF wishes every family a HAPPY THANKSGIVING !!!!!

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS ...READY-To-FLY" !!!!
posts.Content: "The hay is in the barn "....it's time to FLY!!! Welcome to the INDOOR TRACK & FIELD season @ FLYING CIRCUS!!!!! There will be many new and exciting challenges coming for all us this winter season and we would like to salute your dedication and focus for the past four months of serious training . Now..it's your time to enjoy your sport. Your FASTER...STRONGER.... and TOUGHER than ever before and with your technical gains in technique model...it will be filled with FUN. Our goals should be more than just new personal bests... our goals should also focus on the pure beauty of .."'the competitive spirit" that lies deep in each one of us... and the display of true sportsmanship at every competition. posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON …13' 0" and SYDNEY WOODS …12' 7" OPEN BIG @ ARMORY !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club Warwick, New York The "Flying-Season" is officially open !!!! Congratulations to all Circus Pole Vaulters at every level for starting up the competitive Indoor Pole Vault Tour in our five states on a great note. Seventy five Flying Circus athletes laced up there spikes this past three days and the ..."Spirit-of-Athletics" is now in motion. Enjoy the benefits of serious training and full time commitments. The fireworks started up Friday night at both the New Balance Armory and West Point 's Gillis Field House. The 24 athletes at the Armory were led by Warwick Valley,NY senior Kaeli Thompson (USA #2) and Northern Valley-Demarest,NJ senior Sydney Woods. (USA #4) . These elite training partners were ready to help each other soar...as Kaeli Thompson soared to a new meet record of 13' 0" on her biggest pole ever. This Duke University recruit used her eight step approach and had two close bars at 13' 3.5". Honor Student ..Sydney Woods, just finishing her MVP Volleyball State Championship season for NV-Demarest also flew to a New School and Bergen County All Time record with her 12' 7" leap. This UPENN recruit used her 8 Step and big poles for her near bar at 13' 0" !!!! Abington Heights,PA senior Dani Heine opened strong with a huge jump of 11' 0" for Coach Mike Ludka and placed third with a near miss at 11' 7". Our Boys saw outstanding performances from Tunkhannock Area,PA junior strongman..Dalton Yeust at 13' 0")School Indoor Record) and Aidan O'Connor of Lewis-Mills,Ct over 13' 0" to tie for third place in his first ever Armory experience.. Nanuet,NY senior...Chris Filatov came out of the cave with his Personal Best of 14' 6" for the silver medal for Coach Beckerle of the Goldern Knights. Liam Landau(Pascack Hills) flew 13' 6" for forth place...Ron O(Nanuet) 12' 0" Bryden Creogan(RV) 9'6" Chris Dory(RV) 8' 0" *** The Girls were led by Jamie Rossig of Pascack Hills,NJ. posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON SOARS  13' 3.5" (USA #1) @ Stanner Games !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley, NY BREAKING NEWS ------- -New Balance Armory/ Jan.12. ----- Warwick Valley Central,NY .... senior pole vaulter...Kaeli "Sparkie" Thompson , took to the pole vault runway at the Archbishop Molloy Stanner Games and zoomed to a USA #1...School and Section 9 All - Time Pole Vault performance with her 13' 3.5" sail on her 13' 7" x 170 vault stick to delight the overflowing crowd of pole vault fans. posts.Title: LIAM LANDAU (Pascack Hills,NJ) SAILS  15' 9"... SYDNEY WOODS(NV-Demarest,NJ)  12' 0"  @ Ocean Breeze!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure,LLC Warwick Valley, NY "VAULT FIREWORKS" @ Ocean Breeze ...... It was all business in the pole vault and other field events at the BIG NORTH INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS last night....with LIAM LANDAU of Pascack Hills,NJ setting a New Meet/School/Bergen County All-Time Indoor Pole Vault record vault of 15' 9" for the Cowboys of Pascack Hills...coached by Ross Koehler. This is just one part of the magnificent night for Liam Landau, the Northeast University recruit. This powerful and speedy senior leader won ALL FOUR of his events in super performances... He won the 55m Hurdles in 8.04...then...the Long Jump at 21' 4" then the High Jump at 6' 0" ..and then Pole Vault at1 5' 9"RECORD!!! Thats...right... 40 TEAM POINTS!!!!!! Pole Vaulters can do many different events!!!!! Placing second was Mahwah,Nj senior...Justin Manne at 13'6" SB for the Thunderbirds of Caoch Rob Pasek. Team mate Reece Muller was solid at 11' 0" to score. West Milford Highlander...Mateo Zemer...just a junior..won the Independent Division at 12' 6" and was fast in 55m Dash at 6.98 for third. The Patriot Division winner was Elan Krakow of Tenafly at 11' 6"!! The Girls Championships was another Multi-Event night for Northern Valley-Demarest pole vault star..Sydney Woods. This UPENN recruit flew 12' 0" to win her speciality..then placed first in Long Jump at 16' 0"...... 4'10" in High Jump and 3rd in Triple Jump 33' 4' forCoach Mike Ives and staff. She scored 30 TEAM POINTS!!!!!! We all must be more than just pole vault...as competing for your TEAM is THE ULTIMATE JOY!!!!!!! Jordan Hecker(NV-D) placed silver at 9' 0" and team mate Julia Tucci(NVD) placed 3rd at 9' 0"..Allison Sumereau(Pascack Valley) 8' 6". Gold Medal winner in Girls American Division was Pascack Hills senior star...Jamie Rossig for the Lady CowGirls...This Long Jump/Pole Vault /Relay specialist launched 10' 6"...Circus team mate Kyra Muller(Mahwah) took silver at 9' 6' and Selena Bonura(Mahwah) 7' 0". CONGRATULATIONS to all vaulters!!!!!!!

CIRCUS NEWS

Our Winter Indoor Club Package ends in just 18 days on February 5th. We are proud to have helped 83 MS and HS Pole Vaulters this winter here at FLYING CIRCUS. Your progress and dedication has been inspiring and we look to continue to help you all with EVERYTHING POLE VAULT. Our groups held nothing back and were so very supportive of each other. We are to share in each other success. We will be opening up every Wednesday evening ..beginning Feb. 6 in a Co-Ed setting to help get everyone ready for the CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON of POLE VAULTING. Classes will be Session #1 5:30-7pm and Session #2 7-8:30pm. We also will be open every Sunday for Open Sessions(Except CLOSED SUNDAY FEB 10 for OCL INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS @ West Point). CIRCUS STAFF will be on staff at the March 23rd ARMORY TRACK & FIELD CAMP in the New Balance Track Center,.. Register today at armorycamp.org. It will be FUN!!! Winter Storm approaching this Saturday/Sunday... Check you e-mail on Sunday by 10am to see if we will be open. STAY SAFE this weekend.!!! CIRCUS NATION.......... Drink a cup of kindness.... Rod Stewart

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS  ..... "BECOME MORE"
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault "Nuts", LLC Scenic Warwick Valley, NY "What do you DREAM tonight" ???? That is the most important question each athlete must answer. It's time to step up into the spotlight at mid-season and become your own hero! Legendary Pole Vault Coach Jerry Cahill at Iona Prep has been preaching this concept of self discovery for the past forty years and now it's time for all of us to move up into our own strengths of self belief. Here are a few tips to help you reach your star. *Practice Radical HUMILITY everyday. *Look for GENIUS in others. *Help other people in some way. *Stretch your CONFIDENCE in yourself. *Go beyond the BOUNDARIES in training. *Higher ENERGY is a stimulate in athletics. *Be ALIVE with EFFORT. * Act NOW ..... Don't Blink. BECOME MORE.

Weekend Report .....January 19

New Balance .....Girls Sweep Top Three.. Kaeli Thompson 13' 0"...Sydney Woods 12' 6..... Dani Heine 12' 0"!!! Dalton Yeust Flys 13' 6 School Record!!!! The winter storm alert did not hold back the determined "Flyers" on Friday and Saturday at Tim Fulton's New Balance Games at the "Hall of Fame" Armory. Kaeli Thompson produced her 5th Meet record this indoor season with gold medal vault of 13' 0" on her ESSX 13'7' x 170 Recoil and the was close at 13' 6" with her 14 Foot Sticks... Sydney Woods was on fire big over 12' 6" for silver and Abington Heights,PA senior Dani Heine flew 12' 0" on her new polesto equal her indoor school record for Coach Mike Ludka. Hendrick Hudson ..Haley Merchant jumped 8' 6" and Freshman.. Angelisse Diaz of Newburgh Free Academy won the Freshman Division at 8' 6" for a seasonal best. The Boys NB Championship Division belonged to Iona Prep senior Louis Logsdail at 14' 6" by a ton!!! Placing the silver medal in his pocket ..was the up-and-coming strongman...Dalton Yeust of Tunkhannock,PA. Using his 7 Step approach from the start of the meet and his Big-Boy Poles... Dalton fly to his new Indoor School record of 13' 6" and close bars at 14' 0". Tommy Qualter of Clarkstown South hit 13' 0 for Coach Madoferi ...Dave Murphy(New fairfield) 12' 0"... Mike Moore(Warwick) 11' 0" Jacob Becher(Warwick) 11'0" Merlin Beaufils(Brooklyn Tech) 10' 0" Henry Pennella(Valhalla) 10' 0". New Jersey Relay Championships @ Toms River ---- Conor Reilly Flys 15'0" Again!!!!! Union Catholic,NJ junior Gymnast turned pole vaulter Conor Reilly used his long run at the NJ Relay Championships to win at 15' 0" =School Record!! Team mate Abadare Animashaun cleared 12' 0' for the 18 points for Union. Four Circus girls placed in top 6.. with Hope Handlin (Union Catholic) soarsing 11'0' for the gold and ever so close bar at 11' 6"... Mary Flahive(Holy Angels) 9' 0..Isabella Gray(Union) 9' 0" and Kendall Williams(Holy Angels) at 7' 6". In Group 1 Division... Kyle Russell og Mountain Lakes 10' 6" and Alex Mozsolits(ML) 9' 6" for Coach Jim Murnane. In Connecticut this week... Congrats to Paige Martin of Norwich Free Academy with her 11' 7" National Qualifier for Coach Ross VanSteeg and Elise Russell is coming-on-strong for Coach Matt Medeve at Weston..with her 11' 0" big Clear... Madison Martin is revying it up also at 10' 6" and Katie Ryuan(Newtown) at 9' 6"..... The Boys saw Aidan O'Connor of Lewis-Mills win the Yale Invite at 13' 6" poles. Over at the SCC Coaches meet.. Darien,CT senior scholar---Kiernan Daley flew 13' 0" for a PR and team mates Xander Zanin hit 10' 0" and Alex Jones(D) made 9' 0" for FCIAC qualifier. College Notes... Dane Sorensen had another super college meet at Cornell..placing 3rd at 14' 3.5" for the Red Dragons of Cortland University.... and at Lehigh University...it was Sophomore Madisyn Hawkins(Lehigh) taking gold at 12' 3.5"..and Caitlin Reverand(Lehigh) adding points to the team win at 10' 6" for the Mountain Hawks vs Layafette Dual. CONGRATULATIONS to all---- More to come the second half !!!!! JOIN THE MOVEMENT ........ Fly-the-Circus with us ......

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS" Opens... BEGINNER'S POLE VAULT CLASS !!! Join-the-Future Flyers !!!!
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus POle Vault Project, LLC USATF Club 06-1129 Warwick Valley,NY

CIRCUS PROJECT.... DISCOVER POLE VAULT.

January 25, 2019-- The Flying Circus is proud to launch our new project... DISCOVER POLE VAULT... in Warwick Valley, New York. Our focus will now shift to developing our BEGINNER POLE VAULTERS in our five state region. It's time to" LEARN - HOW- TO -FLY" in Track & Fields most glamours event---- the Pole Vault. This project will offer new access to Pole Vaulting Instruction....Technique...Safety , for the up and coming Boys and Girls in Grades 6- Grades 10. This project begins Sunday January 27 at 11am-12:30pm at The Flying Circus Indoor Facility at The Warwick Center,Warwick,New York. The cost per athlete is $30 for the 90 minute class instruction and continues every Sunday this winter and spring ( EXCEPT-- February 10 and March 10 ). Athletes must have Parent Waiver Form (at www.hvflyingcircus.com) and USAT Membership (at usatf.org/membership) in order to take part in all activities. We look forward to introducing you to the ..World's Greatest Event....THE FLYING POLE VAULT. Other Important Dates WEDNESDAY EVENING VAULT SESSIONS..Begin February 6 5:30-7pm Session & 7-8:30pm Boys & Girls Co-Ed Classes $30 per athlete. SUNDAY OPEN INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCE LEVEL SESSIONS... Girls 12:30-2pm ...Boys 2-3:30pm $30 per athlete. The ARMORY SPRING POLE VAULT CAMP... Saturday.. March 23, 2019... Register at armorycamp.org (Flying Circus Staff) FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS... Limited to First 50 to Register.... Applications April 1 at hvflyingcircus.com GIRLS CAMP... Monday & Tuesday July 8-9, 2019 Warwick,NY Cost $295 per athlete. BOYS CAMP ... Thursday & Friday July 11-12, 2019 Warwick,NY Cost $295 per Athlete. THE FLYING CIRCUS VAULT-MANIA BBQ MEET.... Saturday July 13, 2019 Warwick,NY Cost $40 per athlete..Includes BBQ Lunch. FLYING CIRCUS -----YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE.

posts.Title: DISCOVER POLE VAULT @ FLYING CIRCUS !!!!  BIG WEEKEND RESULTS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus,LLC Warwick Valley,NY

FLYING CIRCUS ON-THE-MOVE UP...CONGRATULATIONS to all ATHLETES!!!!

The weekend was filled with 'Flying Humans'...School Records...."Millrose Magic"...Team Battles... Personal Bests and International Friendship. You can't make this stuff up... it's REAL! NYRR MILLROSE GAMES... Filled with Friendships and 'Spirit'.... The Flying Circus hosted 30 pole vaulters in the three Jr. Vault events..starting on Thursday evening show at the Armory New Balance Center. Danielle Heine(Clarks Falls,PA) blasted over 12' 0" for 3rd place medal... Marisa DiGia( Old Tappan,NJ) also hit 12' 0" for 5th place on bigger poles. The Saturday Elite Jr Events were loaded and Deep ...as the Boys from Arkansas Vault Club put on a fiberglass Clinic with both Haze farmer(Pearcey,AR) taking gold at 17' 2.75" and team mate Rhett nelson(Texarkania,AR) hitting the same 17' 2.75" for the silver medal for Coach Morry Sanders. Top Circus men .. were Liam Landau(Pascack Hills,NJ) at 15' 0" and Shane racey(Ravena,NY) at 15' 0" Conor Reilly(Scotch Plains,NJ) had solid opening height bars for Coach Mike McCabe. The Elite Jr. NYRR MILLROSE Girls were the deepest results ever... with 4 girls over 4.0m and 9 Girls total over 12' 9.5". Completing the NYRR "Millrose Games Double"..was winner Edie Murray(Pearcey,AR) at 13' 5.25" for the Arkansas Vault Club. This was the first time the Boys and Girls winner came from the same Club/HS!!!!! Noah Brown(NP) was 3rd at 11' 0" Bryen Creegan(RV) 10' 0" Colin Drobe9NP) 10' 0". posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS ~~~~~~ "WORKIN'-ON-A-DREAM" ..... JOIN US !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley, NY It has always been about...'Working on your Dream' ,,,here at Flying Circus. The day-to-day work ethic and dedicated routines have always been more important than the final result. After all...... real life is defined by individual and team effort. This is the pure joy of participating in athletics. Effort is the only thing we add to our dreams. This year..more than ever...each one of you have inspired someone else.... to push beyond limits... to support each other in every way and to reach high for your dreams. This Indoor season was special @ Flying Circus.... Keep pushing everyday. These are the days ~ Van Morrison CIRCUS WEEK REVIEW .... Feb. 13----Feb. 18 Bergen County Championships @ Armory ---- SYDNEY WOODS(NVD) soars 13' 0" Record !! / LIAM LANDAU)PH) Flys 15' 6" Record !! Bergen County,NJ loves the Pole Vault Event and their history of excellence proves it true. UPENN bound ..senior ..Sydney Woods of Northern Valley-Demarest and Pascack Hills senior..Liam Landau set all-time records for gold... to lead 18 other Circus Vaulters at the Pole Vault Gala. Girls---Marisa DiGia(OT) 10' 6" Kyra Muller(M) 10' 0" Julia Tucci(NVD) 9' 0" Mary Flahive(HA) 9' 0" Samantha Conjour(PV) 9' 0" Julie Dakwar(R) 9' 0" Boys-Justin Manne(M) 13' 0" Kylo Cho(P) 13' 0" Reese Muller(M) 12' 6" Sean Herlihy(OT) 12' 6" Chris Jost(OT) 12' 0" Brandon Yip(P) 12' 0" Elan Krakow(T) 11' 6" Liam Conroy(NH) 11' 0" Lucas Khowaylo(NH) 11' 0" Connecticut Meet of Champs-Hillhouse,CT -- Paige Martin of Norwich Free Academy won Girls meet at 12' 1" Meet Record for Coach Russ VanSteeg. Weston Junior..Elise Russel.. came on strong this indoor..placed silver at 11' 0" for Coach Matt Meadve. Madison Martin(NFA) 10' 6" Katie Ryan(Newown) 10' 0" Alexis Misiewicz(Trumbull) 9' 6" Boys... Aidan O'Connor(Lewis-Mills) placed 4th at 13' 0" Jackson Hemphill(Fairfield Ludlow) 13' 0" Kiernan Daly(Darien) 12' 6" Mike Blumenstock(Weston) 12' 0" New Jersey State Group Champs-Toms River,NJ --- 3 STATE GROUP CHAMPS... Liam Landau(Pascack Hills)---15' 6" Group 2.....Kyle Cho-(Paramus) 13' 0"-Group 3 .... and Conor Reilly(Union Catholic)... 15' 0" -Non-Public A . SILVER MEDALS went to Hope Handlin(Union Catholic) 10' 6"...Mue Carroll(Matawan) 11' 6" Irene Park(Pequannock) 11' 0" Marisa DiGia(Old Tappan).. 11' 0" !!!! Group 1---Irene Park(P) 11' 0" Kyle Russell(ML) 10' 6" Matt Theuerkauf(GR) 10' 6" Alex Mozsolits(ML) 10' 6" Group 2---Liam Landau(PH) 15' 6" Mateo Zemer(WM) 13' 0" Justin Manne(M) 13' 0" Reese Muller(M) 12' 0" Mue Carroll(M) 11' 6" Jamie Rossig(PH) 10' 6" Kyra Muller(M) 10' 6" Julia Tucci(NVD) 9' 0" Group 3-- Kyle Cho(P) 13' 0" Nick Adams(R) 12' 6" Jason Tomaino(R) 12' 0" Eric Bryne(R) 12' 0" Marisa DiGia(OT) 11'0" Allison Sumereau(PV) 8' 6" Samantha Conjour(PV) 8' 6" Group 4 -- Callum Howald(C) 14'0" Non Public A--- Connor Reilly(UC) 14' 0" Hope Handlin(UC) 10' 6" Mary Flahive(HA) 8' 6" Kendal Williams(HA) 8' 0" Bella Gray(UC) 8' 0" Olivia Toutounijian(HA) 7' 6" SECTION 1 STATE QUALS @ Armory -- 6 Circus athletes advance to States!!! Congrats to Girls-Emily Heese(Somers) 10' 0" Kristen Kolarik(Arlington) 9' 6" Boys-Chris Filatov(Nanuet) 14' 0" Tommy Qualter(Clarkstown South) 13' 3" McDonough(RC Ketchum) 13' 0" Mike Barletta(Harrison) ... Also jumping solid was Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern) 8'6" Haley Merchant(HH) 8' 6" Rebecca Baez(No Rockland) 8' 6" Grace Simpson(TZ) 8' 6" Laura Hancher(TZ) 7'6" Ronald O(Nanuet) 11' 6" Jere Frank(Arlington) 11' 6' SECTION 9 TEAM CHAMPIONSHIPS @ West Point -- 30 Pole Vaulters from Flyin' Circus represented their High School teams in the team scoring in the 7 hour extravaganza at Gills Field House on the Hudson River. Clapping..whistling....screaming and celebrating the pole vault was the fun of it all for athletes,coaches,parents and grandparents. In the Boys..it was all purpose athlete...Nick Villanueva of Monroe-Woodbury leading his team to their 21st Indoor title with 3 events scoring... 13' 0" PV gold...Nick Mirecki(Wash'ville) used his new ESSX poles for silver(12' 6") Louis Martinez(Wallkill) was Top Soph at 12' 0" Mack Hallet(Warwick) 12' 0" PR Jacob Becher(Warwick) 11' 6" Danny Jeong(MW) 11' 0" Kevin Chait(Wash) 10' 6" Mike Moore(Warwick) 10' 6" Anthony Cortez(MW) 10' 0" Chris Ndu(Middd) 9' 0" Ryan Kennedy(Wash) 9' 0" B-Section-Sam Haaland(Onteora) 12' 0"PR Bryden Cregan(RV) 9' 0" Chris Dorney(RV) 8' 0" The Girls Division saw Kaeli Thompson win two events and vault 13' 0" for her 9th time over this season. She had 2 close bars at 13' 6.5" for the Wildcats of Warwick Valley. Julie Penna...heading to York University,PA.. next fall placed in all three events(LJ -PV-Hurdles) 10'0" Gabby Nebiker(MW) 10' 0" Genieve Reilly(Warwick) 10' 0" Keira Couland-Smith(New Paltz) 9' 9" Caroline Fatta(Warwick) 9' 9" Sydney Tomaine(FDR) 9' 3" Daniella Raymond(Wash) 9' 3" Alicia Johnson(MW) 8' 6" Emily Gorczynski(Wash) 8' 6" Sophie Mirecki(Wash) 8' 6" Angelisse Diaz(NFA) 8' 0" Violet Bachorik(Goshen) 7' 0" Shea Ross(Wallkill) 7' 0" NEXT UP--- Tuesday Evening---BOYS & GIRLS EASTERN STATES @ Armory...No Circus Practice. Friday Evening----- BOYS & GIRLS SECTION 9 STATE QUAL MEET @ West Point...No Circus Practice CONGRATULATIONS to former WARWICK VALLEY GIRLS TRACK & FIELD COACH...RICH FURST for his SECTION 9 Track & Field HALL-OF-FAME Selection. This legendary Warwick Valley Girls Head Coach built the Girls Track and Field program to National Prominence from 1974 thru 2014 in Cross Country-Indoor Track and Outdoor Track. Also being inducted will be Coaching Legends Charlie Delmonico of Washingtonville High School Wizards and Malcolm Burks of Newburgh Free Academy. The Hall of Fame Dinner will be May 5 at 2:00pm at Kuhls Highland House,Midddletown,New York Please join us for the entire celebration of athletes,coaches and officials of Section 9 Track & Field !!! For more information/tickets ... www.Section IXHOF.com * The Flying Circus will be instructing the Pole Vault event at The ARMORY SPRING TRACK & FIELD CAMP on Saturday March 23, 2019 in the New Balance Armory in New York City--- Please join us for this Pre-Season Camp and get ready for your spring season ... Register at armorytrackcamp.org.

posts.Title: 85th EASTERN STATES - KAELI THOMPSON 13' 4" ....LIAM LANDAU  15' 0"  LEAD-the CIRCUS-CHARGE !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley,NY

The EASTERN STATES CHAMPIONSHIPS lived up to it's billing!!!!!!

Congratulations to Meet Director..Jacob Brown of Ridgewood,NJ for again packing up each event with National Stars in this 85th edition of ....The EASTERNS at the 168th Street New Balance Armory Center. The CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON is HERE!!!!! Pole Vault Official..Tim Wilson and his brother ran a fast moving..athlete centered pole vault event for both the boys and girls. Warwick Valley,NY senior Kaeli Thomposon set a new meet record of 13' 4" on her 8th jump and then was very close at her 13' 8" bar to move to USA#5. She used her 14' 1 x 165 ESSX RECOIL to set her 6th Meet Record of the season and her 11th bar over 13' 0" semi-barrier !!! She also set a school record of 17' 4.5" in the long jump for Coach Mike Potter's Purple Wave. Norwich Free Academy,Ct... State Open Champ ...Paige Martin(junior) placed 3rd at 11' 7" for Coach Russ VanSteeg. Union Catholic,NJ senior...Hope Handlin was sensational over 11' 0" with BIG AIR..Marisa DiGia(Old Tappan-Junior) and Jamie Rossig(Pascack Hills,NJ) were strong over 11' 0" for the 15 athlete circus team in the meet. The Boys Vault was close...with 4 guys over 15'0" and the result coming down to misses. Pascack Hills,NJ ..senior Multi-Event star..Liam Landau prevailed at 15' 0" for gold medal for Coach Ross Kohler's Cowboys!!!! This Northeastern University recruit continues the battle at Saturday's NJ Meet of Champions at Toms River Bubble at 10AM. Louis Logsdail of Iona Prep was sensational at 15' 0" for Coach Jerry Cahill... Conor Reilly of Union Catholic,NJ.. 14' 0" Callum Howald(Columbia,NJ) 13' 6" and Justin Manne(Mahwah,NJ) 13' 6" for Coach Pasek's Thunderbirds!!! OPEN WEDNESDAY(FEB. 20) POLE VAULT CLASSES are moved to Thursday Feb. 21..due to todays incoming winter ice storm. Regular class times...5:30-7pm and 7-8:30pm. Stay Safe.

CALLING ALLL POLE VAULT BEGINNERS

We now offer Open Sunday BEGINNERS POLE VAULT CLASSES for Boys and Girls in Grades 6-12... Discover our great event and learn how to fly out of your nest!!!!! Still..just #30 per athlete..... Free Parking and Music included.

ARMORY SPRING TRACK & FIELD CAMP

JOIN US for a POLE VAULT PARTY!!! The Flying Circus Pole Vault Staff will be part of the Armory Track Camp on Saturday March 23, 2019 in New York City.. Come to the BIG APPLE POLE VAULT PARTY and LEARN MORE about our Flying Pole Vault Event. Register today at armorycamp.org

posts.Title: "BIG ~ CIRCUS ~ AIR"  Weekend ---- DANE SORENSEN 15' 9" ... LIAM LANDAU 15' 6" ... ALVA SUNDIN ... 13' 1.75" !!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick Valley, NY "KEEP the LIGHT BURNING...." ~~ Bruce Springsteen CONGRATULATIONS to ALL ATHLETES who competed this past weekend of the CHAMPIONSHIP POLE VAULT SEASON. Many new stories and many wonderful experiences were shared by you all the past four months together here at Flying Circus Central. Your efforts do not go un-noticed and your spirit to reach for your very best has been inspiring to all our staff and all your parents. It's now a short recovery period and then... time to RESET your GOALS for our up-coming Spring Track & Field adventure. THANK YOU for everything this Indoor. "KEEP the LIGHT BURNING..." !! The weekend kicked off Friday night at little Houghton College in up-state New York...with the SUNYAC Indoor Track and Field League Championships. Cortland State University freshman...Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY) continued his success story this season ...by winning the Conference Pole Vault title with his 15' 9" (4.80m) leap for Head Coach Steve Patrick and Dr.Peter McGinnis. Clearing every bar on his first attempt sealed the deal and had super bars at 16' 1"!!! Up at Harvard University Ivy League Championships.. Former Circus star..Julia Valenti of Dartmouth won the Vault Gold with her 12' 10 sail.... and UPENN freshman..Abby Norwillo came thru with a seasonal best 12' 10" for 4th place points..as the UPENN WOMEN won again the team title for Head Coach Steve Dolan/Joe Klim!!!! The New Jersey Meet of Champions--Toms River,NJ ~~~ There is joy in Pascack Hills, New Jersey!!!! Senior Multi-Athlete/Pole Vaulter won his first Meet of Champions Pole Vault title for Coach Ross Koehler Cowboys with a clean 15' 6" first attempt and then close at 16' 0" on his new pole... on to Nationals!!! Placing high(4th) was Union Catholic junior ..Conor reilly at 15' 0" and Callum Howald(Columbia) at 13' 6". The Girls were lead by Northern Valley-Old Tappan--junior..Marisa DiGia coached by Jeff Clark/Alex Eckemeyer, with a big 12' 0" for the silver medal. Matawan senior-Mue Carroll was solid over 11' 0"...Jamie Rossig(Pascack Hills) tied her School Record at 11' 0"... Hope Handlin(Union Catholic) also tied her School ecord at 11' 0" .. Irene Park(Pequennock) 10' 6". Down at Penn State Indoor Champs... Dani Heine(Abington Heights) sailed 11' 0" and heads to Nationals EE with more in the tank. SWEDISH JR. NATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIPS- Stockholm,Sweden ~~~ SHE DID IT !!!!! Adopted Flying Circus Swedish Jr. star..Alva Sundin...coached by the legendary pole vault champion.. Carl Alm... is now Sweden's NATIONAL JR> POLE VAULT CHAMPION. The humble Alva used her 14' 1 x 150 UCS Spirit to produce a seasonal best 13' 1.75" to win on her final jump of the meet. This two-time NYRR Millrose Games junior will be back for her final Jr. NYRR Millrose Games next year!!!!! It's another ..Never-Give-Up Story !!! Congratulations Carl and Alva from Flying Circus!!! "BIG PURPLE" Pentathlon Meet @ Armory---- Dalton Yeust (junior) from Tunkhannock Area ,PA is a determined and dedicated pole vaulter with a dream. Dalton won his first Armory Gold Pole Vault Medal with a sensational clear of 14' 4" for Coach Clayton Yeust. He also brushed off 14' 10" for a national spot... but returns to his backyard pit this spring for more work. Tommy Qualter(CS) went big also at 14' 4" sB..Chris Filatov(Nanuet) 13' 10"...Mike Alteri(Somers) 13' 4" Ron O(Nanuet) 12' 4" Jeremy Frank(Arlington) 11' 4". The girls winner was Emily Heese(Somers) at 9' 6" Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern) 9' 6" Kristen Kolarik)Arlington) 9' 0". SECTION ( STATE QUALS_West Point,NY ~~~ Washingtonville,NY junior...Nick Mirecki, coached by Stephanie Duffy .. came out of his cave with a sensational personal best and school record .. 14' 0" and close bars at 14' 6" for the Wizards. Nick Villanueva(Monroe-Woodbury) cleared 14' 0" for Coach Hemmer/Coach Glover.. Louis Martinez(Wallkill) advanced to state meet with 12' 6"(Top Soph).. Jacob Becher(Warwick) fly 11' 0" Danny Jeong(MW) 11' 0" Noah Brown(NP) 11' 0" Anthony Cortez(MW) 10' 0" Kevin Chait(Wash) 10' 0" The Girls Meet rolled out 10 Circus Girls for some Fiberglass-Fun... Warwick Valley senior captain...Kaeli Thompson hit 12' 0" to qualify..then hit relay duty...Julia Penna(MW) set a personal best at 11' 0" to punch her ticket to state and team mate Gabby Nebiker is off to states next weekend with her 10' 0" Keira Couland-Smith(NP) 9' 6" Daniella Raymond(Wash) 9' 0" Sydnet Tomaine(FDR) 9' 0" Sophie Mirecki(Wash) 8' 6"SB Violet Bachorik(Goshen) 8' 0"SB Angelisse Diaz(NFA) 8' 0" Shea Ross(Wallkill) 7' 0". FLYING CIRCUS MASTERS CHAMPION....WILL NESBITT RETIRES..... CONGRATULATIONS and THANK YOU .. to Flying Circus Pole Vault Coach Will Nesbitt for an unbelievable experience he shared with all of our Circus Vaulters...Parents and Coaches. ' Will has been an inspiration to all of us here at Flying Circus Pole Vault Project for the past 7 years. His positive and encouraging technical coaching style is a model for all of us. He promoted our event at The Armory Foundation and started up the pole vault spirit for all youth in New York City. He fought for all the under-privileged and always was there to help in every way. He will be still with us on a part time basis to help coach the future. Thank you Will from your Flying Circus Family." ** Will graduated from Duke University...following a senior year in high school... full of success in the Pole Vault(16' 4" --Still MOC Meet Record!!).. HS Decathlon Champion and Hurdling Champion. He was last years' World Ranked #1 at 13' 1" Pole Vault(56 group) ~ 3rd in 2018 Outdoor Worlds Masters competition... 2nd in World Indoor Championships. !!!!! He will now turn his energy to Rock Climbing and Hurdling world-wide!!!! The Flying Circus will be CLOSED for 6 DYAS for REST & RECOVERY for all athletes and Coaches from March 10- March 16 !!!! We start the ... "DRIVE for SPRING EXCELLENCE" on Sunday March 17 Regular Open Sessions!

posts.Title: CIRCUS  SENDS  5 to NY STATE MEET VAULT  PODIUM..... KAELI THOMPSON..13' 0"  ..  SHANE RACEY .. 15' 0" !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus, LLC Warwick Valley,NY Ocean Breeze,NY The New York State Indoor State Track & Field Meeting Saturday ... March 2 The 10 Flying Circus athletes fought their way thru the snow storm and produced super efforts in the 92 million dollar sports complex ..Ocean Breeze... this past Saturday at the New York State Indoor Track & Field Championships. CONGRATULATIONS to all the participating athletes and their parents ,who have supported their children at every turn this past four months of Indoor Track & Field. The huge positive life lessons learned on the athletic fields can not be taken for granted.... but..they can be cherished forever. "These are the days to savor." ~~ Van Morrison The Boys Pole Vault started the day...as Ravena,NY junior..SHANE RACEY was sensational over 15' 0" for his 3rd place medals in both the Public and Federation standings. This humble star out of the Albany area has been solid all season and will compete this weekend at NB Nationals. Placing his first state medal in 8th place ..was senior Tommy Qualter of Clarkstown South,NY... with a new school and personal best of 14' 6" for Head Coach Peter Mondoferri. Just missing the podium ..was multi-star jumper..Nick Villanueva of Monroe-Woodbury at 14' 0" for Coaches Matt Hemmer and Jim Glover. Completing his comeback season was Washington,NY Wizard...Nick Mirecki(junior) at 13' 0" for Coach Mike White and Coach Stephanie Duffy. Top Soph at state was louis martinez of Wallkill,Ny at 12' 6" !!! The Girls Pole Vault followed at 12 noon and took place on two separate runways.... with Warwick Valley,NY senior...KAELI THOMPSON..soaring big over 13' 0" for her two silver medals in Public and Federation scoring. Thompson..USA#5 this indoor... has produced 12 jumps over the 13' 0" mark...had very close bars at 13' 3" with her 14' sticks and heads to NB Nationals this Sunday at the armory. Winning her first state vault medal..was Kristen Kolarik of Arlington,NY.. with a personal best school record 11' 0". Monroe-Woodbury ..senior Julia Penna ..hurdler/jumper...soared over 11'0" to equal her best and take home her dual medals. Team mate Gabby Nebiker(MW) was solid in 11place at 10' 6" for the Lady Crusaders!!!! WE SALUTE YOU ALL....ON TO THE NEXT CHALLENGES TOGETHER!!!! ************************* DANE SORENSEN....... FLYS AGAIN ~~~~~~ Cortland State University Freshman ..Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY) won the AARTF Conference meet this past Weekend at Ithaca College...with another personal best 15' 9.75" for the Red Dragons. He is now on his way to the Division III National Championships this weekend in Boston!!!! He was close at 16' 1 AGAIN!!! Team Mate Ryan Lawless sailed 14' 0". Dane will be coaching at our summer pole vault camps July 8-12 and will be shooting for that 17 Footer at our CIRCUS BBQ Meet on July 13!!!! Join us for all the fun this summer!!!! In the Womens AARTF Conference.. it was Freshman...Nicole Lester (Ridgewood,NJ) of TCNJ placing 4th at 11' 6.5"...Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) placed at 11' .75" Mary O'Brien (SJ Fischer) 10' 6.75' Julia Nomberg(Ithaca) 10' .75" !!!! STILL TIME to REGISTER ****************************** Our Flying Circus Pole Vault Staff .. will be instructing the Pole Vault sections at THE ARMORY CAMP ...at the New Balance Track Center Armory,NYC on Saturday March 23, 2019. This per season camp is for BEGINNERS...INTERMEDIATE and ELITE POLE VAULTERS...... If you are serious about learning more about training..strength development... speed ..drills and technique... the register today at armorycamp.org !!! CIRCUS CLOSED Sunday March 10 thru Saturday March 16 for Complete Recovery. We start up the VAULT ENGINE AGAIN on our regular SUPER SUNDAYS SCHEDULE March 17. Beginners Boys & Girls 11am-12:30PM Girls Intermediate/Elite 12: 30-2PM Boys Intermediate/Elite 2-3:30PM.... Cost still just $30 per athlete. COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT UP.

Thompson..USA#5 this indoor... has produced 12 jumps over the 13' 0" mark...had very close bars at 13' 3" with her 14' sticks and heads to NB Nationals this Sunday at the armory. Winning her first state vault medal..was Kristen Kolarik of Arlington,NY.. with a personal best school record 11' 0". Monroe-Woodbury ..senior Julia Penna ..hurdler/jumper...soared over 11'0" to equal her best and take home her dual medals. Team mate Gabby Nebiker(MW) was solid in 11place at 10' 6" for the Lady Crusaders!!!! WE SALUTE YOU ALL....ON TO THE NEXT CHALLENGES TOGETHER!!!! ************************* DANE SORENSEN....... FLYS AGAIN ~~~~~~ Cortland State University Freshman ..Dane Sorensen(Warwick Valley,NY) won the AARTF Conference meet this past Weekend at Ithaca College...with another personal best 15' 9.75" for the Red Dragons. He is now on his way to the Division III National Championships this weekend in Boston!!!! He was close at 16' 1 AGAIN!!! Team Mate Ryan Lawless sailed 14' 0". Dane will be coaching at our summer pole vault camps July 8-12 and will be shooting for that 17 Footer at our CIRCUS BBQ Meet on July 13!!!! Join us for all the fun this summer!!!! In the Womens AARTF Conference.. it was Freshman...Nicole Lester (Ridgewood,NJ) of TCNJ placing 4th at 11' 6.5"...Samantha Kaplan(New Paltz,NY) placed at 11' .75" Mary O'Brien (SJ Fischer) 10' 6.75' Julia Nomberg(Ithaca) 10' .75" !!!! STILL TIME to REGISTER ****************************** Our Flying Circus Pole Vault Staff .. will be instructing the Pole Vault sections at THE ARMORY CAMP ...at the New Balance Track Center Armory,NYC on Saturday March 23, 2019. This per season camp is for BEGINNERS...INTERMEDIATE and ELITE POLE VAULTERS...... If you are serious about learning more about training..strength development... speed ..drills and technique... the register today at armorycamp.org !!! CIRCUS CLOSED Sunday March 10 thru Saturday March 16 for Complete Recovery. We start up the VAULT ENGINE AGAIN on our regular SUPER SUNDAYS SCHEDULE March 17. Beginners Boys & Girls 11am-12:30PM Girls Intermediate/Elite 12: 30-2PM Boys Intermediate/Elite 2-3:30PM.... Cost still just $30 per athlete. COME JOIN THE MOVEMENT UP.

posts.Title: KAELI THOMPSON WINS NATIONAL POLE VAULT TITLE  !!!!
posts.Content: The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project, LLC Warwick, New York There is pure joy in Warwick,New York tonight !!!!! Warwick Valley Central High School, multi-event senior athlete ~~~ Kaeli Thompson was crowned..."NATIONAL POLE VAULT CHAMPION" with a School..Section 9 and Personal Best leap of 13' 6.25" for Head Coach Mike Potter's "Purple Wave" Indoor Track team. Great athletes have great bounce...and this was a super comeback event for the goal oriented team captain. Kaeli used her biggest pole in the bag to (14' 1" x 170") to take home the gold medal in the deepest Girls Pole Vault Field ever, as six girls fly 13' 2.5" or better in the 2 hour competition. Fueled by her head Running Coach.Mike Potter and strengthened by her Strength and Fitness Coach..Dr.Frank Welling...Kaeli was set up for success.. It marked her 14 Bar over 13'0" this season... a remarkable achievement of consistency this indoor. She was ready for the break-out performance today at her home track---The NB ARMORY!!!! Congratulations Kaeli--We are proud of you... Conor Reilly of Union Catholic also soared to All American Emerging Elite status ...with his 4th place at 14' 10" for this junior sprinter/vaulter/gymnast. Dani Heine(Abington Heights) looked solid at 11' 2.5" on Friday...Marisa DiGia of Old Tappan(junior) broke her pole and kept on going strong all day... Liam Landau of Pascack Hills..our New Jersey Meet of Champions winner this indoor is ready for 16 Foot Barrier this spring!!! CONGRATULATIONS to all ATHLETES ...PARENTS and COACHES!!!!!!
