posts.Title: " JOIN-the-VAULT TEAM " ..... 2021 FLYING CIRCUS APPAREL  GEAR SALE .... LAST CALL !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault  Adventure, LLC  Warwick Valley Paradice, NY


   JOIN the FUN @ FLYIMNG CIRCUS....... Our    successful Fund Raising...  CIRCUS  APPEARL GEAR  program    will end  on November 6  and  we  thank   every family  for    taking part  thios year.  Our brand   will  now   be EVERYWHERE in SIGHT!!!!!      Final orders can be placed in the  next   fseven days  at  ....https://fancloth.shop/A3YAW  ...  Check out  the  fantastic appareal store for  ALL HOLIDAY GIFTS!!!     Special thanks  to  Circus Coach Rob Pasek for running  the   direct on-line appearl program  this year  for all of  us.   All profits will be used   for  new purchase  of   vaulting poles for  this  winter/spring  seasons.   Many thanks.


   Flying Circus  Accepted Winter Club  athletes begin on November 9 (Boys & Girls Co-Ed Group)  and   November  10 (Girls  only Group).  There is  a  Wait List for  athletes  , as  we   SOLD OUT  fast  again this year.   We will  provide Open Sundays  sessions   for   athletes  not in the  Winter Club Training Package. We hope  to  service    everyone  interested  in pole vault. During our Indoor  Training  Sessions we  are limited  to ATHLETES ONLY  with  FACE COVERINGS and TEMP monitoring at the   enterence  door.  NO CLASS SWITCHING...NO CLASS MAKE-UPS .... NO SPECTATORS,SIBLINGS or PARENTS  ALLOWED in any   Team  Workouts,Meets,Clinics  during INDOOR SEASON.  Stay Safe  and Flatten-the-Curve !!!!!


  Pole Vault Meets @ Circus  will be    starting at the  end of November  for all Beginner...Intermediate   and Advanced(College) athletes who   are members of our  club ONLY.  These  meets  will   be    every  2  weeks this  Indoor...as we  aim  to provide Pole Vault Meets that  count for  your profile during this Covid time.    This meet  schedule will be on Sundays  and restricted   to 15 athletes per meet and On-Line Sign Up. Enteries  will   close after the  15th  athlete registered.   Payment per meet  will be  $50/athlete.... by check At-the-Door ONLY.(Check payable  to HV FLYING CIRCUS, LLC).  JOIN-the-CIRCUS MEETS  with US  this  Winter!!!!


  FLYING CIRCUS..... "TEACHING CONFIDENCE "... Thru POLE VAULTING.

posts.Title: CIRCUS HOLIDAY FLYERS ~~~~ LOUIS MARTINEZ 15' 3" (HS) … DANE SORENSEN 14' 3 (Open) !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Project  Warwick Valley, NY     December 13, 2020   CIRCUS HOLIDAY BOYS MEET


  "Knocking~the~Rust Off" ~~~~~   

Our  limited  15 Boys Holiday Classic  was  filled   with  adreline ...spirit   and  high booming   fun today  at Flying Circus headquarters. Performing without  spectators...parents....siblings  and friends  was no problem thanks  to Greg Mirecki's You Tube   streaming live service to keep us all COVID SAFE.   Competitors.....staff  and  volunteers were  all MASKED - UP  all day  to help bring the  curve down. It was   simply..wonderful  spirit  and sportsmanship on display during  the  two hour meet. Special thanks  to all volunteers for  a  super meet together.   

Taking  the 20 oz.  Bottle  of Raspberry JOE TEA  winning  prize in the High School division  was Wallkill,NY  senior  Louis Martinez at  15' 3 clear   and  3 close bars  at 16' 1" . The  Boys Open division  JOE TEAM belonged  to "Hometown Hero", Dane Sorensen (Warwick,NY)  at 14' 3" on his ESSX.   Top SOPH Award  goes  to Andy Cimino(Warwick,NY) at 12' 9" , as  each athlete represented  their  hometowns...not  their  High Schools.  Perhaps  the   most interesting  fireworks  came  from Albany HS  freshman.... posts.Title: CIRCUS GIRLS HOLIDAY CLASSIC ~~~SAMANTHA SMITH 11' 9" RECORD ~~~~ 12 CIRCUS PR's !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC  Warwick Valley,NY @ The  Warwick Center


  FLYING CIRCUS GIRLS HOLIDAY POLE VAULT MEET  December 20, 2020
  The Circus Girl are   starting  to " BRING~the~HEAT" on the super-fast runways  in that  little old Barn in Warwick Valley.  Todays  Elite Level meet produced  some  unbelievabl  results  from  the  14 Gold Level Pole Vaulting group ..... The GIRLS of CIRCUS  threw up  12  PR's... School  Records.... Biggest Poles  Ever.... and Tons-of-Fun all day..   The very best part of  the day belonged  to the  athletes who  refused  to leave the facility ..untill  EVERYONE  was finished.   This  supportive  concept is the basis  for  what  sport really should be  about......  TEAM...SPORTSMANSHIP.... and  a TOGETHER SUPPORT SPIRIT.  This is what we had  today...... this is  pure  sport.  Thank you all for setting  positive examples.
 "VOLUNTEERISM " IS ALIVE @ CIRCUS.....  Hats Off to our " volunteers"...... Russ & Carlys Lemler....Brian Smith...Bob & Dane Sorensen.....Melanie Beattie.... Greg Mirecki.....Ken  Cevoli....JulieKay Christian  and Stephanie Duffy.  YOU MAKE THESE KIDS  GREAT!!!!!
RECAP --------CIRCUS GILS HOLIDAY CLASSIC

The action started with our  best 45 minute  dynamic  Warm Up of the Year.  In the High School Division... it was  Samantha Smith(Syossset,NY) taking the  RASPBERRY JOE TEA  prize home  with her  11' 9" PR/School  and Section Record. This  junior,Coached by Stephanie Duffy, was close at 12' 3 bar on her  12' 7"  x 125 ESSX. There were 12 Total PR's in the meet  and Coach Greg Mirecki zoomed it out  to another PR...  50 family  friends  and 171 Views on  Live YouTube  Stream, with  some new graphics adding  to  the frenzy. Taking Joe Tea home in the Middle School Division was 8th grader..Rachel Venter at 10' 9"  and close bar  at 11' 3 State Class record.   Looking  super in the Womens Open Division was Megan Biscoglio of Southington,CT  wirh an  easy  sail over  10' 3"  from short run approach.   More Meets  coming mid January.....  WE BE READY.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS BOYS "VAULT~MANIA" MEET… LOUIS MARTINEZ 15' 0" GIRLS OPEN…ALANA CARROLL 12' 10" ~~~~~~ 8 ATHLETES SET NEW PR's !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus , LLC    Thw Warwick Center,NY
  January 10, 2021  


  The Flying Circus Indoor Headquarters on the  second  floor HayLoaft was loaded   with  electric  fun ... contagious  team  spirit... and  some  down home improvements  from  the  16  athletes.     Eight   athletes  set new All Time PR's ... even some  double  and triple PR's   and  School Record  attempts in the   two hour meet presented  by  FLYING CIRCUS VOLUNTEERS.  Greg Mirecki streamed  it out  to all,  setting records  in peak viewing(47)   and over  205 views(Record) for  the meet.   Everyone who  came  in today was ready!Special thanks  to ScoreKeeper Neil Howard.. Steve Martinez,Jeff Clark,Brett Carey,Stephanie Duffy,Bob Sorensen,Greg Mirecki   and Dane Sorensen for  a GREAT MEET  today.


  Wallkill,NY  senior  S[printer/Jumper...  Louis Martinez  soared  today at 15' 0"  and then  moved  up to longer poles   at 15' 6" with success.  Taking the JOE TEA prize in the Open Mens Division was Michael Carey(Washingtonville,NY) at 13' 4"   and nearly  jumped  a New Family Record  at 13' 10" !!! Top Freshman again was Neil  Howard  from Albany ,NY  with  his  12'10" Sail  and moved to  14 poles for  first time  ever.    Putting  the pressure on the boys all day  was  Harvard standout Alana Carroll. Taking  a gap year... this  former  National NB  Champion from Albany Area,NY  was  sensational  over  12' 10"  and close bars at 13' 4" !!!!!     Full Results  Below in  Divisions. posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS"…… "The BOYS LIST" ~~~~~~~ 53 STRONG PAST CHAMPIONS….. JOIN~the~LIST !!!!!
FLYING CIRCUS GIRLS "VAULT~MANIA" Meet..... ALICIA JOHNSON FLYS  11' 8" ....   7 New PR's !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Adventure 
The  Golden Valley....Warwick, NY

 GIRLS VAULT~MANIA~~~~ Recap   January 10, 2021


   The VAULT ARENA at Flying Circus  was buzzing  with  enthusiam  and  the Girls  were ready to take on the real bar at our GIRLS VAULT~MANIA meet today.  The  18 Girls was  organized...focused..groomed  and  solid  in supporting each other with clapping..cheering   and whistling.  Winter Club training is   paying off...as  7 New PR's were set. as well  as  YouTube  Viewers   PR  at  271  people tuned  into  Greg Mirecki's  YouTube  live streaming. during the  2 hour meet.

   The ultimate  prize of  a 20 oz. Bottle  of   Smooth lighting .... "JOE TEA" .... was presented  to 6 deserving  athletes  in 5 Grades  and  1 Open Division winner. Taking  the overall  prize  was   Monroe,NY  senior Alicia Johnson.  This  multi-event elite   jumper  and  elite gymnast for the  Crusaders of Monroe  sizzeled  over 2 personal bests  11' 4"   and 11' 8"  and  had  1 close bar at 12' 1" on her  13' poles.  Top Open athletes  was Megan Biscoglio(Southington,CT) at 10' 4....Top Junior Class Vaulters was Sophia Mirecki(Washingtonville,NY)  at 10' 10"...Top Soph  Flyer  was  Ellison Weiner(Weston,CT)  at 10' 4" PR... Top  Freshman was Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) at 11' 4"  and  Top Middle School Vaulter  was  Rachel Vente(Warwick Valley,NY)  at  10' 4" for the  Purple Wave. 

 VOLUNTEERS AGAIN  ..MAKE KIDS HAPPY!!!!!

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS  "RISING STARS #2" MEET ...MICHELLE LEE  10' 4" ///// SCOTT ANDERSON  10' 10" ..... 38 NEW PR's TOTAL !!!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus  The Golden Valley ... Warwick,NY


" YOU CAN"T MAKE THIS STUFF UP " .........   38 Total PR's  on the  same  day... same  meet...  from  20 dedicated  athletes...... WELCOME to  Pole Vault Paradise!!!!!!!!! 

The  Flying  Circus has  always been  about personal development and   striving for  your own World Record.  Such was  the  case on Sunday at Circus Rising Stars #2  gathering at the Warwick Center Vault Barn.  Coach Duffy...Coach Sorensen  and Coach Mirecki produced the   "Greatest PR Meet in our  club history"...  20 athletes/38  New PR's/ 9 Volunteers/ 6 Joe Tea Prizes/ 2 Athletes  setting 5 PR's in one meet......... YOU CAN"T MAKE THIS STUFF UP !!!!      

Hard work  and  dedication produces ...Personal Bests.    Keep marching on.  VOLUNTEERS for KIDS ..... Coach Duffy..Coach Sorensen... Greg Mirecki...Rob Anderson...Mel Beattie.... Sabrina Anderson...Dane Sorensen... James Beck... Coach Rob Pasek

posts.Title: MEGAN "Flips" CLARK ...15'  .25" @ American League ~~~~~  MARCH...Circus Meets  Dates !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus
Warwick, New York


 Megan Clark will not give up.  The former  Flying Circus  and Duke University Sprint/Pole Vault star was in full speed yesterday at the American Track League Meet #3 in Arkansas and  sailed  15' .25"  for  third place in the Elite Pro Division. She  was  ever so close  at bar 15' 4"(4.68m) for  a  Indoor PR!!!!  BIG DREAMS  fuels  us all.  KEEP TRAINING HARD EVERYDAY.   CONGRATULATIONS  MEGAN !!!!!!!!

CIRCUS NEWS

* Our Winter Club #2  begins tomorrow  night and Wednesday night  and thanks  to you all...it's  SOLD OUT.  New start times are 5:15pm-6:45pm (Session #1) and 7:00pm-8:30pm (Session #2). Dress  warmly...Shin Sleeves...Spikes and  water bottle.

* Our Spring  Season New ESSX pole  orders  are happening now  with Coach Sorensen. Order by March and Save Costs on Shipping!!!  Spring will be  here soon for school outdoor   vaulting.

* Our small pod  meets  have been SENSATIONAL...producing personal bests galore   and there are more to  come. See below to mark your calendars. Sign Up links will be  sent to all Winter #1  and Winter #2 athletes, as we are still just inviting our club athletes only untill spring outdoor and summer  seasons.

* Congratulations  to  7th Grader..Luke Beattie(Warwick,NY)  for establishing a  7th Grade PV Class Record of 9' 4" at Rising Stars Meet on January 24. The Circus Youth Movement is in full swing. Many new  young athletes  are  soaring with their dedicated work ethic.  Full speed  ahead!!!

* Special Thanks  to Coach Cevoli for  supplying   new  Circus Key Chain Medals  to the Top 5 Overall  athletes awards in our next 3 Meets.

Sign Up Link Coming  18 Athletes ONLY.   Sunday  March 14, 2021  FLYING CIRCUS BOYS ELITE "VAULT-A-RAMA"..12 Noon..Cost $40/Athlete...Sign Up Link Coming   18 Athletes ONLY.   Thursday  March 18, 2021 FLYING CIRCUS GIRLS ELITE...... 5:00pm  ...Cost $40/Athlete......Sign Up Link Coming  Bar  starts  at 10'0"   18 Athletes ONLY.   Sunday March 21, 2021   FLYING CIRCUS "RISING STARS #4"....12 Noon...Cost $40/Athlete....Sign Up Link Coming Soon  18 Athletes ONLY.   Thursday  March 25, 2021 FLYING CIRCUS "MIDDLE SCHOOL STARS MEET"... 5:00pm.....Cost $40/Athlte..Sign Up Link Coming Soon...

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS "GOLDEN VAULT"  BOYS MEET ~~~~LOUIS MARTINEZ ... 16' 1.5" Fly-Over ///// ALANA CARROLL.... 13' 2.5 Sail-Over.... 16 New PR's !!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley  Flying Circus, LLC
In-the-Barn ...Warwick,NY

EVERYONE WAS READY-to-FLY

"HATS OFF"....  to  an eager group of dedicated 'Fiberglass Athletes" at Flying Circus "GOLDEN VAULT MEET"  today.  Training thru COVID is not an easy task..... but..today the  REARDS  were  great  as.  16  Personal  Bests were  recorded  and   a few  New School Records were thrown up with no spectators inside the  the old barn...but Live You Tube Streaming  to all family and friends   by Coach Greg Mirecki of MVP the  entire day  was  filled   with spirit.  The Volunteers came thru again  with  fast bar replacements.. immediate standards posting  and lively  loud  clapping on all third  jumps !!!!! YES-- TODAY was  an AWESOME DAY TOGETHER > Congrats   and thank you all.

Recap:
12th Golden Vault Meet
Flying Circus Indoor Facility
The  fun  started  at  high noon..with  a   spirited  warm up  and  a focused group...... Wallkill,NY   senior...Louis Martinez put on a  show of  speed  and technique  with his   double PR and  16' 1.5" Sail for USA#7  and  Flying Circus Club #7 All-Time !!! Using a  7 step and his  14' 7" Essx Recoil poles  to the max...... he took  another  3  great  bars  at 16' 5"!!!  He now is #3 ALL-Time in Section 9 List!!!!   In the Girls Open..It was  all Alana Carroll of Averial Park,NY(Harvard Soph)  flying  13' 2.5"  and nearly claimed  13'8.5" on  3rd  jump. for Coach Duffy. Steve Ditelberg(Fairfield,CT)..  junior.... set  school record at 13' 8.5" on bigger poles  for Coach Sorensen and Junior Max Zuckerman(Pascack,NJ) flew  14' 8.5" silver medal.!!!!

 "VOLUNTEERS~move-the-WORLD".... Here are the  best meet managers in the  business.....Robert Anderson,Stephanie Duffy,Bob Sorensen,Ken Cevoli,Jeff Clark. Mr. & Mrs. Steve Martinez,Neil Howard,Jeremy Ditelberg,Greg Mirecki........ THANK YOU  for making it all FUN -for - KIDS !!!!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS "RISING STARS #3 MEET"...ABBY FOWLER  10' 7" PR...ALEXANDER PEDERSEN  10' 1" ~~~ 16 NEW PR's
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault  Recoil Warwick Valley, NY


    "Good Friends......           ...Share  Good  Times ......                 ... To Promote  Good Causes."


  It  was   another GREAT RISING STARS  competition @ Flying Circus Clubhouse today...  with 16 New Personal Bests  recorded by MVP's Chief Greg Mirecki  and boomed out to 187 viewers who care.  The Meet directors  Stephanie Duffy  and Bob Sorensen put on another   'flying-show' for  these  future  stars in  our pole vault club.Special thanks  and hats off to all our meet volunteers for keeping the meet  strong  and flowing.It was  also  a great weekend   for Circus Vaulters  at the SEC Championships..The Adidas Indoor Nationals in  Virginia  and ... the the  Underground Sprinting in Nanuet,NY by the Purple Wave.   It's going to be a HUGE SPRING SEASON  for ALL. !!!!!!!!!


WEEKEND RECAP ......*** SEC INDOOR CHAMPIONS

.....  Coach Russ Johnson's University of Georgia vault crew went off the charts..with Julie Fixen  soaring 14' 5.25"  for Gold... Kayla Smith taking silver at 14'3.5"  and Kaeli Thompson(Warwick Valley,NY) placing 12th  at 12' 9.5" for the BullDogs!!! * Saturday  morning at the  Open Girls Pole Vault  event Flight 2...in the Adidas Indoor Nationals..It  was Sophie Mirecki(Washingtonville,NY...Lily Beattie(Warwick,NY)... and Rachel Mason(High Point,NJ) all soaring 10' 4" for  some  Nationals Experience now under their belt.   Freshman Vaulter Jayden Beck soard  in her long jump  at 15' 6.5" for the Warriors of Minisink Valley,NY.  Samantha Smith came  thru also in her Seeded  section  of Nationals Pole Vault on Sunday  at 11' 7.5  for 17 th place  for Syosset Braves.

* The Underground Mall Track meet  was a huge ending  to Warwick Valley,NY indoor  campaign  for Coach Potter in all events. Leading the  sprint charge was Rachel Venter in 4th place in 55m (7.85)  and  scoring in the 300m in 50.8 for the  eighth grader at Warwick Valley Middle.* The Boys Adidas National Championship Pole Vault this afternoon  in Virginia Beach..saw Wallkill,NY  senior Louis Martinez  fly 15' 7.25  for 11th place. Coming off his  16' 1.5" PR last weekend. Louis    has been invited to the March 13th Elite  High School Meet at Ocean Breeze!!!!!!
 
*  The Circus  Rising Stars #3 Meet  today  was  filled  with  16 NEW PR's   and   a lot of  "spirit"  Taking the Girls Gold/Joe Tea..was  NV _Demerast,NJ senior..Abby Fowler with her  double PR at 10' 7" for Coach Duffy Training Group.... Top Middle Schooler  was Averie Klein(Pine Bush,NY)  at 9' 1" PR..Top Frosh was was Livy Molko(New York City,NY) at  9' 1"... Top junior  was Alexa Cawood((Holy Angels,NJ)  at 10' 1" PR!!!  The Boys  winner was Alexander pedersen(Somers,NY) at  10' 1"..Top Middle School vaulter...Luke Beattie(Warwick,NY) 8' 7"  Top Freshman boy was  Matt Sands(Denerast,NJ) at 8' 7" !! *Full Results  Below*

posts.Title: LUKE BEATTIE(Warwick,NY) SETS NY STATE 7th GRADE VAULT RECORD 10' 2.5" /// RACHEL VENTER(Warwick,NY) FLYS  10' 2.5"  for GOLD!!

Anthony Roe(Warwick,NY)..  had  a PR   for   second place in Boys Division  at  7' 8.5" for the Wave   and Max Wickrath(Minisink Valley,NY hit  6. 8.5" for the Jr Warriors.  Special Thanks to all Volunteers..... Meet Photos   coming  courtesy of  Mike Venter!!!!!!

posts.Title: OCEAN BREEZE ELITE ...FUN-for-ALL.... LILY BEATTIE  12' 0"...LOUIS MARTINEZ  15' 6" LEAD the INVASION !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus
Warwick, NY


   A  small group of Flying Circus "Flyers"  invaded    the  Ocean Breeze Elite Meet on Saturday and  solid performances  and  solid  sportsmanship were on review.  The  four state meet was limited  to the Top 10 Boys   and Top 10 girls   entered and it  was the first  super   gathering  of vaulters  since  the one year  Covid lockdown.


   The meet provided   a  super atmosphere of sportsmanship at it's best.   Athletes..coaches...officals  alll cheering   each other in thos no spectator  event.  It was a glimpse of  what will be  coming back  to athletics  in the  next  few  months. 


RECAP~~~~  In the Morning Girls Division.....the  Circus  placed  4  girls in the TOP 7...with Warwick Valley High School  freshman..LILY BEATTIE  soaring 12' 0' personal best  for  the  silver medal.  She  had   a close  3rd attempt  at the  NY State Freshman Class record  at 12' 6" held by Erica Ellis at 12' 4.5".  Lily used  her  13' 7 " x 170 pole to finish the meet on her  birthday.   Monroe,NY senior  LJ/PV star ..Alicia Johnson  flew  11' 6"  for  4th place overall.  High Point,NJ  junior sprinter/vaulter..Rachel Mason  flew  11' 0"  for 5th place in her  first trip to Ocean Breeze.  Placing  seventh was Warwick Valley Middle School   sprint/vault  record holder  at 10' 6" and   so close at 11' 0 bar.    The Boys  afternoon section had  three Circus Boys in the  talented   and deep field...  with Wallkill,NY  senior  Louis Martinez  flying  15' 6"  for  third place on misses... Max Zuckerman of Pascack,NJ sailed   14' 6" on his new poles   and Steve Ditelberg,Trumbel,CT..just  a junior..flew high above   his 12' 6" Bar in his first trip  to Staten Island.   

CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL........ It  was  fun  to be  with  you and watch  you soar!!! 


 NEXT  CIRCUS MEETS in MARCH  Thursday  Night , March 18.... at 5:00pm... GIRLS ELITE MEET.....
Sign In  4:45pm  Warm Up 5:00pm    Bar Up  at 5:30pm  Sunday  March 21... at 12 Noon..... BOYS & GIRLS RISING STARS MEET...Sign in 11:45am....  Warwm Up  12 Noon.... Bar up  at 12:45pm  Thursday.... March  25 ...at  6pm...BOYS & GIRLS MIDDLE SCHOOL MEET..Sign In at 5:45pm...Warwm Up  at 6PM..Bar Up 6:30pm

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS RISING STARS ~~~AILEEN HOBAN Flys  10' 5.5" RECORDS !!!!  ALEXANDER PEDERSEN takes BOYS GOLD ~~~  25 PR's !!!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Club 
Up In-the-Barn... Warwick, NY

"Endless Days  of Fun  and Games"

.... The  new   pole vault  stars came out to play  today ..at the  RISING STARS MEET on a sunny Sunday in March.  Congratulations  Vaulters.... 25 Personel Bests  is   hard  to imagine ..but it's  true........ You  all came  to Fly !!!!!!  Here  we go....  Greg Mirecki Video Productions  zoomed  it out.. via  stream ... to 152 proud  family members...team mates   and   college coaches and  the  " spirit of the vault" took over  the hay loft .  Team mates   cheering..stomping   and  clapping with all their mite...fueled  the  Vault Engine.  It was a sensational day together........  More  to come  in April !!!!!
 
RECAP...... Pictured  here is Notre Dame High School,NY..senior..AILEEN HOBAN taking the Girls  meet at 10' 5.5" !!!  Setting   her HS  Record and  a  new Staten Island Record on her bigger poles  for Coach Gezim Capani.  This  senior never gave up thru Covid  and now  heads  to join the Wagner University Track program next fall on scholarship. Taking Gold in Boys Meet ..was  Somers,NY  ..junior Alexander Pedersen  with a  big blow over at 9' 8.5" and  super jumps  at 11' 0" !! 

Top Middle School Boys  were Luke Beattie(Warwick,NY)  and Anthony Roe(Warwick,NY)..both clearing  9' 2.5"!!!!  Top Freshman Boys  was Matt Sands(Demarest,NJ)  at 9' 2.5"...Top Freshman Girl  was Livy Molko(Hewitt,NYC)  at 9' 2.5"PR.  Perhaps  the   biggest  surprise  was  Middle School 8th Grader...Averie Klein of Pine Bush Middle...with her  10' 2.5" School Record and PR  for Coach Bob Sorensen. 

HATS OFF to MEET MANAGMENT CREW....

posts.Title: RACHEL VENTER FLYS @ RISING STARS MINI MEET #8 ~~~ 5 PR's ...3 School Records!!
posts.Content:
*The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault" Nuts" , LLC
On-the-Hill...Warwick,NY


 It was  a Rising Stars Mini Meet... .... But it  was loaded  with BIG  performances.    Six  talented  young pole vaulters gathered  before  the  Spring Break to test their training.     Five  PR's  and   three  School Records were  a treat  for pole vault eyes at the Indoor Flying Circus  Barn and  the  cheering  and  close friendships were  everwhere.  CONGRATULATIONS TO ALL!!!!!  Stay fit  during  Spring Break !!!!


RECAP~~~~~CIRCUS RISING STARS MINI MEETMARCH 25, 2021

WARM TEMPS ON THE  SECOND FLOOR ...provided a great setting  for  the  6 Young stars on fiberglass.   Warwick Valley,NY...8th Grade  Sprinter/Vaulter...RACHEL VENTER  flew  10' 7.5"   and  then had  magic   attempts   at her own NY State 8th Grade record  at 11' 2". She used  her long run ,  with her biggest poles  ever to soar again in taking   her "JOE TEA"   for a ride home. She heads  to California  for vacation and for the Vaulter Magazine Meet on April 3.  Pushing  her  new PR   and New School Record  was  8th grader,,,Averie Klein of Pine Bush Middle Schol with her 10' 1.5" sail for Coach Bob Sorensen Training Group.   Taking the  Goshen Freshman Pole Vault Record ...was  9th grader..Reilly St.Lawrence(Goshen,NY)  with her double PR  night  and  9' 1.5" clear  with big poles/grips!! Placing  forth was Kate Dowling ..setting a new Middle School record  for Pearl River,NY  at 8' 1.5" for  the 8th grader.  Placing 5th in the Girls Meet  was Violet Bonhiak of Goshen,NY  with her 8' 1.5"  PR for the Gladitors!!!!   Warwick Valley Middle School ,NY  Anthony Roe   won the Boys  Division    with his  7' 7.5"  sail  for  his JOE TEA!!!!!

THANK YOU MEET VOLUNTEERS......  Bob Sorensen,,,JulieKay Christian,Mike Venter,Mike St.Lawrence,Katie Klein,Tiffnay Roe !!!!

STAY FIT  and STAY SAFE this  Spring Break.

posts.Title: CIRCUS INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPD ....LOUIS MARTINEZ TAKES CROWN  @  16' 0" !!!!!    5 New PR's  and FUN !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley FLYING CIRCUS , LLC Warwick Valley, NY "TEAM EFFORT" ....SEALS SUPER INDOOR BOYS SEASON @ CIRCUS. A BIG CONGRATULATIONS to our BOYS ELITE GROUP for a solid Indoor Pole Vault season. What started six months agao with our first practice...the dedication and drive from each of you can never be replaced. You are so ready for this coming outdoor season and we can't wait to see you fly for your High School teams. These are the significant moments together that can not be erased from your mind. ..On to the next challenges!!!!! Wallkill, NY.. senior sprinter/jumper/vaulter....LOUIS MARTINEZ was ready-to-fly in his final Indoor Meet.. with his 3rd 16' 0"+ jump on the Indoor Covid Shortened Season. This 135 lb multi-talented athlete used his 180 ESSX for a huge fly-over at 16' 0" and sensational jumps at 16' 5" bar. He has been accepted at Alamaba and LSU and will decide soon at his university program for the fall. Chasing closely was Pascack Hills,NJ.. junior..Max Zuckerman at 14' 7.5' bar on his new sticks....followed by Steve Ditelberg(Fairfield,CT) at 13' 7.5" and Soph Andy Cimino(Warwick Valley,NY) at 13' 7.5" for tThe Purple Wave. Top Open Men Division was Mike Carey(Washingtonville,NY) at 11' 7.5" and Top Open Women was Alana Carroll(Averill Park,NY) at 12' 1. 5". (Complete Results Below). posts.Title: ALICIA JOHNSON SOARS  @  CIRCUS CHAMPIONSHIPS .....   5 NEW PERSONAL BESTS !!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Flying Club The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development The Scenic Warwick Valley, NY " I don't have to win to prove anything...... ....competing at my best was all the satisfication I ever needed." ~ Al Oerter(NYAC) 4 Time Olympic Champion Discus (USA)

Alicia Johnson(Monroe,NY) and her 18 Circus Team mates did just that last night at the 2021 CIRCUS GIRLS ELITE CHAMPIONSHIPS at The Circus Vault Indoor Barn. It's hard to explain to others...the special atmosphere and strong bond of friendships that have been established the past 6 months of pole vault training with this exceptional group ao athletes. It was great to see and feel this support and this "spirit" of belonging to something bigger than oneself. Congratulations to all on acheiving these enduring qualities. On~to~our ~Next Challenges !!!!!!!!

RECAP...
GIRLS ELITE CIRCUS INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS
April 15, 2021 (Birthday 74 !!!)

The Girls of Circus were ready for some fun and celebrating the Indoor Training Zone... as Monroe,NY senior ALICIA JOHNSON ... flew huge over 11' 7.5" for her JOE TEA reward and hit her 13' 6" poles at 12' 0". This Level 10.. Gym~ Kids Gymnastics athlete developed her skills under Pete and Adrian LaChance for seven years ..rode her 8 step to exact acceleration all night and heads to North Carolina-Charlette University next fall to join a very strong group of pole vaulters. Pushing strong were Samantha Smith at 11. 1.5" and Sophie Mirecki at 11' 1.5". Top Freshman was Lily Beattie (Warwick) at 10' 7.5" and Top Middle Schooler was Rachel Venter(Warwick) at 10' 1.5" for the Purple Wave. Helping run the meet to perfection were... Greg Mirecki, Bob Sorensen,Julie-Kay Christian,Bob Mason,Brian Smith,Carlys Lemler,Melanie Beattie,Stephanie Duffy,Ken Cevoli and Bill Conroy. Special thanks to all for a special Birthday Party and Wishes.. We are blessed !!!!

posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club
The Scenic Warwick Valley, NY

The 2021 Circus Indoor Pole Vault Meet Tour was a huge success this year… providing 16 competitive gathering for students to show their new skills and to keep the flame and dreams alive. Thank you to all parents…staff and athletes for making our club a wonderful and connected experience for all of us. We will now move into a six week training zone with our High School and Middle School teams and we should start to try more events that are related to pole vault development….. such as Sprinting…Hurdling…and Jumping events…along with pole vault and Relay racing. This will all help the development of athletism…. the cross training effect to becoming a btter athlete and better pole vaulter. Our Club Meets for Elite and Rising Stars will fire up at Circus BarnYard in June and we will finish at our Summer Festival on July 9-10. BRING on THE OUTDOOR SEASON.!!!!!!

RECAP ~~~~
CIRCUS RISING STARS
April 18, 2021 The final meet was full of back stories…..school records….personal bests…state records and delicious cupcakes. The 20 Girls & Boys were all spetactular..Madison Chalfin of New City,NY ..the junior Diver/Vaulter at Clarkstown North flew 10' 9.5" to take the HS Girls Division….. and Valhalla,NY senior…Matt Caldarola hit a personal best of 10' 9.5" to take the Boys HS Crown. There were 7 New Personal Bests…A Staten Island Record…. 2 School Records and a NY State 7th Grade Class record during the 3 hour meet. Taking the Girls Middle School Division was 8th Grader…Averie Klein of Pine Bush,<NY with a PR 10' 3.5". The Boys Middle School Division…7th Grader…Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) broke his own NY State 7th Grade Class Record with his 10' 3.5" sail. Aileen Hoban(Staten Island,NY) set a school and Staten Island Record at 10' 9.5" for silver. Full results below).

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS....SOLD OUT !!!!!!
posts.Content:

Register NOW   and  Save   the Late  Registration Entry Fee   at    www.hvflyingcircus.com     under the Summer Festival Link !!!!!

        1:01PM....Pit #1... Open Mens Athletes(Outdoor Pit)        1:01PM....Pit #2... Open Women Athletes(Indoor Pit)          4:01PM.... ELITE WOMEN

INVITATIONAL  (14' 0" and UP~~ PERSONAL BEST)  

Contact Coach  St. at coachst@gmail.com for details.      

Bring your  Lawn Chairs  and Dancing Shoes and "Best PV Stories" !!! Music  all day..Food Truck on Site......

YOU GOTTA'BELIEVE.      SIGN UP IMMEDIATELY  ..if not SOONER!!!!!!!!

posts.Title: RACHEL VENTER (Warwick Valley,NY)... BREAKS  8th Grade NY State Class Pole Vault Record @ 11' 6.5" Today.... ANDY CIMINO (Warwick Valley,NY) Sails  14' 3" !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Fun The Warwick Valley, New York


   

It was   another  exciting Pine Bush vs Warwick Valley  get-together in Pine Bush ..under  blue skies  and  warm tempertures... with  all the  pole vaulter's   bringing their  A- Pole Vault Game to the fast runway..loaded up  with side/tail winds all day.     It was    sprinter/hurdler/vaulter...Rachel Venter's  Day... with her  setting  a  new 8th Grade State Class pole vault record of 11' 6.5" for  the  win. The old  all-time record  for 8th graders belonged  to Laura Reigle(Hilton,NY) at 11' 6". Using a modest grip but improved  technique..Venter  had  1 close  bar  at 12' 1".  She  also  won the 400 Hurdles.   Also excelling all day  was  freshman..Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley)  with her 11' 0" leap  and 100m Hurdle win  and  4x100 Relay win.  Pine Bush ,NY..junior Multi-Eventer...Amelia Tremper (Pine Bus,NY) set Pr's  in PV(7'6") Long Jump(12' 4)  High Jump  4' 6"  and 800m !!!!  Helping all day  at the Pit  was  freshman  super  star..Ella Galloway(Pine Bush) and Julie Christian on Clipboard.


  ANDY CIMINO  SOARS  14' 3"  for Gold......  Just  a  Rising Sophomore....Andy Cimino(Warwick Valley,NY) flew  14' 3"PR  and solid bars  at 14' 9"  in addition  to both hurdles   and  4x100 Relay  work  for the CATS.  Grif Vondeben of Pine Bush came up huge over  11' 6"  for  silver for the Bushmen.


  Luke Beattie/Anthong Roe   sweep Middle School Meet Pole Vault......... Watch out  for  the young stars on fiberglass poles... as Coach Bob Sorensen's  Flyers' put on a  show  at Warwick MS Meet....Luke Beattie  flying 10' 0" for 7th Grade School Record  and team mate  Anthony Roe kicking up big over  8' 0" .  It's  starting  to happen...Keep training  with a purpose!!!!!!!

posts.Title: LOUIS MARTINEZ (Wallkill, NY) Sails  16' 6" TODAY....Alicia Johnson (Monroe, NY) 11' 6" and Rachel Mason (High Point.NJ) 11' 6" School Record!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus     Warwick Valley,NY 



       Louis Martinez of Wallkill Central High School broke  his own School Record  today in Kingston... with   a 16' 6" leap  from his long run  and Big Poles... It was   all about thrust... and  he   was ever so close   at the NY State Outdoor Record  @ 17' 0" on his third  jump..This University of Alabama recruit  was ready !  Congratulations Louis!!!!     The Girls of Circus also   took it up today  at various meets in the region.... Monroe-Woodbury,NY  senior...Alicia Johnson  flw  11' 6"  at Warwick Tri-meet  and  close at 12'0"  for the North Carolin-Charlotte University recruit.....She also anchored  the  400 Relay  win...  Over in Kittininny,NJ.. It was   the Rachel Mason day on the runway.. with her 11' 6"  school record   and  brushed off 12' 1" for the gold......  Lily Beattie (Warwick,NY)sailed  11' 0" for  silver  and Ellie Lemler(O'Neill,NY)  flew 11' 0"..as both  had  solid  attempts  at 11' 6".. Rachel Venter(warwick,NY)  took home   the  10' 6" bar and  new  Hurdle PR for Coach Potter's  Purple Wave.   CONGRATULATIONS ALL.... more to come.....
      SEND IN ALL RESULTS  to make  theseCircus Bulletins  !!!!!!!!

posts.Title: LOUIS MARTINEZ (Wallkill, NY) BREAKS NEW YORK STATE OUTDOOR VAULT RECORD  @  16' 9"
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus, LLC
Warwick, NY

Pole Vault History   was  made today in Goshen,New York.The  video below tells  the real  story of ..." joy  in athletics."  Watching kids reach for their  dreams with  everyday preparation  and focus is priceless.    Such it  was today at The Goshen Trotters  Invite Track and Field meet on their  brand new state-of-the-art Track & Field Facility pole vault  area.  Under pure  blue  skies  and temps  hitting 85 degrees plus... Wallkill Central,NY  senior....coached  by Natasha  Kennedy......Louis Martinez acheived one of his  season's  goal.......to become NY State All-Time  record holder in the pole vault.  Coming off his Friday night  Tri-Meet  with a   16'0" vault  and  a school record  22' 9" Long Jump  ...he was ready on Saturday morning. Coming in at 15')  and then  16'0"   and then... 16' 9" clear for  the record.... He  used  his  7 step  and 15' 7 x 160 ESSX  for  the  leap into history...... and then had  2  great bars  at 17' 2".!!! Louis   will be  at Nationals in Eugene  July 2-4 for his  final  meet before    signing at the University of Alabama next fall.... CONGRATULATIONS LOUIS   and FAMILY !!!!

Here are the other brillant  performances reported tonight.....

4-Rebecca Gross(Old Tappan)   9'0"

Class E.....    

1-Alexa cawood(Holy Angels)  10' 6"PR

4-Mary Flahive(HA)   8' 6"

Tri Meet...... Harrison Hayward of Hackley School  won his  Tri Meet this  week  with 12' 1"  sail and close bars at 12' 7PR!!

posts.Title: " LET'S FLY "......... CALLING ALL FLYING CIRCUS VAULTERS ....SIGN-IN-TODAY ... The NEW YORK STATE SHOWCASE 2021 MEET ~~~ JUNE 17-19 !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Group, LLC    The Warwick Valley , NY
    ARE YOU READY TO FLY~A~WAY AGAIN ?????? 

   

Please  join us  at one... "SPECIAL  MEET"...... The New York State Showcase 2021 Meet on June  17-19  At Rondout Valley High School in Accord, New York. This  end-of-the-year gathering of all motivated Track and Field  athletes in the  entire  Northeast...  will be   a special treat in  every  division.   This meet is  for High School  and Middle School  athletes  and athletes  will  register compete  "Unattached"...not  for their  High School affilication, as this  follows the  end of the High School season. No High School uniforms may be  worn.      This meet will replace the Outdoor Greensboro Nationals and provide a high performance meet on the East Coast  for all student/athletes.  Track and Field promoter...Tim Fulton  the  is Meet Director  with  a  vision  and passion to provide opportunity  to all  aspiring young athletes.  Let's  support   his efforts and  "Bring-the-Spirit " to the New York State Showcase 2021.   Flying Circus Coaching Staff will be on hand   all 3  days  to help coordinate  and  coach everyone.   See you @  Rondout Valley Central soon.    SIGN IN TODAY !!


The NEW YORK STATE SHOWCASE 2021    Rondout Valley High School Facility     Accord, New York Open to all High School  and Middle School athletes  in the NORTHEAST !!!!  REGISTER  @   MilesplitNY...  The New York State Showcase 2021 (Under Calendar Link) POLE VAULT MEET

Thursday.. June 17  
5pm..... Middle School Boys  and Frosh/Soph Boys                                 
7pm....  Middle School Girls  and Frosh/Soph Girls

5pm..... Girls Championship Pole Vault(Top 18-24 Girls)

8am ....... Boys Championship Boys Vault (Top 18-24 Boys)                                  12 Noon.... Boys Open Pole Vault

We hope  you can join the "FLY-A-WAY" party  with us.

posts.Title: "GLORY DAYS".......... FLYING CIRCUS RIDES AGAIN ....RECAP.
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault  Experiment, LLC  The  Golden Valley in Warwick, NY



  CONGRATULATIONS !!!  The Flyin' Circus  acrobats  are in full recoil.   The  weekend was full of  exciting   performances  on the  track  and  in the   pole vault  field, with many new  personal bests  and  school records  highliting the results.   The CHAMPIONSHIP  SEASON is in the  air.... as   athletes  push to the  new  grips   and poles  in  an all out assult for  ... The NEXT BAR !!!!!!!!!   The pole vault competitions  are  still all about Friendships on Fiberglass    as the most  exciting  images  are of  athletes   supporting  each other ...... This is PURE SPORT  at it's  finest!      CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!!!!


  ***  SIGN UP ALERT ****......     Don't delay... Sign up now for  our  Final  Meets  ....  and  SAVE on ENTRY FEES with EARLY REGISTRATION.      June 17-19... The New York Showcase @ Rondout Valley HS, Accord,NY.. Open to all Northeast Vaulters...  @ MIlesplitNY  website      July 9-10...The  Flying Circus  Summer Fiber-Blast Festival...... Open to all Groups  .... @   www.hvflyingcircus.com

Circus Flyers  Weekend Recap
* New Britian,CT.... Ellison Weiner(Weston,CT) is  just  a Rising Soph  for Coach Matt Medve....soared  to 11' 6" PR  and  win in the CT  Class M  Championships , under the direction of Coach Stephanie Duffy.  She now  heads  to State Open this week.* Section 8  Division Championships.. It was Samantha Smith(Syosset,NY) adding   big points  to her TEAM  Title  for the Braves... with  11' 6" PV Gold   and  16.88 Hurdle  win to secure  the first ever team crown.* New Jersey North Sectionals..... The NV-Demarest pole vault enclave came thru for Coach Mike Ives..  with Michelle Lee  setting PR  at 11' 6"  for gold.. Jordan Hecker(NVD) 11'0"PR   for silver  and Rachel Mason (High Point,NJ)  sailing 11' 0" for Bronze.... Hanna Lee(tenafly)  10' 0"  Rebecca Gross(old Tappan)  9' 6'  Katie Klein(OT)  9' 6" for Coach Clark.  Shaun Herlihy(Old Tappan)  flew  to another  win  at 14' 0"!!!!!  *Section 1  2-B League...Junior Alexander Pedersen(Somers)  took home  the  gold   at 9' 6". Jeremy Frank  cranked over  13'0"  for Arlington,NY.*Rockland County Championships @ Tappan Zee,NY.. Clarkstown South's  Madison Chalfin  soared 11' 1"    for her gold medal  and  Maeve Loughran(Pearl River)  silver at 9'3"...Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern)  9' 0".. Ashley Harrington(PR)  8' 3"..Erin Dowling(PR)  8' 0"  Kate Dowling(PR)  8' 0".  Eoin O'Gara(PearlRiver) sailed  to his  championship at 13' 0"  for the Pirates in Blue.* Fast Times  @ Warwick Valley.....Under  the Lights at the Fifty Yard Line.. Louis Martinez  flew  to gold    with 16' 1" vault  and took  3 great attempts  at  17' 1.25 " on his  15' 7 Essx  Sticks... Matti Levasalmi(Bethlehem.NY)  PR'ed  at  15' 4"  for  a new family record... Freshman Neil Howard(Taconic Hills) blew out  all his poles  at  14' 1"...Alex McKenney(Horace Greeley) set school record  12' 7"  Andy Cimino(Warwick Valley Soph)  12'7"  Kyle Miller(PJ) 11' 1"PR   Alexander Pedersen(Somers)  9' 7'.In the Girls Fast Times.Big Jumps  meet.. Warwick Valley,NY Freshman sprinter/vaulter...Lily Beattie  had  a  3 gold medal day... with 11' 6" pole vault  win.. 4 x 100 Relay Gold   and 4 x 400 relay gold  3:55.0 final and 59' 3  split!!!!!  Sophie Mirecki(Wash'ville) almost stole the bacon on her  final jump at 12' 0" to place  silver at 11' 6".. Ellie Lemler(O'Neill)   11' 0"   Rachel Venter(Warwick) 10' 6'  Jules Gravier(Bronxville)  10' 6"   Alicia Johnson(MW)  10' 6"  Madison Chalfin (CS) 10' 6"  Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern)  9'6"  Reilly St;Lawrence(Goshen) 8' 6'  Angele=isse Diaz(NFA)  8' 6"  Elizabeth Apostolico(MW)  8' 6"Brooke Schmidt(PJ)  8' 0".* NJ Group 4 Champs.... Ridgewood,NJ  Junior...Luke Gnospelius..sailed  13' 0"  for  thewin..coached  by Tim Wilson. Reece Muller(Mahwah)  12' 6"   Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills)  12' 0" on  1 ankle...

posts.Title: "CIRCUS FLYERS" @ NJ STATE ... "VAULT STATE CHAMPIONS" ...Randi Conroy(Northern Highlands)...Alexa Cawood(Holy Angels)...Shaun Herlihy(Old Tappan)...Max Zuckerman(Pscack Hills) !!!  Sophie Mirecki(Wsh'ville,NY) ~~~  3 Gold @ Section 9 !!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus  "YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE" 

The  "Air ~Flying "  continues   at Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy... as   four  NEW NJ STATE CHAMPIONS  were crowned this weekend  and  New York  State Poe Vault heats up...in prep  for   The  BIG VAULT FESTIVAL on July 9-10  in Warwick Valley ,NY... CIRCUS BARNYARD!!!!!!    Athletes  are gearing  up  and  starting  their  .."Peaking Phase" !!!!!  Join the  Fly~ Movement  with us at our  final  four meets of the year. (Schedule Below).


 New Jerset Stae Meet(Groups) .....   What a difference   a year makes..... Randi Conroy of Northern Highlands never gave  up. After no heighting   a year ago in her Group 3 State Meet...she  dedicated herself this season like no other...  and  now... just 365 days later.. She  is "State Vault CHAMPION"....   It's great how a  setback  can be a GREAT MOTIVATOR in athletes....  Rani used    a borrowed pole  from Coach Ken Cevoli  to  sail  11' 6" for  the  gold medal.  Over in the Private A group//it was  Holy Angel Academy..junior gymnast Alexa Cawood   taking home  the gold  with her  10' 6"  clear   and team mates Mary Flahive placing third  at 8' 6"  and Kendall Williams(HA)  8' 0" 7th   and 9th was Brooke Schmidt(PJ)  at 8' 0".  The Boys    Group 2 Champion was  Max Zuckerman of Pascack Hills  with  15' 0" coming back  from injury   and  Group 3 Champion  was  senior  ..Shaun herlihy of Old Tappan  at  13' 6" .  CONGRATULATIONS STATE CHAMPIONS !!!!!

Rachel Mason of High Point,NJ was   soarin also in Group 2 Championships... sailing 10' 6"  on first jump to   take  home  he  silver medal...Michelle Lee (NV-Denarest) placed  3rd  at 10' 6"   for Coach Ives....Chloe Pasek of West Milford placed    4th  at 9' 6" for the Lady Highlanders.  Hanna Lee(Tenafly) placed 5th in  group 3 at 10' 6"  and Rebecca Gross(old Tappan)  flew  9' 6" for Coach Clark.In Boys.. It was Ridgewood's  junior  Luke Gnospelius  placing 5th   for Coach Tim Wilson  at 13' 6"PR  and moves  to MOC meet next week.  Reece Muller(Mahwah)  12' 6"  Ben Mander(PH)  11' 6"


 Section 9  in New York Sites......    Hats ~0ff to Washingtonville Wizard...Sophie Mirecki  for  her sensational triple   gold  medal day in Class A  at Warwick... This  dedicated   junior  flew  11' 6"  PV...15' 6 Long Jump  and  16.65  100m Hurdle  wins for Coach Duffy.. She heads  to NY Showcase meet on Friday.  Having a  3 Silver Medal Day was Warwick Valley Freshman... Lily Beattie... with  11' 0" PV/  12. 9/100m/  and  26.3  at 200m  for the  Lady Wildcats.  Monroe senior... Alicia Johnson  went  big  at 10' 6" for  3rd   and   Middle Schooler Rachel Venter produced  big team points for the Purple Wave   at 10' 6" PV/400 Hurdles in 73.6(7 second PR)   and  super  anchor leg  on 4 x 400 Relay!!!..  Elizabeth Apostolico(MW) place 5th at 8' 6"  Angelisse Diaz(NFA)   took gold  at  8' 0"  in Kingston Group...  Miranda Frisbee(Wizards)   hit 6' 0"  Andy Cimino(Warwick-Soph)  flew 11' 6" PV  . Griffin Voneben of Pine Bush took home the Gold  at 12' 0".

USATF New York Youth Meet  @ Icahn Stadium on Saturday... Luke Beattie  won his  Age Group  with 10' 0" leap  for the 7th grader  and close at 10' 6'PR... Averie Klein was solid   at 8' 6"  win   and Anthony Roe  was  solid all day  for Coaches  Bob and dane Sorensen. Fred Monesmith won his  73 Year Age Group  for Circus at 7' 6"PR!!!!!
 

In Section 1  Pole Vault Action....  Madison Chalfin(Clarkstown South)  won gold  at 10' 0" in Suffern...Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern) placed  silver at 9' 6"  Ciara Murphy(Somers)  8' 9'PR.  Jeremy Frank  took his Championship in Arlington  at 12' 8"  Charlie Hatzman(RCK)  12' 2... Alexander Simon(Scarsdale_  1st in 8' 9'  PR  and Maia Perillo(JJEF)   hir 8' 9" pr  for silver.

CONGRATULATIONS ALL!!!!!!!!!!!

FINAL CIRCUS MEETS at the WARWICK CENTER for POLE VAULT DEVELOPMENT

posts.Title: NEIL HOWARD III  Sets NY STATE FROSH RECORD  14' 8" ... ALICIA JOHNSON  Sails  11' 8" ... NJ STATE MEET~~~RANDI CONROY flies Again 12' 0" School Record !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole  Vault, LLC 
Warwick Valley , New York

  THE NEW YORK SHOWCASE MEET.... It  started out with  a   dream and vision from  Tim Fulton. The former Somers High School elite  coach  and now  the  New Balance  Armory Track and Field coordinator produced   a  wonderful meet  for  over  1200 athletes  and parents the past  three days.  CONGRATULATIONS  and THANK YOU  Coach  Tim Fulton and Staff.   The   brand new  state-of-the-art  Track & Field   site  at Rondout Valley High School  was outstanding and produced  new National Records.. State  and School records   and  so many personal bests  it's  hard  to explain.  The Circus  sent 20 athletes in the   8 separate  divisions  and  Coach Bob Sorensen brought all the  equipment   and  6 bags  of poles  and cross bars for the event. Coach Duffy..Coach McIntee, Dane  Sorensen   and Bob  Sorensen handled  the  coaching duties  and  a GREAT TIME  was had by all. We now move  to limited practice sessions  and  3 Great Circus Meets  before  we open our 20th SUMMER CIRCUS CAMPS  for  64 aspiring  athletes  from  6 states.   IT'S NOT OVER YET.. in fact.. welcome  to SUMMER POLE VAULT DEVELOPMENT !!!!!  Our  final  Summer Festival  meet will  be  July 9-10   and   we want   every  Flying Circus  pole vaulter  we have  to join the celebration of   a  super  season together.  We have  77 vaulters  signed  up for the fun... JOIN us.. Registration  is on our  web site only and there is NO DAY of MEET REGISTRATION.   Any parent who wants  to  help with this project.... just let us know   which day  you can volunteer!!!!! Many thanks....!!!!


  The  GIRLS CHAMPIONSHIP section   on Friday was  exciting to watch.. with Monroe,NY  senior..Alicia Jihnson taking the  gold and new meet record  of 11' 8" on her ESSX series and  close bars  at 12' 2.5". Sophie Mirecki(Wash'ville,NY) went big over 11' 4"  for  silver... Madison Chalfin(New City,NY) made 11' 0"... Lily Beattie(Warwick,NY)  vaulted  11' 0"  on bigger poles  Ellie Lemler(West Point,NY) made 11' 0"  for her 6th place medal. Rachel venter(Warwick,NY) doubled back from her Thursday meet  win...  with 10' 6" and Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern,NY)  fly  9' 0".   Taking home  the Gold medal in the Open Division was  Angelisse Diaz(Newburgh,NY)  at  8' 6".  In the  Middle School Divisions...  Boys  winner  was Luke Beattie(Warwick,NY)  at 10' 6"PR  and Anthony Roe(Warwick,NY)  was  silver medal  at 8' 0".  The Girls  were also soaring  with Rachel venter(Warwick,NY) taking Gold  at 9' 10"  and  Acerie Klein(Pine Bush.NY)  silver at 9' 0".  The Frosh/Soph Divisions ..Reilly StLawrence(Goshen,NY) placed  3rd  at 9' 6'  for Coach McIntee..Maia Perillo(East Fishkill,NY)  9' 0" PR..Elizabeth Apostoilco(Monroe,NY)  9' 0" for   the   Circus Girls..  In the Boys Fr/Soph division... Scott Anderson(Flemington.NJ)  took the  silver  at 11' 10...Colin Robertson(Marlboro,NY) placed  3rd  at 10' 6".  All these  athletes  will be   attending Summer  Circus Camps.  The BOYS CHAMPIONSHIP section  was loaded  with the best... as Nick Lourenco ...just a junior our of Jim Hendersons Warehouse Pole Vault club in Long Island   entered the 16 Foot Club  with his  gold medal soaring 16' 0"  win.  Placing second  was Louis Martinez(Wallkill,NY) at 15' 0". Pole Vault history was made  with Neil Howard of Taconic Hills,NY.... breaking the NY State Freshman Pole Vault record  with his 14' 8"  clear on his  15'1" x  175 pole. He also won the 400m Hurdles Championship in  56.18 !!!!!!   Noah Brown(New Paltz,NY)flew  a PR   at 14' 4"... Steve Ditelberg(Fairfield Ludlow,CT) placed   at 13' 0"   Eoin O'Gara(Pearl River,NY)  13' 0"  and Kevin La-Chua(NYC) made 11' 0". 
NEW JERSEY..... "MEET of CHAMPIONS"....    RANDI CONROY(No.Highlands) FLYS  12' 0"!!!!!

South Plainfield,NJ~ Super vaulting  and records  tumble  at the  New jersey mOC meet... as  senior Brian McSweeney of East Brunswick,NJ flew to the gold  at 16' 4.75".!!!! This  mark   broke Flying Circus Coach..Will Nesbitt's  16' 4" mark  from 1980.  Brian  is  heading  to West Point Military Academy in 2 weeks. He is coached  by Carl Palumbo  at VAULT FACTORY,NJ!!!!!  TMaking  and unbelievable comeback  from ankle  injury  2 weeks  ago.. was junior  Max   Zuckerman of Pascack Hills, NJ  with his  15' 0"  silver medal.. Shaun Herlihy of Old Tappan  fle  13' 6  for  5th''Luke Gnospelius(Ridgewood,NJ)  13' ).. Reece Muller(Mahwah,NJ)  12' 6"  for the ThunderBirds!!!  Randi Conroy.. the talented   and dedicated  senior  from Northern Highlands,NJ...finished  off her  storybook  season with her first  12' 0" pole Vault....  a New  School Record  for the  silver medal. She  heads  to Lehigh University next fall for academics  and athletics.  Michelle Lee(NV-Demarest,NJ) was  sensational at state  .. with her 11' 6"=PR  for  7th place..  Rachel Mason (High Point,NJ) flew 11' 0" for 10th place in state and returns next year for her  senior fling on fiberglass.  Hanna Lee(Tenafly) 10' 6"  Alexa cawood(Ho;y Angels)  10' 6"  Chloe Pasek(West Milford)  9' 6"     CONGRATULATIONS  to all athltes  for pushing thru Covid!!!!!!! 

CIRCUS MEETS COMING NOW .......   Tuesday  June 22... BOYS ELITE MEET  4:45pm at Barn... Entry $40...... Warm Up at 5pm.. Bar up  5:45pm   Wednesday  June 30...GIRLS ELITE MEET  4:45pm at Barn... Entry  $40..Warm Up 4:45pm... Bar up  5:45pm   Thursday  July 1... BOYS & GIRLS RISING STARS MEET  4:45pm at Barn..Entry $40  .. Warm Up at 4:45pm...Bar up 5:45pm   Friday...July 9..SUMMER FESTIVAL... MS....   Frosh/Soph  .... Masters  ON LINE SIGN UP ONLY   Saturday...July 10..SUMMER FESTIVAL//Junior/Senior ... College/Open....... Elite Women     ON LINE SIGN UP ONLY  at www.hvflyingcircus.com     Flying Circus...  Summer Time Pole Vault  now till July 11.

posts.Title: CIRCUS BOYS ELITE MEET ~~~ LOUIS MARTINEZ 16' 7" ... DANE SORENSEN 16' 7"PR ... NICK LOURENCO 16' 1"PR  FUN !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault, LLC   " Flying-in-the-Barn " Together

 "IT's NOT OVER YET" .........  School Records....... 9 All-Time  PR's .......Spirited Laughter  and Stuff you can't  make up !!!!!!!!!! The  Boys Circus  Elite Meet was moved  Indoor  due  to rain,thunder,lighting conditions.....  and  the  21 Elite Pole Vaulters put on  a show!!!!!!!!!  Congratulations to all vaulters, parents   and meet volunteers for making it  a memorable  day at our  19th MEET of the YEAR  @ CIRCUS HEAVEN.  This  tune up meet for  our SUMMER POLE VAULT FESTIVAL on JUly 9-10   was deep with results and  energy.  Guys  were moving up poles  and grips every other jump  and new performance levels  were acheived.  THANK YOU ALL  for making POLE VAULT FUN !!

 MEET RECAP~   The High School Boys Division featured  newly signed NY State Recordholder..Louis Martinez (Wallkill,NY)  fly a new indoor PR  at 16' 7" with room  to spare  and super  bars  at 17' 1.5" for the University of Alabama signee. Louis takes it to Oregon's Hayward Field  next week  for  Nike Nationals.  Great jumps  came  also to St. Anthony's Nick Lourenco..with his New PR  and  New School record  of  16' 1"  for  coach Jim Henderson and The Wearhouse Pole Vault Club. Nick was  close  at the NY State Junior Class record   with his 16' 7" leaps.  Cranking up in  third  ..was  Pascack Hills,NJ  junior , Max Zuckerman with  15' 1"  and also heads  to Nike Nationals... Taking the  forth spot was junior Harrison Hayward of Hackley School,NY  with  a double PR  at 13' 7" for Coach Duffy.  Top Soph  was Scott Andersen(Hunterdon Central.NJ)  at 12' 1"PR .   The  Open Division was loaded with  college vaulters and former champions... as  Dane Sorensen  set PR  and Cortland University record  of  16' 7" and moved up poles  at close  bars  17' 1.5".  Taking   silver was  the  resurgancing Nick Mirecki(Washingtonville,NY)  with  14' 7" seasonal best for the Bryant University  freshman.  Miguel Negrete(Bucknell)   and Rich Mangogna(Long Island) were  super over 14' 1" to round out the TOP  FIVE.  The Big Surpirse  came  from Brett Carey ..the former M-W Star from 30 years ago.. with his 10' 1" clear to win the Masters Division   at 59 years young!!!!!   Congratulations  all.. full results  below .

  Boys Circus Elite Meet..(Indoor)  June 22, 2021  The Warwick Center Flying Circus  High School Division :   1- Louis Martinez(Wallkill,NY)  16' 7"   2-Nick Lourenco(St.Anthony,NY)  16' 1" PR/Sch Record  3-Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills,NJ)  15' 1"  4-Harrison Hayward)Hackley,NY) 13' 7"PR  5-Steve Ditelberg(Fairfield,CT) 13' 7"  6-Mike Crooke(Fordham,NY) 13' 7"  7-Luke Gnospelius(Ridgewood,NJ)  13' 1"  8-Eoin O'Gara(Pearl River,NY)  13' 1"  9-Carter Tresdallo(Fordham,NY)  12' 7"  10-Andreu Lossada(Fordham,NY) 12' 7"  11-Scott Andersen(Flemington,NJ) 12' 1"PR  12-Liam Conrardy(Long Island)  12' 1"PR   13-Alex Jones(Darien,CT)  11' 7"    14-Alex McKenney(Greeley,NY)  11' 7"    15-Kevin La-Chua(NYC)  11' 1"   Open Division:    1-Dane Sorensen(Warwick,NY)  16' 7"PR/Sch Record   2-Nick Mirecki(Wash'ville,NY)  14' 7" 3-Miguel Ngrete(Bucknell) 14' 1"   4-Richard Magogna(Long Island)  14' 1"   5-Mike Carey(Wash'ville,NY)  12' 1" Masters Division:    1-Brett Carey(Wash'ville,NY)   10' 1"  (59 Age Group  !!!)

   NEXT CIRCUS MEETS   ***************************  GIRLS CIRCUS ELITE MEET  Wednesday  June 30  at 4:45pm   $40 Entry/Free Parking  BOYS & GIRLS RISING STARS MEET...Thursday  July 1  at 4:45pm   $40 Entry/Free Parking

posts.Title: LOUIS MARTINEZ FLYS to ALL-AMERICAN Finish....LUKE BEATTIE Sails NYS  CLASS RECORD...AVERIE KLEIN takes Middle School at 10' 2"!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault , LLC  Warwick Valley,NY


    The FYLING CIRCUS  vaulters are putting on  a  ..." BIG FINISH"  to  an unbeleavible  season. " KIDS DON"T GIVE UP."..... thats  the message here at FLYING CIRCUS as  we  salute  all 90+ Vaulters  this year at our little pole vault paradise.  It's  on to  a super camp next week   and  to our  "Greatest Meet of the Year"  @ CIRCUS SUMMER FESTIVAL.!!!!!!!!!!!!!
  Here is the Fiberglass Recoil Scoop......


  * The   action started up on Wednesday  with   Temps  soaring  100+ degree heat in the Barn Yard   at Circus Girls Elite Meet... with  6   outstanding girls having  fun together.  Warwick Valley,NY  Freshman..Lily-Ann Beattie roard  down the   Mondo runway like never before   an fly 11' 8'   for the Joe Tea on her  14' 1 x 165 Recoil..... She then  moved  her grip up  and was big  over 12' 2" on all three and is ready  for  Camp and Festival.  Lady Wizard..Sophie Mirecki  took home the  silver with her powerful sail over 11' 2"  and Rachel Mason(High Point,NJ)  nailed  the plant with 11' 2" for bronze. Taking honor  in Soph Class..was Ellison Weiner of Weston,CT  with her 11' 2". Junior Madison Chalfin(New City,NY) moved up to her  12' 7" Poles  for  her  first time this year and  sailed 10' 8"..Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Suffern,NY) made 9' 8"  as  each girl  was finishing at a PR attemps!!!!!  Peaking together!!!!


  *  The Circus Rising Stars Meet  was full of Personal Bests on Wednesday ..... with  9  Total PR's from the 12 girls as the meet was moved Indoor due  to the  approaching rain.   Fairfield,CT..Junior star..Steve Ditelberg... was on his game  with  a 13' 9.5" Indoor PR' for this  speedy approach run athlete.. He   sailed big at 14' 1" on all three jumps.  Alexander Pedersen(Somers,NY) took silver at 10' 2" in HS division. Brady Bonser(Wallkill Valley,NJ) placed   third  at 8' 8"PR. The HS girls were  sailing...with Elizabeth Apostolico(Monroe,NY)  taking gold  at 9' 2"PR..followed  byFreshman,,Maia Perillo(East FishkillNY)  at 9' 2"PR ...Olivia Sciaino(Mahwah) 7' 2"  and Jessica Orsino(West Milford,NJ)  6' 2"PR.   

Our Middle School Youth Movement Project were sensational all meet... with Luke Beattie(warwick,NY)  breaking his own 7th Grade Indoor NYS Record  with  his  10' 8" PR.   Max Wickrath(Minisink,NY), also just a 7th grader....placed   silver at 8' 8"PR   and Anthony Roe(Warwick,NY)  made 8' 8"  for this  8th grader!!!   It was  Pine Bush Middle School 8th Grader..Averie Klein that stole   the show  with her 10' 2" make  and  so close at 10' 8" PR bar.   Special thanks  to Pit crew..Dane Sorensen,Katie Klein,Jeremy Ditelberg,and Bob Sorensen  and all parents surviving the heat in that second  floor Hay Loft!!!!


  *  Today  was  a  special day  for Louis Martinez @  the legendary Hayward Field NIKE NATIONALS in Oregon. Starting as a freshman four years ago  and barely bending   the poles.. he  jumped 11' 0" for the Panthers of Wallkill High School.NY.  He then ..."hitched  his wagon" to -the-stars ....and began  a  dedicated   and focused journey to become a special elite  athlete. There are  so many stories  behind  each athlete here at Flying Circus Pole Vault.  Each story is deiiferent  and  carries   beautiful magic and  wonder... of what can be  acheived with a Hard Work Ethic and  a Gracious Spirit. Yes.. Louis became  an ALL-AMERICAN  today in Oregon..with his  5th place  sail over  at16' 0" on jump #1 on his BIGGEST  180Essx   for this  136 lb. athlete.  Weight Training  with Focus... Sprinting for  his HS team and  doing  4 events  in  almost  every  dual meet produced  one   tough athlete.   DEDICATION  TRUMPS TALENT  ..every time in sport.     Team Mate  Max Zuckerman of Pascach Hills,NJ  gained   valuable  experience for his up-coming senior  year  with   a 14' 8.5" finish for 19th in USA today.
   

*  Our CAMPS are full of  exciting athletes... Beginners... Inteermediate   and  Elite..... Ready to Soar this week in prep of SUMMER CIRCUS FESTIVAL!!!!
   CIRCUS.        ..Hitch-You-Wagon-To-The Stars....   and DREAM BIG.

posts.Title: THANK YOU ALL ... from FLYING CIRCUS. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
THANK YOU ALL ........ from. FLYING CIRCUS !!!!!!!!!     

The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Festival      Warwick Valley, NY
     

Dear Athletes...Parents...Coaches  and  Meet Volunteer Workers and Media Specalists ~~~~~~~~


          THE  FLYING CIRCUS  would like. to say THANK YOU.... to each and. everyone of you .....for. making our SUMMER FESTIVAL MEET a wonderful gathering of  FRIENDSHIPS and FUN.  We all enjoyed the many new athletes. and families and our regular veterans  all mixed up together  on a summer day...sharing. stories and JOE TEA!!!!!!!!!!   Full. results will follow to each of. you. and. the. wishes. for. a summer. filled. with joy. We will be back next year and. hope. you all can join us. again.  KEEP  TRAINING...... it's ONLY. 257 DAYS AWAY!!!!!!
   

2021 CIRCUS SUMMER FESTIVAL MEET    July 9-10  @. FLYING CIRCUS
 
The Recap ~~~~~~~The 10th edition of Circus Summer Pole Vault  Festival. was billed.  as. the . ..." Celebration of  the Pole Vault Spirit"..... and  the "spirit" moved the. 110 athletes. from the. nine  states. This. two day fiberglass mingling of pole vault "nuts" can not  be matched...as.  29 Personal Bests ruled. the. day.  Meet. records. were set in  5 of the 8 Divisions...along with New York State Class Records with Louis Martinez(Wallkill,NY) at 17' 1" for. seniors. and Nick Lourenco(Bayshore,NY). setting. a new Junior NY State Record. at 16' 7" for Coach Jim Henderson.  Co-Meet Directors...Bob Sorensen. and Stephanie Duffy produced another wonder0-meet of Fun.....  6 Photo Journalists promoted  attended.  and made it all  thrilling. with. interviews,video.  and photos of. the. action.  Our. 22 CIRCUS VOLUNTEER ARMY kept.   everything. going strong following our. Circus Camp Week.    The lively music. set the. stage and rhythumic clapping prevailed. on  every third attempt.... The. ultimate. prize was. awarded. to all athletes... yes--the "Lighting-in-a-Bottle"..... JOE TEA .  DAY 1....  Competitions. were moved. into the Barn Hay Loft second floor.... with Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) freshman. taking the top mark in Girls Frosh Soph at 11' 7"(Meet Record) on her. 14'1 x 165 Essx and Ellison Weiner(Weston,CT) setting her PR. at 11' 7"!!!  The Boys Frosh/Soph  Comp... came down to a jump off between Scott Anderson(Flemington,NJ). and Andy Cimino(Warwick,.NY)...with Cimino prevailing. at 12' 4" . The Masters. was sensational and stacked. with legends.  John Marz(NJ)  flew. 12' 1" PR to lead. the 6 never give up. athletes. to the fun. Taking the longest trip. to the festival ..was. Appoka,  Florida legend...'Jumpin' Joe Johnston...The MASTERS. GROUP  won. the. MOST SPIRIT AWARD  @ Festival !!!   The Middle School Division Girls. were sensational...with Rachel Venter(Warwick ,NY) 10' 1" sail taking the PEACH.  and Averie Klein(Pine Bush,NY)  9' 7" the Silver. Emily Coss(Land-o-Lakes,FL) taking bronze. The Boys. Middle School Division was.  a Warwick Valley Middle School Sweep...with Luke  Beattie at 10' 1"...Anthony Roe. 9'1". and Colin Redpath. at 6'1"                 

DAY 2 ......The BIG BOYS. and BIG GIRLS ARRIVE in VAULT-TOWN. for. some MAGIC!!!!  The Boys/Men took. to  the outdoor Mondo Runway. and the. Girls/Women  laced 'em up in the Indoor 107 foot.  Speed Runway.   The. fun began. at. 10:01 am. .. with  the Girls Junior/Senior Division.... Alicia Johnson(Monroe,NY) flying  12' 1" under the direction of Coach Stephanie Duffy. This  all-around.  track and field. star will be heading. to UNC-Charlotte. this. fall to join. a.  super. Womens Vault  Squad .  NJ State Meet Runner-Up ..Randi Conroy(Allendale,NJ)   flew 11' 7" for. silver. and heads to Lehigh University next fall for Coaches Matt & Debbie Utesch.   The Boys Junior /Senior Division  was deep..as. Louis Martinez(Wllkill,NY) made  history..with his new  Outdoor NY State Record. of. 17' 1" ...Using is. 15' 1. x 180Essx....this. 131. pounder let it. fly.  and. close bar at 17' 4" ..... Adding. fuel to that mark. was. Nick  Lourenco of St.Anthony's,NY  with his all time. New York State Junior Class record. of 16' 7"PR. for Coach Jim Henderson.  Coming up big  for. third. was MASS State Champion ...Jack Vecellio(Gill,MASS)  at 16' 1". and. close bar  at Eric Duffy's. State record. at 16' 7'.  Both Nick and Jack  have been invited. to NYRR Millrose Games. on  Jan 27th Thursday Night Boys Jr Pole Vault Event!!!!!!!!!      The Womens Open Vault. was loaded up. with former HS Champions... as. Julia. Valenti(North Reading,MASS) took home.  a. close. comp at. 12' 7". with Victoria Atkinson(Mountain Top,PA) also. at 12' 7" ..as both.  near missed. at 13' 1" in the indoor.  comp.  Outside. the Men's Open. was. taking place...as. former  NY Pole Vault   star. Jordan Yamoth(Houston,TX). rallied over. 16' 7". to edge Dan Sorensen(Warwick,NY). 16' 1"...Conor Reilly(Union,NJ). 16' 1".  and Bradley Jelmert(Basking Ridge,NJ). at 16' 1" !!!!!    In all... seven. guys over. 16' 1" + for the meet.
 

 Good Friends.... Share Good Times... to promote. GREAT KIDS !!!!!!   

   ......See you next year!!!!!

posts.Title: NEIL HOWARD Wins JUNIOR NATIONAL DECATHLON TITLE... 6,316 Points
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure, LLC 
The Warwick Valley, NY


   The "Olympic Spirit" touches every athlete.  Pole Vaulter...NEIL HOWARD III ..... just a 15 year old. freshman in upstate Albany,NY...put iall 10 events  together in winning. the. USATF Jr.Olympic National Championship in the. 15-16 Age Group Decathlon. in Jacksonville,Florida.  this week.  His. 6,316 point total sets. a New York State All Time Record for Freshman Class....  with HS implements and hurdles.  He blended his. speed...strength. and. endurance to win  the. event by over 500 points in hot/humid tough conditions!!!!!!!!  He 's not done. yet.. as he. enters.  the. 400 Hurdles.  and Pole Vault.  individual events in the.  final days.  This.  14' 8". pole vaulter is. coached. by his Dad...Coach Neli Howard II.... It;s. a family affair. and he has accepted. his  NY Millrose Games  Jr.Pole Vault invite. for Thursday January 27 at the New Balance Armory.  CONGRATULATIONS NEIL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


   NEIL HOWARD III....   Decathlon  Jr National Champion. (Age 15-16 Group)

   Freshman NY State Record.... 6316 (HS Implements/Hurdles)

  Events.  
100m............. 11.50 (753 points)               
Long Jump....21' 8.5" (723 points)               
Shot Put........38'1.5"  (583 points)               
High Jump.... 5' 7" (544 points)               
400m........... 51.36. (753 points)               
110 Hurdles.. 16.12 ( 719 points)               
Discus..........  100.1" (454 points)               
Pole Vault.....  13' 5" (645 points)             
Javelin...........  135' 5" (416 points)             
1500m...........  4:43.29 (660 points)       
________________________________ 
.............................  6,316  Total Points !!!!!!

    KEEP TRAINING. for STRENGTH and SPEED this. summer.

posts.Title: CIRCUS  NEWS ~~~~~ "Preparing-for-Winter"
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault
Warwick Valley,NY
                                   
FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT                               
Families ......... Friendships ........  Fun
 
WELCOME back to the. final weeks. of. summer.   We are about ready to  fire-up. our Flying Circus Fall and Winter prep for this coming Indoor  season . We open the barn doors. on  September 8 for all levels of  Boys and Girls Co-Ed practice sessions and. you can get a  solid start on your Indoor Team season. These Open Sessions will be. every Wednesday evening for 8 weeks of  drills,conditioning and short run vaulting beginning. September 8 at Session #1 (5:15-6:45pm) and Session #2 (7-8:30pm). Join  the fun, as we strive to stay in the present .  Cost is still just $30 per athlete per session.  Additional private and semi-private sessions can be scheduled with coaching staff thru e-mail contact at Coach Duffy(stph2178@yahoo.com )--- Coach Sorensen(bsoren29@optonline.net ) --- Coach St (coachst@gmail.com).

    * This summer's feedback from our 110 athletes has been simply....AMAZING !! So many athletes caught the "Olympic Spirit. ....of  getting. the most out of ourselves." This attitude can never be defeated and will yeild. great results.  As you finish up your. summer.  strength. and speed. routines.....it's time. to push the throttle down to the floor.   You are building the foundation  for. an injury free and next level of performance.  Write you workout down in your journal and be proud of being. a full-time athlete.   

* Congratulations. to all athletes. finishing up their. summer. meets.....Highlights included Louis Martinez 16' 7". and Dane Sorensen. 16'1".  Scott Anderson 12' 0"  at Vault Factory meet....Rachel Mason 11' 0" and Rachel Venter 10' 0" and  Averie Klein 8' 6"  at Rockback Beach..... Wren Usiatynski (F-M) at Keystone State Games.    

* Thanks to your support..we  produced. 17 much needed meets. last year for our athletes.  We will again host meets this. Fall,Winter and Spring @ Flying Circus. Out  Fall meets will be ...Circus Girls Fall Classic. on October 28. at 4:45pm..all levels.  and  Boys Fall Classic on October 29  at 4:45pm..all levels....  Mark your calander and join us. We encourage all pole vaulters to join you High School Indoor Track and Field teams. this winter and try all the. events and make a contribution to your High School Team !!!!   

*." Mad Dash Alert".......   You will be. sent.  early Winter Training Packages for our limited. Winter Pole Vaulting at the Barn.  Try to sign up and mail in the same day to secure. the limited Winter Vaulting Sessions # 1.(Nov.  8- Jan. 20) and Session #2 (Jan 31- March 11.   It's going. to be. a. sensational year again. with  our strong returning vaulters.   

* The 114th NY MILLROSE GAMES Jr. Boys and Girls Pole Vault Events are loaded up with the best USA has to offer..with Top seed Amanda Moll(Olympis,WA) at 14' 7.5" and. 4 other girls.  at 14'+. and Boys Jr.Pole Vault on Thursday evening... Top Seed....Anthony Meacham(Woodsboro,TX) at 17' 6". and. 6 others over 16' 6" !!!!!  Tickets. for this EPIC  Competition go on sale  this October. at armorytrack.com.  Be part of history and. watch all the best in the USA this January!!!   

*  Include Water Recovery days following your. run workouts on these hot and humid days. You can add deep water pool running with a Life Vest on  and repeat 20 x 10 seconds of fast legs and arms in the perfect upright posture.  

      IT'S YOUR TIME NOW......... Don't Blink.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS WINTER CLUB...NOW SOLD OUT !!!!!   MANY THANKS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy                                 Warwick Valley,  New York


          "PASSION  CREATES  ENERGY"..........  WELCOME TO FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT.   Thanks. to your  great support.....our. Winter Training Packages  are. filled up with motivated.  and highly          dedicated  young. athletes ready for the challenges. of modern day fiberglass pole vaulting.   We are NOW SOLD OUT. for this Winter and READY to FLY with our flight crew.  Your class placement. and          and your runway placement will be. e-mailed. to you by Oct. 20...... as we. evenly  get ability grouping on both our RISING STARS 6-Step Runway. and our EMERGING ELITE VAULTERS on our 8 Step          Runway.   This ability grouping instruction will speed up the learning curve for both groups.     Masks. will be required  for all athletes  and staff for indoor activities( OurPractice and our meets). and all athletes         must renew their. current USATF memberships on line. by December 31, as they turn over each  new year with re-registration. There  will be no spectators or family members  inside again this year for our         practices. and meets.     We have  a strong group of new vaulters.  and the seasoned  vaulters will model the leadership necessary. for success in  our sport.


         Things to Remember.......           
*. Be 10 Minutes. EARLY. for your training session.            
*  Encourage your team mates. every chance. you get.  It goes. full circle.      
*. Make  serious training. a priority...... not just going-thru-the-motions.            *. You must be. COACHABLE.  and. be ready. for. new levels of challenges.         *  Stay POSITIVE......   Bring a small notebook to each training session for. grips,run approach starts ,pole changes,drills, etc.           
*. Dress for practice. like. you are a world class elite athlete.  Present. yourself.... Bring. small spikes/masks,waterbottle.           
*  Start up your. run and. strength lifting NOW... Just  5 weeks. till Nov. start up.           
*. Give more than you take in life....... GO HARD in our club.           
*  Bring...a. "SPIRIT" driven  training. attitude with. you each day....  There are NO LIMITS to your. ACHEIVEMENTS.


      OUR FIRST MEETS are only. 4 weeks. away...  It's  our. season opening ICE-BREAKER FALL CLASSIC..... BE READY for FUN.       Thursday. October 28, 2021... GIRLS ICE BREAKER FALLL CLASSIC...4:30pm.... Fee-$40/athlete       Friday.      October. 29, 2021..BOYS ICE BREAKER FALL CLASSIC... 4:30pm......Fee-$40/athlete
                                                       FLY-the-CIRCUS...... PUSH TO THE TOP of the MOUNTAIN.

posts.Title: CIRCUS CLUB FLYERS .... READY-to-LAUNCH !!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Winter Pole Vault Club, LLC     
3 Warwick Center & Hoyt Road     
Warwick, New York. 10990


THANK YOU  for joining  the CIRCUS !!!!!!!     Mermbership in  something ......"BIGGER than SELF"  .....is a powerful and  positive experience  for our  club  athletes...for our club  staff coaches  and for our club parents  .   The  Flying Circus  is based     on progressive improvements...... athletes supoirting  athletes.  and living.the ideals of true sportsmansip thru athletics.   These. are. the real goals that never fade here in our little pole vault club.
 
"EVERY ATHLETE COUNTS"......  from the shy beginner starting out their journey...to. the outstanding..... 150 "State Champions" who have plastered us on the pole vault map.  EVERYONE COUNTS @ CIRCUS !!!     

Now...It's. YOUR TURN....... to leave your mark  at Flying Circus.    Let's prove to all ....that HARD.....CONSISTANT WORK HABITS and solid POSITIVE MENTAL TOUGHNESS are the      real  qualities  of sport.    

STAY TOUGH...STAY HUMBLE... STAY FOCUSED. for SUCCESS !!!!!!!!!!!!!!   The Next 16 Weeks are   Filled-with -FUN !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
       
Things to Remember         
* We are. staying Covid Safe....  Every Athlete/Coach. must be fully Masked in each Indoor session... Bring your own MASK.           
* Athletes/coaches feeling ill should not attend practice.            
* Athletes. should plan to arrive. 10 minutes before class start time.  Sesson #1 begins. at 5:15pm each night. Session #2 begins. at 7:01pm.           
* All athletes. should. dress warmly. and. bring spikes.  and water bottlke. w/ name on it.  Dress for practice neat and clean.... Dress like an ELITE ATHLETE.           
* BE COACHABLE.... Be ready to experiment. with NEW DRILLS..NEW IDEAS... NEW GRIPS.... NEW and LONGER POLES.   NEW MENTAL TOUGHNESS.           
* Encourage. each other  the. ENTIRE PRACTICE.   This.  encourging spirit creates. and UNBELIEVABLE atmosphere where. EVERYONE RISES UP with the. incoming tide.         
 * BARN DOOR SOPEN. for. the 21st. season. at 5:01pm and close. at 8:31pm each night.    STAY UP with your ACADEMIC  RESPONSIBILITIES EVERY DAY.           
* CREATE a unique and motivating practice. space. that you can express yourself. thru movement.   This is what  sport. was ment to be.         
 * WALK in MOTIVATED and  WALK out IMPROVED.....   YOU HOLD THE KEY to YOUR SUCCESS.    
   
@@@. @@@@     

In  unsafe. weather  travel days.. we will CANCEL PRACTICE.   by e-mail. by 3pm that day. Check your e-mail  before traveling on  bad weather days.@@@@@@                                   

We will be having our only fund raiser....FLYING CIRCUS APPAREL/GEAR  FUNDRAISER Nov. 8- Dec 15.....to purchase. new ESSX poles to complete our series.                                   

Details. and. flyers coming this week.    
               
FLYING CIRCUS WINTER #1 CLUB................   65 ATHLETES WORKING TOGETHER.

posts.Title: CIRCUS NEWS ALERT ~~~GEAR SALE ENDS in 48 HOURS!!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus, LLCThe Warwick  Center Barn , NY
 
We hope you enjoyed  a  healthy and relaxed THANKSGIVING DAY with  your  family.  Now..it's on with the show at Flying Circus Training. Our. first. 3 weeks.  have been filled. with basic drills..technique gains.  and run approach improvements.  We now.   will move. to phase. #2. and. start up. the. pole drop and tall plant mechanics before.  our  Armory Opening  Meet  on Friday Night... December 17.    " HOLY- COW...BATMAN" ...... Just 20 DAYS TO ARMORY MAGIC !!!!!!!!!!!!



    *******. Ask your High School  coach to enter you in the  FUN @ Coach Saint Invite. Meet Director Tim Fulton. announced. the  pole vault progressions. for  this small and condensed meet (.See below). The meet is open. to the first 30 High Schools. to enter. and we have. 25 schools already....  Enter Immediately if possible.  Girls Pole Vault  4:45pm.   Start 8' 0"-9'3"-10'0"-10' 6". etc  Boys Pole Vault. 7:00pm.   Start 11' 0"-12' 3"-13' 0"-13' 6" etc.

 *. Our  CIRCUS GEAR/APPAREL FUND RAISER   is just 48 hours to closing deadline .  Last call. for gear. and. thank you all. for. ordering  again this. year.       Circus Gear Link.   .... https://fancloth.shop/4QHBY      


  *. WINTER CIRCUS POLE RENTALS..... With meets. just around the corner, we will be renting UCS Spirit. and Altic Vaulting Poles to all athletes again this. winter.  Cost. $125. per pole. rental. for. the. 3 month indoor winter season. We do not. rent ESSX Vaulting Poles again this year. See Coach Bob Sorensen if. you need to  rent  some poles. this. winter.
   *. We will be. moving back the approach. run this week. Be ready to adjust to more. speed of the longer approach run. with pole. drop mechanics.  and  plant mechanics.
    *    " Per Ardua Ad Astra" ...        ...(by striving...we reach-the-stars.)             -Royal Air Force motto-

posts.Title: STEPHANIE DUFFY....... Elected to SECTION 9 Track & Field.... HALL-of-FAME !!!!!!
posts.Content:
Dear Vaulters... Families.   and Coaches..     

 

I am delighted. to inform you all .....  that our own Coach Stephanie Duffy. has been selected. to this year's  class of inductees into.the Section 9 Track & Field Hall of Fame.

          Stephanie Duffy.......  Athlete....Teacher..... Coach         

Stephanie Duffy   was. a team captain at Washingtonville High School. and competed. with grace. and style.  She was. coached.  by  Charlie Delmonico. and Art Jessup. and Hugh Cauthers.  She excelled. in all. sprint... jump...relay events...but the pole vault. was. her. speciality.   She. spared. to.  three. NY State Pole Vault Championships. and. placed. All American her. senior year at the Outdoor Nationals. in Greensboro as. runner-up at 12' 11.5"..  She competed on scholarship for the University of South Florida for legendary coach..Don Marsh and.  was  a. 5-Time Academic All-American  and Big East Champion in the pole vault with a. personal best of. 13' 6.5".   

As great as. she. was a team player... she excelled. at coaching even higher..  Returning to her home school district. as a teacher.. she has inspired the Wizards with her positivity and. encouraging coaching style.    As Co-Director at our. Flying Circus Academy...  she has molded champions. with her grace.  and  dignity.

     CONGRATULATIONS..Coach STEPHANIE DUFFY......

  Visit the website  https://sectionixhof.com for. tickets to   her HALL of FAME GALA  Tribute  brunch and reunion. . Date:   May 1, 2022.  at 2pm  Place:  Kuhl's Highland House in Middletown,New York Tickets :  $75 each adult for family, friends, coaches, teammates  and all others.
