posts.Title: CIRCUS POLE VAULT......BUILDING TEAM CONCEPTS.
posts.Content:
The  spring pole vault. season is just about to explode.  The. technique prep work the past. four weeks has been full of positive. energy. and inspiring support of each other.  This team support. and  encouraging each other is the essence of athletics.   Thank you for Building the Team Concept in Track & Field. and in our Club.  Competing for. your TEAM is a POWERFUL FORCE

 Here are some 'Key Points in Building Your Team'.     

* Track & Field s a TEAM SPORT.....place TEAM GOALS FIRST.   

 * Think..Talk...Act...Train like. a "TEAM CHAMPION".     

* See the whole picture....the TEAM Picture...Compete Hard for each other.     * DREAM BIG DREAMS..... Set your GOALS  High.     

* Make STRONG CONTRIBUTIONS to TEAM in LEADERSHIP...SPIRIT...DEDICATION.     * HARD WORK is a TEAM DECISION ....LEAD-the-WAY.     

* Be the STRONGEST LINK in the ..."TEAM CHAIN".     

* MAKE A DIFFERENCE......  COMPETE HARD for the TEAM.     * Set the TEAM WORK ETHIC TEMPO..... PUSH to the TOP of the MOUNTAIN in Training.     

* Be LOYAL to EACH OTHER.     

* Practice saying ..."THANK YOU"...more often.     

* GIVE MORE THAN YOU TAKE in LIFE.     

* LITE your "ATHLETIC FIRE" with SELF~MOTIVATION.     

* Make Training TOGETHER IMPORTANT.....EVERYONE BENEFITS     

* TEAM CONCEPT ATTITUDES MAKE YOU A BETTER ATHLETE....BETTER LEADER...BETTER PERSON.   

* I WILL GET READY...and then...PERHAPS MY CHANCE WILL COME.

SUMMER CAMPS...... Only 7 Spots left in Girls (July 5-6) Camp.                                          Only  15 Spots left in Boys & Girls Co-Ed Camp(July 2-3)                                               Register ASAP. at.  www.hvflyingcircus.com


     SUMMER POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEET..... Registration  NOW OPEN. for our. Final Meet of the Year. posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS ~~~~ YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Flyers   Warwick Valley ,NY

 In 1974 at Warwick Valley Central..... 5 tough guys. showed. up for. the  first     Cross Country practice of the season. at C.Ashlet Morgan field. These trailblazers were all about wanting to push their human limits in training and competition. Coming into. the. season that year. from the 0-16 record from the previous year...it. was  truly a rebuilding situation. Our goal was. to win 1 meet and train like "CHAMPIONS EVERY DAY".      They ran and raced. for. each other the entire. season... never letting up  in grinding each day.. and never let anyone down. They refused. to miss. a. single day of practice together.  They ran hard. for those "SEVEN LETTERS" on the. front of their  jersey. The TEAM was. the only focus . No one. in Orange County knew their names before the season started.     They ran for respect......they ran. for WARWICK.... and on the. back-of-their training shirts.... they choose to be printer..."YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE".
   

This illustrates the Power of BELIEVING in YOURSELF...YOUR TRAINING and YOUR TEAM MATES.  So it is at this mid-season cross road...... YOUR FINEST MOMENTS TOGETHER ARE JUST AHEAD....YOU GOTTA' BELIEVE.


Pole Vault News. and Results 

 Alumni Vaulters---- Kaeli Thompson(Texas) hits. 13' 2". for LongHorns  at LSU Invite and is regaining her technique. Close bars at 13' 7"!!!  Tyler Hrbek(UCONN). wins. the college  section at  Penn Relays....Dalton Yeust(Monmouth) , The.  strong Tunhannock.PA sophomore. flew. 15' 11.75. for silver. Abby Norwillo(UPENN) placed. second. at Penn College Women at 12' 10.75"..Randi Conroy(Lehigh)  vaulter 11' 11". At Shippensburg Paul Kaiser Invite..Dane Sorensen flew 4.50. from short run for. the Cortland Red Dragons.   High School News----  Lily Beattie(Warwick). was Top Soph at 126th Penn relays with her 11' 8". 4th place finish in challenging conditions....Rachel Venter(Warwick). was. solid at opening bar of 11' 3"...   Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills)  flew 14' 5.5" in Boys Championship !!!

*** RACHEL MASON (High Point,NJ) Sets School Record   of 12' 0" at the Randolph Relays on Saturday and. close bars at 12' 7". Rachel has. signed.  at UCONN for. next season and this 12' 0" mark qualifies her for New Balance Nationals this June at UPENN!!!    TATUM NORRIS(Susquehanna Community,PA) is lighting up the. sprints. and pole vault events this spring. Racing to  three school records in the North Pocono Invite,PA.. She. was a TRIPLE WINNER... 100m----12.43...200m-24.43...Pole Vault. 11' 3"...ALL New School Outdoor Records!!!  Gold Rush Invite----CHLOE PASEK(West Milford,NJ) won the Varsity Pole Vault. at 10' 6..Olivia DeBellis(Suffern) 10' 0"...Elizabeth Apostlico(MW). 9' 0".  Gabreille Swaine(BT). 8' 0".  Saskia Tommelen(BT). 7' 0"....Kate Dowling(PR_ 8' 6PR..  Reily Craig(PR) 6' 0" . Todd Korman(Suffern) 10' 7"PR. Varsity Boys... Alex McKenney(Horace Greeley). 13' 6"..Jor Tufano(Bergen Tech) 13' 6" School Record!!! Max Decker(Bronxville 11' 6'. Alexander Pedersen(Som) 10' 0" Dan Haigh(Som) 9' 0"  Kingston Relays---   Sisi Diaz(NFA). took silver at 9' 6". Maia Perillo(JJEF)  9' 0". Kyla Aviles(Midd). 7' 0"

 

SUMMER CAMPS...... ALMOST FULL... ONLY  5. Spots. left in July 2-3 Camp!!!!!!  HURRY!!!!!!  SUMMER  ALL COMER TWILIGHT MEETS....   Boys and Girls  JUNE  8, June 22. and June 29.   HS-College-Open Sections                 Sign Up DAY of MEET ONLY at Site .... $40 Entry Fee. 4:30 Warm Up..  5:30 Bar Up SUMMER CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL.. July 8-9.   Registration Now Open.  at.    www.hvflyingcircus.com

posts.Title: BRIAN AHEARN CLASSIC ~~~~LILY BEATTIE. 12' 1"(Girls).....LUKE BEATTIE. 12' 1" (Boys) ....15 PR'S!!!!
posts.Content:
The BRIAN AHEARN TRACK CLASSIC      Warwick Valley High School


    May 7~~~~~   Saturday Night was dedicated. to the Spirit. and. Courage  of Brian Ahearn...as. twelve High School Boys & Girls  teams gathered to Celebrate one of Warwick Valley's most inspirational. and. courageous  X-Country and Track & Field  athletes....... BRIAN AHEARN.  Sensational performances lite up the night in every event.  Thank you athletes for running..jumping. and throwing in his. name.

 

The past three days have produced. 5 New School Records in the Pole Vault ... 15  Vault PR's. and. SUPER TEAM SPIRIT in our. event.     Yes... the Train is leaving-the-station...... Punch your  PR TICKET the next 6 weeks. of this. season!!!!!!!!!
  LILY BEATTIE(Warwick Valley). Sophomore. cranked. 25.6 in her Sprint Medley Relay. and then. flew. 12' 1" PR. for the gold medal in the vault and team mate...RACHEL VENTER(Warwick Valley) ..Freshman cleared. 11' 7(=PR) for silver and. hit the Super State Standard for the NY State Meet next month in Syracuse.  LUKE BEATTIE(Warwick Valley)..Just an  8th grader  from Warwick Valley Middle..took home the Boys section of Pole Vault. with his 12' 1"(=PR) effort on his biggest poles so far this spring. EMMA KEATING(Pompton Lakes,NJ). Junior---flew. 12' 0" for her new school record and her brother Owen Keating(Freshman).  set school freshman record of 11' 6" for the win in Boys division.  JULIA LAZO(Crestwood,PA)...senior..Coached. by Bob Sorensen...flew. 11' 9" PR this week and close bar at 12' 0" for this District 2 Class 2 all-around. athlete.  RACHEL MASON(High Point,NJ)..senior... sailed. 12' 0" this week again  for the UCONN  signee on her biggest 13' 1 ESSX RECOIL!!!!  MICHELLE LEE(NV-Demarest,NJ). sizzled over  11' 6" for her Conference.  win for this Columbia University recruit coached. this winter by Coach Duffy.  ANGELISSE DIAZ(NFA)..senior... Set her school again with her 10' 3" dual meet win for.  this UALBANY signee.  DANE SORENSEN(Cortland University) won  the pole vault. at conference at 15' 9:  for the Red Dragons of Coach Steve Patrick. Dane.  will be one of the lead instructors at this year CIRCUS SUMMER CAMPS(July 2-6).  ABBY NORWILLO(UPENN) Senior...finished. her HEP career on a. sensational note. with her 12' 11.75. second place  at IVY CHAMPS at Yale.

AHEARN RESULTS---Girls- Lily Beattie(Warwick) 12' 1.  Rachel Venter(Warwick) 11' 7". Rachel Mason(High Point) 11' 1". Samantha Smith(Syosset) 11' 1".  Danielle Bruce(Vernon). 10' 1". Sophie Ragans(Warwick) 8' 7"PR.  Sami Brady(Warwick) 7'1"PR  Boys-Luke Beattie(Warwick). 12' 1"    Anthony Roe(Warwick) ..10' 1".  Ryan Morales(Warwick)  9' 1"

CIRCUS SUMMER CAMPS. are now BOTH SOLD OUT....  THANK YOU ALL for supporting our Summer Club Activities.  CIRCUS ALL-COMERS MEETS COMING... MARK YOUR CALENDAR NOW!!    June 8, 2022... 4:45pm..Boys and Girls Open.. $40 entry at site Only.    June  22, 2022. 4:45pm..Boys and Girls Open.. $40 entry at site Only.    June 29, 2022.. 4:45pm..Boys. and Girls  Open..$40 entry at site Only.
   "THE VAULT MEET of the YEAR"      Fri & Sat.... July 8-9 , 2022. ~~~  8 Divisions/Music,Fun,Food Truck/Joe Tea      SIGN UP  ONLY at WED SITE.  www.hvflyingcircus      NO DAY of MEET REGISTRATION .

posts.Title: CIRCUS FLYS @ DISTRICT 2~~~TATUM NORRIS 11'6"(PV)-12.18(100m)-25.35(200m ~~JULIA LAZO 11' 6" POLEVAULT GOLD!!!
posts.Content:
TATUM NORRIS (Susquehanna Community,PA) 

District 2 Class AA Championships  today at Valor Veterans Stadium  was. "The Tatum Norris Show" for the gracious. and humble junior..Tatum Norris.  Opening the. day coming out of the blocks. strong and explosive..she advanced. to PA States with gold medal  12:18 for 100 meters, breaking the All-Time District 2. old record of 12.22 by Lauren Ellsworth(Montrose-2011).   Next up was her best pole vaulting of the outdoor season..with her 11' 6" fly. for the silver medal and. very close bars. at 12 foot club.  Three hours later..she raced the 200 meter curve like it was  a 100m dash!!!  Winning in 25.35 to set another All-Time record.(Old record  25.69 by Amiah Lukowski( 2016)..    The Norris  Team fan club was deep into the cheer support!!!  Tatum advances. to PA  State Championships. in all three. events at Shippensburg University May 27-28!!!!!  
  JULIA LAZO (Crestwood,PA)

District 2 Class AAA Championships yesterday was filled. with many inspirational. stories of "NEVER GIVE UP on YOURSELF".   Senior Crestwood,PA  Captain.....JULIA LAZO is  this year's  Flying Circus 'Never Give Up Award' winner.  Coached. by  Bob Sorensen. the past 6 months have produced a confident pole vaulter with spirited and tough competitive edge.  Winning the. AAA Pole Vault. at 11' 6" in tricky winds all day. was thrilling to watch.  She also advances. to PA State Meet in Shippensburg!!! 
  RICHIE REED(Western Wayne,PA) 

In today's  AA Boys Championship.....Senior--RICHIE REED(Western Wayne) came out of his pole vault cage for Coach Bob Amos of Western Wayne. Perhaps. the. most humble pole vaulter to train with us on a limited basis... Richie Reed is  SPECIAL.  Richie. advances  to PA STATE MEET. with.  his 14' 6" PR win. and. a. 1 foot  PR in this meet.  You can't make this.  great stuff up!!!!
  CONGRATULATIONS to all Vaulters. and Families. and BEST @ STATE!!!!!!

posts.Title: 8 CIRCUS GIRLS FLY @ NY STATE--LILLY BEATTIE & RACHEL VENTER SAIL 12' 0!!
posts.Content:
2022  New York State Meet   Cicero-North High School , NY


  The Flying Circus Pole Vault Team  showed up as. a group... they supported. each other as a group....  and they thrilled. the on-lookers. as a group. !!!!
   YES--- The FLYING CIRCUS  was a GROUP PROJECT. at the New York State Track & Field Championships. yesterday in challenging conditions all day..... with 8 Girls making huge adjustments with  20+mph tail and cross winds the. entire. 4 hour competition.  Everyone. adjusted and. moved up poles.  for.  New PR's....New School Records.  and.  exciting fun of a. State Championships together.                        CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!!!!!
  Leading the. charge were Lily Beattie ( Warwick Valley). and Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley,NY) with their.  12 Foot Blasts  on their. BIGGEST POLES of the YEAR!!!   Lily used. her 14'1" x 175  from 8 steps for her massive. 16  competitive. jumps to place. 3rd place medal...and. Freshman  Rachel Venter moved up to her. 12' 7 x 150 for her double PR day from her. 7 step. Everyone. made. great adjustments  on each jump  in tough conditions.  The comeback of the year belongs. to Washingtonville,NY. senior...Sophie Mirecki.....coming back from a 3 month injury this spring..to sail 11' 6" for 7th place. for the Bryant University  signee Coached. by Stephanie Duffy.
   Placing 10th. was. Clarkstown South,NY. senior... Madison Chalfin ..with her. 11' 3" PR. and = School Record. for the UCONN  signee next year.    New York City PSAL Champion...Grace Zagoria)Bronx Science,NY) was. the Top  Junior in the meet. with her. 11' 0" on her New Essx Poles... Kailing Zhu(Valhalla) Capped off a sensational  year at 8' 6". and Siri Walsh(New Paltz,NY)  vaulted. 8' 6" on bruised rigs. the last 3 weeks of the season for Coach Ann Gregory.
  In the  afternoon Boys Championships... St.Anthony's  senior. Nick Lourenco was. sizzling. with coach Jim Henderson coaching him up to 16' 7.5". for a New Meet Record...and heading to Circus. Pole Vault Festival on July 8-9 in the BarnYard.  Placing 10th. was. Sam Buckler(Kingston) 12' 6"....14th-Max Dicker(Bronxville). 11' 6".  and Harrison Hayward(Hackley Prep) at 10' 6".

                                           THANK YOU VAULTERS and FAMILIES for Representing FLYING CIRCUS ALL YEAR !                                           *****************************************************************************************************
        CIRCUS ACTION CONTINUES...............        June  17-19.  New Balance Nationals.  @ UPENN       June 22....... Circus Meet #2.  in Warwick,NY       June 29......  Circus Meet #3   in Warwick,NY       July 8-9.....  "The Pole Vault Meet of the Year... FLYING CIRCUS FESTIVAL.  (Register at. hvflyingcircus.com)

posts.Title: 17 FLYING CIRCUS VAULTERS to NEW BALANCE NATIONALS !!!! 4 New Jersey STATE GROUP CHAMPIONS !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy, LLC    A Private Pole Vault Club    Warwick Valley,  New York.   


  CONGRATULATIONS. to our 17 Boys and Girls Pole Vault Flyers who  have been invited to the New Balance National Pole Vault Finals this weekend  at UPENN's Historic Franklin Field in Philadelphia.    .... there's more. than just. hay in that old barn.......


  NEW JERSEY GROUP CHAMPIONSHIPS 

Rachel Mason(High Point)....Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills) ...Nate  Park(NV-Old Tappan). and Alexa Cawood(Holy Angels)  are NOW ~~~~~ STATE GROUP CHAMPIONS in POLE VAULT !!!!!   It's. a title. like. no other. and it lasts. a lifetime.......  Hard Work was the. answer to the puzzle.
Group 4-----(Large School)  Girls---- 3-Talia Hutchinson(Ridgewood)... 11' 0"  Boys---  5-Luke Gnospelius(Ridgewood)... 14' 0".  Scott Anderson(Hunterdon Central..13' 0"Group 3-------Girls---- Katie Klein(NV-Old Tappan)... 10' 0"Boys---  1-Nate Park(NV-Old Tappan) .. 13' 6"  5-Ian Kearney(Northern Highlands) 13' 0"PR   8-Caleb Park(NV0Old Tappan)  12' 6"

 Group 1-------  Boys---    5-Brady Bonser(Wallkill Valley).... 11' 0"PR
 Non Public. A ----  Girls---   1-Alexa Cawood(Holy Angels).  10'

Lending a helping hand is inspiring.     *  CIRCUS VOLUNTEERS provide. the fuel to move our little. club forward in every  Barn Meet...Barn Clinic...Barn Camp.   and Barn practice. session and at every Barn Travel Meet Tour.   "VOLUNTEERS MOVE-the-WORLD".  Thank you All.

posts.Title: New Balance  NATIONALS.......   " A  Field~of~ Dreams "
posts.Content:
The FLYING CIRCUS     A Private Pole Vault Group

It's hard to explain the inner drive of humans... but at the  four day extravaganza called the New Balance Nationals.... at Historic Franklin Field at UPENN.... it was  a joy to be a part of..  The.  show. was.  all about the ' Magic of  the human spirit "....as. 4, 000+ athletes. from all over the.  USA ... gathered together for friendship...spirit... and fun. It's. hard. to explain. the. energy supplied by athletes.. meet producers,,Tim Fulton,Rita Finkel..Jonathan Schindel,Lex Mercado,Aaron Robinson and parents supporting their kids.   YES ~~~. it was. a. "Field~of~Dreams" at. NEW BALANCE NATIONALS.....  THANK YOU ALL !!!!! 
     

FLYING CIRCUS FIREWORKS ~. 11 ALL-AMERICANS !!!!!!            The Flying Circus competed. 16  strong and. determined. athletes..... are came away. with 11 ALL-AMERICANS.  It was. exciting to just be in the meet with the nations Best of the Best....... measuring up to the best within us was. the only goal of the meet. MISSION ACCOMPLISHED
  LILY BEATTIE (Warwick Valley,NY)  Placed 3rd in Girls Championship Pole Vault started the team energy  with unbelievable will to get to her biggest pole. ever.  Using her. 14' 1" x. 175 ESSX RECOIL. from her 8 step.. this. powerful. Sophomore out of Coach Mike Potter's. Purple Wave T.C. flew to  a  15' 5.5" PR with first jump dedication  all day long. She. was. very close. at 12' 8' bar in very tough conditions.  She later.  ripped.  a. sizzling. 200 meter leg of her SMR!!!
 

TATUM NORRIS (Susquehanna,PA) Won her  first NATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP in her Rising Stars  Pole Vault event... with her big air  at 12' 1.5" for the gold. and close at 12' 5" bar for the. speedy junior sprinter. Tatum used. her biggest pole. (13' 1 x 165) and. 12' 11'grip!!!  Tatum placed. 6th in 100m(12:06). and 9th in 200m (25.25)  This PA State Champion at 100m and 200m. this year will fly at Circus Summer Festival on July 9 in Warwick. Also soaring in Rising Stars. was Pompton Lakes,NJ. senior Gymnastic. star..Emma Keating...as. she flew. 11' 11'75 " for the. silver medal All-American , coached by dad and former PV  legend,,Steve Keating!!! She also had strong jumps. at  her PR 12' 1.5" !!! Emma won the NJ State title. the next day ..just 90 miles away. at 12' 0"!!!!  High Point,NJ. senior self-made champion...Rachel Mason placed  4th. at 11' 7.75" and poole took of. her 11' 11.75 bar. Also Ready-t0-jump was Pine Bush,NY Sophomore jump start..Ella Galloway..with her. 11' 3.75 clear for 10th.  and Ellison Weiner(Weston ,CT State Champion). at 11' 3.75" for 11th.  Bronx Science,NY. powerful junior..Grace  Zagoria is perhaps our most improved. vaulter this year among the 87  Vault Crew training in the Hay-Loft... soared. on her new Big Poles (13' 1 x 160) to 11'0" for 13 th  followed. by Julia Lazo(Crestwood,PA) 10' 6".  Maia Perillo)John Jay,NY) 10' 0". and Madison Chalfin(West Nyack,NY). at 10' 0". 
 RACHEL VENTER (Warwick Valley,NY) won her first NATIONAL  POLE VAULT CHAMPIONSHIP in the Girls Freshman Meet with her fast  and consistent approach run. and Super Plant mechanics with a flyover at 11' 6.5" and close jumps at 12' 1.5" on her biggest poles of the year!! Rachel will be at Circus Camp and Circus Festival the next 3 weeks!!!  Also producing. was. Madeline Magliaro(Trinity School.NYC)..the Ivy League Champion this year , coached by Bob Sorensen, with her 10' 0" clear and backed up with her 11' 0"PR this season.
 

FRESHMAN BOYS CHAMPIONSHIPS.... MATT HERBERT  & OWEN KEATING ---ALL-AMERICANS !!!!!!  Our Freshman Boys refused. to let windy conditions. alter the mind set... Short Hills ,NJ Freshman star..MattHerbert flew. to a 2nd place finish.  with his 11' 7.75" Sail Over, coached. by Will Nesbitt.former. Short Hills,NJ State Champion!!!  Placing 3rd. was first year vaulter...Freshman Owen Keating of Pompton Lakes,NJ. with his. solid. 11' 7.75 bar as both near missed. at 12' 1/5"!! Bot  boys are  entered in  Circus Summer camp and Festival Meet!!!
 

STEVE DITELBERG(Fairfield Ludlow,CT).... This. senior Connecticut Indoor and Outdoor Champion from Fairfield Ludlow flew. to his All-American 6th place finish with  his 14' 5,25" Fly for the Emory University signee  and finally on his bigger poles.  Sawyer Garret(Mass-Patriot PV). flew. big over 14' 9" PR and  is heading to Barn Festival. andplaced. 3rd in Rising Stars.
 

BOYS CHAMPIONSHIP~~~. It was Justin Rogers(Hersey,PA) taking the gold. at 16' 8.75 "  for  VaultWork PV  club coached. by Matt Concannon....Placing 3rd. was.  Jack Vecellio, the MASS State  Champion and All Time. #1 PV King. at 16' .75 " and Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills,NJ) 14' 3"...following. his sensational. 16' 0"   NJ State Win just 24 hours before. Coached up . by  Ross Kohler. and heading to Northeastern University next fall.
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

 NEW JERSEY STATE MEET. (Saturday June 18).  Franklin,NJ
 

EMMA KEATING & MAX ZUCKERMAN. ...... Take~the~GOLD!!!!    Great Performances were all over the NJ State Meet  on Saturday in Franklin,NJ.. with  11 Flying Circus Vaulters  having fun.  Taking the Girls Gold Medal. was Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ). Just a junior...doubling back from her all american  vault. ay Nationals.. Emma. took the title. with first jump clear at 12' 0"  for the gymnastic. star with great speed... Placing 3rd. was. super star..Michelle Lee(NV-Demarest) at 11' 6", as she heads. to Columbia University next fall.  Talia Hutchinson(Ridgewood) flew 11; 6" for  4th place coached by tTm Wilson ... Rachel Mason(High Point) placed  5th at 11' 6" for the UCONN Bound. star.... Chloe Pasek(West Milford) placed 11th in state. at 10' 0" and Katie Klein(Old Tappan)  finished at 9' 0" in head wind conditions.   Max Zuckerman(Pascack Hills,NJ) was the shining star of the Boys meet into heavy wind. as her won the. meet at 16' 0" and close bar at 16' 5". It markes. his consistent journey this year. with his. 22nd. meet over 15 barrier., coached. by Ross Kohler. Luke Gnospelius(Ridgewood).  place 5th at  14' 0".  Ian Kearney Placed 10th at 12' 6". Caleb Park(Old Tappan). 12' 0"... Nate Park)Old Tappan). 12' 0" rounded our. the Circus Crew.

June 29...Summer Circus #3. 4:30pm at the Barn.. $40 entry at Site Only.  Friday & Saturday....CIRCUS SUMMER FESTIVAL. at the Barn...  $85 Pre-Entry. at hvflyingcircus.com. posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS. CAMP #1...AWESOME SUCCESS!!! On to Camp #2 & FESTIVAL !!!!
posts.Content:
CONGRATULATIONS   to   CAMPERS. and STAFF. @ CIRCUS CAMP #1

Camp #1 was AWESOME !!!!   The 40 dedicated. and  extremely coachable. athletes soaked in the  instruction  of 10 teaching professional  pole vault coaches  both days  and BIG IMPROVEMENTS and BIG KNOWLEDGE were that goals of. the camp.  MISSION ACCOMPLISED.  Lectures...Run postures....Clawing mechanics...Drills...Charts... Booklets...Stories....Watermellon...Vault Exibition..Apparatus....FUN!

THANK YOU PARENTS. and ATHLETES.

posts.Title: CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL.....PRE-VIEW ~~~ JOIN-the-FUN !!!!!
posts.Content:
The HV FLYING CIRCUS 2022 Pole Vault Festival. Preview July 8-9 2022


    Wanta' see  "humans fly" ??????      ....just. stop by the Vault Barn in Warwick,New York. this weekend. and. enjoy the spirit. and. energy of over 80  daring pole vaulters of all ages  defy gravity together.        YES...  the 22nd  edition of  the Flying Circus  Pole Vault Festival Meet. will be. filled. with fun for the whole family.... Bring your lawn chair and cooler of. drinks and be a part of our Pole Vault Celebration.  Full schedule for this. two day meet (8 separate Divisions) and  top entries highlighted. below.     Free Parking...Free lively Music.....Free Story Telling !!!!!!


  Friday..July 8.....

The Warm Up begins on Friday morning at 9:01am  for  our future   vault stars Middle School Division for both Boys and girls.  Top seed in the  MS Boys  is   hometown hero 8th grader, Luke Beattie(Warwick,NY) with is sensational 13' 0"   vault this  spring for the Purple Wave of Warwick Valley. The Girls Middle School top seed  is Kate Anderson  of  Monroe MiddleSchool,NY and Flying Circus.  The High School Freshman meet warm up begins  at 11:01am for the Boys and Girl 12 noon start time. Leading the Boys  are  two NB Nationals All Americans  this  year... Matt Herbert(Shore Hills,NJ)  at 13' 0"   and Owen Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ)  at 12' 6"  this  spring. Anthony Roe (Warwick Valley,NY) is seeded  third  at 11' 1" for the Circus.  The Girls Freshman is loaded with 10 of the best girls in the East. Leading top seed is  NB National Champion..Rachel Venter  of Warwick Valley,NY  at 12' 0".. followed  by National Ninja Warrior Champion...Jordan Carr(Joel Barlow,CT)  at 11' 6"  and   Madeline Magliaro(Trinity School,NY) 10' 8" Ivy League Champion this year.    The Sophomore Boys and Girls warm up at 1:30pm  for their  2:31pm Start time....  leading the girls section  will be  Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY)..the Multi-Event champion from the Purple Wave...with her  All-American. 12' 8" performance this. spring on BIG POLES. Pine Bush,NY Sprint/vault star..Ella Galloway continues. to soar at 11' 8"PR. and John Jay,NY  Rock Climbing Champion ..Maia Perillo is third. seed. at 11' 0".  The. Masters Division kicks off  warm up at 4:31pm for their  5"01 start time..  with Top Seed and Last year's winner..John Mraz (Edison,NJ) top seed   at 12' 1.5". and William Russel(Leonia,NJ) in hot pursuit....            VOLUNTEERS  for helping with scoring..Pit standards..PR Bell Ringing...Awards... are greatly appreciated. both days.. T-Shirt REWARD!!!!!


Saturday. July 9...Preview

IF Rain.. all  Division move inside at Barn on a rolling schedule .    Warn Up for the Boys & Girls HS Junior  Meet will be.  at 9:01pm for their. 10: 01 Start time.  Top Boy seed.  is fast improving Ian Kearney(North Highlands,NJ). with his. 14' 0" sail this year and Coached. by Dane Sorensen at Circus. Matt Aono(Ridgewood,NJ) also at 14' 0"... Lucas Williams(Ridgefield,CT) at 13' 6" and Matt Lourenco(Bayshore ,NY) will push hard. for. the cold JOE TEA  in the. 12 man field. The HS Junior Girlks will feature.  two of this year Flying Circus All American  Champions.... Tatum Norris(Susquehanna,PA) at 12' 4" (also 2  time PA State sprint champion(12.08/ 24.94) and Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ) perhaps.  the most improved vaulter in the Northeast this spring  at 12' 4" and both pushing onto  the 13' barrier.  Connecticut Indoor. and Outdoor State Champion..Ellison Weiner(Weston,CT) will not be left behind. at 12' 0" is third seed.       The HS Senior Section warms up at 11:31 for their  12:01 Start time...  This section features. a shootout  from  two great kids over 17'  bar this season... Jack Vecellio(Gill,MASS).  2 time National Indoor Champion ,with 17' 1.5"PR and State all time record. and Nick Lourenco(Bayshore,NY).All American and NY State Champion. at 17' 0" will have the crowd breathless...   Luke Gnospelius of Ridgewood,NY. at 15' 1.5"..all time school record coached. by Tim Wilson... Connecticut Indoor/Outdoor state champ..Steve Ditelberg(Fairfield,CT)  is close chasing. at 14' 11" PR... Sawyer Garret(Sherborn,MASS) at 14' 9"(NB All American)...Harrison Hayward(Bedford  Corners,NY) has. a 14' 6' PR. The HS Senior Girls will feature. Rachel Mason(High Point,NJ) with her. 12' 1.5".  PR for.  our UCONN Signee.  and Madison Chalfin(West Nyack,NY). at 11' 3" for the UCONN signee for next fall.


   BRING ON THE COLLEGE/OPEN  VAULT STARS....        The BIG BOS. and BIG GIRLS. warm Up following the HS B & G  meet..   At 2:01pm warm up for their. 3:01pm start time  College/Open WomenWomen are lead by top seeded.. Sydney Shannon of Clifton,NJ) at 11' 5.75:  and Jamie Rossig(Montvale,NJ). at  11' 4.25: for the former  Pascack Hills star...Jules Gravier(Bronxville,NY).  comes in at 11' 1" seed.... at approx 5:01-5:31pm. as the meet. starts. at approx  5:31-6:01pm time slot. Top seed. is All American Dane Sorensen  of Cortland University. and Flying Circus Coaching Staff... at 16' 7" PR and ready to fly... Calvin Gould(Ridgewood,NJ).  comes in with his. 15' 1"PR..Aidan O'Connor(Burlington,CT) 15' 1".... Shaun Herlihy(Old Tappan.NJ) 14' 11"PR.  ..Owen Fogarty(Verona,NJ). at 14' 7.25"....Robert Kalinowski(Farmingdale,NY) 14' 6' are ready to mix it up in the BarnYard.


        THANKS TO YOU...It's. going. to be EXCITING DAY TOGETHER. !!!!!        JOE TEA .... Each athlete in the meet will be blessed. with. a. 20 oz Bottle  of JOE TEA. as they leave the  thirsty competition. with the DRINK od CHAMPIONS !!!!!!!!!!!!!


    Registration. still open. till Friday Night.......Midnight........ JOIN THE PARTY!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS FESTIVAL WEEK = FAMILY FUN in the SUN!!!
posts.Content:
The  Flying Circus, LLC  Warwick Valley, NY


 "CIRCUS POLE VAULT WEEK" .... Recap  ***********************************  It's billed as ...."A Week of  Pole Vaulting". and the. seven day shenanigans  were full of stories...friendships.  and new faces.  They came. to the Circus Barnyard. from. nine. different. states... all ages. and all carrying. their dreams  in their pole vault bags.    It started on July 2-6.  at the 27th Circus Pole Vault camps.....83 Athletes strong. and. 14 professional pole vault coaches lending. a. teaching hand to the future. flying stars. It was  filled. with. spirit and motivation...and. ended.  with  a pole vault. exhibition of. 17'0" by Dane Sorensen and Louie Martinez.... at 'Watermelon Time".


 The. 20th Flying Circus Pole Vault Festival was up next on this rolling pole vault week...  with 90 flexible athletes. entered(80 competed). for the. coveted  prize of an  Iced-Cold 20 oz. Bottle of Refreshing JOE TEA (the Official Drink of Pole Vault Champions)Yes... The dedicated MileSplit NY. editor,Kyle Brazeil. and Historian MileSplitCT editor,Perry King  had. all the promotion and stats you could. ever image for. the family crowd of Pole Vault "Nuts". Lively music filled. the. air for the dancers. and. a great time was had by all.


   THANK YOU .....promoters...club coaches... athletes... parents...meet volunteers.....donors ... clean up crews. and Olympians on site for the motivation.....   YES---CIRCUS POLE VAULT WEEK. WAS FUN TOGETHER.


   Full Results will be. forthcoming this week....(with  interviews)...compliments. of Kyle Brazeil..Perry King. and. Julie Christian. Early meet results. at hvflyingcircus.com. 


        ENJOY  a  SUMMER FILLED WITH REST and FAMILY .   THANK YOU ALL.

posts.Title: CIRCUS ATHLETES TRAINING ....... Summer Fitness Cycle #2 Coming...... VAULTERS GAINING SPEED and STRENGTH !!!!!
posts.Content:
FLYING CIRCUS.......Preparing~for~FALL POLE VAULTING.   


  JOIN THE SUMMER FITNESS CYCLE TEAM.........  as. we approach Cycle # 2  together on Monday, August 1.  The feedback. has been sensational in Cycle #1 from over 40 vaulters.  IT WILL PAY OFF with INCREASED HORSEPOWER and POSTURE this fall season.  Cycle #2. has added  phases of  reps...sets..times..and recovery. You should already feel gains. of power and speed from the first 21 day cycle #1.     The KEY to this Fitness is  CONSISTENCY.  Try to be as consistent as you can be...... stay motivated EVERYDAY to become stronger..faster and more. fit.  Your pole vaulting will take off like a rocket. this fall and winter.  NOW..is the. time. to prepare yourself for the. BIG JUMP.   Don't. wait a single day.    .... just remember... there are 24 hours in each day....                               .... you sleep 8 hours each day.... that leaves. 16 hours left in each day.....  this. Cycle #2. takes only 1 hour each day.... that leaves. 15 hours in each day for. you.!!!!!


        LET YOUR COMPETITION  REST and LAY on the BEACH. this. summer.........   TAKE CHARGE of your. athletic career.......Just 1 hour of the day.     


     " OFF~the`GRID TRAINING"........... Be smart......... Train NOW........Write your workouts in your Notebook.   REFUSE to CRACK...... 


       BIG VAULTS are a result of smart, intelligent and consistent training routines.
          "CHAMPIONS are MADE...when ..NOBODY is watching."..........................     Coach St.

Our season at Flying Circus began  with  our "Homecoming Ice-Breakers " Pre-Season meet this week,  as. 32 athletes... and 16 Meet volunteers joined in the. celebration of  'Human Flying' in the. cozy old Vault Barn at The Warwick Center.  The Boys  and Girls....  were exciting to watch,  as 20 Personal Bests were in the. air...along with some great spirit of supporting each other all day.   YES ~~~~. FLYING CIRCUS in now in session !

Leading the TOP SOPH. was  Matt Herbert(Newark Academy,NJ).  at 13' 4" PR  for Coach Will Nesbitt.    5 Personal Bests  raddled the rafters!!!!  Meet Volunteers. were Coach Sorensen,Ella Galloway,Rachel Venter and Hannah Cann.  Thank you All.  (Full Results Below)

Top Soph Award went. to Rachel Venter(Warwick,NY). with. 11' 7" make before bar  injury  sidelined. her.. and   Junior Hannah Cann(Warwick,NY) produced 4 Personal Bests to clear 11' 7" for the Purple Wave. and. a new T-Shirt !!! posts.Title: CIRCUS POLE VAULT CHECKLIST for Winter #1 Athletes~~~
posts.Content:
Dear Flying Circus Vaulters in WINTER #!1 TRAINING~~~

We are all ready for your  7 weeks of Pole Vault instruction this coming week.  Here are some important checklist reminders. 

* First-week Action Begins Sunday, Nov. 6. 1 pm-2:30 pm class of 16 athletes and continues Monday thru Thursday with our other groups. 

* Each Athlete.  should plan to arrive. 10 minutes EARLY,  as. we. start and. stop each class on the clock.  There are no. spectators, and friends allowed in the training sessions.  There will be some visiting HS Coaches permitted in sessions. 

*  Athletes. should.  come dressed. for activity... with sweat pants, sweatshirts, leg compression socks, spikes, and a water bottle.  Dress like an ELITE ATHLETE. 
 

* Athletes must bring a small notebook/pen ..to record all steps... poles... handgrips for all 4-5-6-7-8 step jumping.  This is MOST VALUABLE for your  SUCCESS.   

* Barn Will be CLOSED on Sunday, Nov. 13. for our athletes to participate in the Armory Track Camp in New York City.   

*  A Missed. class is not made up,....  try. to be. consistent with your scheduled class.  Athletes. can not switch to other classes..as. we. are packed. tightly in every class.  A class was canceled. due. to weather. will be made up.           FLYING CIRCUS WINTER CLUBS.... 97 VAULTERS STRONG!!!!!!!

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS VAULT NEWS ... Plus ..CIRCUS MEET LINK !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus,LLC    "Home ~of~the~FLYERS"


GREAT TEAMS...   
                     
* Win Together ...                   
* Love Together ....                   
* Rally Together .....                   
* Prepare Together ...                   
* Stay Focused Together ...                   
* Minimize Drama Together ...                   
* Celebrate Success Together ...                   
* Overcome Challenges Together ...               
 GREAT TEAMS HAVE GREAT ... TEAMMATES!
    
It's already the middle of November.....and the Vault Prep Phase has taken off. Congratulations to all our Circus Club members in Winter#1 training and to all our athletes taking part in yesterday's Armory Track Camp.    Somehow.... our Winter Club of 93 young and aspiring athletes produced a super first week together in our Foundation Drill Program. Breaking the vault down into these small parts is the only way to learn our complex event.   Keep the focus on the small drills... in the warm up phase.... the apparatus and small run vaulting stage as we go forward.  Remember~~~ SMALL DRILLS = GIANT VAULTS.
   

Thank You to Coach Rob Pasek and all our families taking part in our Circus Apparel Fundraiser that ended on Friday. Proceeds will be applied to our next ESSX Pole Order this Friday. Now is the time to order your NEW ESSX POLES for the indoor season. SAVE on SHIPPING COSTS by ordering by Friday with Coach Bob Sorensen at bsoren29@optonline.net   Many Thanks in advance.   

Here is the Sign Up Link for our Holiday Pole Vault Classic Meets in the famous Circus Vault Barn on December 27,28,29. Find. your ability group meet and SIGN UP for the FUN with US.  https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10C0D4FABAC28A7FEC07-circus 

Compression Socks SAVE the LEGS in POLE VAULT.  * The two things in life you have total control over...are

posts.Title: 15th MILLROSE GAMES ~~~ POLE VAULT EXCITEMENT AGAIN !!!!
posts.Content:
This 115th edition of the ' world's most famous' Indoor  Track & Field. the extravaganza will again be present. the. finest pole vaulters and pole vault coaches on the planet. Meet Director Ray Flynn and Armory Directors Rita Finkel and Jonathan Schindel have lifted. the pole vault development with our Pro Women's Vault Event ...and the up-and-coming young Jr. Boys and Girls events again on the. exciting program.  The Millrose Games pole vault rich tradition is unmatched and this year's" field of flyers" is the best in the world in all three separate pole vault events.  Get your tickets now and be a part of the MILLROSE POLE VAULT MAGIC.


  WOMEN'S ELITE POLE VAULT will be in prime time..Saturday, February 11 on national TV. beginning at 4:oopm EST  with the 2020 Olympic Champion..Katie Nageotte(USA). and Olympic Silver medal champion...Sandi Morris(USA) is scheduled to produce fireworks all night....   and the.  world famous  VAULTING TWINS...Hanna Moll (World Jr.Champion last year) and Amanda Moll(Olympia, WASH) taking the. the stage for some Jr.Pole Vault history.. The Moll sisters are coached. by the one and only Tim Reilly of the NorthWest Pole Vault Club.


  THE JR. BOYS POLE VAULT EVENT will take place.  at 11:45 AM on Saturday, February 11... with the  3 BEST RETURNING Jr. BOYS in the USA!!!!Leading this young group of fiberglass strongmen is Maddox Hamm of Scottsboro, Alabama, and Peah Athletes coached by Chris Spear. Maddox. has. a personal best of 18' 1" and could challenge. the Jr.Millrose record(Mondo Duplantis 18'10.5"). Wyatt Stewart(Richmond, Kentucky-Kazian PV Club) enters. with 17' 7" PR coached by Chris Stewart and Monte Orchard. Returning. from a Runner Up last year is the Best in TEXAS...Ryley Klefsted(Coached by Brad MacFarling-MAC ACADEMY Pole Vault) with his 17' 3" personal best. Top Junior is Collin  Pate(Hoover, Alabama) and Peak Athletes PV Club. with. 16' 4" PR.  and Joey Marlow(Woodlands, Texas) and Brian O'Sullivan(Hillsborough, NJ) and The Vault Factory coached. by Carl Parambo at 16' 3" pre-season bests.


  THE JR. GIRLS POLE VAULT EVENT is loaded with Regional Champions. and takes place on Thursday Evening(February 9) at the Armory,. along with the Jr and Open Weight Throw. events. at 5:00 pm sharp.  The 14 flying Jr. Girls. are the future vault champions in our pole vault.   event.   They all range. from. 12' 3". to. 13' 7" and the friendships will be. forever.  The top seed is Veronica Vacca(PA) at 13' 7". from the powerful Philly Jumps Club, coached. by former vault champion  Brian Modschein.  She will also have her four teammates soaring with her. Madelyn Kelley, Kristin Hoffman,Katie Urbine, and Sophie Hill Joining in the fun.. Two great vaulters are confirmed. from San Shipley's Vault Lab Club of Maryland...with juniors Ava Allen and Elisa Ramos competing for their first time at Millrose.  Susquehanna Community,PA.  double state sprint champion..Tatum Norris will represent. HV Flying Circus Pole Vault Academy...along with Lily Beattie,

Emma Keating, Rachel Venter, Ella Galloway, and Ellison Weiner.   Fast improving Amelia McBain(Saratoga Springs PV Club) will also add the. New York flavor. to the. event.                GET YOUR TICKETS NOW... IT WILL BE SOLD OUT AGAIN                  POLE VAULT LIVES.  @. THE MILLROSE GAMES!!!!!!!

Images by by JODANI Photography & Wells Sports Photos

posts.Title: TATUM NORRIS SIGNS @ BINGHAMTON UNIVERSITY !!!!
posts.Content:
Dear Circus Vaulters and Families ~~~~~

It's. official now... Susquehanna Community.PA... Super senior...TATUM NORRIS will be taking her academics. and athletics. to Binghamton University next fall. with Coach Mike Thompson.

Tatum Norris... the 2022 PA STATE OUTDOOR CHAMPION in both the. 100m(12.17). and 200 m(24.95). and NB NATIONAL EMERGING POLE VAULT CHAMPION can now. enjoy the rest of her. senior year.

Tatum will be. studying Nursing and. will handle the. sprints. and pole vault for the Bobcats. She will be coached. by one of the very best elite pole vault coaches in the USA in Head Coach Mike Thompson. This Honor student has. shown great leadership qualities here at Flying Circus and. at Susquehanna Community Schools and she has left BIG FOOTPRINTS of the work ethic and humbleness necessary to be called. a CHAMPION.
Tatum has been invited. to. compete in The 115th Millrose Games Jr. Girls Pole Vault Event on Thursday. February 9 at the Armory. Join her. for. the Flying Action.

posts.Title: Flying Circus News Report..... MEETS are COMING!!!!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
Dear Circus Vaulters......               

Just 2 more weeks. and. we are off to the races !!!!!    You are all ready to take it  up.....  may your final two weeks are filled. with confidence. and final grips.. pole runs.  Record. all start marks. in notebooks for. 6- 7- 8 step approaches. this week.       



* Compression. socks in practice and in meets help. with stabilization of the athlete on the runway and take-off.  and prevents shin injury. ..Also increases circulation for a faster recovery phase.  be smart in this pole vault game.

*Sign Up Link for registration in our  Circus Holiday Meets (December 27-28-29). in the Barn are on our website (www,hvflyingcircus.com).  You will jump high in your own training facility.. Sign Up Today!!!!

        * Winter #1  Vault Training Package. ends on December 22.  Winter #2 Training Package. begins on January 2. We will miss the 16 athletes leaving Winter #1. and. we will celebrate. the new. 16 athletes taking the Vault Barn by storm!!!!       


*  There is no class on Wednesday. December 21. The entire staff will be. at Armory Section 9 Classic. with 30 of our vaulters. Mark your calendar on the Barn Closed. that day. It will be made up in February.

    FLYING CIRCUS...."Vault -for-FUN"...and  .. the Results will Come.

posts.Title: CIRCUS WEEKEND...UP....UP. .... and AWAY !!! Lily Beattie. 12' 6".. Brian O'Sullivan 16' 5" Fly !!
posts.Content:
CIRCUS COMES OUT of CAVE TOGETHER ....      
51 Flying Circus Vaulters open the. season together.             
C~O~N~G~R~A~T~U~L~A~T~I~O~N~S             


 It is truly hard to explain the joy and happiness of watching young people. strive for excellence.  Such was the case in point. this past weekend in small energy packed.  arenas in our tri-state area.   with the spirit of love and peace surrendering us... all things. are possible this magical holiday season. Athletes coming together to help each other is the story we all seek.... and it shows in the positive vibes at each gathering.  You are more than just athletes in motion ..... you are. examples of the human spirit.   Keep. striving.


 * Friday Night @ The Armory.... Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley) started up the train with a sensational. 12' 6" launch for gold and had.  solid. bars. at  Kaeli Thompson's meet record at 13' 0". Ellison Weiner(Weston, Ct State Champ) also sizzled. over. 12' 0" for silver. and Pompton Lakes senior, Emma Keating sailed. 11' 6", along with Ella Galloway(Pine Bush) Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley, NY).  and Tatum Norris(Susquehanna, PA) all at 11' 6" and close bars. at 12' 0".   Making. the National Standard for the NIKE INDOOR NATIONALS also were Hannah Cann(Warwick Valley, NY and Maia Perillo(John Jay, NY). at 11' 0". Grace Zagoris(Bronx Science). and Olivia DeBellis(Suffern, NY) both sailed. 10' 6" for the Top 10 sweep. 

Dunmoor, PA junior. Maura Michalczyk won the. club section. at 10' 6" (Full results Below) Tatum Norris(Susquehanna, PA). ripped.   thru. a. win in her 55m Dash. with. 7.53 Blast for the Sabers !! 

The Boy's competition was. also magnificent.. as. senior Brian O'Sullivan(Hillsborough,NJ) set. a new meet record.  and personal best of 16' 5" and close bar at 16' 9" for the Jr.Millrose Games invitee from Vault Factory(USA#1).  RLuke Williams(Ridgefield, CT) flew double PR. with. his state-leading 14' 6" silver medal. and Fresh Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley, NY) equaled the NY State Freshman record. of. 13' 6" on his. 14' 1" x. 180 Essx!! Tyler Demarco (Old Tappan<NJ). Max Decker(Bronxville, NY) 13' 6' and Nate Park(Old Tappan, NJ).  13' 6". (Full Results Below) 

Special thanks. to  Bob Sorensen, Dane Sorensen,Will Nesbitt.  and Steve Keating. for helping all night at the pole vault pit management. and. to our Flying Circus Photo Specialist... Francesca Frasco.. who promoted. our. young vaulters. with her 200+ photos album.  (See her Photo Link Below. and send a thank you note).* Essex County Opener @ Ocean Breeze.... posts.Title: CIRCUS WEEKEND REPORT--MATT AONO 14' 0"... LILY BEATTIE & ELLA GALLOWAY Soar 12' 6" !!!!
posts.Content:
"TEAM SPIRIT is the MAGNET that draws people ....Include others."


Weekend Report~~~~ There was a ton of Pole Vault Team Spirit this past weekend in venues. across. the Tri-State. Athletes reaching for personal bests together is the goal @ Flying Circus. and a wave of positive spirit carries us all to our very best. Solid demonstrations of focus...toughness and supporting each other on stage and the power to achieve are here. CONGRATULATIONS on all~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Hispanic Games @ The Nike Track & Field Center at The Armory...Kicked off on Friday with Klaus Lindenau(Warwick Valley,NY) taking gold in the Freshman Pole Vault. at 10' 6"(Meet Record) with teammate Anthony Roe coaching him up. Leadership shines again. Taking the Sophomore Section was Minisink Valley,NY. Soph Logan Schupner at 11' 6" for Coach Beck's team.

The Boys' Varsity was loaded with 35 vaulters on Saturday Morning and Circus Man..Matt Aono(Ridgewood,NJ) flew to the. a win for Coach Tim Wilson at 14' 0". Lucas Williams(Ridgefield,CT) hit 13' 6'. Derek Amlicke(Staples,CT) 13' 6'...Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley). 13' 0:" >>Liam O'Meara(Ridgewood) 12' 0". Anthony Roe(Warwick) 11' 0" for Coach Potter.

The Girls' Varsity was like a state meet atmosphere... as Warwick Valley,NY, junior Lily Beattie. flew. 12' 6" again and close bars at meet record 13' 0" on her. 14' 1" x 180 ESSX!!! Tatum Norris had sensational Triple Events.. with Pole Vault Silver. at 12' 0"... 55m Dash 6th place... 7.17 =PR. and 25.60 7th place in her opening 200m dash of the season. Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ) was third. with big air at 11' 6'.. Sophomore Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley) flew 11' 0". Grace Zagoria(Bronx Science,NY) 11' 0" and 27.14/200 legPR... Talia Hutchinson(Ridgewood) 10' 6' Hannah Cann(Warwick Valley) 10' 6" Maddie Magliaro(Trinty,NY) 10' 6"...Maia Perillo(John Jay) 10' 0"... Lilliana DeFelice(Cornwall). 9' 0"... Sadie Steiner(Cornwall). 6' 0". Action continues. at The Nike Armory next Friday Night at Steve Borbet Classic.

Freedom Games @ Ocean Breeze,NY ~~~~~ Pine Bush,NY. sprinter/jumper...Ella Galloway set a new. school indoor record in placing second in the invitational pole vault... with her 12' 6' and solid jumps at 13' 0" for Coach Stephanie Duffy. Teammate Averie Klein(PB) made 9' 0" for the Lady Bushmen. Logan Schupner(Minisink Valley) sophomore. hit 11' 6". and Declan Kelly(Nanuet). went 11' 6". for the Golden Knights. Luke Kotsides(Rondout Valley) cleared 10' 0".

RCC Action this week in Suffern,NY.. saw Aaron Bell of Sleepy Hallow,NY) take. gold. at 10' 0" in Dendy Games #1. and Kate Dowling(Pearl River) won the girls at 7' 6'. Reily Craig(PR) placed at 6' 0" for the Lady Pirates. In Dendy Games #3... Suffern,NY senior Olivia DeBellis set a new school indoor record at 10' 7' breaking Caitlin Cross's. record. by an inch for Coach Borczyk. Todd Korman(Suffern) set a new PR. at 12' 1" for the Mountie Boys.

Section 1 - League @ Nike Armory~~~~~ Jonah Smith (Valhalla,NY) led a sweep in the vault. with his 10' 6" gold and Charles Nasshar(Val) placed at 7' 0" for Coach Sonya Graves.

BUS TRAVEL GUIDELINES for Track & Field Athletes.


1. Always remember... it is a special privilege to travel and represent. your SCHOOL and. your TRACK & FIELD TEAM. and. Your FAMILY.
2. CONSERVE YOUR ENERGY and FOCUS on YOUR COMPETITION. Many High School athletes leave their best performances ON THE BUS. DO NOT SHOW OFF by seeking attention with LOUD and RUDE BEHAVIOR. Your actions. and language should reflect your character and your family values.
3. LEADERSHIP should be modeled by the UPPER-CLASSMEN ALWAYS.
4. ACT LIKE A CHAMPION ON THE BUS and ON THE TRACK! Be POLITE and SHOW RESPECT.
5. DO NOT BOARD the BUS without the Coach before. or after the meet. Do NOT board another school bus at any time.
6. STAY SEATED at ALL TIMES while the Bus is in motion. When unloading the bus..use the front door only.
7. CLEAN YOUR AREA following all trips...LET'S LEAVE the BUS CLEANER BEFORE.
8. ALWAYS let the Bus Driver know you appreciate him/her for taking you to and from the meet. Always thank you to the Bus Driver. IT MAKES A DIFFERENCE.
9. TAKE PRIDE IN YOUR BEHAVIOR. SHOW THAT YOU ARE A CLASS ACT IN EVERY SITUATION.

posts.Title: "CIRCUS ROUND~UP"... BEATTIE...BEATTIE...NORRIS FLY !!!!
posts.Content:
Freshman...LUKE BEATTIE(Warwick Valley, NY) Sets. New State Frosh All~Time Record at 14' 0" in Pole Vault.


  It was. a.  super fun night. at The Nike Track & Field Center at The Armory on Friday night... with a packed house of  Pole Vault  "Nuts" enjoying the screaming and clapping encouragement on the runways.  and oval from the 20+ Flying Circus acrobats.Here is some of the scoop...Steve Borbet Invite (January 13)************************************* 

*The night kicked off with Susquehanna Community, PA. sprinter Tatum Norris cranking a. 7.21 win in the 55m dash... a new PR without blocks !!!! 

* Next up. was. the Girls Loaded. Pole Vault... with Circus teammates taking the first 8 spots. Leading the way. was Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) with 12' 0" gold.  and Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ). 12'0" silver.  Next came Warwick Valley, NY) junior  Hannah Cann with her 11' 6"PR . Weston,CT. state champ..Ellison Weiner. flew. 11' 6" for Coach Medve. and Warwick Valley, NY. Sophomore. Rachel Venter went Big over 11' 0". from her 8-step return.` Sophomore.  star Maddie Magliaro(Trinity, NYC) was solid. at 10' 0". ..Lillianna DeFelice (Cornwall).8' 0".. Isabella Centeno(Cornwall). was solid.   Taking the. gold medal in the club section.. was in Dunmore,PA. sensation...Maura  Michalczyk at 10' 0" for the Circus. 

* Here come. the Boys. Pole Vault.ers... with Freshman Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley, NY) blasting a. NEW  NEW YORK STATE All~Time  Freshman record. of 14' 0" !!!  On his. 14' 7"  x 175 ESSX RECOIL. and a  Nike Nationals qualifier!!!  Derek Amlicke(Staples,CT). took Gold. at 14' 0"... Lucas Williams (Ridgefield,CT). 14' 0". Ian Kearney(North Highlands,NJ) 13' 6"...Sergio Talamo(Massapequa,NY)  11' 0"..Anthony Roe(Warwick Valley, NY). solid. bars. at 11' 0". 

*Final. fun. came in the Girls 200m Dash...  with Binghamton University signee...Tatum Norris blasting the opening curve in Lane 5 and. showing her strength in the. final 50 meters. for the win in 25.60 for the SABERS of Susquehanna Community Track & Field. *. Now. Back to a Training Block. for 2 weeks-----                 

CONGRATULATIONS ALL !!!

posts.Title: FLYIN' FUN..... TOGETHER !!!!!
posts.Content:
It was an AMAZIN' WEEK of Flying Energy all around the Northeast Section in Pole Vault Country.  CONGRATULATIONS to athletes for supporting each other with positive energy and kindness at every meeting. 

The weekend was filled. with personal bests...  high spirits...school records....  new grips...new poles... longer runs... new friendships. and a greater appreciation of the joys of participating in athletics.  The photo above are the. " 2023   MILLROSE  Jr. GIRLS  of POLE VAULT " ... sharing a. wonderful night of flying and togetherness with  2016 Olympic Pole Vault Champion...Katerina Stefanidi (Greece) and with their Pole Vault  Officials backing up there efforts all night long.  It's. always. exciting watching kids taking up the challenges.  (Professional Photo~ John Nepolitan)

Millrose Jr.Girls-(Feb 9)----Veronica Vacca(Flourtown, PA)  put on a show from Philly Jumps Club.. with her. 13' 5.25" sail for Coach Brian Monschine and Coach Talen Singer.... and her teammates joined. her in the next 5 places!!!!  Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes, NJ) and Ella Galloway(Pine Bush, NY).  tied. at 11'11.75" for. Circus honors.. followed. by Lily Beattie(Warwick). Tatum Norris(Susquehanna,PA).  Rachel Venter(Warwick)   Ellison Weiner..all at 11' 5.75".     Grace Zagoria(NYC) was. solid bars following her injury of the last 3 weeks.

Millrose Jr.Boys-(Feb. 11)----  It was. a jump-off dual in the Elite. Jr.Boys. Pole Vault... with. Superman Maddox Hamm(Scottsboro, Alabama) prevailed with a huge. jump at 17'-00.75' FOR  Coach Chris Spears Vault. club. edging superstar Wyatt Stewart(Richmond, Kentucky) also Soaring 16' 10.75".. for silver. Cody Johnson)Hobart, IN)  16' 6.75"...Paul Migas(Lake Villa, IL) 16' 00.75"... Collin Pate(Hoover, Alabama) 16' 00.75". Connor EWhite(Hoover, Alabama) 15' 7'.  Joey Marlow(The Woodlands, Texas) 15' 1"...Max Austin(Katy,Texas) 15' 1".  Neil Howard(Albany,NY) Solid Bars.

Millrose Pro-Women (Feb. 11)~~~ This was another loaded Pole Vault. event..with the. best in the world taking it up strong.  Katie Moon(Nageotte)  flew 15' 9.5" for Team Essx. and Coach Brad Walker...  and c close bars at  16'1". Bridget Williams(Guy) flew 15' 7.25 for the third week in a row. for Team Essx. and Olympic Champion...Katerina Stefanini(Adidas) went big over 15'  2.75 ..Gabby Leon)Puma)  14' 8.5"...HS Stars... Amanda Moll. 14' 8.5". Naha Moll 14' 2.75".  and Emily Grove(Elite Athletics). 13' 9.5".  ** A special Thank You and Salute to Meet Director Ray Flynn and Armory Co-Presidents. Rita Finkel and Jonathan Schindel for providing. Jr. Pole Vault Development in their prestigious Millrose Games.** 
     

*  Stay Tuned.......More results. coming from this weekend.     
*. This is the final week of the Circus Winter #2 Training Package.  Thank you, vaulters/parents.     
*. Flying Circus Indoor Pole Vault Championships. March 14-16...  Register now.   at. www.hvflyingcircus.com

posts.Title: CIRCUS ROUND`UP--NJ State Champs--Nate Park...Emma Keating,. Jamie Kim...Matt Herbert !! ! Tatum Norris Flys in Armory!!
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus. LLC  "STRONGER TOGETHER"
  It's. true...... .."    from a small seedling.... comes. a mighty oak. "

THANK YOU ALL for believing in the process. slow. and steady training model.  We don't. cut corners to development. great technique... it is day-to-day. grinding out. the flaws. and. gaining confidence every day of the. week in ourselves.   This. is how. change.  and performances. are. built...    Small drills equal  HUGE JUMPS!!!!

 Results of the week. ~~~~~   
Toms River,NJ. NJ State Group Championships...   Pompton Lakes senior. hurdler/vaulter was. at her best in winning. Group 1. PV Title. with her  11' 6"
 fly over.  and a state runner-up in the. 55m Hurdles in 8.78.  Joining the State Group Title. were Nate Park(Old Tappan). at 14' 0" in Group 2...Jamie Kim(Old Tappan) is State Champ at 10' 6".  and. Sophomore Matt Herbert won his state title in Non-Public at 13' 0" for Newark Academy. Many new Personal best and school records. listed below in Full Results.

posts.Title: CIRCUS STRONG ~~~ Ellison Weiner ~~State Champ... Rachel Venter Soars. 12' 0"... Tatum Norris Steps Up !
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Circus, LLC                         "...Something within me."
      There's a change. a coming.......                    ..................let it start with me.


    CONGRATULATIONS to all Circus athletes for the extreme. effort, spirit, and sportsmanship displayed this weekend in our four boarding states.  Here is the weekend scoop! 


 Connecticut State Open Championships at Hillhouse fieldhouse was. exciting in both the girl's and boys' runways...Weston Senior... Ellison Weiner won her. 3rd State Open Pole Vault. with an easy 12' 0" sail for her coaches. This Dartmouth University signee moves. to Nike Indoor Champs.. Jordan Carr(Barlow). placed. at 10' 6'. for the speedy sophomore.  Taking the. Boys. honors. was Lucas Williams from Ridgefield? at a school record 15' 0".  and Derek Amilcke(Staples) placed runner-up at 14' 0".

  Tatum Norris(Susquehanna Community, PA)  "steps up on the inside" at the PA State Open Championships at Penn State today.. with two new. indoor school records.  and personal bests in placing the in both the 60m Dash.  and the 200m Dash for the. Sabers.  Competing with her heart instead of her legs.. she blasted. 7.71 school record.  and. 25.02 for 200 meters school record in lane 6.  She moves on to Tuesday Nights Eastern States at the Nike Armory in both sprints.


   Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley)  was ready to fly at Section 9 State Quals in the Armory on Saturday.  Using her 13' 1 Essx sticks.. she sizzled over 12' 0" for the honors and is off to state next week at Ocean Breeze.  Also ripping some. high air. was Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley) soaring 11' 6". to qualify for next weeks. NY State.  and Ella Galloway(Pine Bush) took the. final qualifying spot at 11' 0". after her huge long Jump qualifier. at 17' 7".  Warwick Valley sprinter/vaulter...Hannah Cann came. thru in flying colors. with her 11' 0" pole vault.  and 60' 1 anchor leg of 4 x 400 Relay that advances. to state. for Coach Thomas Ady Laurie(NP) 11' 0". Stella Scherbak(MW) 10' 0".  Eliozabeth Apostolico(MW) 10' 0". Jayden Beck(MV) 9' 6". Averie Klein(PB) 9' 0". Isabela Centeno(C) 8' 0" -----  The Boys comp was exciting. as Logan Schupner(MV)  won the. tiebreaker at 13' 0". followed. by freshman Luke Beattie(War) at 13' 0". Klaus Landenau(War) flew 11' 6PR..Anthony Roe. went big at 11' 0". Luke Kotsides(RV) 11' 0" PR. Nate VonDeben(PB) 10' 6" PR. Brian Chen(MW) 10' 0".  Cole Wilson(Wash)  9' 0".


  In todays Warwick Valley Tune~`Up meet at the Warwick Center... It was  Grace Zagoria returning to glory, with her. 11' 6" PR for a school record and top honors...   Maura Michalczyk(Dunmore, PA) was. a sensation on her. 12' 7" poles, with her school record 11' 3" Personal Best for the District 2 star gymnast

posts.Title: NIKE NATIONALS ~~~~ 2-LILY BEATTIE 12' 8.5" .... 4- ELLA GALLOWAY. 12' 8.5"~~~ ALL-AMERICANS !!!
posts.Content:
CONGRATULATIONS CIRCUS VAULTERS......  EVERYONE. CAME THRU.  !!!!!!!
 Nike Indoor Nationals...  The Armony,NYC March 10-12


 The. Circus Vault Crew saved their best for their final Armory meet this weekend... as 8 Personal Bests...   5 New School Records. and. a. ton~of~fun  was the. final mark that counted. the most.  There is. nothing quite like the energy.  and. spirit of. competing in this historic building in Washington Heights.  We salute.   Nike.  and The Armory staff for providing us. a sensational chapter in our athletic. scrapbook.
 

Leading the. way in today's. Girls Championship of America Pole Vault competition.. it was Junior Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley) placing a tie. for. second place. with her new personal best of 12' 8.5". and so close a bar at 13' 1" on her. 14' 7  pole series for another  All-American medal to match her Sprint Medal for the. Lady Wildcats on Friday.  Also taking the podium as an All American was Pine Bush,NY  junior. Ella Galloway with her PR.  and School Record. 12' 8.5 in forth place overall.. Weston,CT. senior. Ellison Weiner finished her indoor career with a 7th Place tie.  with Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ), both big over. 12' 1".  Sophomore Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley). finished 11th as Top Soph. at 12'  1" and Susquenhanna Community,PA). super.  star sprinter.  flew 11' 8.5" for her Sabers.  Top Boy in the Championship. was  Cody Johnston(Hobart,IN). at 17' 1" for the Millrose Games medal winner.  Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) freshman...launched. 14' 1" in his new school uniform for the  CATS.  in Emerging Elite  section  and Ian Kearney(North Highlands) battled back at 13' 6.5" for 10th place.
 

Nike Emerging Elite Girls. were. on their game, as Grace Zagoris(NYC) flew. 11' 2.5". for 8th place.  and  a new school all-time record on her big poles... Ady Laurie(New Paltz) 11' 2.5" School record. Audrey Cheng(Lawrenceville0 10' 8.5"..... Jamie Kim(Old Tappan) 10' 8.5'.  Madeline Amagliaro(Trinty) 10' 8.5".  Maura Michalczyk(Dunmore) 10' 8.5". Olivia DeBellis(Suffern) 10' 2.5". ..  Pole Vaulter..Hanna Cann(Warwick Valley). flew. to her All American medal. with a. super fast 400m relay split for Coach Kirt Thomas sprinters. Boston New Balance Indoor---@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
 

Pole Vaulter Nate Park(Old Tappan).  flew. to his. 4th place medal with 14' 3.5' for Coach Clark.  Taking the. Championship Gold. was Maddox Hamm(Scottsboro,Alabama). at 17' 8.5". for Coach Chris Spear.  Neil Howard.. Last weeks. NY State Pole Vault Champ placed. 4th in the Pentathlon with a sensational 3661 points for  the USATF Jr.Decathlon Champion!!!!


    *FLYING CIRCUS CHAMPIONSHIPS. March 14-16.....@. The Barm.. Register at www.hvflyingcircus.com

posts.Title: "CIRCUS VAULT "~~~~~~~~~~~~~News---Views---Thoughts.
posts.Content:
Here at Flying Circus.. we. emphasize the value of being a great supportive teammate.  It has never been about the gold medal or the big trophy... but... rather about the power of encouraging each other all day long.  Athletic participation is a gift we all are privileged to be a part of. I would like to take a moment to reflect on our pole vaulters this past winter season in our club.


  We were a collection of 97 young and aspiring athletes and  8  inspiring volunteer coaches, who jumped on the "Pole Vault Rollercoaster "  for some unbelievable moments together......   and some lifetime memories that will not fade.   The "Cheering~for~Each~Other"  was the highlight of the season for me. To watch young athletes strive. is a great thing... but .. to watch athletes cheer for one another is the "glory of sport".


   As we approach our next season together .......  we will rebuild your technique and strength.  and confidence and continue to grow solid positive character traits that will be so desperately needed in the years to come.   Your Circus  Coaches would like to thank every family... every athlete and every support team member for representing us this season.                ............ On to the Spring Season !!!!

10 Ways to be Mentally Tough                 
*. Do hard things.               
* Let go of your ego.               
* Try your hardest.               
* Leave your. Comfort Zone.               
* Learn. from.  every moment.               
* Be consistent and coachable.               
* Stay poised. and persistent.               
* Find solutions.....Not excuses.               
* Fight through adversity.               
* Finish what you started.
             

" Start each day with a positive thought                           .....   and a grateful heart."                                  ~~ the coaches journal.com

posts.Title: "CIRCUS POLE VAULT WEEK "~~~ JULY 2-8.. JOIN US!!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault, LLC                                       
 The Warwick Center, New York

The 2023  .... FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT WEEK  !!!!!!!                     
   If you love the  pole vault.... then this is a dream week. come. true for. you. and. your. friends.   JOIN US  for. some exciting flying...   some. lively loud. music...... some great food from our food trucks and some old fashion storytelling of. bars flew over.  and. some incredible.  ice cold "JOE TEA" on a hot summer day.   Our 25th edition of POLE VAULT~MANIA is almost here.... Registration is. now open for Our 100+ vaulter CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEETS on July 7~8.  for your age division group. and our Summer Pole Vault camps on July 2-3.  and July 5-6 are almost. sold out ~~~ Just 10 spots left for a great. 2-Day Camp of Pole Vault before. the. Festival begins.    July 4 will be. a rest day again to  "Celebrate the Fourth." with family.

Sunday & Monday. July 2~3 .... Circus Co-Ed Pole Vault Camp for Boys and Girls in Grades. 6-12                              2 Days of Basic Pole Vault Instruction on 5 Runways... Camp T-Shirt-/ PV Booklet /Fun                               Registration Form at www.hvflyingcircus.com.... ONLY 7 SPOTS LEFT!!!!!!!

ONLY. 4 SPOTS LEFT !!!!!!
   

Friday. July 7.....  CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEETS BEGIN .....
10 am..Boys & Girls Middle School Athletes     
12:31pm. ..Boys and Girls Freshman Athletes     
3:31 pm....Boys and Girls Sophomore Athletes

10 am... Boys and Girls High School Juniors Athletes

4:31 pm...College.  and Open Men & Women Athletes
   

REGISTER TODAY...  JOIN THE VAULT~MANIA  PARTY  with  US this SUMMER!!!!

Results Yesterday Pine Bush/Warwick Valley Dual Meet   Pine Bush, NY    The Outdoor Season opens. with.  SPEED.  and  VAULT FLAIR!!!!         

The  4 Warwick Valley  HS buses. rolled into Pine Bush. for an exciting opening meet and was highlighted. with  Speed.  from Freshman Luke Beattie(Warw).  in 11.3 (h)  win for the  CATS  and a huge 14' 0". pole vault into a.  hard. cross wind. He. took 3 great shots. at the NY Freshman Record. of 14' 9".    Also unloading speed. was sister Lily Beattie(War)  in her 100m Win in a PR. 12.8  !!!   Junior Hannah Cann(Warw0  won the 200m in a. fast PR  26. 6 !!!!.  Rachel Venter cranked. 27. 7/200m after her vault activity and  Nate VonDeBen(PB). sailes 10' 0" and  Klaus Landaneu. flew. 10' 0". for third  place in the Boys Vault.  Pine Bush junior...Ella Galloway broke her outdoor. school record. with a. 12' 6" fly-over.  and close bar at 12' 9" and. won the High Jump and Long Jump.  for the Lady Bushman.   Action.  continues today at O'Neill HS  and Saturday morning at Goshen HS Invite..   Stay tuned.......  Coach St.

posts.Title: Flying Circus Up`Dates~~~ Rachel Venter 12' 0"...Neil Howard. 15' 6" ...Tatum Norris Strikes.4 Golds!!!

"Where Everyone Vaulter  Counts"

GO ~ TIME @ Flying Circus.

posts.Title: Penn Relays Results... Lily Beattie. 12' 3(4th) ...Neil Howard III 14' 8
posts.Content:
The  Flying Circus Rides Again               

 C~O~N~G~R~A~T~U~L~A~T~I~O~N~S  !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The  127th Running of ..."The PENN RELAYS". was. filled.  with many great efforts in very challenging weather conditions(52'/Rain/Headwinds) ... but our athletes. never backed. down and. competed. with grace.  and dignity all weekend.  we are now. at mid~season.   and the.  skies. are about to open up with warm competition days.   and light breezes to your back.........   GET READY TO FLY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


Penn Highlights: Thursday action in the HS Boys  Pole Vault Championship Section was loaded,, as. Wyatt Steward(Kentucky) sailed. to his gold watch prize with 16' 8" Meet Record... breaking Flying Circus Jordan Yamoah's record of 16' 7.75 from 2012.  Records. are only borrowed. in our. sport....  placing 5th. was New York State Indoor Champion...Neil Howard III(Taconiv Hills).  at 14' 8". Friday Pole Vault weather (52'/ strong headwinds. and rain) prevented any real attack of personal records...  and.  was a survival test. for the 21  Best  HS Girls  in. 5. states.  Veronica Vacc(National Record and National Indoor Champion.) was. the. winner. at 12' 11"  into the.  wind all day!!!!   Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) produced 4th place. at 12' 3"...Emma Keating(Pompton Lakes,NJ) placed. 6th.  at 11' 9".   and Sophomore. Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley,NY). Place. 9th.  at 11' 3" .. ....    8 Super HS girls No Height!!!  It was a day of. adjusting each step of.  every jump.... Congratulations to all.


 Saturday  Men's Championship of America Pole Vault. was moved to the Indoor Tennis Center for safety.  and. former Flying Circus State Champ...Shane Racey(Cornell)_ blasted. to his. first gold. watch performance.  with a. huige 17' 5.5"  soar!!! Shane is just a junior.  and plans.  on vaulting.  and coaching at CIRCUS VAULT WEEK activities.  July 2-8 in Warwick !!!!!  Co-Ed Camp  July 2-3.  and Festival July  7-8.

 Wyalusing Lasagna Invite, PA ~~~~~ TATUM NORRIS  Rips. 4 Golds. AGAIN!!!!!!  Talented.  and dedicated.  Susquehanna Community,PA. senior...Tatum Norris won her.  four events again on a. cold, rainy. and windy night.  for. the Sabers in Blue.. Tatum heads. to Binghamton University next fall to join Mike Thompson's powerful Track & Field program.   Performances. 100m---12. 5.... Long Jump~~~ 17' 0".  Pole Vault. 11' 6".   200m ~~~ 26.0 !!!
 Kingston Relays,NY---- New Paltz,NY.  sophomore. Ady Laurie won again vault for the gymnastic star. at Tiger Relays. with her 10' 6'

PR. at  11' 8".  Averie Klein(PB) Hurdles =PR.  Goshen Boys.  and Girls sweep PV for the 5th time. tis. season.. Reilly St. (G)10' 3"PR. posts.Title: CIRCUS SUMMER CAMPS ~~~SOLD OUT !!! SUMMER FEST MEETS REGISTRATION NOW OPEN !!!
posts.Content:
Our 25th FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT CAMPS are now--- SOLD OUT!!     THANK  YOU. for.  helping us develop our pole vault. event.     


   We now have registered. our  80 athletes. for this year's 25th Summer pole vault camps on July 2-6 in scenic Warwick, New York.  It is loaded. with the most enthusiastic group of young vaulters ever. and it will be. a unique. experience for all coaches...athletes.  and families.
   The Camps. are just half of the. "CIRCUS POLE VAULT WEEK". activities.   

The." fun of flying".continues after. our camps.  end on July 6.   The next. two days.  will be filled. with the. "Spirit of the Pole Vault". Summer Fiberglass Fest of. 12 Age Division Meets on Friday, July 7.   and continues on Saturday, July 8 at the Circus Headquarters in Warwick, New York.    This. Celebration of our Pole Vault. Event .....will be the highlight of our activities here at Flying Circus. before. we close our Barn doors.  for.  a 6-week recovery break from vaulting.  The Competition. will be filled. with friendships made. from the past year... lively/loud music.. Food Truck goodies...Free parking/bathrooms... 12 Age Group divisions for Middle School...High School  Classes...College Champions....Open athletes who love our sport.  and Masters Vaulters. who inspire us all.   Ice~Cold. ..JOE TEA. will be. served. to all Vaulters on a hot July weekend. and pole vault. stories will abound all day long.


  Join the FUN. with US....   Register today. for our Summer Fest Meets.  coming on July 7-8.   @ hvflyingcircus.com

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS ........ SEARCHING FOR THE BEST IN ME
posts.Content:
Dear Circus Vaulters ~~~~~~~       
As we approach our final meets... practice sessions...summer camps and summer Vault Festival Meets.... it is time to reflect and give thanks to all of our athletes and parents. The past. nine months of  skill learning.. sportsmanship development and a gracious attitude approach to our sport is truly inspiring to watch. Watching kids support each other..... watching kids never cutting corners in preparing.... watch kids. fight. thru a bad day and bouncing back is the. true. joys of sport.  You all have raised the torch here at Flying Circus.        

There are some things in this world that money can't buy... and it is called character. Other kids watch you compete.  and watch you handle yourself.  How you keep your head up regardless of.  your performance..  How. you are humble in victory.  and. gracious in defeat.  These. are the real qualities that enrich us in athletics.  and teach us huge lessons. of life.        It is never about the trophy......... it is. about searching for. the best within us.        

Let's. finish the last 6 weeks with a huge finish together.

End-of-the-Year Circus  News    
*. Camps. are loaded and both are SOLD OUT. July 2-6... Stay fit. and in.  shape after States.   
*  All Rental Vault poles. due back at Barm on June 17 ...after NB Nationals.   
*  We have scheduled.  a NEW BALANCE  NATIONAL LAST CHANCE MEET for boys.  and Girls. who are close to the Entry Standard. for NextSunday  June 4. at 2:31pmat the. super fast runways. at the Barn and BarnYard.  Starting heights. will be.  high like NB Nationals.  Cost $40/athlete. at the door.   
* Our Coaching Staff at our Summer Camps. will be.... "Best Ever".. Be ready for some new voices/ideas. reboot.   
* SUMMER FESTVAL MEETS ..July 7 & 8  will end our. season and we will take. a 6-week recovery phase and move to strength. and flexibility work for July and August.   
* Summer Festival. has. every Age Division.  and is a gathering of. every pole vault enthusiast in our reach. Don't. miss this final meet with us.  It will also be a. 2024 NY Millrose Games Qualifier this year for the HS Boys. and Girls Winner!!!   
* All Festival. entry athletes. will be treated. to EARLY REGISTRATION for WINTER POLE VAULT CLUB.    REGISTER NOW. for our Final Meet.  at our website.  www.hvflyingcircus.com.  (July 7 % 8, 2023)   
* SUMMER TWILIGHT MEETS @ Barn. Thursday, June 22.   and Friday, June  30.  5:01 pm Start. (Warm Up 1 hour before at 4 pm). Cost $40 at the door/athlete.   
* Pictured. above... 2023  SUMMER CAMP T-SHIRT  REVEAL !!!!!


          Flying Circus........   ALL-ABOARD !!!!!!

posts.Title: 'BEATTIE~NATION "@ Section 9.....LILY. 13' 1....Luke. 15' 0"!!!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Pole Vault Club "The Place~to~Fly" Warwick, New York
  25  Circus Pole Vault....Never Giving Up.     That is the. story of the day. for each athlete measuring up to their very best.  CONGRATULATIONS. EVERYONE !!!!


 The day started. with 86'degree temps at the north pit. , as. 22 Girls supported. each other on every jump. and in-between. GIRLS LITE-IT-UP~~~~~~~~Lily Beattie of Warwick Valley's Coach Kirt Thomas staple of. vaulters...  set a Junior Class record for the Wildcats. with her. 13'  .5" PR Sail for the. gold.   Using big 14-foot poles.  and her biggest grip of the year.. she. was. close at bar 13' 4" and heads. to State.  and NB Nationals. Big jumps. also came. from Warwick Vallet Sophomore Gymnast..Rachel Venter. with her 12' 0" for. silver.  and then a gutsy move. to her. 13-foot Essx's. at 12' 6" bars. Ella Galloway of Pine Bust came into her medium 6-step approach. and. sailed. 12' 0".Stella Scherbak of Monroe Woodbury placed. 4th at 11' 0" and. had.  super. jumps. at  NY  State Middle School record at 11' 7".   Ady Laurie of New Paltz. was. solid at 11' 0" to advance. to next Friday NY State Pole Vault Championships @ Middletown.NY    In total---  9. Personal Bests !!!!  The full Results are below.

The Boys. battled.  stiff headwinds to set. some PRs.   and State  ALL-TIME Bests !!!!! Luke Beattie of Warwick Valley's Coach Mike Potters  Purple Wave. was. sensational in his. Gold Medals vault of 15' 0". to break the ALL~TIME. NY State FRESHMAN pole Vault Record of 14' 8" !!! Using a borrowed pole. from Max Dicker.. her was. close. at 15' 4" bar to end the meet on a high note.. Luke also won Division I. Javelin with PR. 137' 0" and a dinner. from Coach Potter!!!!!~. Sean Robertson of Marlboro won Division II. at 12' 6" PR. for the talented. sophomore.  The Full Boy's Results. are below.

posts.Title: Circus Last Chance.. Ian Kearney 14' 4" ....Maura Michalczyk 11' 8" !!!
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Last Chance Meet
The Warwick Center Vault Barn
Warwick, NY


  Pole Vaulting still happening ........            ........  School  Records. and Personal Bests. were on display tonight, as. 9 Flying Circus athletes continue. to improve on the. second-floor pole vault area at Flying Circus.


  IAN KEARNEY of Northern Highlands,NJ found his rhythm and posture. with. a school and personal record of 14' 4" for the. win in the  Circus Boys Last Chance Meet.  Ian qualified. for NB Nationals.  Rising Stars Division.  Ian is coached. by Dane Sorensen. Adding to the   NB Nationals. was. super Warwick Valley,NY  freshman star.. Klaus Lindenau..... who has been vaulting less than.  a year for the Purple Wave hometeam...flew. 12' 3" for PR. and NB Freshman Nationals Division!!!!


 MAURA MICHALCZYK of Dunmore PA has been  one of. the many improved. girls this year at Flying Circus. This.  strong and humble junior vaulter/hurdler, who placed. 8th. at PA State meet this spring.. upper her school and personal best to 11' 8".  and 2 close bars. at 12' 2". and is on the. waitlist. for Rising Stars NB Nationals next week.  Also soaring to school and personal best was Olivia DeBellis of the Suffern,NY Mounties, coached. by Elizabeth Borczyk. Olivia made 11' 8". and had. a close bar at 12' 2" for the Quininnepac University signee. Third place. was the. sensational sophomore Ady Laurie of New Paltz,NY with 11' 8" and heads. to NY State Meet  Division II this Friday.  Madeline Magliaro of Trinity School,NYC had big air over 11' 2" for Coach Bob Sorensen.  Hannah Cann of Warwick Valley,NY..coming off her. splendid 400-meter dash on Friday.. made 10' 8"... Middle School sensation..Stella Scherbak(M-W_. made 10' 2". and Averie Klein of Pine Bush opened big. over 9' 8". and close at 10' 2 bar
  All in all.... this group demonstrated the pure beauty of sport.........   It's in the effort... that we find ourselves.


 Special thanks to "".. Bob Sorensen, Stephie, Rudy Tomaselli, Ryan Morales, and Rachel Venter.
  NEXT  MEETS @ CIRCUS   CIRCUS TWILIGHT #1...Thursday, June 22.  at 4:30 pm Warm Up... ALL LEVELS ARE INVITED...  Boys Outdoor Runways/ Girls Indoor Runways. $40 / athlete at the door.    CIRCUS TWILIGHT #2..   Friday. June 30 at 4:30 pm Warm Up. .. ALL LEVELS  ARE INVITED ..Boys Outdoor Runways / Girls Indoor  Runways. $40 / athlete at the door
