posts.Title: CIRCUS @ NATIONALS ~~~~. 16 ATHLETES... Two NATIONAL CHAMPIONS... Three All-AMERICANS!!!
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus, LLC " The Place to Fly"
 CONGRATULATIONS to all of our 16 Flying Circus Athletes at The New Balance. and Nike. Outdoor Nationals this past weekend.  You EARNED.  your level and we are PROUD of each one of you.    NOW ~~~~ ON TO  the  "GREATEST MEET of the YEAR"... The Flying Circus Summer. Pole Vault Festival

  NEIL HOWARD(Taconic Hills,NY)..LUKE BEATTIE(Warwick,NY). win NATIONAL TITLES !!!!!  Nike Nationals, Eugene, Oregon----  Taconic Hills,NY. Multi-Star...Neil Howard is now crowned USA Decathlon Champion.  This. speedy. junior was ready for all 10 events...  and hit Decca PR's. in 6. events. to record. 7, 153 points for the gold. It represents 500+ point improvement from last year.  His top 3 events. were  400m(48.49-886 points)..110 Hurdles(14.97-853 points).  and pole Vault(15' 9"-849 points). He competes. in the 400 Hurdles today. and will attempt the NY State Junior Class record.  in Pv. at our Festival (16' 7'-Lourenco-2021).


New Balance, Nationals, Franklin Field,PA  Warwick Valley,NY ...Luke Beattie won his first National Title. in the Frosh Competition with his 13' 7.5" sail on his. first jump for  Head Coach  Mike Potter's Purple Wave of Warwick Valley.  His hot jumping will continue.  at Circus Festival Frosh section on July 7 in the BarnYard outdoor pits. Another Frsh star was born, as Klaus Lindenau of Warwick Valley,NY pole vault stable....placing 7th at 12' 1.5" outdoor PR on his biggest pole ever!!!  Pole Vaulting. In the Girls Freshman Division..  was Cornwall,NY outstanding  Jump star(PV-HJ-TJ) Anderson Farina... with. solid. vaulting on her longer poles.  and longer run. She heads. to both Circus Camps. this summer !!!


Girls Championship ...EMMA KEATING(Pompton Lakes,NJ),  had. a BIG 24 hours of pole vaulting success.. Thursday night, she. won NJ Meet of Champs. at 13' 0" on her. longer sticks and 1. close strong bar at All-Time NJ Record at 13' 6"..then placed ALL-American status on Friday in the. NB  Nationals. at 12'  1.5".  Teammate Ella Gallowat(Pine Bust,NY) placed  9th   at 12' 1.5".  and Warwick Valley,NJ. Lily Beattie. hit 12' 7/75". for Head Coach Kirt Thomas' Wave.


 Girl;s Rising Stars.  produced fireworks of fun   for six Circus teammates..as. Maia Perillo(John Jay,NY)  became an All-American Pole Vaulter. with her. 4th place 11' 5.75) clear on her first attempt.  Warwick Valley.NY Sophomore ..Rachel Venter...   flew 11' 5.75" also for an All- American podium finish for the  Wave. Tatum Norris(Susquehanna Community,PA) flew BIG over  11' 5.5" for the Circus Sabers... Madeline Magliaro(Trinity,NYC) was solid. at 11' 0", and Maura Michalczyk(Dunmore,PA) hit 11' 0" in the tricky wind.  competition.  New Paltz, NY Sophomore..Ady Laurie. went. for it following her. 12' 0" state meet finish of last week.


 Boys Rising Stars.... Connecticut State Champ..Derek Amilick of Staples flew 14' 9" and heads. to Circus Festival. ..NMate Park(old Tappan,MJ) hit 14' 7.5" and Teammate  Tyler DeMarco made 13' 7.5" for Coach Jeff Clark... and Ridgewood,NJ. senior. Matt Aono sailed. 14' 3". and split FAST on the Maroon Relays for Coach Tim Wilson.


  It's NOT OVER YET. at Circus.....   Register on line ONLY. for. Summer Circus Pole Vault Festival..July 7 & 8..  and Join the. final salute to our GREAT EVENT!!!!


 Circus Twilight Tune-Up Meet.. Thiursday  June 22  at 4:30pm.. $40 at the doo sign up. Circus Twilight  Tune-Uo Meet...Friday  June 30 at 4:30pm $40 at the door sign up

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT ....BECOME MORE. !!!!!
posts.Content:
Welcome  Back to Flying Circus  Fall  Pole Vault Prep   


 "Championship athletes don't give up........ they work harder and dig deeper."  Now is your time to prepare for. your successful Indoor Pole Vault. season.  Flying Circus Pole Vault will be opening sessions. on Sundays.  and Wednesdays this fall beginning Sunday.  September 10 with Coach Stephanie Duffy..Bob Sorensen. and Dane Sorensen will be instructing small ability groups on separate. runways . The sign-up link is weekly at our website (www.hvflyingcircus.com) at the Bulletins section. Check for availability each week to get signed up for the Pole Vault  Fall Foundations program.   Excellent progressive instruction including warm-up dynamics.. run mechanics/posture...apparatus drills. and short run vaulting in the 90-minute instruction class.(Cost $40/athlete.). Bring spikes and Water.  and Join~the~Flying Fun.
   *. New Elevated Indoor  Runway....  Get ready for some Speed Pole Vaulting.   Our new rubber runway is lighting fast and ready for your new personal best.  Spikes 1/4" Only......... Vault  Pits and Standards have also been upgraded, along with fresh paint, and the  "Positive Vibe" will again be the goal of every session.    *  Coach Bob Sorensen will have his new ESSX POLE VAULTING POLES RENTAL  system for all our athletes. Check all the details on our website at the Bulletins Section. ORDER EARLY to be ready with your proper  ESSX Vaulting poles.
   *  Fall Pre~Season Vault Meets are scheduled. for October. 25(Boys only).  and October 26(Girls only) to break the Ice before HS Indoor seasons begin. Meets are. 4:30 pm-8:30 pm on the indoor runways at The Barn,   Cost will still be. just $40/athlete.
   *  Registration for our very limited Winter Club Training Packages will be in person this year at the Barn on Sunday...October  8, 2023. from 10 AM-2 PM. ONLY.  Make plans. to register that day, as we have sold out the 64 spots for Winter Training in 24-36 hours for the past 10 years.  There is no mail-in registration this year. Registration  Forms will be sent to all athletes from last year. indoor club and Summer Festival vaulters first on October 6.   It's going to be a BANNER YEAR @ FLYING CIRCUS !!!! Don't miss this one-day Registration.
    "Nature can not be hurried..... years of training is necessary for athletic success to emerge."

posts.Title: ARMORY INDOOR POLE VAULT CAMP…November 11…JOIN~the~FUN!!!!
posts.Content:
Dear Pole Vaulters....... 

   IT"'S TIME ~ TO ~ FLY @ THE ARMORY !!!!!!!

  You are invited. to join us at The NIKE ARMORY TRACK & FIELD  CENTER  this November 11, 2023, for a fun-filled. day of Fiberglass Pole Vaulting instruction.

   It is. time to REFOCUS... REMOTIVATE and RECONNECT for this Olympic year Indoor Track and Field season at the World's Greatest Indoor  Pole Vault facility.... "The ARMORY".

 The Lead Instructor will be EMILY GROVE, along with our FLYING CIRCUS  POLE VAULT STAFF. GROVE  competes. professionally. for TEAM ESSX in pole vault and she was the Silver Medalist at the NACAC championships and the 2023  USA INDOOR CHAMPIONSHIPS. She was a six-time All-American at the University of South Dakota and as a high schooler, she set the Illinois state record. She has a personal best of. 15' 7" (4.75 meters) and also represented TEAM USA at the. 2017 World Championships.

 REGISTER NOW. at armorytrack.com ....    Both Instructional sessions. are LIMITED to the first 25 athletes. to register.  It sells out FAST!!!

   Hope to meet you all there. for some Good Old Pole Vault FUN!!

         Coach St.  and The FLYING CIRCUS Staff

posts.Title: CIRCUS CLUB Starts~Up.... "ROLLING THUNDER".
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault, LLC

  "The Journey Begins"...

     The Circus 12-week  pole vault training phase has. started on a very HIGH NOTE.... our 80+  dedicated.  and. committed athletes producing  'super spirit' and team encouragement. at every session.   You can feel the  TRADITION  and the  HISTORY of POLE VAULT  SUCCESS .... as you walk up to that. the second floor of that 100-year-old dairy barn @ The Warwick Center for Pole Vault Development. It's. full of talented beginners... seasoned Intermediate and strong returning veteran pole vaulters of all sizes... all abilities.   and all DREAMING BIG DREAMS of FLYING. Perhaps...this is the strongest and deepest club team in our  40-year history.!!!!! It's going to be a fun year @ Circus. !!!!

    * There are NO FAVORITES....... EVERYONE COUNTS and EVERYONE gets treated. the. same. That's the beauty of learning pole vault here.

    *  As we approach colder winter weather...... our old Barn Heaters will keep us warm...and each athlete should bring sweatshirts. and sweatpants for. warm-up activities. and vaulting.  Leg tights.  and Compression socks are also recommended to keep athletes super warm and injury-free.  Compression socks. are therapeutic ..help prevent shin splints... and drastically improve run stability and balance. Invest in this proper.  safety equipment.

    *. We teach discipline and safety in every pole vault drill...activity and class. 

    *  We also teach CONFIDENCE.  Human nature can not be rushed.   Our teaching progressions are small drills. and small vaults building into longer runs. and pole grips.

    *. We are CLOSED  for THANKSGIVING this coming Thursday(November  23) and. this class will be made up at the.  end of the Gold Package. It's family time this Thursday!!!

    *. We will not be. bringing 80+ poles. to meets this year for club athletes. to borrow..... but we are opening our ESSX  Rental Poles business for your needs.  Contact ESSX  dealer and Circus Coach Bob Sorensen. to get you on the. correct poles. for your meets. Coach Sorensen's Contact information at our website ~~~ www.hvflyingcircus.com ~~~~

    * Our Flying Circus Apparel/Gear FundRaiser has  JUST 5~DAYS TO GO!!! 45 Items/Gear......... Wear our Brand whenever you can !! Ordering ends   November 22.

    *. "In learning you will teach, and in teaching, you will learn."  ~~~ Phil Collins

     HAPPY THANKSGIVING.............. from Your Pole Vault Staff

posts.Title: ELLA GALLOWAY(Pine Bush,NY) Signs @ University of South Florida !!!
posts.Content:
HV Flying Circus Pole Vault

 Sunday, November  26, 2023

BREAKING NEWS ~~~~~

 CONGRATULATIONS to ELLA GALLOWAY (Pine Bush, NY) for signing her National Letter Scholarship to the University of South Florida for next fall.  This Multi-Jumper/Sprinter/Pole Vault specialist and two-time New York State  Pole Vault Pole Champion, with National Honor Society academics, will be coached by legendary pole vault Coach Don Marsh for the BULLS Track and Field successful program in Tampa, Florida.

 Her personal best marks are in Pole Vault  12' 8.5"(All-American Indoor)....  Long Jump 17' 10.5"...  High Jump. 5' 4".  and 25.3 for her  200-meter speed, to go with her gymnastic Level 10 agility.

 Ella is the proud daughter of Chris and Heather Galloway of Pine Bush, New York.

posts.Title: Girls Circus Gala Meet ~~~ Lily Beattie & Ella Galloway Fly 13' 0"...10 Personal Bests!!!!
posts.Content:
The  FLYING CIRCUS, LLC

  Warwick Valley,   NY

" HOORAY  " and HAPPY NEW YEAR!!!!!

  **********************************************

 C~O~N~G~R~A~T~U~L~A~T~I~O~N~S. to our 23 Circus Vaulters today for a fun day of the fiberglass.  You all put on a spirited show and it was a treat to watch you compete with that crossbar.   You are off to a great. start for this indoor season.

 It was a day of high level vaulting and   produced 10  athletes reaching their personal bests ..... 4 new school records and another athlete qualifying  for Nike Indoor Nationals (Maura Michalczyk-Dunmore,PA).

 * Flight # 2. at 3:15pm  was.  sensational... as Seniors Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY).  and Senior Ellas Galloway(Pine Bush,NY) flew big over 13' 0" for personal bests. Both used their BIGGEST POLES. and HIGHEST GRIPS on their home facility.  Lily  won the countback gold, as both. were solid.  bars. at 13' 3". Maia Perillo(John Jay,NY)  had huge  air all night. and Maura Michalczyk(Dunmore ,PA) clear Nike Nationals bar with 11' 0".

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS....... COMFORT ZONE vs MAGIC ZONE
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault

" Where Opportunity Meets Potential"

Warwick, New York

       Many pole vault athletes get stuck in the mental 'Comfort Zone' for far too long.   Championship pole vault athletes move up to the "Magic Zone'  that produces magic results. As we. start up our. next training Phase #2.. it.  will be. important to step up into practice situations that the athlete moves into the Uncomfortable Zone... called the "Magic Zone" for top-level performance and personal achievement.   Pole vault practice development requires you to step up mentally and GO FOR the MAGIC ZONE.    

            MAGIC ZONE .... Thinking @ FLYING CIRCUS

             * Show up ready to be challenged. every Vault Day.

             * Dream BIGGER.... Train BIGGER.

             * Look after one another~~~ ENCOURAGE.

             * TAKE A CHANCE on YOURSELF ~~~ EXPERIMENT EVERY VAULT DAY

             * DO your HABITS....match your GOALS.

    Weekend Results~~~~

    Armory Hispanic Games @ Nike Armory

    Girls-   Meet Records...School Records.... 6 PR's ~~~ Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley, NY)  flew. 13' 2" Meet Record/PR(USA #3) to win the HS Section with her 14' 7" Essx sticks. Also.  racing 26.2 leg on the school record  4x200 Relay team coached by Kirt Thomas.  Maia Perillo(John Jay, NY) sailed. big over 11' 6" for silver and so close at 12'0"... Zoe Levitt(Bronx Science, NY). 10'0" on the next two poles bigger...Stella Scherback(Monroe, NY) returned. to a fantastic. 10' 0" for the talented  Freshman... Isabella Centeno(Cornwall,NY) 8' 0:  and Ellie Scherien(Pittston,PA). 7' 0'.

    The Club/Unattached section was also an electric vibe... with  Pine Bush, NY. senior..Ella Galloway soared 12' 6" and so close bar at 13' 2 with her 13' 7 ESSX poles. Maura Michalczyk(Dunmore, PA) set her school indoor record. with a big 11' 6" make. and almost the 12-foot club for the Bucknell recruit.... Ady Laurie(New Paltz,NY) placed bronze at 11' 0". .. Jenna Monaco(Dumont, NJ) moved up to her 12' 7 poles.   and brushed off  11' 0" for this hurdler/speedster.  .. Sarah Shipton(Crestwood, PA) was. super in her first trip to the Armory with 10' 0" on her longer run/pole,

   The Boys @ 2 pm....  Sophomore Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley, NY)  was ready again!!! He sailed. 15' 7'. for new PR. and NY State Soph Record. for Coach Mike Potters Purple Wave.... Sophomore teammate..Klaus Lindenau  pl;aced. 6th at 12' 0".     The Club/Unattached Section was sensational with Julian Lynch(Jump-the-Fear TC) with his new PR at 14'0" for this. sophomore coached by Jerry Cahill.

 Ocean Breeze Freedom Games....  The snowstorm prevented mass participation...  as Minisink Valley, NY sophomore Dalila Kronimus.    made 10' 0"..followed by Jayden Beck(Minisink). 9' 0"

 Dendy Games at RCC........  Aaron Bell(Sleepy Hollow, NY)  won  Dendy #3. at 11' 0"..Aiden Gleeson(Pearl River,NY). 10' 6 silver.  Girls-Kate Dowling(Pearl River,NY) 8' 0" gold...Riley Craig(PR_ 6' 0".  In the Dendy #2..  Todd Korman(Suffern, NY) won gold at 12' 0''. Justin Digga(Suffern, NY). 9'0" PR... Girls--- It was Anna Riskin.  taking home the Gold. with her 8'0" and Kennedy leone(Suffern). 6' 0"

 SanDiego, CA ~~~~~ Big Vaults.  went up in San Diego.... the other brother/sister combo making magic...  Jathiyak Muhammad( Senior,CA).  flew. 14' 0" in her first winter meet for this Nike Elite-sponsored athlete. She is the top seed. for this year's 116th Millrose Games on February 11 at the Nike Armory.  Her Brother...Khaliq Muhammad... just a junior.. flew. 16' 0" for the. win and also will be vaulting at the 116th Millrose Games. on Feb 9(Boys event) at the Nike Armory.

       BACK~to~TRAINING Tomorrow in Winter #2.

posts.Content:
"WEEK of MAGIC" @ FLYING CIRCUS

   It may be. sub zero outside.... but our vaulters  have turned up the heat on the pole vault runways this past week.... and. entered. the 'MAGIC ZONE" in pole vaultland.

    OCL Division 1-3-5 Champs @ West Point--- Ella Galloway(Pine Bush) sailed. 13' 1" School Record Pole Vault on her 14'1 ESSX sticks, along with her 5'4"  High Jump Gold and 17'3" Long Jump Silver..thus. 28 Team Points. Stella Scherbak(Monroe)  blasted back over 10' 6". for Crusaders for silver. and NYS Top Frosh....Averie Klein(PB) 10' 0" Bronze. Syd Remenar(VC) 6' 0". Ady Laurie of New Paltz was sensational in her.  win.  at 11' 0".  and close bar at 11' 6'.   Nate VonDeben(Pine Bush) was champion in Division 1...with big 11' 6"... Logan Willens(Goshen) silver at 9'0". Jacob Andrade(G) 8' 6'  Tyler Stevenson(SW). 7' 0" silver.   

    Coaches Hall of Fame Invite @ Nike Armory ~~~ produced two school records and 7 PR's...as Neil Howard III(Taconic  Hills)  flew. 15' 10" seasonal best.  and dashed. a PR. 6.58 for the Decathlon Champion.  Trinity School,NYC junior. Madeline Magliaro produced a magnificent. 12' 0" clear. for the gold medal again and big height over 12' 3".....Zoe Levitt(Bx Science placed 5th. at 10' 0"...Madison Tierney(PJ)  7' 0"  Natalie Krisanda(Columbia) won Soph Group at 10' 0"..Maddelyn Duong(BX Science). 8' 6'... The novice winner was Ashley Weakley(Columbia) 9' 0". Chris Nugent(Stepnic) won Boys. Novice. at 11' 0"...Cole Michelini(Stepnic) won the frosh at 7' 6".

  Toms River Athletic Bubble,NJ--- Senior Ben Mandler(Pascack Hills)  won at 14' 0".  and teammate Mike Dao hit 13' 6'. again for the Relay win at 27'6".

  Section 1 Action at Armory today... Aiden Gleeson(Pearl River) brought home the gold pole vault medal. at 10' 6".  Kate Dowling(Pearl River) won the. girls. at 9' 0".   and Michael Weyne(Greeley) won his D-1 division. at 12' 0" PR!!!  At the. Susquehanna Invite ,PA... Delaware Valley,PA-Soph). Liliana Coe placed 3rd. at 10' 0".

  College Circus Kids Soaring............

      Pole Vaulting continues. after High School..Here are awesome results...

       *  Texas Senior,.. Kaeli Thompson won her. first indoor meet for the National Champions Longhorns with a PR. 13' 6.25" and. so close. at 14' 0'bar.... Emma Keating(Rutgers -Freshman). sailed. 12' 8.5".  in Boston for 5th place Indoor PR..... Tatum Norris(Binghamton-Freshman) placed.  2nd. at Bucknell with her 11' 7.5". and then placed 5th in 60m Dash at 7.81. and Brandon Love(Binghamton-Senior) won gold at 15' 3" Caroline Fatta(Warwick Valley,NY). Senior. flew. 11.2"PR, thanks. to Coach Thompson and Coach Duffy.   Up in Boston..it was Rachel Mason(UCONN-Soph). winning her. second college meet. at 12' 2.5" and Big East #1 on her. 13'1.  and 13' 6" poles for the Lady Huskies. Mallory Matz(UCIONN). flew PR at 11' 8.5" for silver... Madison Chalfin(UCONN-Soph) 11' 2.5".... Jules Gravier(UMASS)  set her best at 11' 2.5"... Charlotta Moscovici(Albany)-Freshman). 10' 9". Hannah Solomon-Hollander(Albanu) 9' 9'.   Big PR. came. from Coco Metcalf of St.John's University. at Ocean Breeze..with her 11' 2.5 for Coach Sorensen. Down at the Carolina Challenge... Freshman Grace Zagioria (Davidson University,NC) flew 11' 4.5"PR. from just her 5 step and light poles.!!!

    CONGRATULATIONS to ALL OUR VAULTERS !!!!!!!!!!!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS @ NATIONALS~~~NEIL HOWARD III...NATIONAL CHAMPION... 16 CIRCUS VAULTERS SHINE
posts.Content:
Welcome. to the. .... 'Sprit of Athletics' and CONGRATULATIONS to all 16 athletes taking part in this week's. National Indoor meets in New York and Boston.   Just making the National Meets is the thrill of a lifetime and we are so proud of every effort you all showcased this weekend.  Bring on the Spring season !!!!!!

  Here is the scoop---------

  NIKE INDOOR(Armory,NY)....Neil Howard II (Taconic Hills,NY) put on a Nike Show of Speed...Speed.. Strength. ..Endurance.  and. deep-down Spirit in taking the All-Around Athlete title. in the Pentathlon with a New NY State Record 3,881 points for the Nike Elite Program  athlete. (EventMrks-60HH-8.18-LJ-22'3.5'-SP-41'3"-HJ-5"11.25"-100m-2:37.64) It came. down to the final event and it took a 9 second PR to hold off Max Tucker(GA) for the Gold!!!  Decathlon coming next this sp[ring ........

VAULT @ NIKE Armoty----

 Friday Emerging Elite Girlds ~~~ Old Tappan (NJ) junior Jamie Kim   and Dunmore,PA   senior  Maura Michalczyk capped off  sensational. indoor season with  a tied. 12th place. at 10' 8.75"  bar.  and Minisink Valley,NY ...Delila Kronimus sophomore  made 10' 2.75" bar for the Green and White. Averie Klein(Pine Bush,NY) had   solid opening bars for  this huidler/vaulter junior.

  The Boys Emerging Elite followed. with.  a new PR for Rising Star..Julian Lynch of Foprdham  Track Club coached by Jerry Cahill. Julian flew into the 15 Fooit Club. at 15' .25" for the.  silver All American place. Alan Vill;avicemcio(Tenafly,NJ) placed 8th.  at 14' .5"PR.  and Suffern,NY. ..junior.. Todd Korman hit 13' .25". for Coach Liz Borazack.

 Boys Championship odf America Section...  Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY)..  enjoyed getting to his. biggest pole of the indoor. and placed. 3rd. at 16' 4" bar from his walk in 6 step and had  32" push off the top. Also flyin' high was P{ompton Lakes's Owen Keating..just a junior with a.  15'0"PR this indoor placed  15th. at 14' 1".

Girls Championship of America Section...  Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley,NY) kept up with the family tradition...with her 13' .5" sail over.  for. 3rd place medal and went big with her  new 14' 7" x 170 Essx. at 13' 5" bar!! Watch out  outdoor season...  Circus team mate.... and. All Elite Jumper. supreme(PV-HJ-LJ) Ella Galloway(Pine Bush,NY)  aslo fly big over. 12' 8.5". for. 4th place podium medal and All-American status for the  University of South Florida. signee.  Maia Perillo(John Jay,NY). had. a super meet in placing 11th at 11' 8.5"  for the UMASS-Amherst signee.  Madeline Magliaro(Trinity,NY) was   solid in the heat of the battle... taking her 12' 0" pr  for the indoor season and placing  12th for Coach Bob Sorensen at 11'

 2.5".  Ady Laurie(New Paltz,NY)..just a Rising Junior...  was. solid  at opening height.  and Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley,NY)--junior .. was held out with injury and did not compete.

 NEW BALANCE NATIONALS(Boston,MA)....... 

     More Sensational pole vaulting also came. from The Track @ New Balance Nationals.  from Amelia McBain of Saratoga Springs Bule Streaks !!!!  Amelia, using her next pole. and a new grip won the gold vault  in Flight #1.... with. a huge. 12' 3.5" sail. and  close bars  at  a PR bar at 12' 9.5" for this Penn State signee.  Jordan Carr(Jole Barlow,CT) is more tha a National Ninja Warrior!!!  She. ha.  added   pole vaul.  to her activities for this Circus Summer vaulter.  and place 15th.  at 12' 3.5" for the Flyin' Bees!!!   Logan Schupner(Minisink Valley ,NY)  had. a. sensation  indoor season   with multi- 14' 9" performances  for  this  dedicated  junior and moves  to   outdoor with some new goals.

     "BUILD A CULTURE...... To be the very best version of yourself."

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS CHAMPIONS"…. TOGETHER.
posts.Content:
Dear "FLYING  CIRCUS  ATHLETES" ....................

        For most of us.....  it was 255 days~ago... that. we started together in our pre-season fall vaulting groups to plan and map out your pole vaulting success in   'chase of your personal bests'. We are now approaching  your final meets together  on July 5-6 at our Final meet of the year...The Flying Circus Festival at your home pits.

   You have all sacrificed many things TOGETHER.... you have pushed. yourselves on those lonely fall and winter days... almost 90+ vaulters jumping at our. club this year. from many different towns and states..... through winter groups... to private sessions and home meets.... through the. heat.  and. the cold barn nights....all TOGETHER. You pushed yourself every day.... TOGETHER.. You helped. and supported. each other....TOGETHER.    Your story is filled with motivation and Full effort...TOGETHER.

    Beyond the. results.... You all became  a SUCCESS ...... TOGETHER.

               CONGRATULATIONS.  and THANK YOU.

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

    REGISTER TODAY for our Final MEET TOGETHER....The 26th FLYING CIRCUS FESTIVAL on July 5-6

    Registration Open. at.  www.hvflyingcircus.com

-------------------------------------------------------------

  Results Galore Report (May 28-June 1)

  Section 2 State Quals... "The Howard and McBain Show"-------  The strong Section 2 (Albany Area) was loaded. with super results in every event. Senior Neil Howard II(Taconic Hills)...coming off his Tuesday night PV record 17' 1.25" leap..  advanced to state in  400 Hurdles in 53.54. and another. 16' 6" pole vault  win.  Circus teammate..Amelia McBain(Saratoga Springs). coming off her. school record. 12' 6" jump..also produced gold at 12' 0" and   close bars at 12' 7" for the Blue Streaks. Asklyn Weakly(Columbia) flew. again over. 11' 6" and moves on to state finals next Friday in Syracuse.  The Circus advanced a record..... 17 Vaulters to this year's  NY State Championships!!!!!   HOORAY!!!!!

  Section 9 State Quals..... Section 9(Lower Hudson Valley Area) is perhaps.  the. strongest section in NY State Track & Field this year.   In all... 57 teams of motivated and focused coaches and athletes in every event. Many vaulters excelling in other events and relays for their teams...... Leading the production of team points this weekend. was Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley)...just. a 15 year old. sophomore Coached. by Mile Potter/Curtis Acacki and finally on their new track facility. ... Luke. set school record.  of 10. 67 in the. 100 meters.. raced.  strong on a school record 43.05 400m Relay silver.. and flew to 15' 6" from longer run and bigger pole in the PV win..Totaling  Team 22 Points !!!! Logan Schupner(Minisink)   is back to his flying tricks on fiberglass.  with 15' 0". ..Klaus Lindenau(Warwick Valley). 13' 0" for bronze...Anthony Roe(Warwick Valley) 11' 6'. Nate VonDenben(PB) 11-0". ..Logan Williams(G_. 10' 0". Luke Kotsides(Rondout Valley) advances. at 12' 6' in D II. The Girls flew in New Paltz... as. clubmates. Ella Galloway cranked up 13' 0" for the gold and also made state in High Jump and Lily Beattie(Warwick Valley) flew in 100m... PV- 12' 6" silver... 400m Relay school record. 48.65 Gold.. along with the HS Chemistry Award that night at the school assembly night.!!!  USA#6 Freshman...Stella Scherbak(Monroe)   place 3rd. at 12' 0" and close bar at 12' 6".....Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley) and Delila Kronimus(Minisink) tied. at 11' 0"... Avery Klein(PB) 10' 6". Lilliana DeFelice(Cornwall) 10' 0" Anderson Farina(Cornwall) 9' 6".  and 5' 2" State Standard.... Hayden Flynn(Wash). 8' 6".  In DII section .. it was all Ady Laurie(New Paltz) soaring on her home pit. for the. win. at 11' 0" SB...Keely Schock(SW) 8' 6'..Timber Jackson(Marlboro). 8' 6'=SB.

  Section 1 State Quals @ Arlington.... Senior Maia Perillo won the gold medal in Division I. with   her 11' 6"  sail and close at 12' 3" NB Standard...Anna Riskin(Suffern) took home the silver at 9' 6" SB....In D-II... Kate Dowling(Pearl River)  cleared 8' 6"and in Boys I..Todd Korman(Suffern)  won at 12' 6".  David Schfrim(HG placed. silver at 12' 0-"  Ryan Toner(HG) 11' 6"... Justin Digga(Suffern) 10' 6". Liam Taylor-Normoyle(JJ) 10' 6"Jessup Whitehurst(Suffern) 10' 6"...In D-II.. it was Aaron bell*Sleepy Hallow) taking the win at 11' 6". Aiden Gleeson(PR) 11' 0" Colin Donadio(PR) 10'6"SB...Kemari Miller(Valhalla) 9' 6".

 New Jersey Sectionals. (North)...@ Vernon HS.... Soph Jenna Monaco went fast in 100m Hurdles for gold at 14.92. and followed up with 11' 0" Pole Vault silver.  Kayla Sanchez(NVD)  9' 0". In Group 3--Dylan Golden(Tenafly) placed  first at 10' 6". Jamie Kim(OT) 10' 6" for silver...Allie Tuite(OT) 10'0". Salome Sanchez(OT) 9' 6". Campbell Chadwell(T) 9' 0"..In Boys action---Owen Keating(Pompton Lakes. took the D-II Vault title. at 14' 0". Ron Rozenthal(NVD)  12' 6'. Ben Mandler(PH_ 12' 6'. Matt Sands(NVD) 11' 0". Ben Malone(PH) 10' 6"..In D-I... Alan Villavicencio(Tenafly) placed. second at 13' 6". Carter Pataki(NH) 11' 0" and Sam Irizarry(T) 10' 0".

 New Jersey Sectionals @ Livingston HS......It's. a.true story of...'never ~ giving  ~up" in yourself.  Such is the wonderful result yesterday. for Wallkill Valley's Brady Bonser.  Coming off  a serious injury this winter fueled. this talented and humble left-hand pole vaulter from Hamberg,NJ RANGERS..... Brady set  a new  all-time school record  yesterday  with his. 14' 1" gold medal in Group 1. action !!!! In Group 4...Ray Stellmach(Ridgewood) placed. bronze at 12' 6"....Adrian Alvarez(BT)  8' 0"... In Girls Group 4-- Isabella Formoso(Bergen Tech) sailed. a school record of 11' 6". for Coach Ken Cevoli and Bronco Meric... Emai Handa(Ridgewood). 10' 0"....Lucie Crosby(R) 9' 0"~~~~~

 On to State Finals............

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

  Neil Howard UP & OVER. at 17' 1.25" STATE RECORD!!!

posts.Title: CIRCUS FESTIVAL... FRIENDSHIPS RECAP HIGHLITES !!!!!
posts.Content:
Dear Flying Circus. "Family of Flyers"..........

    The. 26th Festival was all about FRIENDSHIPS   and FUN.
    When pole vaulters get together....its always about fellowship. This year's edition was filled with joy...spirit.  and togetherness. Thank you to all  112 athletes for. coming together and. every parent,, grandparent...coach. and siblings. for. making our. meet a huge blessing.  Bring on summer !!!!

   Here are DAY # 2. Recap  stories and full  results will be up on our website in a few days.

     Girls High School~~~Junior Class Division (Top 3) 
       The Girls  ESSX BAG winner was. Jordan Carr of Joel Barlow High School (Redding Connecticut). This years  Connectict  State Champion. flew.  12' 1" with ease and  was close. at 12' 9" PR  attempts. She represents. Black Rock Pole Vault Club and coached bt Robert  Rakish. Placing. silver was  Warwick Valley,NY ..junior...Rachel Venter with her comeback 11' 7" bar and close. at 12' 1" on longer poles.  Taking the bronze JOE TEA award. was. New York City's finest..Madeline Magliaro(Trinty School). at 11' 1".

   Boys High School ~~~Junior Class Division (Top 3)
      The Boys ESSX  BAG winner was  local standout...Logan Schupner of Minisink Valley High School.      Logan set a new School Record. and Personal Best with his 15' 7" leap and. a close bar at  16' 1" for the lefthanded. vaulter. Taking home. the. silver JOE TEA was. Owen Keating of Pompton Lakes,NJ. Wearing his dad's old USA EAST FESTIVAL jersey.. he flew 15' 1" and close to 16' 1" on the outdoor pit.   The  Bronze was. a tie. with  Luca Cioffi(Long Island,NY) and Korvan Nameni(Wisconsin) both sailing 13' 7" with air to spare.

    Girls High School ~~~Senior Division (Top 3)
     The ESSX Bag award.  the winner was the hometown star..Lily Beattie of Warwick Valley,NY. Lily blasted over 13' 1" to set a new meet record.  and record. the 16th  4.0 meter vault of her High School career. She was. very close at 13' 7" and heads to the University of Mississippi. this fall.    Also soaring BIG was. Ella Galloway of Pine Bush High School,NY.  wit. a New School Record of 13' 1" and. close. at 13' 7" bar also. Ella.  heads. to the University of South Florida. this fall to be. with legendary pole vault coach Don Marsh. Placing third. was Maia Perillo of John Jay High School..perhaps. this years Most Improved Athlete with her. 12' 1" = School Record vault for the UMASS-Amherst signee.

   Boys High School~~~Senior Division (Top 3)
       The ESSX Bag. winner. was an All-American Decathlete...Neil Howard III of Taconic Hills,NY. This 5-time Decathlon Champion and GaterAide NY Athlete of the Year. flew huge over  16' 7"    from his. shorter run. and close. at   17' 3" for the Michigan signee.  Thking. second. was this year's Connecticut State Champion..Liam Wright of All H.S. CT.   Liam. set a nEw school Record of 15' 7'. and heads to Columbia University this fall. Taking the Bronze JOE TEA. was. Ryan Hoo of Pope John,NJ. with his  12' 7" and heads to Utah University this fall.

  Womens Open  Division ~~~~ Top 3
      The ESSX Bag winner. was.  Rachel Mason(Unattached) of High Point, New Jersey.  Using only her 6-step approach...Rachel blasted. 12' 1" and close bar at 12' 7' PR. Rachel was runner-up this year in Big East Championships. Placing Silver  was. a tie between. Marisa DeAngeloof Long Island. and Emma Keating of Pompton Lakes.  Marisa, Former NY State Champion has started her comeback.  and Emma. was NJ State Champ last spring at 13'0'. Both were close at 12' 7" bar.  Coco Metcalf of West Milford,NJ was 4th at 11' 7 and the St John University junior.  was close. at 12' 1" PR for Coach Bob Sorensen.

  Mens Open  Division~~~ Top 3
     The ESSX Bag Champion was  Peter Roach of Appex Vaulting Club of New Jersey. This former Cornell Pole Champion. sailed. 17' 1" and the place went crazy.!!!  Coached By Bronko Meric. He too 3 great shots at 17' 7"  to end the day.  Placing Silver JOE TEA. was former Texas Champion... Warren Miller... After his. 28-hour car drive(Longest in Festival History). this humble grad flew 16' 7' and brushed off 17'1". Warren. was encouraging vaulters both days and taking photos of excellence for all  to take home. Taking third was  Nate Llanos of Connecticut at 15' 7".   and Dane Sorensen of  Flying Circus. 15' 7". for his. chilled JOE TEA award.

   Masters Men Division
     The ESSX Bag
winner was. Robert Rakich of Connecticut. .. with his  Black Roch Pole Vault Club athletes cheering him on all day... he. flew. a seasonal best of 10' 1" to take home. the GOLD!!!!

     Special thanks. to Southern Catskill Track & Field Officials for. running a class Meet.  and All 15 Meet volunteers helping make it. go........    Full results.  in a few days.  at. www.hvflyingcircus.com

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS TRADITION"……."The LIST" !!!!!
posts.Content:
Welcome to the Hudson Valley Flying Circus Pole Vault Club !!!!

  The TRADITION......The CHAMPIONS...... "The LIST"

  As we celebrate the start of our  41st Year of Flying Circus Pole Vault .. we invite you to be a part of our deep TRADITION of Success. Here are just some of the stories and numbers from our dedicated and spirited athletes.

  Our club first took wings on the backs of  Warwick Valley pole vaulters, Dave Holt...Rudy Tomaselli and Brian Kittner in 1978 in a tiny gym vault set up in the Warwick Valley Middle School, NY. with Dave Holt soaring. 15' 7"...Rudy Tomaselli 14' 10". and Brian Kittner. 13' 6"  that year to kick off the Fiberglass Tradition in scenic Warwick Valley.

  The Official Flying Circus became a club for all area schools in 1985. Coach Hugh Cauthers(Monroe-Woodbury) joined Coach St(Warwick Valley) in offering pole vault instruction to everyone who needed safe and modern-day coaching and state-of-the-art facilities.   The Warwick Center Vault Barn opened its doors in 2004 to athletes in all  5 neighboring states and the rest is history.  Champions developed fast.

    Developmental Pole Vault  Instruction became the center focus of teaching.. ... as team spirit..., a positive attitude and sportsmanship the key life goals. The Circus vault barn is now the hub of pole vault development on all levels..... .beginner--intermediate. and elite stage. Last season alone, our club reached out to 137 pole vaulters enjoying the positive atmosphere of instruction and motivation. We invite you to join us this coming year for some exciting fun and development.

  The ALL-TIME LIST @ FLYING CIRCUS.... WHO is NEXT. on the List  ..??????

  *****************************************************************************

  " The All-Time List" at Flying Circus has been a tremendous MOTIVATIONAL  tool for our young and aspiring athletes. Located in the Barn on the West wall..... it serves as the inspiration for our new group of athletes taking up the challenge of Pole Vaulting.   The Boys List is loaded with CHAMPIONS.... with 3 Guys over 17 Feet....  12 more over 16 Feet... 44 guys over.  15 Feet. and a total of. 50 boys over 14'9" + !!!!  They all started on Day 1 as Beginners!!!! 

  The Girls List is equally impressive and is stacked with State  and National Champions.... with 11 Girls over the 13' Barrier... 20 more athletes over.  the 12' 6" bar.... 32 more over 12' 0". and  a total of 42 athletes over. 11' 9".   Who will be next on "The LIST" ?????  

  Keep Training for strength and speed.

posts.Title: Coach HUGH CAUTHERS….. Rest~in~Peace
posts.Content:
Dear Flying Circus Families ..........

       With a heavy heart, I  sadly report the loss of our Flying Circus Pole Vault Club.....Co-Founder and Special Head Coach... HUGH CAUTHERS. 

        Coach Cauthers was a unique teacher... skilled motivator and a coach for young athletes in various sports and levels... but his greatest success. was as. Soccer Coach...Head Field Event Coach in all the jumping events in the Championship CRUSADERS Track & Field Program at Monroe-Woodbury Central Schools. for over. 45 years.  In that time. he mentored all of his athletes.  and co-coaches with his positivity...  his competitive spirit.  and. his humble gentle voice.

         He formed our Flying Circus Pole Vault Club in November of 1984  and produced. Pole Vault Champions, as well as the Long /Triple./High Jump Events for the last 36 years on all levels.  He is most renowned for his dedication and determination in introducing the Girls Pole Vault event as a real scoring Track & Field event in New York State in  1998.

         Coach Cauthers was. elected into the esteemed...Section 9 Track $& Field Hall of Fame for his outstanding contributions in athletics.

         His leadership was his strong trait and he attracted and convinced his athletes to believe beyond themselves.  He was a Master  Team Coach... the KING ~INNOVATOR  of drills in soccer. and pole vault and a true role model for all of us.

         HUGH CAUTHERS was  ...filled. with gratitude...kindness.   and made us all better humans. We are blessed to have his spirit with us.

     "A Celebration of Life" Service for Coach Cauthers will coming soon.

  .  REST in PEACE Coach Cauthers and THANK YOU for everything.     ~~~~~   Your Family  @ Flying Circus Pole Vault Club

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS NEWSLETTER # 1 …….. ALL ABOARD !!!!!
posts.Content:
WELCOME NEW MEMBERS  to the "FLYING CIRCUS VAULT SHOW" .

      @@@@@@@@@@

     Newsletter #1 (September)

      THANK YOU for joining our 27th Edition of Pole Vault Flying and Friendships here in the Warwick Valley.  Your new membership and support will help us to keep the  'spirit soaring' this coming year.  Our membership program is now. stacked. with. 106 motivated and exciting athletes... ready to reach for the.  sky and share some. good old fellowship. Each month we will have the updates and highlights from our athletes in action from our members in five states. Including all activities on our growing calendar. and the New Wave of Fiber-Benders.    GET READY----- Here comes the CIRCUS!!!!!!!

   * "SOAR~BEYOND~YOUR~TALENT"  ..... The pole vault is an extreme sport that requires discipline...dedication... and a 'never give up attitude'.  It takes many jumps to master the World's Most Complex Event.  Championship athletes in our country are taking between  1,200 and 1,800 Jumps per year to gain mastery.  We all have to keep grinding out the drills. and mental preparedness each day to find our mark.  Confidence is developed through small gains in structured practice. sessions. " He or she who practices best.... will reach the top of the mountain."

  *  WINTER POLE VAULT CLUB ......  is 95% FULL!!!!!     THANK YOU for making this Winter Club strong. There are a few training spots still open in various packages....  as we close up  Winter Vaulting Registration on October 16 and we will send out Class Placements on  October 23rd.  We are "Loaded. with Talent."...in our  Beginners...Intermediate.  and Advanced levels. It's going to be. a SUPER INDOOR SEASON @ CIRCUS !!!!!!!

 *  Our   'Celebration of Life' Memorial Service for Co-Founder. ... Coach Hugh R Cauthers Jr. on Saturday was a "Day of Remembrance---Love---Spirit " for a special man who gave all of himself to help others.  The 135   former athletes..families.  and friends filled. the tent. with LOVE  and GRATITUDE.  Flying Circus will endow a yearly educational scholarship in Coach Cauthers' name for a boy and girl on the Monroe-Woodbury Track team exemplifying the qualities of spirit...teamwork.  and sportsmanship.  Donations. can be forwarded. to Hudson Valley Flying Circus, LLC.     Rest~in~Peace Coach Caruthers.

  * Circus athletes are making their college commitments this fall. and please send in your college choices to join the  College List. for next month's newsletter.

  *  Our Winter Club Training begins Monday. November 11- February 6,  and will be focused.  and serious opportunities to increase. your level of pole vaulting. Our Wednesday evening Open Sessions. will end on November 6.

  *  Please join us in our HUGH CAUTHERS PRE-SEASON FALL CLASSIC Pole Vault Meets here at the BARN.. The Boys will kick off the preseason fun on Tuesday, November 5 with a 4:30 pm Warm Up time.  and a 5:31 pm Meet start time.  Entry Fee is still just $40 at the door. The Girls Meet will be on Thursday, November 7 with a warm-up time. at 4:30 pm and a Start time at 5:31 pm.  Let's kick the rust off together and be ready for the Armory  Opener!!

  *. Flying Circus Staff will be at the Pole Vault Event Instruction at this year's ARMORY CAMP at the world-famous. Nike Track & Field Center at the Armory(NYC) on Sunday. November 17 and you are invited to this exceptional "Day of Vaulting". Register at  armorytrack.com  and join Coach Duffy---Coach Sorensen... and Coach St. 

     "You don't get results by focusing on results..............

              .......You get results by focusing on habits and behaviors that produce results."        Keep Training with purpose--See you all soon--- Coach St.

posts.Title: "FLYING CIRCUS".....Lite~the~fire~within....
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus Pole Vault Adventure......

     Somewhere in Warwick Valley, NY

   Throw new sticks on your fire.... before the fire dies out...

          ......... "lite~the~fire`within."

 Pole Vault Shananingins are about to begin at the Circus Indoor Barn....and YOU and your flying buddies. are invited to take part.

 Check out. The important dates are listed below. Mark up your calendar for some authentic fun together.  Remember... Fun MUST be SHARED by ALL!!!!!!

   * Our Coach Cauthers Pre-Season ICE BREAKER Pole Vault Indoor Meets. are just  10 DAYS AWAY!!!!!  The motivated Boys Meet is on Tuesday, November 5...with a warm-up at 4:30  pm and Meet bar up at 5:31 pm sharp). Register at the door ($40 Entry Fee) per athlete.  Sharpen your spikes. for. some good old-fashioned speed and fellowship on fiberglass.

  * The Girls will gather for the Girls  Indoor Meet on Thursday, November 7.. with a Warm-up at 4:30 pm and Meet bar up at 5:31 pm.  JOE TEA...will be served. to the winners of each grade.  Volunteers to help with this in-house competition are always adored and loved!!!!!!!!!!  You have to be there to experience the joys of sport.

  * WINTER CLUB BEGINS....Monday. November  11 for the Monday/Wednesday Groups.  and Tuesday, November 12.  for the Tuesday/Thursday groups !!!!!!! Thank you to all parents. and athletes for making our club a unique and positive learning experience. It's. very hard. to explain the lessons beyond pole vault that take place in our little club.  Responsibility... Spirit....Gratitude is the main goal @ Flying Circus.  Remember.. athletes must stay in their assigned class..... a missed class is not made up. Classes canceled. due to the weather...WILL BE MADE UP.  Don't miss your assignment.  days..... these days are critical for your success.

  *  We are proud to announce...the addition of the Olympic Silver Medalist..Lawrence Johnson(Tennessee)... a. 19' 7.75".  Pole Vault Champion to the.  pole vault staff at this year's ARMORY TRACK CAMP. pole vault instruction. on Sunday. November  17 at the NIKE.  Track & Field Center At The Armory(NYC). It's almost sold out... Join us. by registering at armorycamp.org.

  *  Some parting thoughts.............

       As the new. season is about to begin..... how. will you represent yourself?   and how will you step up your? commitment to excellence. This. is a personal decision that only you hold the key.. It's. not about what your. coaches. ... your teammates.   or your parents want for you.  You are the. one that decides your goals...  your efforts. ... your sportsmanship. and your dreams.   It's. time to STEP UP in all areas of your life.  and. to feel the power and joy of. full effort.

 Capture each day.... Leave big footprints in leadership...accountability ....responsibility and high standards of kindness for others.  This is the. real ticket of success.  we all aspire to.  Do it Now.....Dare to be GREAT!

   We gather together very soon..... Keep training fitness.. power....speed.  ~~~~~~~~~  Coach St.

posts.Title: HUGH CAUTHERS CIRCUS Pole Vault Meets....Just 7 Days-to-Go !!! Join us !!!!

FLYING CIRCUS..... START YOUR ENGINE.

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS NEWSLETTER #2 …..RISING UP !!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
CIRCUS NEWSLETTER #2 (October)

  Welcome to the start of INDOOR TRACK & FIELD.

  The Flying Circus Pole Vault Club has completed our Membership Program and we now have 110 athletes signed in for our professional pole vault instruction and many other pole vault activities for this year. Our private pole vault club wishes to thank all our parents....High School coaches and athletes for supporting our mission of Safe Pole Vault Instruction for all levels of athletes. Let us all RISE UP TOGETHER and enjoy the flying fun.

  The month of October was filled with many new stories of dedication....commitment.... and motivation. Athletes traveled. from long distances..just to feel the positive atmosphere of athletes cheering for each other....sharing ideas. and enjoying athletic fellowship. The Fall Vault Foundation phase was a huge success and sets everyone up for early-season success this winter. We are about ready to feature some very tough veterans and many new upcoming stars at Flying Circus.  BIG THINGS happen when you reach for the stars...... Keep your eyes on every result...every new PR... every new "flying positive vibe" in the coming months in that chilly old barn.

  * Winter Training Club sessions begin this week for athletes making it into our training programs..... as we sold out fast again and now have a Wait List in place. Coach Duffy and Coach Sorensen will still offer our Sunday Open College and Open High School Vault sessions for the winter. Our Vault Barn will be CLOSED on Fridays and Saturdays this winter... so the coaching staff can help coach at meets at West Point and the Nike Armory.

  * Our ESSX VAULT POLE RENTALS PROGRAM  at Flying Circus is now open and taking rental orders. Essx poles take 3 weeks to arrive for your rentals. ORDER YOUR RENTAL POLES NOW to be sure you have them for your first meet!!! We believe you must have the very best equipment to FLY HIGH..... go to circuspolevault.com to order NOW!!!!

  * At Flying Circus... we teach in SMALL DRILLS for HUGE VAULTS. You must break this pole vault event down into mastering the small parts...over and over again.... until you link up that muscle memory into the powerful complex vault. Look forward to mastering small drills ..small vaults... there are no shortcuts in pole vault development. Apparatus drills are just as important as full approach vaulting.  Many kids try to sidestep this fundamental process for a quick-fix solution to pole vaulting.Do not get trapped into this approach. Pole Vault for the Long Haul journey.

  *. " RANDOM VIBES for SUCCESS "

         ~~~ Show Up every day with ENTHUSIAM and FULL ENERGY.

         ~~~ Dream BIG.....Train BIG

         ~~~ Look after one another.

         ~~~ "I shall not waste my days." ---- Jack London

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

     The Coach Cauthers Scholarship Fund....... Thanks to the 36 Flying Circus pole vaulters jumping in last weeks Coach Cauthers Pre Season Ice Breakers meet.... we have raised $1500 for the endowed educational scholarships for the next few years to honor our Circus C-Founder. This educational scholarship will be awarded each spring... to a deserving boy and girl from the Monroe-Woodbury Central High School Track & Field program who most exemplifies the.  Spirit... and Kindness of Coach Hugh R Cauthers Jr.  Kids step up when it matters most.... 31 Personal bests in the meet and true sportsmanship and fellowship all night.  Congratulations to all parents....athletes....and volunteers.

     The Flying Circus will be CLOSED on Sunday, November 17(Next week) , as the Circus coaching staff will be a part of the Armory Camp pole vault sessions.

       ".... thou shall fly.... 

                        without wings."

posts.Title: FLYIN' CIRCUS NEWS…Championships…Summer Camps…Festival Dates !!!
posts.Content:
" LARGE INVESTMENTS ..... = ..... LARGE RETURNS."

It's time. to mark your pole vault calendar..... Here are some important pole vault development opportunities for all Flying Circus Club members. We have scheduled some unique and positive environments for every pole vaulter of every ability. Join us whenever you can and share your spirit."

• The Flying Circus Indoor Club Championships will be an exciting night at the Barn.... The Boys Championship Meet will be on Monday, February 10, 2025, with a sign-in at 4:15 pm., and the meet starts at 5:31 pm. Entry Fee is $50 per athlete up at the door. The Girls Championship Meet will be. Wednesday, February 12, 2025, with a sign-in at the door. at 4:15 pm and meet starts at 5:31 pm. Entry Fee is $50 per athlete at the door. Snow Date will be Thursday, February 13 at the same time

• The Flying Circus Beginners Pole Vault Clinic.....for all Middle School and HS freshman Boys & Girls who want to "Learn How to Fly on a Fiberglass Pole" will be on Thursday, April 3, 2025. at 6:00 pm - 9 pm at The Circus Barn. This. 3 hour introduction to Pole Vault will be a great start for the. spring season. Entry Fee is $125 per athlete and includes a Clinic T-Shirt and Pole Vault Booklet. Sign in At the Door. at 5:45 pm.

• The Flying Circus Summer Pole Vault Camps will be one week earlier this year. Both camps will be Co-Ed Boys & Girls. and will fill up very fast again. The dates are Flying Circus Camp #1 (All Abilities) on Saturday and Sunday, June 28 & 29, 2025 at the Circus Barn in Warwick, New York. Co-Ed Boys & Girls Camp #2 (All Abilities) will be—Monday & Tuesday, June 30-July 1. The 2-day Entry Fee is $330 per athlete and Entry Forms will be on our website (www.hvflyingcircus.com) on January 1, 2025, to be mailed. Camp includes every aspect of pole vault development... Camp T-Shirt. and Camp Booklet.

• The Flying Circus Pole Vault Summer Festival Meet........ This is the ultimate pole vault gathering... with all ages divisions(14).... lively music.... tremendous pole vault fellowship and hard-to-believe stories of flying and delicious JOE TEA. served. to all athletes after their last competitive jump! Two runways... Indoor. and Out... Southern Catskill Officials.... Middle School...High School.... Open... and Masters groups.... The Middle School Boys & Girls Meet and Freshman-Sophmore Boys & Girls Meet are Wednesday, July 2, 2025, from 11:01 am- 4 pm and the Master's Men & Women begin at. 5 pm. The High School Junior & Seniors.Open Men & Women will be. Thursday. July 3, 2025. from 11:01 am - 6 pm. The Open Division for Men and Women will have a Cash Prize of $500 for first place. Registration. is still only $65 per athlete. and Registration will open January 1, 2025, at our website( www.hvflyingcircus.com). Join us. for. some genuine. Flying-Fun this year.

Thank you all for supporting our programs this year and past..... Coach Tim St.Lawrence & Flying Circus Staff

posts.Title: 2025 SUMMER FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT CAMPS

 Rachel Venter (Warwick Valley, NY)over 12' 3.5"

posts.Title: HOLIDAY VAULT RECOIL
posts.Content:
The Flying Circus Pole Vault

    ' A Private Pole Vault Adventure

  HAPPY HOLIDAYS  to all  Vault Families...... 'tis the season for joy.

   Here's some RECOPIL NEWS ~~~~~~~

   Great opening weeks of spirit and sportsmanship were on display on the pole vault runways and a time to celebrate our many gifts. It's hard to believe our blessings. 

  * The Armory is the magic place for athletics.   There is no other match for the motivational environment created on 168th  Street and Fort Washington Avenue in New York City.  As you climb the three flights of stairs.. you begin to feel the TRADITION of this historic masterpiece built in 1906.  You become the next chapter in this storybook of friendships and common fellowship.   Leave. your finest efforts there and enjoy every trip with gratitude. 

  * Recoil @  Armory December 20....  the 21 athletes showed competitive spirit all night.... with new school records..personal and seasonal bests and fun together. Leading the pack. was. Luke "Rocket" Beattie(Warwick Valley) with his meet record. 16' 0" vault and fast anchor on 4 x 200 Relay. He had. 1 choose bar at the NY State Record at 17' 2"... .... Pompton Lakes,NJ strongman..Owen Keating flew 15' 6" school record and brushed off. 16' 0" on his big poles. Julian Lynch(Fordham Prep) also hit the rafters with a booming 15'6' SB for Coach Jerry Cahill . Todd Korman(Suffern) made 14' 0" for Coach Boraczyk and closer to that old school record!!! He split fast on winning 4x200 Relay win. Klaus Lindenau(Warwick)  made 13' 6"..Chris Bustamante(FP) 13' 0".  Justin Digga(Suffern) 12' 3"...Anthony Roe(Warwick) 12' 3"  Seamus Corcoran(Pope John,NJ) 9' 9'.

   The Girls were ready for the night...... with Rachel Venter(Warwick) taking the spotlight at 12' 0" and close bar at 12' 7"PR.... Jenna Monaco(Dumont) was spectacular in vault at 11' 0".  and 55  Hurdles 8.47 School Record.  Jamie Kim(Old Tappan) was sharp over 11' 0".... Madeline Magliaro(Trinity)   the Cornell University signee made 11' 0". big from a longer run... Zoe Levitt(Bronx Science) 10' 0 .... Salome Sanchez(Old Tappan) 10' 0".  Sophie Kumar(Edgmont) 10' 0". Anna Riskin(Suffern) 9'3"PR... Madelyn Duong(BS) 8' 0". Madison Tierny(Pope John) 8' 0". In the Unattached Club Section.. Sarah Shipton(Crestwood) won the gold. at 10' 6" for Coach Duffy... Liliana Coe(Delaware Valley) 10' 6"...Tomara Seid(Abington Heights) 10' 0". Evelyn Kruczek(Crestwood) 9' 3" and Ellie Schardein(Pitston) 8' 0"

  * JamBar Coaches Hall of Fame Meet at the Armory on Saturday was all Minisink Valley High School glory..  Taking the gold in the Boy's section was senior..Logan Schupner. at 14' 6"... followed by teammate Tyler  Cloidt at 10' 11' 0". Jesse Berman(Bronx Science) 8' 0". The Girls section was won by Minisink Valley..Junior...delila Kronimus at 11' 0".  and very close bar at 11' 11' for coach Doug Schupner.  The small School section had Sophia Kumar win at 10'0".  ain Boys..Ben Malone(Pascack Hills) placed 3rd. at 10' 6"

  *  Armory Yount Series... seventh-grader... Bryce Leslie of West Milford was the gold medal winner in the 13-14 Division. at 7' 6' .  Jonathan Andrade(West Milford) won the 55 Hurdles at 8/54 PR!!!

  * North Shore Invitational @ Armory(Dec. 23)......  Rachel Venter(Warwick Valley)...the North Carolina University signee. won the gold.  at 11' 6" and close bar at 12' 0". and Circus Teammates Stell;a Scherbak(Monroe) placed. silver at 11' 6" SB and Madeline Magliaro(Trinity) at 11' 6' SB.  The Boys of Warwick Valley. went. gold & silver... as Luke Beattie won at 15' 0. from short run.. Klaus Lindenau(Warwick Valley) placed.  silver at 14' 0' from long run. and Miles Macklin (Danbury). went. 12' 6". Luke  Beattie also cranked. 6.52 to tie for 55-meter dash gold.

   NEXT  : The Circus Pole Vault Train stops. at The Section 9 Holiday Invite on Friday evening( 6pm-10pm) December 27 at The Armory.

posts.Title: CIRCUS WEEKEND FLYING…. CIRCUS VAULTERS HEATING`UP!!!!!
posts.Content:
Hudson Valley Flying Circus    " A Private Pole Vault Club "  The Flying Circus athletes are...' Catching~the~Recoil'. and not looking back... Welcome. to Mid~Season Madness of Carbon fiber vault poles.!!!    Congratulations to all athletes representing our brand again all over the Tri-State area.  It's great to watch kids take a chance on themselves.... Kids. pushing out of their Comfort Zones. and into the next level of poles... grips.   and length of runs.   This is the only way to ... 'Catch Lighting in the Bottle'...  This is the search for meaning.... continue. to challenge yourself in all areas.    Back to training drills and toughness this week at Flying Circus. 

*  Hall of Fame Meet at Armory--- Owen Keating of Pompton Lakes,NJ  showed up on a mission.... with his Triple PR Day....  hitting 16' 6" for NJ #1... School Record.  and USA #4 lists. His Fall vaulting is paying off, and he shut it down on that make for the day.!!!! There is more in the tank for another day!!  In the Girls division... Cornwall Senior... George Krause(Rensselaer) 12' 6". Ryan Toner(Greeley) 10' 6". 

* College Alumni Results...  Sophomore. Emma Keating hit an indoor PR. at Akron Invite, Ohio for her Scarlet Knights of Rutgers.  at 13' 4"....Lily Beattie (Ole-Miss) freshman.. zoomed over 13' 0" for the Rebels. 

* The Warwick Center Winter #2.......  Coach St's Training Group tightened up their spikes. today in Winter #2 meet.... As LUKE BEATTIE(Warwick Valley,NY) put on his best show ever... making a School Record. 16' 9.5" (USA #3) for Coach Potters Flying Purple Wave. This. all from his.  short run 5-Step and his. 15' 7" x 193  ESSX Cannon!!!!! 2 Near jumps at 17' 1.5" to end the day... Placing. silver. was Cole Wilson(Washingtonville, NY) at 13' 1.5" PR. .. followed by Anthony Roe(Warwick Valley)  hit 12' 1.5".  and M<att Herbert(Newark,NJ) flew. 12' 1.5" in his season opener!!!   The    8 Girls were led by RACHEL VENTER(Warwick Valley).. senior and our most consistent vaulter... over 11' 7.5" and big height at 12' 1.5" for gold.   Taking the silver  were Anderson Farina(Cornwall) 11' 1.5".  and Jenna Monaco(Dumont,NJ) at 11' 1.5"...   .Next came Maddie Magliaro(Trinity) and Sarah Shipton(Creskill,PA).  both 11' 1.5"... Averie Klein(Pine Bush). 9' 7.5"... Evelyn Kruczk(Crestwood)  9'7.5"PR and Ady Laurie(New Paltz) 9' 1.5".   Special thanks. to Julie Christian. and Rudy Tomaselli for working the meet at scoring table.  and pit.

 Luke Beattie(Warwick Valley) sets NEW SCHOOL RECORD @ 16' 9.5" !!!

 "I Shall Not Waste My Days" ~ Jack London.

posts.Title: LUKE BEATTIE (Warwick Valley)..NEW NY STATEINDOOR RECORD… 17' 1.5" !!!
posts.Content:
CONGRATULATIONS to LUKE BEATTIE (Warwick Valley,NY). for soaring tonight  to a NEW NY STATE INDOOR POLE VAULT

   RECORD POLE VAULT of 17' 1.5" at The Steve Borbet Invitational at the Nike Track & Field Center at THE ARMORY.

posts.Title: CIRCUS FIREWORKS @ ARMORY… LUKE BEATTIE (16' 6" & 21.72) and RACHEL VENTER (12' 8") !!
posts.Content:
REAKING VAULT NEWS..............

     North Shore Pre-Nationals @ Armory

     February 14

   It was. "Circus Fireworks" tonight at the North Shore Pre-Nationals in the historic Nike Track & Field Center At the Armory,

  as the Boys Circus and Girls Circus Flyers swept both events. with stellar performances.

 The Girls sweep was led by senior captain ...Rachel Venter  of Warwick Valley,NY .. with  a lifetime best. 12' 8". for Coach Kirk Thomas Lady Wildcats. This North Carolina Charlotte signee

 then took 2. great vaults at the 13' 0"  bar and moved up to second All-Time. at Warwick Valley Central Vault list.  Also flying strong was junior, Delila Kronimus of Minisink Valley with a   great 11' 6'

 fly-over for Coach Doug Schupner for the silver.  Coming on strong this winter is junior Anderson Farina of Cornwall Central.  with her bronze medal finish at 11'0" and near bar at 11' 6' for the Lady Dragons Section 9 Champions.

 The Boys followed with sensational a  1-2-3 sweep also... as junior captain...Luke Beattie of Warwick Valley Purple Wave, NY put on a dual Vault ~ Sprint show!!!  Using a medium-run approach on his 193 ESSX RECOIL.. he. flew. 16' 6'

 for the gold. and had. 2 close bars at 17' 4" State Record attempts in his new team singlet!!!  He also blasted a come-from-behind anchor leg on his 4 x 200 Relay in 21.72 for the CATS New School Record. 1:30.45 !!!!!! Logan Schupner

 of Minisink Valley was also ready with his clean 16' 0" again to equal his indoor school record for the silver medal. Completing the Boys Fireworks. was senior...Anthony Roe of Warwick Valley,NY with his huge 12' 6' bronze medal vault!!

***********************************************************

 ELLA GALLOWAY Breaks out with her first college win for the University of South Florida... by sailing to gold today with a lifetime PR. of 13' 3.5' at the Windy City Invite in Chicago for The FLYIN' BULLS!!!!! 

********************

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS……"Coach~of~the~Year"… Coach STEPHANIE DUFFY !!!!
posts.Content:
CONGRATULATIONS  to FLYING CIRCUS Head Pole Vault Coach... STEPHANIE DUFFY for this year's "COACH of the YEAR"  honors.   Coach Duffy is the Co-Director of the HV Flying Circus Pole Vault  Academy, LLC for the past 10 years and has been the program director. for all Beginning...Intermediate.  and Advanced Pole Vault groups.  This 3-Time New York State Pole Vault Champion. from Washingtonville,NY. and Big East Pole Vault Champion at the University of South Florida learned her coaching craft from Head Flying Circus Pole Vault Coach Hugh Cauthers. and  South Florida University legendary Pole Vault guru..Don Marsh.   She was. a 5-Time Academic All-American at South Florida...'Home of the Bulls'.  She is currently a Middle School teacher in the Washingtonville Central School District. and will be the Head Modified Track & Field Coach this spring for the Wizards. S Coach Duffy will be headlining as lead instructor for pole vault next month at  the Armory Track & Field Camp on March 29 at The Nike Track and Field Center At the Armory,NYC.  Registration is open at armorycamp.com. She will  also be assisted  at the Armory Camp by Flying Circus outstanding  Coach Steve Keating.  Join the Fun and Learn more about the Flying Pole Vault.

  CONGRATULATIONS COACH DUFFY !!!!!!!!

posts.Title: NEW YORK STATE MEET…."DAILY DOUBLE" CHAMPS..Rachel Venter (12' 6") & Luke Beattie(16' 6")
posts.Content:
NEW YORK STATE INDOOR TRACK & FIELD CHAMPIONSHIPS

 March 8 , 2025. @ Ocean Breeze Complex

 CONGRATULATIONS to all our 13 State Pole Vault Finalists on Saturday in Staten Island. It's truly an honor to represent. your school at a STATE MEET. You all carried. yourself with pride and passion... and it was a thrill to watch you and your competitive spirit on the biggest stage.  You are all set up for a huge Spring season together.  Thank you for.  supporting each other all indoor season...    ON~to~OUTDOOR FUN !!!!!!!!

  Girls STATE.... This event started off the fireworks for our 9 competitive girls on fiberglass sticks in the morning session. Flying High was. Warwick Valley Central's Rachel Venter coached by Kirt Thomas. This talented and never-give-up senior sprinter/vaulter showed poise.  and confidence in her record.  10th consecutive.   state meet.. Using a clean slate of first jump clearances... she. sizzled over 12' 6' for the gold medal and then moved up poles with a near miss at 13' 0" to complete the competition.  Vaulting tough was training partner...Madeline Magliaro of Trinity School, NYC.. with a tie. for the silver medal.  at 11' 6" clean. and blowing through all poles. at 12' 0" for the Cornell University signee.  Minisink Valley junior..Delila Krominus  placed. 4th in Federation standing at 11' 6'. and earned her first state medal and returns next year for more.  Columbia School senior...Ashley Weakley was also ready with a big 11' 0" for 6th place state medal for coach  Ashley Gansel. Top Soph in the meet belonged. to Stella Scherbak of Monroe Woodbury. at 11' 0" , still recovering from an ankle injury. Zoe Levitt of Bronx Science was solid all day with 10' 0" clear...Kate Doling(Pearl River). Senior flew. 9' 0" and Madeline Duong(Bronx Science) hit 9' 0".

  Boys STATE..... The Boys also had. two flights on separate runways at mid-day... as  Warwick Valley Central's. Luke Beattie won his. fourth State Vault Title for Coach Mike Potter with a massive. 16' 6"MR clear for this year's Indoor State Record holder at 17' 7". . Luke had 3 great vaults at 17' 0' to finish the competition. Pushing to a new school record.  and personal best was Logan Schupner of Minisink Valley Central with a 16' 3"  clear for Vault coach Doug Schupner. Horace Greeley explosive junior... Dave Schrifrin was solid. at 13' 0" and close at 13' 6".... and Cole Wilson of Washingtonville leaped 12' 0" for WizardNation.   It's. going to. be a wild.  and great outdoor season in Section 9 !!!

  20 CIRCUS VAULTERS have been invited. to next weekend...NIKE INDOOR NATIONALS at The Armory on Friday-Saturday.  and Sunday for our final Indoor Meet of the Year.

  The Armory Youth Championships on Saturday was a pole vault sweep.... as Coach Bob Sorensen coached four girls up and over all morning. Leading the Vault Crew was Ady Laurie(of New Paltz with 11' 1" gold medal. for the Scripps College(CA)signee...  Brooke Bull of Liberty flew 10' 7' and was perhaps our most improved athlete the last 12 weeks...Averie Klein(Pine Bush) zipped over 10' 1.75".  and Katherine Fritz(Kennalon,NJ).  made 8' 7".5 in her first Armory meet ever.   Hats off to Bryce Leslie of West Milford,NJ  for an outstanding. 9' 0" Fly Away for the dedicated. 7th grader!!!

posts.Title: FRIENDS of FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER REUNION !!!!!!!
posts.Content:
Dear FRIDENS of FLYING CIRCUS. ~~~~~~~

   It's REUNION TIME...... and YOU ARE INVITED to the Party !!!!

   ************************************************************************

  We are gathering.  everyone. back together to relive the  "glory days". @ @Circus and we want you with us.   The dates are July 2-3 at your Flying Circus Barnyard during our 27th FLYING CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL.  Pole vaulting will also be taking place. with our current athletes all day. and you can share. your stories of past and updates us. with tyour present adventures.  JOE TEA will be served under the tent all day.  Dress is  causal(unless. you are vaulting that day in the meet).   Fact-checking will not take place in any storytelling.!!!!

 Here's the. scoop and schedule.

*************************************

  Your $65 donation registration ticket will be Tax deductible.  and Include.

      * Free Parking... Free Bathrooms... Free Music

      * Entry into the Pole Vault Age Group  Competitions (14 Separate Divisions)

      * Free JOE TEA Under~the~Tent...the Official Drink of Flying Circus CHAMPIONS.

      * Free Dancing on the sidelines during the meets.

      * Free HUGS All~Around.... ALL DAY.

   REGISTER at  our website... hvflyingcircus...Under the Bulletins Section. .... Flying Circus Pole Vault Festival.

   *****************************************************************************************************************************

  The 27th Circus Pole Vault Festival and Reunion Time Schedule

  *************************************************************************

 July 2 and July 3, 2025

      The Warwick Conference Center Flying Circus

 3 Warwick Center Road & Hoyt Road.... Warwick,NY 10990

   Wednesday.  July 2  The Competition  Divisions

 11:01AM..... Middle School Boys. &. Girls Competition Begins

 12:31PM..... High School Freshman Boys & Girls Competition Begins

3:31PM......  High School Sophomore Boys & Girls Competition Begins

6:01PM......  Men & Women's Masters Competition Begins

      Doors open at 9:ooAM... Rain or Shine Event

Thursday    July 3.   The Competitive Divisions

 11:01AM......  High School Junior Boys & Girls Competition Begins

 3:31 PM......  High School Senior Boys. & Girls Competition Begins

 6:01 PM......  College & Open Men's & Women's Competition Begins

      Doors open at 9:01AM.... Rain or Shine Event

  Southern Catskill Track & Field Officials  will  use USATF Open Rules

       We hope. ....You can join the Reunion and Fun   with us this summer

       See you all soon------- Coach St & Staff / Flying Circus

posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER POLE VAULT FESTIVAL !!!!!!!!
posts.Content:
THE 27th FLYIN' CIRCUS POLE VAULT FESTIVAL MEET ********************************************************************    

JULY 2-3 in WARWICK, NEW YORK YOU are invited..... to the Pole Vault Party this summer at FLYING CIRCUS at our 27th edition of Pole Vaulting Flying.    Join  the Pole Vault Fun  in our Middle School Division and Freshman & Sophomore Divisions and Masters Men /Women Divisions on. July 2 on the FASTEST RUNWAYS in the Northeast!!!  Last year we hosted 115 pole vaulters in this. two-day gathering of motivated and focused athletes on bending sticks!!!   Ice cold JOE TEA will be. the ultimate prize for all vaulters finishing each competition on both days.  On Day TWO..(July 3)..  all High School Juniors and Seniors this year will take the bar up beginning at 11:01AM.  and at 6:01pm.... The Open and College men and women will show us how it's done  with BIG POLES and FAST APPROACHES.  Music...Sportsmanship... The "Spirit of the Pole Vault" are the main goals for all our meets. Listed below are last year's  Division Winners... Join us this year for some fun!!!   EARLY REGISTRATION is OPEN till JUNE 1. at $65 per athlete//// LATE REGISTRATION at $75 per athlete begins June. 2.  ENTRY EARLY. and SAVE !!! posts.Title: FLYING CIRCUS SUMMER NEWS
posts.Content:
The Hudson Valley Flying Circus LLC
A Private Pole Vault Club
Warwick, New York

Flying Circus is about to "RESTART the Pole Vault Engine" for our Fall season on Sunday...September 7 and. we are excited. to work with you in prep for the up-coming Indoor Track & Field season. The Fall season sets up your pole vault successfully. for the highly competitive Tri-State pole vault area. Please join us as often as possible in our weekley sign up sessions with our professional pole vault staff of coaches. These limited sessions will begin with basic progressions and increase in technique progressions for the months of September and October @ $50 per vaulter per session(90 minutes). Athletes must become a current Club Member by September 1 to be eligible for all Flying Circus Activities beginning this Fall..Winter. and Spring. (Membership is $100 for the full year per athlete @ QR Link enclosed.)

NEW Coaches...NEW Program Leadership...NEW Programs... NEW Price Schedule... NEW Spirit...NEW Benefits
*****************************************************************************************************************************************
THANKS to you and your dedication and support last year... our membership was a CLUB RECORD..... 165 pole vaulters.... the "Largest Little Pole Vault Club in the Northeast" !!!! We aim even higher this year with spirit development...personal growth....friendship...sportsmanship..... and Flying FUN !

Joining the Leadership Team will be Coach Stephanie Duffy, as Co-Director of Program Development and Lead Group Level Instructor for Progressive Development of all activities. This. 5-Time All-American knows how to care for each athlete and her motivation carries over to all of us.
Joining the Coaching Team will be the exciting and knowledgeable Colette Metcalf...Level II pole vault champion and coach.(See Full Bio and Photo below)
Also coaching this Fall/Winter/Spring will be Bob Sorensen...Steve Keating,Will Nesbitt,Ken Cevoli,Rudy Tomaselli,Jeff Clark,Sonya Greaves and Coach St.

Some more New Programs,Clinics and Beginner Competitions will dot the schedule for our "grassroots of beginners" to soar higher faster on our new and fast runwaus..both indoor and outdoor and new ESSX Vaulting Poles for all to use at the barn and Rent for your seasonal High School meets.

A slightly new price schedule and price benefits. for CLUB MEMBERS to save on pole vault club meets and Camps and Winter Training Packages. !!!!!!

"A NEW SPIRIT of FLYING @ CIRCUS" will prevail , as we seek to build Championship Kids and Championship Pole Vaulters again this year. We invite you to "Join-the-Movement" this year at your Flying Circus.

@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@

Membership Registration:

Boys Program Information:

Girls Program Information:

New All-Time LISTS.... See Below...... Shoot for this list this year!!!!
New Pole Donations...... Lauren Russo...9 poles donated back for Circus Use---- Rachel Venter.....6 poles donated back for future stars....Madeline Magliaro... 4 poles donated back to Circus for others to soar !!!!
Winter Club Training Packages coming October 1 for November-Febuary Training groups...very limited ..ONLY 64 vaulters before SELL OUT. ONLY Current Club Members are eligible for MEMBERSHIP PRICE BENEFITS. Register for Membership today at QR Link attached.
Special Thanks to Pole Vault Champion...James Schuler. for assisting us all year with club promotion and elite management. and our Web-Master. ..Connor Mulchahey, former Weston ,CT pole vault champ for keeping the torch lite brightly for Circus the past 12 years!!!!!
Summer Speed Development has been FANTASTIC for many buying into this program. Phase II kicks in this week and ends. Sept. 6... IT WILL PAY OFF!!!!!!!

SUMMER VAULT RESULTS.....
Vault Factory..July 26th.... Rachel Venter. sails 12' 4,5'. for 4th place...Close bar at 12' 10"
Atlantic City BEach Vault... Coco Metcalf. 11' 0"(2nd). Brooke Bull 10' 6" (4th).. Timber Jackson 10' 6"(5th). Kathleeen Fritz..9'0".(. Klaus Lindenau 12' ^(6th) Ryan Spidal. 12' 0". Ray Stellmach. 12' 0". Julian Scachez 11' 6' (6th)
Memorial Twilight Series.... Lindsey Cargain....7th Grader.... 8' 6" PR!!!
Rockback Beach Vault.... Coach Coco Metcalf.. 11' 6'. Brooke Bull... 10' 6". Timber Jackson.. 10' 6'.. Kathleen Fritz 8' 0". Zoe Casal. 8' 0"... Klaus Lindenau. 13' 0". Ryan Spidal... 12' 6"

See you all this Fall..... Coach St-Coach Duffy and Staff
